title: Times Square Crowne Plaza COVID Refund  - IHG rip off
text: Still waiting on our COVID refund from 4/2020. Prepaid over $800 for a weekend stay. Got our theater refund within a few weeks. IHG nothing.  I get a runaround from IHG corporate. Hotel front desk sends me to a mail box every time. Going on 4 years.

title: Excellent! 10/10.
text:
Ignore the negative reviews!! Currently staying at the hotel, checked in 01.02.2024. 

Check in staff amazing, very friendly and welcoming. 
Room on the 44th floor, excellent views!
Room was a little hot, just turned the heating off and opened the window, no issues at all. Then during the night I put the heating on lowest and the room was perfect. 
Had a lovely breakfast in the little cafe by the lobby/reception.
Wifi, really good and fast. 
Hotel bar and food, good staff very friendly. 
Contacted guest services and 4 bottles of water were brought to my room within a few minutes. Again excellent. 
A big fan of Times Square, its literally on the doorstep along with broadway. Amazing location.
Will stay here again.   

My only negative, 
Some of the light switches don’t work. However, doesn’t really bother me. But open and honest reviews require positive and negative. :-)  (if any)

title: Great hotel right in the centre
text: Friendly welcoming staff, room large with very comfy beds, clean and although tired it was comfortable and plenty of space for 2 people. We did not have the chance to try breakfast but it looked good. Bags were stored the day we left, free of charge, doorman was really helpful in getting us a taxi for airport and making sure we were looked after. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Overcharged my card without explanation
text: I have been over charged 1.1k € I had paid everything upfront before arrival and as I was there my card had been charged twice and I have been trying since January to contact this hotel and it’s April now and I still can not get in contact for a refund I have asked upon check out why I’ve been overcharged and they did not know

title: Unfair resort tax
text: Great location, but zero hot water, no information on gym, long distance calls on check in, complained to receptionist about not having hot water and it was overlooked and nothing done about it. And only informed about resort tax on check out, not happy about how IHG went about their buisness

title: Travel friends
text: It is very well located, the only thing is that it does not have a refrigerator. We did not have water in the room. They put just one gel for each penis in the bathroom and we are two people... I spoke to the girl at the reception and she told me to call and she would give it to me they would bring and in the end it was this morning

title: Is not what it used to be
text:
Currently staying at hotel, 3 people in the room. Their accommodation for that is a king size bed and a pullout sofa, or two queen size beds that do not suit 2 grownups. So the room is crowded with beds because I chose first option. 
Water in shower not hot enough in the evening. There is a base for kettle but no kettle so all these coffee and tea bags have to just lie there. No fridge in room. The toilette is the worst it does not flush the waste properly. No toilette brush. The carpet is shabby and the whole place has a shabby feel to it. The gym is in a different building. The service, if you need anything done, is really bad. Expect to call 6 times and wait several hours before it’s done. I gave 3 stars for the location which is great.
 
I stayed here 10 years ago it was totally different.

title: Booked thru IHG - never got refunded the security deposit 198$
text: I booked this hotel thru IHG and I never received back the Security Deposit. They charged the security deposit thru the IHG Website and I did call them and they promised that they will refund the money - it's been 1 month and nothing has been refunded. Never again on IHG.

title: Best pick
text:
The hotel is very well located, but what got me was the kindness of Sandra, the receptionist who assisted me in the check-in. That friendly and kind welcome made my day. 
The room is lovely with a view of the city. The bed is comfortable and the space very clean. I’m glad I choose this hotel.

title: Jewel of Time Square
text: Just  5 min walks to time square and near to many eateries. City view room has really great view of city and room is spacious too. Reception staffs are friendly and we are allowed to check in early. We love to stay there 3 nights and will come back again.

title: PRIME LOCATION!
text: Prime location!!!!!! A few setbacks like non working bathrooms on the lobby level which makes it a nuisance if you’re eating at the restaurant or having cocktail because should you need the restroom you need to go to the 4th floor which kind of kills the vibe. Which leads me to the non working escalators which would make it extremely convenient because it takes you directly to the 4th floor and is located right by the bar/restaurant. Another issue, the doors. Those doors slam hard. Very hard. At all hours of the night. It makes it hard to sleep if you’re a light sleeper. It sometimes feels like it’s the door to your room that’s being opened or broken into. Aside from that, the stay was great. It is close to everything and anything. It’s seriously my favorite location to stay at because of the location alone. The prices are very reasonable also. I do want to give a shout out to Evelyn at the front desk. I had so many issues with my rooms and the correct names registered. No fault of the Crown Plaza because we booked with a 3rd party. Although complicated, Evelyn was extremely patient and worked though the issues and made everything right. Thank you!! All in all this is a great place. The bartenders were also so nice. They remembered us and our drinks and when they saw us coming they began preparing them before we even sat. You guys were amazing. So the amazing service far outweighed the little setbacks hence the 5 stars all around.

title: Amazing hotel.
text: Recently returned home from a stay here. I was very apprehensive following some reviews on here. Check-in was easy as can be after a long day travelling. The rooms were brilliant sized and clean. The aircon worked and the temperature in the room was manageable. The location to the hotel was brill, it’s in Times Square and pretty central to everything. We were able to put our bags away on the day we come home as we had a late flight and our bags were safe and staff were very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to family & friends. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Completely Lost All Direction
text:
The Crowne Plaza, Times Square in Manhattan has been my hotel of preference in New York for a great many years. This was my first return since Covid and I was very taken aback by how far standards have slipped, so  much so that I have needed to remove it from being the recommended Manhattan hotel to my clients. The hotel has lost direction in virtually every way possible and only just attains the standard of a 3* hotel. Gone are the days when it comfortably provided 4* standards and service.

The rooms are timeworn and haven't been upgraded for years. Whilst my room was generally clean, I was shocked to find that the extractor vent in the bathroom had caked on dirt (see photo). There were no bath robes in the bathroom and it was unbelievable that the drinking cups in the bathroom were made of cheap plastic. The bed was comfortable and the room temperature could be controlled with ease. 

I was shocked beyond measure to find that the hotel no longer provides a breakfast service and I find this to be totally unacceptable. This was not mentioned on the website. It is a disgrace that guests need to leave the hotel to eat breakfast. The hotel also used to have an onsite gym that was part of a local New York chain.  That has now closed down but, again, there was no mention of this on the website.

The only staff members who showed any interest in guests were the receptionists.  They were clearly embarassed at the degraded service and suggested quite openly that the management cared only about income streams.

About 100 hotels in New York now charge a ridiculous Resort Fee,  Crowne Plaza, Times Square is one of them.  IHG needs to recognise that this hote is not a resort and their claim that it covers internet and phone calls is insulting. IHG 1 status  boasts that members receive free internet connection.  Is this not a contradictory statement since IHG 1 guests are not exempt from the Resort Fee? In this day and age who makes phone calls from their hotel room when everyone carries a mobile phone and has internet connection for video chat?  The concept of Resort Fees is nothing short of  a money spinner for the hotels, and one that does not serve breakfast at that.  I am aghast that this fee is also levied on IHG 1 guests who are using reward nights.  Have the number of points needed for a night's accommodation been decreased as a consequence?  They have not.  They have in fact increased.

I must recognise the service provided by Evelyn M on reception. She was animated and very friendly and she was the one highlight of my stay.

IHG and Crowne Plaza Times Square is on very shaky ground at present and I would not even consider setting foot on the premises again when there is a new Kimpton hotel (part of the IHG group) just around the corner. This reviewer is not impressed

title: Amazing hotel, great staff!
text: Sandra E checked us in and took one look at my frazzled self and immediately made me feel at ease and relaxed. She's a gem! The hotel is the perfect location, literally everything is right there! The housekeeping was immaculate and its clear they took pride in their work. Cannot say enough great things about it and the staff there! I felt super safe and secure and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

title: Very Poor Experience
text: I had made a reservation for one night. Plans changed and needed to extend for two nights. Called the hotel twice but no one answered. So I called the 800 IGH reservation number.  They extended my stay but ended up giving me a second confirmation number. When I tried to check in, the clerk first could not find the second reservation. I gave her the confirmation number and she found it. Then told me I would have to check out in the morning and check back in for the second night. That is not acceptable and 20 minutes later, this was cleared up by a manger. Went to the room, thermostat was broken. Maintenance came up and confirmed it was broken and then told me even with a good thermostat, I could not have heat. It was turned off in the entire hotel. It was 47 degrees out. They brought me a space heater. Went down for dinner. the restaurant is closed. only the bar is open. Ask for a dinner menu. the only thing they serve, in the entire hotel for dinner, is bar food like chicken wings. Not even a hamburger.  When I was leaving the line at the desk was very long so I just left. Got an email thanking me for my stay with a link to get a copy of my bill. The link doesn't work. I called the hotel every day for 4 days and left a VM. no one ever called back. Day 5 I called IHG and opened a complaint. Still no one called back. two days later I get a receipt for less than half of the amount they charged to my credit card. Called the hotel again, no answer like normal. Called IHG again. They put me on hold and called the hotel. No answer for them either. They sent the hotel a fax and said there is nothing they can. This is one of the largest hotel chains in the country and they can't help.

title: Great Check In
text:
I live in CT, but go into NYC quite often. When I am going to the theatre or Lincoln Center, I appreciate the convenience the Crowne Plaza Hotel affords me, literally a short walk to most theatres. In the past, I have experienced some of the issues with room temperature and hot water that some reviewers have mentioned. However, during my last few stays, those problems seem to have been addressed, by and large.

My last stay was very pleasant, primarily due to Victoria, the woman who checked me in at the front desk. Of the dozens of stays I have had in New York, nobody comes up to the standard set by her. There have been times in this same hotel when my check in ranged from professional, friendly, and efficient, to bored and going through the motions. Victoria made me feel that she was happy to welcome me and went out of her way to treat me with the friendly professionalism that should be the norm in any hotel. 

So much of a guest’s experience depends on his or her initial intake experience. In this post Covid era, one would think every hotel would try to up their game. This should especially be the case in this hotel, since they lack an on-site sit down eating option due to their restaurant never reopening after the pandemic. While that is a decided disadvantage, a pleasant welcome would go a long way towards soothing guests’ disappointment.

title: Can’t think of anything good to say!!!
text: Terrible stay for this diamond elite member. Only one person at the desk so no special check in line. Waited about 15-20 mins to check in. Asked for the free breakfast and was told they don’t do anything for diamond elite. First hotel since we received our status where they do zero for you. Thats why we stay with IHG. Then we got to the room, no fridge, that’s a $30 charge - wow! I never pay for in room fridge at other hotels. The real issue for us was the heat at night. This hotel only has the ability to heat all rooms or cool all rooms in the hotel. So our room was 78 degrees at night. When we called they told us to open the window for cooling. That cooked the room to 76 degrees. Awful stay to say the least. Barely a worker available to speak English, managers never on duty or available. Zero seating in the lobby meanwhile there is an empty restaurant area full of seating that nobody can use so the lobby has a very unpleasant feeling to it. For Crown Plaza we have grown to expect way way more than we got at this Times Square property. Won’t be back.

title: Dirty and Hot. Who Gave This Hotel 4 Stars?
text:
Pros: The hotel is in an excellent location, just steps away from Broadway. Upon entering the hotel late at night (around 10ish), we appreciated the security measure of being asked to show our room card, providing a sense of safety. The staff was generally friendly and helpful, and I was pleasantly surprised to be allowed an early check-in, albeit I wish I had waited. The beds were pretty comfortable, and the abundance of charger ports throughout the room was convenient. The elevators were fast and there was hardly ever a wait.

Cons: The small entrance made the hotel somewhat challenging to spot. Unexpected additional taxes and fees were a downside. Unfortunately, our room was not up to par upon arrival. Although offered a new room due to used towels in the bathroom, I assumed it was a simple oversight by housekeeping. However, my optimism faded when I discovered a hair in the bathtub later on. The following day, we noticed a hole in the wall behind the door and stains on the chair. Then, we couldn't get the temperature in our room to go below 74 degrees. When we reached out to maintenance, we were informed that there was no air conditioning in March (considered winter), and the suggested solution was to open a window. Eventually, a fan was provided. Additionally, it's worth noting that, while my oversight, the room lacked a refrigerator and microwave, leading to a lot of wasted food. Oh, and my daughters later found a long hair that did not belong to any of us. Plus, we found a towel folded on the nightstand that I had assumed my daughter put there. Turns out it was there when we checked in. Another disappointment regarding cleanliness.

title: Amazing staff, location and comfortable!
text: This hotel is amazing.  We were worried because of the review and even called hotel to almost cancelling but glad that we did not.  The hotel is great. The room is cool and comfortable, the temperature was never a problem.  The location is amazing.  The staff from fromt desk, guest services, housekeeping are all very friendly and accomodating.  If you are worried about reviews, give them a call.  They will make sure you will have peace of mind and when you get there, it will be very comfortable. Great hotel, great location.  Will definitely book here again!

title: Broken promises
text: I had no intention of providing a negative review. However, when four months have passed and the resolution promised to me has not happened, I am now compelled to tell this story. My friend and I had a very unpleasant stay at CPTS on 11/12. Started with check in. Went to our room, key did not work. Went back downstairs where key was reprogrammed. Back upstairs still did not work. Called desk as was advised to do, was told security would be there to reprogram lock. Waited 30 minutes in hall, no one came. Went back downstairs (third time) and was told they would be there. Returned to room, waited another few minutes and security came. They were very apologetic, and said they were never told to come. At 10:30 went to shower, no hot water. Tried to call desk from phone in room, phone did not work. Called number from website on cell, could not get through. Finally reached someone. Snarky maintenance man came, said we needed to let water run for a few minutes. I explained we let it run 1/2 hour! Not even warm. Bedside lamp would not turn off, had to unplug it. Room temperature would not go below 75°. Window latch broken, could not crack window for ventilation. Room was 79° when we got up. Upon check out, we shared our issues with a very sympathetic night auditor. Mr. R. Was extremely polite, and listened to our concerns that were also presented to him in a very calm manner. I used points and cash to pay for room. Mr. R. Promised to refund my amount paid to my card. I explained I did not care about the points. Well, here we are four months later, no refund. I spoke with Mr. R on November 28th and again was promised a return of my funds. I have never been anything but polite in my interactions, as he was as well. I just want what was promised to me. I have made numerous more attempts to call, and cannot reach anyone. Tried to email with the email address on the business card, only for it to be returned as I am “outside the network “ I am so disappointed that I have had to go resort to this to get anyone’s attention! It probably still will go ignored, but at least I am heard. I must repeat that security, and Mr. R were very polite.

title: Strong point: the location
text: In the heart of midtown, the strong point of this hotel is undoubtedly its location. We stayed in a family room on the 42nd floor with a nice view of the Hudson. For the record, the room shows the signs of age, like most structures in Manhattan, and the bathroom is no exception. To be chosen without regrets if you want to reach all the highlights of Manhattan on foot and if you can find it at a reasonable price.

title: Don't stay at the Crown Plaza Times Square!!
text: Our family was fortunate to be able to visit NYC over the weekend of Feb.09.  We booked and stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square.  We had an absolute terrible experience with the hotel.  We were sweating and extremely hot in our room.  The thermostat was set on a high temp.  It was a mild weekend in NYC.  The front desk could not unlock the thermostat nor assist us.  We barely slept due to the heat.  Soon as we came home we called the hotel.  Though we were promised a call back, no one has called us back nearly two weeks later.  They really do not provide good service nor do they care about their guests.  This is just terrible!  We will never stay here again!

title: Worst hotel experience ever
text: The worst hotel experience I have ever encountered. Supposedly a 4 star hotel but have received better amenities, accommodations and guest/customer service at a budget hotel. Room was absolutely abysmal and the IHG name should not be on this hotel. The list of things that were either broken, stained or dirty is a mile long. Graffiti on walls, rust stains on counters, what looked like vomit stains next to the bed, electrical box hanging out of the wall with wires exposed, furniture and safe broken, heat unable to be turned down so the room was boiling hot the entire time, just to name a FEW. I have many pictures to prove it. Tried to get my experience amended by hotel manager and move rooms. She informed me the hotel was sold out for the stay and the best she said she could do was refund the measly service fee. At this point we didn’t have much of an option so we accepted the service fee refund and decided to handle the experience once we got home. I tried to initiate a refund directly through guest relations and the same hotel manager responded by saying they would not refund since we declined a room change. She completely lied and is trying to pass off her accountability in this onto a guest. I would have been more than happy to move rooms if that was actually an option offered to us. As I stated before, that was the FIRST THING I ASKED. I have now disputed the charge through my credit card company. I have never had to do such a thing before. I am so beyond fuming about this entire experience and I will never be returning. Pick literally any other hotel.

title: Location, Location, ... and little else
text:
We had a four night stay with theater tickets for three of those nights.  The location was perfect - at most we walked one block.  The price was reasonable give NYC standards.  Beyond that, there isn't much to recommend this place,  

We were greeted on arrival by a fellow who was interested in getting back to a conversation he was having with the other desk clerk.  Abrupt and well rehearsed, he rattled off a few things and didn't bother pointing out the elevators.  The room was adequate, with a nice desk, but no lounge chair.  No microwave.  Single-ply, rather coarse toilet paper.  Good shower with lots of hot water.  No refrigerator.  Plastic cups and glasses, with sediment filled tap-water. Paper coffee cups.  Single-cup coffee maker with no sugar nor creamer on arrival.  No choice of pillows, and inadequate blankets (additional blankets delivered promptly on request). Lounge bar served snack-type food - no real in-house restaurant.  $22 for a Manhattan cocktail.  No bell captain at the kiosk when we left - we had to find our own taxi (which wasn't hard)  Fast elevator.  Long lines for coffee at the coffee stand each morning, and you had to get there pretty early to get a decent pastry - they sold out of most by 9 am.

All of that is pretty picky, but for what is called a 4-star hotel, it felt more like a Holiday Inn express.  In a good location.

title: Highly recommended
text:
Perfect location in the heart of Times Square.
Daily cleaning and conditioning of the room. Super comfortable and spacious beds and pillows!! Upon arrival they charge you the appropriate fees and retain a credit card deposit which they unlock when you check out.
For breakfast they sell coffee, pastries, savory food, fruit, juices...
Without a doubt it is a highly recommended hotel.

title: Great location
text:
Great hotel and location
Ideally positioned on Times Square
Within walking distance to a lot of attractions
Room - we were offered an upgrade free of charge and were given a room with a panoramic view
Beds were comfortable staff friendly
Rooms were clean 
Only downside was coffee shop closed around 2pm which wasnt great on our last day and not many areas to sit prior to leaving for airport

title: In the heart of Times Square
text:
Our fourth time in this fantastic city. This time, we chose to stay in the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Just go down the stairs and you're in the turmoil of this incredible place!
Check in was a little long, around 30 minutes, as there was only 1 employee, even though it was an extremely sensitive time, around 3:30 pm.
We stayed in a corner room with a sensational view of the city and part of Times Square.
Very good sized room, with 2 queen beds, good bathroom with shower and good amenities. There is no minibar.
At reception there is a cafe for breakfast with some good options and prices compatible with the rest of the city.
 Furthermore, it is a beautiful hotel, with a good room, a beautiful view, very honest in terms of value for money. We receive orders from Amazon for 6 dollars per package.

title: Shout out to Brunilda!!
text: As a hotel general manager it’s very rare that you come across desk agents who genuinely love their job! In the small window during my check in it was nothing short of amazing. Brunilda was very welcoming and sweet. I hope she is able to see this and gets the credit she deserves. Thank you very much for the great customer service!! If I decide to stay again

title: Terrible
text:
Terrible service at this hotel. Rude and grumpy receptionists - especially the one who was there on February 15th at night. Dirty hotel. Dirty coffee. Many days without the escalator working. Decadent hotel.
NYC is broke. Full of beggars on the street. Dirty.

title: Exceptional service
text: Excellent hotel!! Sandra checked us in and was wonderful, she allowed us to check in ahead of time. The room was super clean and well organized. The view from the room is incredible. Gratitude to the entire team. We will be back soon.

title: IHG not backing our refund that was promised
text:
I've been reaching out to your hotel for LITERALLY the past three years. 
We pre-paid for a hotel stay during COVID and were promised many times to get a full refund. 
Our stay was supposed to be 3/24/20 through 3/27/20 and we pre-paid over $1000. 
A couple calls ago, they promised a refund after a "capital infusion" and they said the closing was extended. Then someone told me they were "waiting on a process".  I went through the chat on IHG and got nothing. Now the hotel managers are saying since the previous owner went bankrupt, they are not refunding us. 
I can see online that your hotel is up and running. 
This is particularly disappointing from IHG, a company that claims to prioritize customer service. We've been members for years. There is no way I'm staying in another IHG hotel until we are given back the money we've paid.

title: Excellent hotel!!!
text: Excellent hotel, very good location of all attractions, BIG room which is appreciated in New York, good cleaning service every day, very nice bed and shower, you have several subway and bus options. It will definitely be my best option to stay.

title: Sandra Thank you for the easy checking
text: Front desk Sandra, was very professional and her courtesy was second to none. Great checking expiriance. Sandra saw how tired we was from the trip, and I asked if I can do my check in early and she explained to me everything and she was so warm as she was talking  to is. My other family member was having problems  communicating which se help us on communicating everything to her on Spanish also.

title: Poor
text:
Restaurant closed. No mention. Upwards escalator off. No mention. Bar only open for 5 hours in the afternoon. Imagine going back to Prohibition but electricity doesnt exist and no one cares. Book here.

Oh the beds are comfy. Well done international chain

title: Deposit not returned after more than a month Crowne Plaza Time square NYC.
text:
Hello, nice hotel very well located, the experience could have been perfect but we had an unpleasant surprise on our return, it has been more than a month since we returned and our deposit has not been returned to us, even though we We had no problems.
Certainly there are service fees in addition to 40.15 dollars per night but here I am talking about 212.20 dollars in addition and never returned and the establishment does not even respond to us on Airbnb despite our dozens of messages. So I say be careful of suspicion of fraud or theft from tourists.
Be careful and don’t wait 14 days to alert social media.
I am going on a crusade until I have obtained reparation in principle.
Sincerely
Charlotte

title: This is the worst Crowne Plaza I have ever stayed in - my advice is to go elsewhere
text:
When we arrived we were told there was a $40 per night service charge - which is ironic because this hotel is totally lacking in service in every respect. One of ‘services’ this covers is free wifi which therefore isn’t free and is therefore a lie. As an IHG member I get free wifi anyway! From the start the service was awful
Having emailed ahead and I had the request for a quiet room away from public areas etc, I checked on being given the key card that this was the case? Lucky I did, despite the request being  on my details the receptionist had allocated us a room by the lifts!!
The room was ok to look at but was actually quite dirty - bits on carpet, dirty sink that could clearly be seen in the mirror and then on last night when I went to use the hairdryer I discovered underneath the sink was filthy - see photo. I took some new slippers with me and the bottoms were dirty after our stay so if I hadn’t my feet would have been on the dirty floor! The cleaning staff also conducted very loud conversations in the corridors on a morning - not conducive to a quiet start if you wanted one!
The only things you got in the room were shampoo, conditioner, lotion and shower gel and on three out of our four day stay, we did not have our shower gel replaced. Coffee and polystyrene cups were provided but once again not always replenished and it wasn’t till last day when had to ask yet again for cups that we realised there were actually stirrers!
The towels were small and quite thin and very poor quality.
The staff were not interested and despite asking to see the manager I am still waiting, presume too busy with all the many complaints? 
Having gone on here it is clear that the hotel know what these problems are and are doing nothing about it. I will be pursuing a refund of the ‘service charge’ I paid as it is daylight robbery, theft and a basically a hotel tourist tax - as if the price of this hotel was not high enough anyway.
If you are looking for a hotel near Times Square do not choose this one - the reviews speak for themselves, unfortunately I clearly didn’t check well before I booked 😡

title: Never again
text:
Arrogante, unfriendly staff at checkin. No Welcome.
Even beeing a Diamond Member they treat you like an idiot. No breakfast available in the Hotel, no Welcome Drink. 
The rooms are very noisy, like Paper Walls.
It used to be a great Hotel,once but has lost its charme and exclusivity.
Never again

title: Crap
text: Pick a different hotel. They clearly take advantage of tourist. $40 dollars a night we were charge for fees which apparently covered tea we didn’t drink, phone we didn’t use and a safe which was broke £200 + we are down best thing is we were told on arrival it was included in our package and all we were being charged for is the $70 a night damage deposit which we would get back  yet when refunded we were only partially refunded and the amount for hotel fees had been deducted. Our shower didn’t work as the dial wouldn’t stay round and our room temperature couldn’t be changed we were there in winter and were boiling hot

title: Will stay here again
text: Good clean rooms.  Great price.  GREAT location. Felt safe.  Cafe on first floor offered good quick food and very convenient.  Cleaning lady on our floor (10th floor) was wonderful. Check in was easy. Recommend leaving bags on first floor and getting started -with so much to see and do and then checking in when you are ready to -- check in for the evening and take a break.

title: Great for Times Square action but not not worth the price if you are exploring the whole city
text:
I had high expectations for this hotel but it was average. You’re paying for location and nothing else. It’s older and it shows, no real amenities. The staff was friendly enough and I fell for being upsold to the Times Square view- don’t do it! It’s neat to look down and see the activity but it is SO loud all night from motorcycles and screaming. We were high up and still very loud. The city side is quieter and has much better views. 
It was close to Broadway which is why we chose it. It’s also close to subway stations which was nice. If you want to be in the center of the action of Times Square this will be great for you but if you just need a base hotel look a little further into the Financial district or midtown.

title: Don't Stay Here
text: Do not stay here.  The rooms are unbearably hot and they will DO NOTHING.  Front desk is terrible and managers are no help.   I eventually was able to get a fan but stay was still miserable and there are so many better options around and for less money

title: Great Place!
text:
Pros:
Great location
Spacious, updated room
Friendly and helpful staff
Bar and coffee shop in lobby
Cons:
Terrible lighting in the bathroom
Took forever for the water in shower to get hot and didn't last long

title: Repeated Lack Of Hot Water Issues
text: The overall location is fine depending on where you want to be, but the entrance area can be difficult to find and navigate. The rooms were good sized and clean. There is not a fridge in the room and they said they had none to bring. It’s supposed to be a non-smoking hotel, but that is not enforced even when notified. Here is the reason we will never stay there again. Each of our 3 nights there we (2 of us) both experienced complete loss of hot water only about 5 minutes in to our showers…every time without fail. We notified front desk on each occasion with no new results.

title: IS NOT WORTHY OF AN IHG HOTEL. MORE LIKE AN ECONO LODGE
text:
I stayed here over New Year.  Worst hotel i have ever stayed in in terms of service and being lied to by hotel staff, including management. Since the bankruptcy of this place, it seems they only want you money. Bad customer service, bad attitude when you ask them anything, and poor service. 

I am an IHG platinum elite, which allows me to select a free drink or points on check-in. I was not even offered that, then when I asked, they stated they had not got the vouchers. What vouchers, surely they could print them up. In my opinion, they just wanted to save $$. 

I thought I would then ask for a late check out. They then said they were fully booked, yet when I tried to reserve a room, there were plenty available. Yet again, another lie. I phoned for an additional blanket 3 times, and it never arrived.

Simply, this place should not have the IHG brand. It is not worthy of it. Since staying here, I will be using a Hilton for all my further trips. 

My family has stayed here many times since 2016, and it was exceptional. However, since the bankruptcy, it sucks in terms of service along with very disrespectful  staff. All it wants is the $$

IHG should be ashamed to have any connection with this hotel. 

Go somewhere else.

title: Couldn’t pay me to stay here.
text: Very rude staff and long wait times. The only decent aspect of this hotel is the location. Would not recommend at all. Staff is slow to attend to basic requests such as extra soap or towels. Hotel is grossly overpriced without the most basic of amenities. Room is not soundproof so it is noisy and hard to sleep at night. Rooms are clean however.

title: Poor accommodation
text: While this hotel is in a great location, it was a very poor room. The  shower plate was falling off with dirt falling in the tub,  the phone was dead and the bathroom was unclean. There was no microwave or fridge. For $500 a night it should have at least be clean and have a working phone for emergencies. The check in staff did not seem aware that 20 feet from them was an in house restaurant. No recommendation to stay here. Find an alternate!!

title: RECEPTION STAFF
text: Unfortunately this hotel was a disappointment for us on our honeymoon to New York! Thankfully we were only here for 3 nights and went to a different hotel in soho! The reception staff were rude and rolled their eyes when we asked them to organise/ring a taxi for us to bring us to soho. They said “there are hardly any taxis here and it is very hard to get a taxi” even though this hotel is based just off Times Square!! We will not be staying here again.

title: Location is Key
text: I love NYC! And if this Hotel wasn’t located where it was. I probably would not ever stay here. First off the Rooms were HOT HOT HOT! Not a good hot, but the room tempt was set @75. And no way to lower it. The Men in charge of luggage were not nice or pleasant. We called @7am to have our luggage brought down. After waiting 2 hours we decided to bring our own down. When asked the men standing in front of the luggage room why there was not help provided when we called the front desk.? The Hispanic man in the suit said oh well.?! What a nice response to a guest who spent 5 nights in your establishment that you work for.

title: Fotos die täuschen
text:
Das Hotel ist voll in den Jahren gekommen. Grundsätzlich ganz ok, aber für den Preis und den Fotos erwarte ich mehr Qualität. Die Lage ist TOP. Parkplatz sind verfügbar. Checkin war so voll, dass wir 1.45 h gewartet haben. Richtig crazy. Die Zimmer sind alt, fenster undicht!!! 
Wenn man duscht dann wird das Zimmer neben dem Bad nass. 
Auf jeden Fall, wer die Lage will passt das Hotel.

title: Terrible experience and wouldn't stay here again
text:
I'll start positive with the location. The location was great if you want to be in the middle of everything and walking distance to a lot of shopping. 
The negative is we went the week before Christmas so the temp outside was mid to upper 30's. When we checked in our room was 74 degrees so we immediately turned the thermastat down and left to explore the city. We came back the room was still 74 degrees and very stuffy. Called the front desk, they send the maintenance guy who tells us the whole hotel is the same temperature and told us to open the window. We opened the window and he turned our room unit off. The room stayed 74 degrees. We barely slept because it stayed so stuffy even with the window cracked open.  We went to the front desk the next morning and heard a couple other people complaining about  the same thing. They sent maintenance again and nothing changed. Long story short if you like your room to be 74 degrees and sleep in an inferno then this place is for you. Our family didn't sleep the entire time and had a terrible experience. I still could not figure out how it was 22 degrees at night and we had our window cracked the entire time and the room never cooled below 74.

title: Lack of Customer Service
text: We had a reservation with a late check in. They ran my cc but my bank thought the $1700.00 was fraud, told bank it was good BUT the hotel cancelled my reservation with no contact or anything. My cc was fine if they would have reached out. Terrible customer service!

title: Great Spot
text: I booked this place for convenience during our trip. I saw some reviews that were less than outstanding and I have to say my expectations were EXCEEDED. Our room was plenty big. The bathroom was spacious and clean (and I get weirded out by hotels and cleanliness). The staff was so nice and the check in was fast. Elevators are fast as well. I would definitely recommend and stay here again. The price couldn't be beat and the proximity to everything was ideal! Thanks for a great trip!

title: Would stay again
text:
Booked for 5 nights via British Airways. Paid extra for Times Square view which was definitely worth it. Hotel  was in a great location for getting around Manhattan. Room not as big as I was expecting but defintely adequate. Clean, comfy, what more can you want. We all had the best nights sleep for a long time.
We found the staff to be friendly and helpful and a credit to the hotel. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Excellent service, comfort and location.  You won’t regret booking this hotel🙃
text: A truly wonderful stay at Crowne Plaza Times Square.  We asked for and got an upper floor room with a view overlooking Times Square.  The room was spacious, the bed comfortable, plenty of hot water, and daily maid service.  We asked for a blanket, and it was promptly delivered to our room.  The  breakfast “cafe” had many and delicious offerings.  It’s not truly a cafe, as there is no seating…it’s grab and go which is perfect for an early start to a busy day of sightseeing.  The hotel bar had great service, truly friendly, and had food offerings as well.  Everyone was helpful,  and the doorman (?) gave excellent directions to these first-time visitors as we navigated the city.  Great location but with that comes massive crowds.  Our stay was the weekend before  Christmas so a bigger crowd than usual, I imagine.  You can’t make a better hotel choice in Times Square.

title: Engaño , no tiene frigorífico, y aunque lleves hotel pagado no vale
text:
Llevar cuidado con este hotel, lo abonas todo antes del viaje y cuando llegas te cogen datos de tarjeta te cobran conceptos tasas,  eso ok, pero además se quedan con otro depósito sin justificar de casi 500 euros .
Osea pagas 3 veces por el mismo hotel.
Estoy reclamando devolución.

title: Perfect hotel in every way
text: This hotel did not let us down. We had been warned to be aware of small rooms in other places, but this room was to the back of the hotel with a view between buildings of the river. The room was large and clean and the most comfortable bed. Staff were so helpful and lovely. The room was done everyday and spotless. Right on Times Square ideal for everything to get to. We would have no hesitation in returning. It was recommended to us and I’m now passing on the recommendation. In house diner would have made it perfect but did not spoil our experience.

title: wouldn’t stay here again
text: Pros: Great location very conveniently located to Times Square and subway station. Escalator on street level to elevator/ lobby makes room access easy and fast. Elevators were extremely fast, never had to wait longer than a few seconds. Cons: We paid extra for a Times Square view room. I didn't see it being worth the extra cost with the room/view we had. Our room stayed 85-87 degrees the entire stay. When we called maintenance, we got a vague explanation that there is no AC and to just open the window and they could provide a box fan. This made the stay very uncomfortable. The beds were terrible, stiff and dirty. No microwave or mini fridge in a room when you're paying this much is crazy. The hotel and rooms especially are dated and not a reflection of the prices they charge to stay here. Our bathroom was filthy and each time you showered became soaking wet with steam and filth dripping from the ceilings and walls due to poor ventilation. I had to move all of our things out of the bathroom due to this. Much better places to stay nearby for comparable rates.

title: Do not stay at Crowne Plaza Times Square!
text: DO NOT STAY AT THE CROWNE OLAZA TIMES SQUARE! Crowne plaza calls itself upscale and sophisticated but they are far from it! Disaster from the moment we arrived. First they couldn’t find one of the rooms we paid completely in full for, a month and a half prior to our trip, BUT most important….  WE HAD NO AIR CONDITIONING IN OUR ROOM for the three days we stayed there! We brought this up multiple times to the hotel and they did NOTHING. It was 76 degrees in our room the entire weekend for an $800+ a night hotel! Aside from that, the tub was old and delapidated, the sink filled up with water and the counter top looked disgusting, the ice machine on our floor and soda/water machine were both broken. The concierge told us to go to other floors to get ice and the floors we visited were broken also. My son’s feet were starting to get brown five mins after his shower from the carpet in our room. Everything about this hotel was a disappointment and I can’t believe they have the audacity to charge $800 a night. They should feel ashamed!

title: Don’t stay here
text: Lobby decorated beautifully.  Joanie V. In the cocktail lounge was top notch.  Room clean however room temperature would not go below 72 degrees.  Multiple calls to have fan brought to room fell on deaf ears.  Ive machine on floor was unplugged and not in service.  There was NO HOT WATER in the shower morning or night. Only warm sink water first night we were there.  Help desk answered calls but didn’t do a thing.  Very dissapointing.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text: Perfecto hotel para ir en familia a Nueva York, la ubicación es inmejorable , está a 1 cuadra de time square.  Nosotros no contratamos desayuno, no se si el hotel lo tiene, pero debajo del mismo hotel hay una cafetería con muy buenos productos.  Esta muy cerca de estación de subte, la habitación con liando vista y espaciosa.

title: Good location
text:
We took a cab from Penn Station to the hotel which we now know was stupid.  The subway is just a short walk from the hotel and a lot less money. Took that route to go back to Penn.
The hotel was a bit hard to locate but with a little looking up we did find the sign.  The cab had dropped us on the Times Square side of the hotel not near the lobby entrance. We arrived at the hotel about 11 am but were told we couldn't get into our room until check in at 2.  The lobby was so full of people waiting so there was No where to sit. So we checked our bags and headed out.
The room was a typical high traffic tourist hotel.  Not very modern, a little run down but the bed was comfortable and it was in the heart of the action.  They are in the process of doing major renovations to the restaurant so its closed.  the bar does serve nice bits and bites in the evening.  AC in the room was turned off for the season but we were able to open a window for fresh air.
They don't provide a bar fridge or microwave in the room.   But there was a coffee maker. They did bring a fridge when we  requested one. There was only 1 USB port in the room and it was on the clock.  
We were on 38th floor and our ears popped going up but what a view.  The WIFI was absolutely awful!!  So slow.  Couldn't open many sites.
For the 5 days we were there the location was the best.

title: WORST FRONT DESK/MANAGEMENT EXPERIENCE IN NYC
text: All systems down at the Crowne Plaza but the worst was the treatment of all the guests who couldn't check in.  Arrived early and it was $75 to check in but guaranteed at 300.  By 330 no systems up.  Got on phone to main help number as front desk said it would be hours and my associate and i had flown in for business.  After being hung up on 3 times with customer service (all nice people but after each transfer we were then transferred to a completely new person).  Tried to get another IHG hotel, any hotel, to get ready for an early evening business meeting.  The 4th try got a lovely customer service rep who asked to speak to the manager as she had had no luck reaching them.  I took the phone to the manager who was very frustrated as customers were all asking when they'd get a room.  She was short with the agent but said she would make sure we weren't charged and could move to another hotel which we did.  Our customer service agent kindly supplied her name and a reference number as she was worried, as we were, that we'd still be charged.  Two hours of long distance and within 30 minutes we were checked into another hotel.    Home from NYC and have been charged for the two rooms at IHG even though we were told we wouldn't be.  Multiple phone calls to the hotel and many transfers again only to be told manager would call back in 48 hours.  No call back.  4 calls later, all with hang ups, we gave up and are hoping the call will come.  TERRIBLE service, not friendly, huge area lobby where people could have waited but they wouldn't open it.  Would never stay there again and we had had a nice time on a previous trip.  IHG is generally good but this is the worst!  Stephanie

title: Good location and comfy bed
text: This was a last minute booking as initially we had booked another IHG hotel but not as central. We liked this hotel, lovely view of the cruise ships (we were in town for 2 nights before we got on ours) and we woke to see here the morning we were departing. The bed was huge and so comfy! Bathroom clean and nice walk in shower. 1 small gripe the towels were too small for coming out the shower, they hay went round me and I’m just average build. I have marked 4/5 as what really frustrated me was our key was clearly only programmed for 1 night. We got back from a day of sightseeing, all the way back to the 44th floor and red lock, key not valid! We go all the way down to reception and ask them to reprogram it, they did (but they didn’t) back up to 44th floor and still not working. This time I use the lobby phone to save going all the way down again to be told they need me to come back to reception again. By now I am very tired and grumpy and still jet lagged and I feel we should have been brought a new key up! This did tarnish my opinion of the hotel staff as if was their mistake and things happen but to make me come down again I felt was no acceptable, they should have been more guest focused. Desk staff were rather blunt and lacked warmth in our opinion, maybe that’s a New York thing and being Scottish we expect people to be friendly like us. One lady was nicer than the rest but didn’t get her name. We used the restaurant on our 2nd night, it was ok, again I don’t get any warmth from the staff and felt a bit awkward. We will return due to the location, large room and comfy bed.

title: Room experience wasn't great
text: Bad experience on my trip. I recently stayed at this hotel Nov 29-Dec 1 2023, and was very disappointed. I had NO HOT WATER for 2 days the ac/heat did not work properly. The worst part of my stay was the loud noises from the vents. It sounded like the vents were breaking or gargling for 2 days... we weren't able to get any sleep. Just all around very uncomfortable. I paid $450 dollars per night for such a terrible experience. Not to mention the amenities are none existent. Not even a robe or microwave unless you want to pay $30 extra. I brought my son so he could experience the Rockefeller tree lighting hoping to have a pleasant and peaceful stay. That did not happen. Rockefeller was great but the Crowne Plaza hotel was a huge disappointment. This is unfortunate because I wanted to become a loyal member since I've had good experiences at other Crowne Plaza hotel locations. If I try this location again I hope I have a better experience.

title: No es nada espectacular
text:
La ubicación del hotel está muy bien, es lo único por lo que merece pagar el precio que cobran pero no esperes nada sobresaliente en la habitación.
Ofrecen una habitación con vistas, pero no es nada espectacular (no vale la pena el costo adicional). Es una vista lateral parcial de la calle, que corresponde aprox al 30% de lo que ves, el resto es el edificio de al lado. La habitación está solo ok, con el mínimo de amenidades que encuentras en cualquier hotel de este tipo como elementos de tocador, cafetera de 1 taza, TV, agua caliente en ducha (sin bañera), no tiene nada que llame la atención. La cama es comoda pero la habitación es fría y el termostato es solo de adorno porque no ajusta la temperatura. No hay cobertores adicionales en la habitación, y no te dejan botellas de agua. 
Cuando llegamos había un inconveniente con el sistema y no podían chequear a los huéspedes. Muy mal manejo de un plan de contingencia en estas situaciones por parte del personal, esperamos una hora en la fila, los huéspedes (aún con niños y las personas mayores) parados o sentados en el piso. La única amenidad que ofrecieron fue una botella de agua, y después de una hora dijeron que se podía poner el equipaje en la sala de juntas (inútil sugerencia en este punto cuando ya todos estábamos cansados y molestos). Finalmente volvió el sistema y solamente dijeron 'disculpas por la tardanza' y nos chequearon. Pésima atención al cliente, hubiesen podido repartir números(turnos) para que nos hubiésemos podido ir al menos a sentar al bar a tomar algo, o comer. O darnos un estimado de cuánto tiempo podía tardar el inconveniente para decidir si volver más tarde. No volvería a este hotel y tampoco lo recomiendo.

title: Hotel is terrible!  No check in x3 hours due to no computer system!
text: The computer system has been down for 3 hours as of this time 6:00pm.  We cannot check into our room…. We are exhausted and they have no back up plan.   There are over 100 ticked off people waiting in line.  There is currently no one at the desk as the staff are seriously hiding from telling guests that they cannot go to their rooms.  No back up system when their computers go down?  The STUPIDEST thing I ever heard of.  Also, their own staff said that this has been going on for weeks and they have not fixed their computer system!

title: Small Rooms, Horrifically Disgusting Mattress, Desk Staff Detached and Indifferent
text:
Arrived late at night and was greeted by a somewhat convoluted entry, greeted by a suspicious doorman who had to guide us to the front desk, located somewhere in the middle of the building.

Front desk staff was adequately functional, but not what I would describe as "friendly" or "welcoming".  NYC culture, I guess.  That said, the night janitor who was cleaning the floors was super helpful and friendly. Move that guy to the front desk!

The building has a split tower layout of some kind so you have to switch elevators, mid-travel, depending on where your room is. Confusing and something the front desk staff might have mentioned.

Arrived in our $450/night room, which was permeated by an offensive odor, had a poorly patched up ceiling,  was cramped and was filthy.  The mattress had mystery grime and filth near the head and a giant, freshly deposited urine stain which had partially transferred to the bedding.

Contacted the front desk and got a hold of the night manager.  He was apologetic, offered us a different room and said someone would be up to help us relocate.  45 minutes later, no one has showed up.  At this point it's 2 or 3 AM.  Eventually, the manager himself came up and helped us relocate to the new room.  He was pleasant enough.

The new room as marginally better in that it was apparently absent of malodors and human excrement.

No concession were offered or made.

As for the rest of the stay, the only saving grace for this place is the location.  It's located conveniently in Times Square.  

For $900 for two days, it was sadly deficient.  Do not recommended.  1 star for the location, 1 star for the night janitor.  2 out of 5 stars.

title: SHEENA! Racist and disrespectful desk supervisor!
text: I was treated with hate and racism. It's hard to admit that I was in tears after speaking with Sheena! And I'm over 40 yrs old. Our family has a lot of traveling experiences, therefore meeting someone like her in a hotel of global recognition is a shock. Her attitude is next level of treating guest disrespectful. When I tried to contradict her, she started threatening me with security. She practically decided in advance to NOT help  and was enjoying all my growing frustration. The situation was of technical matter and I'm convinced we could've solved it in any other hotel with normal management. I'm  surprised to read older bad reviews about Sheena, and yet she's still there. IHG Hotel please do better with choosing the right employees.

title: Crowne Plaza Times Square Review.
text: This room had an excellent view of Times Square, right in the center of the action. Close to Times Square Station where you can pretty much connect to the whole city. The staff was very accommodating and gave us a stress-free check-in.

title: Only good thing is the location - avoid!
text:
Arrived at the hotel on day of check-in to be told that they did not have any of the room type we had booked (and paid extra for) and that they would have to downgrade us for the night and we would need to go back to reception the next day for them to move us to the room we actually booked and paid for. I did say that I wasn’t happy to be told that there was nothing they could do apart from maybe waive the nightly facility fee which I had already paid in full for our stay through Booking.com. We took the downgraded room as we had no option and when we arrived, the room was filthy, it had a dirty, old wash cloth over the shower head, blood on the bed sheets (I have photos which I also sent to the manager), the lamps did not work and neither did the hairdryer. The USB charger on the alarm clock also wasn’t working. The room felt like it hadn’t been used, cleaned or maintained in a very long time. I went to reception and told them I wasn’t happy and it wasn’t good enough. The manager asked me to send her the photos which I did and she gave us another (downgraded) room. She didn’t really seem to be that bothered or care about the issues we were having. We got the key card for the new room and went up in the elevator to the 38th floor for the key not work on the door and the lock just kept flashing red. I went back down to reception again to be told that the key should work but they will send security to the room to check if the battery needed to be changed in the key card lock itself. They sent security and sure enough, the battery was dead in the lock. The guy that came gave it a quick charge so we could enter. He said that he would send an engineer up asap to change out the battery and not to worry, that we didn’t need to stay in the room and that it would all be fixed by the time we got back. As it was our first night in New York, we went out for dinner. We arrived back a good few hours later and of course, the key card wouldn’t work again and nobody had bothered to come to fix it. We then had to wait AGAIN for someone from security to come up at 0330am to give the lock a quick charge just so we could enter the room. I have never had such a bad experience with a hotel in my life. I work as an air steward and stay in hotels very often and have done for many years. It just seemed to be one thing after another on the first night and nobody at the hotel really seemed to care or be that bothered.

Complained through booking.com and of course, the hotel came back and said they had no record of my complaints.

title: GREAT housekeeper, wonderful service
text: Gabriela Peraita, she gave great!! service , paid attention to all our needs , she went above and beyond all needs and  services. You need more people like her 1st class service and very polite. I can't say enough good about her.

title: Great location in Broadway close to subway and Times Square
text:
The Crowne Plaza has a great location - it is within easy walking distance of the 50th Street "E" line subway which connects direct to the JFK Airtrain - manageable even with a bag. There is parking on site if you are driving. All the theatres of Broadway are close and there is a CVS opposite, so it is very convenient.

The front desk staff are friendly. There is a gym nearby at a partner hotel and a bar on site for evening drinks, but not restaurant. For breakfast there is a takeout coffee shop  at the back of the lobby with salads, wraps and French pastries. That was fine.

The rooms are spacious and high up (starting 28th floor to 40+ floors) with very comfortable beds and large bathrooms. Rooms were clean and quiet with efficient wifi. No complaints. It wasn't cheap, but hotels in Manhattan are never cheap!

title: Great customer service
text: This is my second time staying at this hotel and it was another comfortable experience. Sandra at the front desk was so kind and answered all of my questions. I really appreciated the great customer service after a long day of travel.

title: THEY DID NOT REFUND MY SECURITY DEPOSIT !
text:
They did return my security deposit .They charged us 50 dollars per night ! 
 Charged on 4th october till 9th October . I stayed 5 nights under the name Raafay Israr & Mahnoor Fayyaz . Its been over a month now . Need to resolve this asap ! My email address 
Mahnoorf@hotmail.com.

title: No deposit refund
text: I was surprised to see that I never got my deposit back from the hotel. I've tried numerous times to get in touch with them regarding this matter, but nothing happened up to the moment. I've never encountered this and I cannot see any rational reason about it.

title: Las camas muy cómodas y limpias
text: Me encanto el servicio y la ubicación del hotel está todo cerca desde restaurantes y tiendas muy iluminado y muy impresionante con hermosos edificios al rededor aunque el precio está un poco alto volvería a quedarme en el hotel otra vez y hablan español 😀

title: 3rd time, last time...
text:
Third time I stayed here, but the hotel is in need of a renovation.
The room we had was with partial Times Square view. The view is amazing. I had mailed the hotel to be able to get an upgrade with better views and higher floor. They mailed me back and told me to ask at checkin desk.. there they told me it was impossible to change room.. never heard that before.
Didn't feel ok. 
Will not stay here again, way better options nearby in the same price range

title: Bring your own hot water, great for cold showers !!!
text: Not one hot shower was made available for any of the 3 nights in Oct that i was in NYC.   Asked to transfer to new room...non available.  Talk about an issue taking the fun out of a "fun trip".  Waited for GM to return emails regarding this issue...did not happen...poor customer service...too busy I guess.

title: Crowne plaza
text: Great location.  Fair priced.  Not the friendliest of people.  Some minor issues - ice machine didn’t work for three days.  No refrigerator in room.  Poor customer service - took three calls to get a late check out and the operator was very rude!  If you don’t mind the poor customer service it is an excellent location!

title: Novel solution for no warm water
text: Location is convenient for shows and getting uptown and downtown, so that’s why it has 2 stars. We didn’t have a warm shower any of the 3 nights/4 days we stayed here. We finally asked the front desk to have someone take a look at it. So they took away our bath mat instead. Being from Minnesota, I admire the passive aggressiveness of that.

title: Horrible Management
text: The hotel is horrible. The temperature was 77 degrees in our room. Too hot to sleep. Too hot to rest. When I called the front desk, I got told the heat is on and the operator hung up. I ended up having to contact upper management multiple times before the issue was addressed. Eventually, a service man came up and opened the unit. The filter was filthy. When my partner tried to photograph the filth, he literally ran away. It took over 3 hours to get the heat addressed. It took hours to cool. The thermostat doesn’t work in the room. Someone in the hotel sent room service to our room at 11:30 at night to antagonize us, because we complained that it was too hot to sleep the night before. Piss poor management. Avoid this place at all costs. Rude unprofessional staff. I could go on about the lack of amenities, like refrigerators, laundry, and microwave.

title: It’s a pity this hotel is not what is used to be
text:
I am used to New York hotels, that are often of rather poor quality compared to the rest of the world, inevitably due to the high number of tourists all year round. 

I was staying here for 3 nights on a long weekend to visit friends. I paid for this hotel with my IHG points, and even with my Platinum Elite status I was not provided with an upgrade. I was assigned room 3715, a rather shabby room redecorated perhaps 20 years ago which reminded me of a much lower category of hotels. Nonetheless the room was functional, but lacked a fridge (or a mini bar), slippers, bathrobes, and to my surprise not even a bottle of water. There was a coffee machine of sorts, with barely drinkable coffee.

As I arrived to the hotel late afternoon after a long flight from Europe, a bottle of water would have been welcome, so I called room service using the shortcut on the room phone. There was an answering machine; “we are buys, please leave your name and room number and we will call you back to take your order”. After waiting 30 min I called Guest Services to find out that a) there is no room service and b) there is no restaurant. The website does list in-room dining as does the Tripadvisor information page. 
The Manager in charge did not seem to find this strange. I sent a note to the reservations team and Management and received no response.

Obviously there is no breakfast either, and I eventually discovered that there is a small shop that offers a few takeaway breakfast items in the lobby.

Times have definitely changed … I would give this Crowne Plaza 3 stars max and I am certain the other hotels that I have stayed at in New York would be better value for money.

title: Cidade difícil meio maluca. O atendimento da recepcionista Victoria foi de grande ajuda. Gentil prestativa e eficiente.
text:
Hotel bom quarto confortável. Limpeza boa. O atendimento da recepcionista Victoria foi o melhor da experiência. Gentil prestativa e eficiente, salvou a viagem em muitos aspectos. O pior foi o café ( da cafeteira).
Poderia ser melhor mesmo nos USA.

title: Very good
text:
We were very happy with our stay at the Crowne Plaza. We had a corner room which was much bigger than your standard New York hotel room. We also had a good view of Times Square. The bed was extremely comfortable and we had maid service every day. 
No breakfast but, there was a coffee shop in the lobby, as well as a really nice bar overlooking Broadway.
We found al staff to be very helpful.

title: Centralt beliggende hotel
text: Fint hotel midt på Times Square. Gode senge og rengøring hverdag.8 elevatorer så ingen ventetid der. Dårlig kaffe på værelset, så køb den ude i byen eller i morgenmads restauranten. Super service af alle på hotellet. Der er ingen gadestøj på 43 etage :-) Super udsigt fra alle værlser

title: Can't Reach the Front Desk
text: This review is a cut and paste excerpt of an email that I sent to the CEO of IHG and the General Manager of the property. I have mutiple upcoming reservations and needed to request my rooms be connected. I am a Diamond Elite Member and Intercontinental Ambassador (the highest status tier). "I am writing to you today because I have been trying to reach someone at the Front Desk of your Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan Property since yesterday afternoon. My office or I personally have called no less than 25 times over the past 24 hours for the phone to just ring then disconnect. This is completely unacceptable. Additionally, I reached what I thought was a helpful operator at the property named Kim on the evening of October 3rd. She purportedly put a message through to the on-duty manager about my request and stated that I would receive a phone call back that evening or at the latest this morning. I have not heard from anyone. I’ve attempted to call during morning, night, and even overnight hours to try and reach someone during slower periods; my attempts were futile."

title: Great location for NYC
text: Great base for exploring the city. Comfortable and a little more than average but nothing swanky! Would stay again as the location is amazing, you step outside and there’s Times Square! The rooms are a good size and it’s not too noisy even though it’s so central!

title: They refuse to refund my room after cancellation in time.
text:
I made a resevation for 2 rooms from 20-27 september 2023. Unfortunately I had to cancell my trip to New York so on 13 september I cancell both room.
After some discussion they refunded 1 room after 1 week. For the 2nd room I am still waiting for a refund. It is now 15 days later and after my requests they even do not answer me anymore.

title: Would definitely stay again
text:
Perfect location right in the heart of time square but unable to hear anything from the rooms
The rooms are extremely generous on the size 
Nice comfy bed
Iron, hair dryer, safe, smart TV, wifi
The breakfast on site was nice 
Rent an umbrella from just outside 
Brilliant, really helped add to the greatness of our New York trip

title: Old, dirty and run down. Please don’t waste your money!
text: Please, please listen to the terrible reviews on here! Do not give it the benefit of the doubt like I did. I travel all the time for work and trust me when I say this is a horrible experience. The only redeeming quality is the location. Our shower wouldn’t work. The rooms and bath are so old and dingy, yellowed and I had red soap/mold in my shower.  Towels are thin and old. Stains on the carpet and the edges of the furniture are so worn - they are rounded. Please do not spend your money here when there are better options nearby for similar money.

title: the Hotel reception - specifically Mrs. Sandra ESP
text:
We arrived at the hotel after a long international flight, around 07:00.
Sandra welcomed us gracefully and ensured that we got an amazing room before the formal stated order. 

This is "as good as service can be"! well done and many thanks!

title: Wanted to ship bed back uk as it was so comfortable 😀
text:
Location right on Times Square which can be very busy especially 
at weekends, lots of restaurants within  walking distance.Lovely room, bed was so comfortable  slept so well. 😴
Bar staff and staff downstairs reception were very helpful and very friendly. Housekeeping did a good job everyday.(didn't have much to do with main reception)
Only moans some places were a bit tired and need updating and would have been great  to have a fridge in the room.

title: Arrogant staff in front of desk
text:
Just back home this week from US and Europe 
I stayed at 9-14 September 2023

I ask to changed/moved to the others room, but at that time they said fully booked even to up grade was not possible.
Very disappointed one of the staff in front desk names Lyonnel is very arrogant want to cancel my stay. You can imagine! He did not give the solution but with easy and arrogant to cancel my stay. He was threatening me to cancel. 
I read trip advisor review and found one of the guest was complaining about Lyonnel very bad too. 
Please to train him how to communicate well to the guest. 

The room
please to evaluate criteria for time square vies room .
There’s no tool to make hot water.

title: Sandra was amazing
text: I came with North Carolina A&T on a financial tour. The concierge Sandra was the best host, this was my first time in the city. She gave excellent insight on how to commute from place to place. She even recommended some spots in Jackson Heights queens for some great food. This hotel was a very good experience and I look forward to returning.

title: Alta Aspettativa, disillusa in toto
text:
In pieno centro a Manhattan, questo è l’unico aspetto positivo. 
Per il resto, camera vecchia con moquette e senza frigo bar (senza nemmeno una bottiglia d’acqua). Bagno vecchio e non “aggiornato”, muri che avevano bisogno di una verniciata e porta della camera che perdeva il rivestimento.

title: Gute Zentrale Lage
text:
Tolle zentrale Lage. Man kommt zu Fuß gut zu den Sehenswürdigkeiten. Personal teilweise sehr nett und hilfsbereit.
Was negativ ist  , dass Zimmer schon etwas veraltet sind , gruselig die Teppichböden, undichte Fenster, heult wie im Hexenhaus um das Gebäude. Wir waren 42.Stock, keine Nacht ein Auge zugemacht!

title: Superb location
text: Location is bang on Time Square and unbeatable … perfect for anyone who wants to shop, eat and have fun in the theatre district.  All the large shopping stores are walking distance. Service is good and the staff is very helpful.

title: Ottimo
text: Centralissimo...pulitoe bellissima camera...peccato la doccia vecchio stile...per il resto eccellente...buona la colazione..personale gentile...consigliatissimo...ho risparmiato un po prenotando con largo anticipo..

title: Not worth the money
text: We got stuck in NY on a Saturday night as our flight home was cancelled and ended up paying $700 for the privilege of staying in this hotel as we could find nothing else.  For the money it really was not worth it.  The rooms are tired almost shabby.  No fridge in the room, not even any water.  My bed was also quite lumpy.  There are virtually no facilities in the hotel either. A coffee shop during the day and one bar the does not open til 5pm.  With the money they charged?  Absolutely not.  We stayed at the much newer Margaritaville down the road which was way nicer than this and much cheaper.

title: Memory of a lifetime
text: One of  the most amazing experiences  ever this was our first family trip in a hotel and from the moment of our check in with Victoria Martin everything has been a truly memorable time. Our room had the views of times square. Location literally in the center of it all. Staff at Crowne Plaza treat you like family customer service is always available for anything you need. Definitely coming back. Thank you for this experience!!!

title: Terrible treatment and disrespectful management
text: My wife and my daughter came all way from overseas to NYC, and the booking was made with my wife's card. After arrival she tried paying with card and card got blocked due to limit allowed by bank in Egypt to pay in dollars. So she offered to pay in cash as its emergency and its same card  name she booked with. The manager was so disrespectful and told her go check another hotel. Imagine a woman and her 7 years old daughter after 12 hours flight and she gets that treatment. I tried to talk to the manager on phone to explain the situation and he refused to talk to me and my wife told me he acted like he is not listening on loud speaker....she went to another big hotel name and they accepted respectfully understanding and accepting to be paid cash instead of letting them sleep on street.....very unprofessional and disrespectful management...

title: Tired old hotel with ridiculous resort fees
text: Stayed for five nights in August. At check in a deposit was taken off us and we were told that everything was paid for in our package including resort fee. I’m not sure what the resort fee was for, the gym is not even at this hotel! On checking out the receptionist told us she would deduct $200 dollars for resort fee, when I questioned this she reduced it to $120. I was not happy with this but had a plane to catch so paid it and left. Resort fee for a hotel that does not have a gym, doesn’t even provide water in the room, has no restaurant for breakfast! It’s the fifth hotel I’ve stayed in NY and most definitely one I won’t come back to.

title: Great birthday stay.
text: Booked for a 30th birthday trip. IT systems were down when we got there, so they stored our luggage for us while it got fixed. A couple of hours later it was fixed and we were checked in quickly to our Times Sq view room (2803). Room was spacious and very clean. Bed was comfy. Housekeeping did a great job every day. Air con was fab. Despite being right on top of Times Square, it wasn’t noisy. Genuinely no complaints at all. Thankyou for a lovely stay

title: Gross and very disappointing
text: This hotel was so disappointing!!  E got there around 5pm (prime check in time) and they had 1 clerk at the front desk to check the 15 people into their rooms.  After waiting about 45 mins to an hour we finally got into our room.  We missed our dinner reservations.  Our room #3116 smelled of stale water/mold.  It appears the ac unit must have been leaking because about 1/4th of the carpet was sopping wet.  We were only staying for 1 night and my husband didn’t want to move after we got all settled in.  BUT I WOULD HAVE.  I went down to complain to the front desk and they said they’d take money off the bill.  When I went to check out the next day I see that they took $55 off the bill.  We still paid $243 for the room!  Ridiculous!!!   I would NOT recommend this hotel!!

title: Start of our trip
text:
We have just checked in, and I’m a return guest. Room is very clean and comfortable with good air conditioning and an amazing view!  The receptionist and porter were so helpful and pleasant. 
Couple of things missing  in our room though like the do not disturb sign, only one coffee cup and no luggage racks. Unfortunately there is no fridge in the room, if I want one it will cost me an extra $30 per night.

title: Considerar otras alternativas de alojamiento.
text:
Dejamos en el velador unos lentes de sol que ya no estaban cuando regresamos de un paseo. Hicimos el reclamo varias veces pero no hubo solución. Nunca nos había pasado esto en otros hoteles de Nueva York. 
Hay además un cargo de U$ 40 diarios por servicios, sin embargo la habitación no cuenta con refrigerador. Esto es complicado cuando se necesita conservar  alimentos como lácteos por ejemplo. Si bien el aseo diario como recambio de toallas, ropa de cama y limpieza del baño  fueron adecuados, al revisar detrás de los muebles había polvo y suciedad de larga data lo cual habla de poca preparación de la habitación antes del ingreso. El sillón disponible estaba manchado y con restos de alimentos y un frasco de medicamentos entre los pliegues. 
No tenemos quejas con el personal que fue amable en la atención pero los detalles mencionados no hicieron grata nuestra estadía en este hotel.

title: Great experience will choose again
text: The hotel has the most amazing location. Its right there in the midst of all the Times Square related action. Tons of performances right outside of the hotel every single night. It was too fun. The hotel itself is very clean and very beautiful. We got housekeeping service every day and we loved it. Our room was ready on time and we asked for late checkout which they allowed one hour complementary and charged $25 for another hour. We liked everything. But one of the ladies at the counter wasn’t the best to customers. We didn’t get to deal with her thank goodness but another customer did and she was very rude to them. She even said I need to open a psychiatric ward here. No cap. Vanessa was very nice of that’s her name. She dealt with us and was super accommodating.

title: Incorrect charge and still no refund
text: The hotel took my card for a holding deposit and actually charged me $400, 6 weeks on and multiple email chases this still hasn’t been returned even the hotel have stated on 3 occasions the money has been released back but ‘timing to reflect depending on issuing bank’ complete rubbish!!!

title: Avoid the Times Square Crowne Plaza
text:
I was due to stay at the intercontinental Barclay hotel for 3 nights but due to a legionnaires health issue at the hotel ended up staying at the crowne plaza in Times Square. 

It is without doubt the worst crowne plaza I have been too. The hotel has minimal facilities. The room was average at best and the bathroom was a disgrace. My 12 year old daughter refused to have a shower is was so filthy. Barely any sockets worked. 

I complained to three managers who were unable to do anything as the hotel was full. 

To compound matters IHG charged me over $400 more to stay in a significantly inferior hotel ($1400 for 3 nights). Again the managers were allegedly unable to review the rates. 

I would have been disappointed had it cost $200 dollars a night it was that poor.

title: Great Location, Average Room
