text: The main thing that this location has going for it is the location, which is terrific if you're in New York to see Broadway shows. It's perfectly situated. The room itself was fine, although I was surprised that there was no mini-fridge ... especially when the person who checked me in told me that I would be charged if I took anything out of it! I was on the 20th floor, and 1/3 of the elevators wouldn't stop at the 20th floor - the button just didn't work - so I either had to get out on 19 and walk up a flight, get out on 21 and walk down a flight, or just wait for a different elevator. The worst thing about my stay was that I was woken up on my first morning at 6 AM because housekeeping hadn't checked to make sure the alarm clock was off! Coming from the West Coast, that was 3 AM for me ... and I was NOT pleased. There is a little grab-and-go coffee shop in the lobby, but they really need to hire extra staff because it was always very slow.

title: Rock Star Service!
text:
Crown Plaza Hotel Time Square New York City Located in the heart of the Theater, Arts, Entertainment and Media Communication centers, hidden among sights and sounds of the city and among the high-rises is the Crown Plaza Hotel where guest experience stand out for its esthetics and genuine exemplary customer service. This hotel has a Guest Service team that look like Rock Stars, literally-professional, chic and stylish. This team greets you in a genuine courteous manner while handling your check-in like a pro revealing their efficiency and the class New York City is known for. 

     Your senses will be soothed in their spacious (competitively affordable) rooms. Comfortable beds stunning views. Rounding out the exemplary guest experience are service staff who can save the day in entertaining ways. On the second day of  my arrival the thermostat to my room went on the fritz, not cool on a cool New York day, I was directed to speak to  engineering and maintenance, which sent my anxiety on a climb. Since it was late, visions of a half awake service member arriving with a wrench to bang on a pipe or two and promise an operable heating system rose in my head. Immediately upon the maintenance team member  picking up the call my experience changed! He was not only awake, he was full of energy and spoke with a enthusiasm in his voice. 

      The service team  took the experience to a high-rise level. He went the extra mile not only in his communications but in his service. Wait for it!  he immediately apologized for the inconvenience, still sounding enthusiastic he offered to service the thermostat and offered a “Sun shine package” which included another blanket, a thick cozy robe, and a bottle of water.  Wow! I actually hung up with a smile! Great team, great stay!

title: Fantastic city great hotel
text:
Perfect location for visiting Manhattan so clean and yes there was noise during the night but hey New York the city that never sleeps 
The rooms were comfortable and clean 
The staff were amazing  
New York is the city to see  we loved it 
Can't say enough about this hotel 
Don't delay visit as soon as possible

title: Great, clean property with staff that cares!
text: Great service, great rooms! Clean and on the higher & nicer end of affordable hotels. Staff was super pleasant and helpful, from the bellman to housekeeping. Great location right in the middle of the tourist craziness. Tip: if you are parking a car go online to Icon and prepay your parking. You’ll get a discount by doing it ahead of time.  Choose the lot at 1601 Broadway. Our car was safe throughout the stay, despite our initial concerns about leaving it in an unattended, albeit enclosed lot overnight. Upon check in they weren’t able to get our family on one floor, but an extremely helpful front desk lady made quick arrangements and got us switched to connecting rooms immediately. I only wish I got her name to personally call her out and thank her, but I hope she sees the review and knows. We would definitely, absolutely return again!!

title: Bed bugs warning!!
text:
BED BUGS WARNING!!
I stayed at Crown Plaza Time Square on July 15 2023.
I got a lot of bed bug bites by confirming my urgent care doctor.
I am in pain of burning and itchiness from the bites as I am writing this.

title: It's what you would expect
text:
Its a crowne plaza in time square, so don't be surprised. Its functional and ok. Expensive and not the best hotel in the world.

I was on the 29th floor. There was no noise. Downstairs in a coffee shop and bar. I didnt use the bar.

I am struggling to say more.

title: Manager needs training!
text: I asked to speak with manager as booked a standard room and was hoping to get a glimpse of the view. I was so rudely spoken to by Lyonel who raised his voice and tried to lecture me about the room category booked. Ridiculous customer service! And he abruptly left after I asked him to stop yelling. Seriously need to revamp your team. Please review the CCTV. Will never book again.

title: Great hotel and location
text: Very happy with our stay and view of Times Square. The staff was friendly and rooms were clean. It would be nice to see an addition of small refrigerators for leftovers and my personal need to store milk for my toddler, but that’s not a deal breaker. The lobby was pretty and elevators were fast. Bonus to be right in the center of everything too! We will be back!

title: Avoid
text: Still no refund from covid cancellation, they message back on tripadvisor in public view to make it look like they are concerned and doing something about your review but nope, they are not. They just say in a private message they will pass our complaint to management and it goes no further.

title: Weirdly… no breakfast offered !
text: Great location. Clean rooms. Old fashioned bathroom. Very friendly and helpful reception team with bags of personality. Weirdly no breakfast offered…..No frills, normal rooms, no additional facilities worth writing about. NYC is way behind Dubai in terms of hotel quality

title: Very good quality-price
text: Great location. It’s near everything you wanna see when you go to New York. It’s so close to 49th and 42nd steets subway stations (that’s what my family and I used to move when we went). Maybe the rooms need an upgrade, but nothing really important to remark. The personal is charming and they’re there for everything you could need. There’re ice machines in every floor, coffee machines in every room and buckets to put your drinks and make them cold. I’m overall, 10/10. When I go there again, i'm very probably staying there.

title: Not Professional people
text: We have been holding a conference last twenty years. Again, three years ago we have paid $2,500 to hold a conference. But the hotel still is not fully open. We wanted our money back. But they are not giving our money back. This is not very professional behavior.

title: Convenient location for theatergoes
text: Room was clean and a good size.   In cafe the leather couches were so worn and the room was in need of updating. Check in and out was effective. Location was best for theatergoes but as expected, the outside noise was intense all night.

title: You pay for the location
text: This hotel is a bit pricey, but it is in Times Square. I was actually surprised with how large our room was, compared to other places I've stayed in Times Square. The room was great. We didn't pay for a room with a view, because I planned to not be in the room except to sleep. The bathroom, not as great. Definite signs of aging. The coating on the tub was chipped in places. The water went through extreme temp changes during our showers, from cold to burning hot and back again. But for the location...probably worth it. Walking distance to Central Park, obviously close to Times Square, easy subway access. Plus, we saw Hadestown while we were there, and it was right next door. Couldn't beat our location! We did reserve parking in the garage attached to the hotel, and I do recommend reserving a spot, especially during peak times of travel, not only to guarantee they have a spot, but they have coupons online that saved us $50+.

title: Good experience - great manager Eden
text:
I had a great stay at the hotel. I was here for a month with my brother. The manager Eden was very helpful. She helped me with the registration, she made sure that the room was always nice and clean and showed me a lot of kindness. She directed me how to get around the city. The hotel reception always called to make sure I was happy with my stay and everything was good. I had a great experience at the Crown Plaza. 

Ora Feldman

title: Won't call you cab, and their 88$ Flat fee with their car to the airport is only if you pay Cash!
text:
Overall, the Hotel is fine. 
My problem was with trying to leave. 

I went down to the front desk to book a wake up call, and asked about booking a cab for when I had to leave in the morning. They said that was fine and to ask the concierge downstairs about the cab. 

I went down and asked them if I could book a cab for 6am. Since I didn't want to be late to the airport (LAG). They said they don't pre-book cabs, but when I was ready all I had to do was come down and ask and they would call me a cab. 

Easy! Or so I thought.... 

Come 6am, I went down with my bags and asked the concierge if they could please call me a cab. 
Their response was "Oh you can take our cars, 88$ flat fee" I said, no thank you, can you call me a cab. 
They said "No, we don't call cabs at this time" so they took me to the front of the hotel and stood there waiting for a cab to drive by. 

15 minutes of watching him stand there and not even try to flag down a cab.. he comes over and says "See, not many cabs at this time" ... 
I looked on my phone and saw that I could have just called a cab myself, but now it's been 15 minutes of standing there and I was going to be late. 

So frustrated, I went back inside and took their car. 
Which BY THE WAY was not a flat fee of 88$. That's only if you pay cash, and doesn't include a tip. 
If you pay with card they add taxes as well! Awesome! 

Thanks for lying and ripping me off. 

So just a note for people staying here that may need a cab in the morning. Call one yourself, because apparently they won't do it for you (even though they say they will).

title: Great Hotel
text:
Hotel is a really good location for sightseeing and located right in the heart of Times Square. 

No complaints from us, staff really friendly and helpful especially as our bags got lost coming, offered us toiletries and robes complimentary.

For those cautious/ confused of charges, we were charged $75 a night for service fees/ charges and included a breakages deposit. Upon check out we were charged $200 for our 5 night stay. Expecting a refund for the remaining amount.

title: Exceeded Expectations
text:
This was the perfect hotel for my mother-daughter trip with my 14 year old daughter. She wanted to stay in a hotel with a view of Times Square. I was a little nervous that our view wouldn’t be good, but it was perfect! We were on the 37th floor, so pretty high up (which was a fun elevator ride 😳). I was a little disappointed at first when we stepped out of the elevator and saw our room was right in front of us. I was dreading the noise I’d hear from it— but I’m happy to say it was not an issue at all. In fact, I was pleased with the overall sound quality of the room. We didn’t really hear much noise other than some city traffic at night but it wasn’t bad. The room itself was very spacious and comfortable (King bed). I was expecting it to be more cramped in the room but again, it exceeded my expectations. The front desk/reception were pleasant , though I wouldn’t say overly friendly. No issues with them. Check in and check out was quite simple. The location of the hotel was absolutely perfect! It really could not have been better for our particular trip. We ate dinner at Juniors right across the street, and then saw Wicked at the Gershwin theater which was just a few blocks away. It was a quick walk back to the hotel at night after the show. 
We only stayed one night, but I was more than pleasantly surprised about our experience. I would absolutely stay here again some day!

title: Shall never stop in this cowne plaza again
text:
Can honestly say that this crowne plaza is the worst one I have ever stayed in. And believe me as a diamond elite member on ihg rewards I've stayed in quite a few around the world.
Were to start? No restaurant, no pool didn't find out about this until check in.
Then to be hit with an extra $40 a night  on top of room fee and taxes. Which was not charged by the intercontinenta times squarel in April.
Furniture is absolutely knackered, all chipped, scratched and doors and draws do not close properly. Had issues with getting TV cable to work. Whole place needs renovating.
The only saving grace to this hotel is the bedding. Needless to say won't be staying here ever again

title: Enjoy the Crowne Plaza@Time Square!
text:
What lovely place to stay!  EVERYONE was so accommodating and the room and hotel were well appointed and immaculate. No pool or refrigerator in the room but we were in the midst of Times Square!!! There was so much to do and see. The hotel’s Grind & Co. coffee shop was our go-to every morning after a small coffee in the room (& Krispy Kremes from next door.). There was a CVS 2 doors down and many great restaurants close by. 
I booked through Expedia-BIG MISTAKE. THEY ADDED $357 to our bill. I could have booked through IHG for a lesser rate with my membership. Avg was $312/ night plus tax and fees. Recommended: call and book direct. Research. And I know you will enjoy. We walked to plays, restaurants, bookstores, shops, etc. You will love it!

title: No Restaurant for Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner
text: We’ve stayed here before and enjoyed it, but we’re very disappointed this time as the restaurant was closed. You can’t get a sit down breakfast! There is a ‘grab & go’ kiosk but nowhere to go and eat. This is not great for families. The bar/lounge doesn’t open until 17:00 and only serves bar snacks - not a proper lunch or dinner. We also had to pay a service charge of $40 per night on top of the room charge. This was unexpected and felt like a scam. Would not recommend.

title: Couldn't ask for a better view.
text:
We had room 4101 which is on the Times Sq side of the building. The views in two directions are truly spectacular, but despite being on the 41st floor it still gets a bit of street noise so bring ear plugs if that bothers you (it didn't bother us).

As with the previous IHG hotel we stayed in, the beds and pillows are absolutely primo and we had a great sleep every night.

Room 4101 is an accessible room with grab rails in the bathroom and a drop-down seat in the shower.

The coffee from the food bar was excellent - I didn't try the room coffee maker.

The only negative thing I would say is that the lighting at reception is rubbish. That area was very dark even during the daytime. The upmarket and moody look is all very well for hospitality spaces but we also need to be able to read our bill.

This hotel is in a great location with a subway stop a few meters up the street and a larger one five to seven minutes walk in the other direction. When leaving NY we were flying out of Newark so we walked down to the bus terminal - approx 15-20 minutes - and caught the bus to Newark which was a tenth of the price of a taxi and took the same amount of time. The same bus also goes to the big outlet mall next to Newark airport.

title: Disappointed
text: Good day travelers. It’s very disappointed that in this kind of hotel (4star), they cannot provide 2 cup glasses for our room? Instead they sent us paper cups! We’ll be here for 10 nights and this is unacceptable! The room is ok, beds comfy, but the amenities are not for the IGH chain.

title: Convenient location, Will return
text:
This has to be by far my favorite hotel in  NYC, and I am returning tonight. I stayed here before Covid and find the location ideal-watching a show, seeing the sights and even going to the new Urban Hawker food court is so convenient .
The staff are  amazing and friendly  checked in quickly, went to my room absolutely wonderful The staff are attentive, This will be the hotel I would stay! Thank you for the good experience and memories.

title: No Deposit Refunded Back To Me
text:
Nearly 3 weeks later and I'm still awaiting my deposit you pay $75 per night. No replies to any of my emails. Paid alot of money for this hotel for them still to have my money in their bank account and not send me back my deposit! Absolutely disgusting from a 'proffesional business'! 
This issue needs to be resolved so other people don't loose their money like myself !

title: Pathetic Management at such a nice property.
text:
This hotel has a fantastic location in the heart of Times Square. Very close to the subway. However it is “impossible” to get a live body at the property to answer the phone or respond to an email. I had a dirty toilet when we got to the room and it was always hot in the room, despite setting the thermostat to be cold. When I brought this to the attention of the manager, she said she would remove the facility fees. However I see that my card is charged and I cannot get anyone at the hotel to respond sensibly. 
Really deplorable!!! You just get the run around by the staff at this location and are treated like dirt inspite of being a diamond elite member. Just sad!!

title: Un bon hotel bien placé
text:
Difficile de trouver un niveau qualité prix avec une situation aussi proche de time square. 
Vraiment idéal pour visiter New York à pied, central park à 5 minutes, beaucoup d'autres attractions (rock, summit) très proche. Broadway bien sur et 3 entrées de métro à 2 pas.
L'hôtel est correct mais pas exceptionnel. Pas de salle de petit déjeuné, c'est bien dommage. L'entrée est en sous sol, pas des plus sexy et les ascenseurs sont plutôt long à arriver à votre étage... Mais la literie est bonne et on est pas à NY pour rester dans la chambre...

title: Good View Bad Customer Service
text: The room and view are good. Front desk staff are unprofessional and not helpful. There are many other hotels in the area, and I would suggest seeking out a better overall experience. I am still still waiting on a call back from a manager.

title: Great location
text: Great location and staff. We were upgraded to a room with a nice view due to our IHG status. The room was surprisingly spacious! Even though we were on one of the higher floors, we were still able to hear some noises from the street (ie siren) at night. Note that they charge a ~$40 facility fee which includes free wifi and phone calls lol

title: Just for sleeping
text:
It is an old hotel, more 3 stars  than 4,The room is ok and the cleaning staff , very effective, the attention of the front desk is very professional. The Bar is closed most of the time and if you want a soft drink for your room you have to buy it outside, the fridge in the lobby floor is always with locker.
It remind me the old hotels for salesmen.A pity they are not going for more, the location is fantastic

title: No refill on soap or coffee cups
text: The services are terrible. No refill on coffee cups or soap. We phoned 3 times and asked for coffee cups. Every time you are told they are coming to bring you some but they never do. The wifi password did not work on the first day because the name was entered wrong and front desk did not pick up the phone. The shower faucet is unstable and you can only get cold or very hot water but nothing in between.

title: Very good and well located hotel with one caveat- no room service or glassware
text:
This is a very comfortable four star hotel at 49 StW on Broadway. Tell the diver to enter from 48st into the proper entrance instead of dropping you in the street at the Broadway side.
Our room had 2 queens and a view of Times Square. Large and comfortable room, beds and bathroom.
Very clean and tidy.
The big problem is they haven’t restored room service and there’s no fridge. The result is that there are no glasses anywhere in the room or from the lobby bar. Only paper cups and tiny plastic specimen cups. Had to find a place to purchase coffee cups and glassware. Who wants scotch or wine in paper cups???
For supplies there’s an excellent food market at 49th and 8th Avenue and a good breakfast at the Times Square diner on the opposite side of 8 th Ave.
Joel is very close to the TKTS booths for same day theatre tickets at 50% or 40% off.

title: Victoria the best ever customer service!
text: Absolutely amazing service! After a bad night at another hotel, Victoria went above and beyond to make our trip better. She provided a fantastic room and the best customer service I've experienced. We can't thank her enough! Truly the loveliest experience with her. Thank you Victoria! Highly recommend the Crowne Plaza Times Square.

title: Very Bad Experience, would never book stay here again
text:
Hi Everyone,
I did not like the service of this hotel at all. I did a booking through 3rd party and due some unfortunate situation (Emergency) I was not able to travel and wanted to cancel my trip but the hotel staff was not at helpful in this situation and was very rude they didn't even receive my call quickly and no one was willing to help in this situation. I understand the policies are very strict and hence I requested credit points at least in my account but they didn't even listen to my request. I would never book stay here again because there is no Humanity in people there.

title: ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE! HORIBLE hotel management and customer service
text:
ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE AND HORRIBLE HOTEL MANAGEMENT! I stayed at Crowne Plaza Times Square from late Apr to early May 2023 and they've overcharged my credit card. Despite 10 days if back and forth messages with the hotel management including attachments of screenshots of credit card charges and reservation confirmation stating the amounts, the hotel keeps on saying that they haven't overcharged without a proper backup explanation to the statement. I can't stress how ridiculous the conversations have been.
In addition to this, there were other issues during the stay: we stayed for 24 hours without Wifi in the room (they said it was due to the heavy rain), there was one day without housekeeping (even though there was no "don't disturb" sign on the door), every now and then the shower water would turn cold (we had to wait a couple of min to get it back to warm), there was no laundry service on the weekend (in the country of good service, can't they outsource it to a business that works on the weekend, or at least Sat?). I'd never recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Excelente ubicación y calidad
text: La mejor ubicación de NY, el hotel es limpio prolijo y el personal muy dedicado, esmerándose ante cualquier inconveniente, volvería sin pensarlo. Es literalmente el ombligo de Nueva York. No duden en elegirlo

title: Worst experience ever from hotel staff
text: My husband and I took a romantic break to New York for 5 nights. We stayed in a King Room with Times Square View. The rooms we can't fault - nicely sized, comfortable, clean and not forgetting the amazing views! The check-in/front desk staff/porters were absolutely amazing and super helpful and friendly! Absolutely nothing to fault! However, the one bad experience we had at this hotel absolutely ruined our stay for us and has left a bitter taste in our mouths. My husband and I went to go get coffee and cake from Starbucks one evening, upon our return - we decided to sit at the bar to finish off our coffee and cake; then the waiter came up to us to advise the bar is closed. We advised her it's okay - we don't want to order anything and just wanted to finish off our coffee and chat with our family and friends on wifi as that area was the only area we could access wifi at the hotel (the hotel wifi wasnt working in the rooms, in the 2 days we had been there already), we will leave when the guests start leaving as there were still over 10 guests at the bar finishing off their drinks. She then called a lady who is apparently the manager named Shahana, whom I find  hard to believe is a manager - not with the way she handled the situation. Shahana then arrived and demanded us to leave the bar, otherwise she will call security if we refuse to leave. Like we are some sort of criminals, forgetting that we are paying hotel guests (our rooms cost a fortune!). And eventually, she did call security who escorted us out. This situation really could've been managed better. Especially after the inconvenience of not having wifi for 2 days, the least they could do was allow us to sit at the bar with comfortable seating to access it and finish off our coffee. We were not bothering anyone. Not just chase us away when there are still other guests there. I myself am in the conferencing & events industry, managing outbound conferences worldwide, but not once have I experienced such treatment from hotel staff. Crowne Plaza is a world famous brand and to have your management treat guests like that is really worrying. Based on insider information, I know you've recently opened after being closed for the longest time due to Covid and were made to reopen, and with this re-opening it came with new staff members. Whom I think are not fit for a customer service role - or need to be trained when it comes to conflict resolution with guests.

title: 💜💜💜💜 MERVE Y
text: A very wonderful place, I enjoyed a lot, the cleanliness, beautiful food, beautiful treatment, and I will return to it every time when I visit Istanbul. Thank you, and thank you to the beautiful employee with a beautiful smile and a wonderful heart for her elegant dealings MERVE Y 💜💜

title: Buon hotel
text:
Ottimo albergo.
Camere pulite e molto spaziose.
Buona la scelta di caffè in camera.
Non ho provato la colazione però, quindi non so dire di quello.
Lobby efficiente.
Posizione perfetta per Times Square, anche se la zona è decisamente rumorosa.
Positivo!

title: Friendly Staff
text: From the moment we arrived the service was excellent. We told the receptionist it was our 40th anniversary and our room was immediately upgraded, the we!come was very warm and ALL the staff couldn't be more helpful.

title: Room too small
text:
Comfortable beds. But tiny rooms.  It’s quiet as we are at the back. I don’t know if all the rooms are as small as this one. But this is ridiculously small. Bed is big enough though. 

Friendly staff.

No robes. No water. Two small thin towels. Coffee machine. Very basic. It’s not like other Crown Plaza’s we have stayed in. We were disappointed

title: Un 4* bien placé mais plutôt moyen
text:
Chambre double traditionnelle 2 lits doubles

Points négatifs: 

Chambres vétustes,

Les toilettes sont dans la même piece que la baignoire.

La baignoire etait très abimée, peinture écaillée pas de pomme de douche a raccord pour se laver.

Pas de mini bar/ frigo dans la chambre!!!! Pensez a demander votre bouteille d’eau chaque jour a la reçeption, elle sera a temperature ambiante et pas de frigo pour la refroidir.

Odeur et atmosphere humide generale dans la chambre.

Hygiene tres moyen.

Points positifs:

-litterie etait de bonne qualité,
- plutôt calme compte tenue de son emplacement en plein times square,
- le personnel très sympa

Ne vous attendez a un vrai 4*, cependant, connaissant d’autres établissement de même game dans le quartier, celui-ci reste correcte.

Attention un déposite de + 500 eur vous sera demandé au check in.

title: Dilapidated expensive hotel
text: We stayed (fortunately) only for 2 days. The room  looked like 50s motel. Very bad choice of decor. Bathrooms fitting were all leaking. There was no temperature control, seemed to be broken. No repair was done despite asking. I slept in my jacket as I was freezings. Location was great, you are right at the time square. I’ll definitely not even think of staying there the next time.

title: Très agréable
text:
Excellent séjour. Emplacement idéal.
Notre chambre était très agréable, salle de bain un peu vieillissante.
Le personnel est charmant.
Un défaut, pas de petits déjeuners pour cause de travaux mais possibilité d'avoir boissons chaudes et service Bakery.
Toutes les chambres ne donnent pas sur Times square. Pour ce faire, il faut demander une corner room et spécifier "sur Times square" mais il 'y en a qu'une quarantaine...s'y prendre en avance...

title: Not as advertised service lacking
text:
Definitely not worth the cost with so many other nice hotels in the area.  

Went up to room to find temp 75 degrees.  Turned on AC and waited three hours as the temp never changed.  Called desk asking for another room.  They sent tech up to tell me AC isn’t working because it is too cold outside so opens window and sends up box fan.  So not I am facing Times Square with window open loud as hell and box fan running.  I always specifically request room away from elevator and was placed directly in front of them.  Here for work and want sleep so this is not a great start to the long work week.

Also upon arrival I was informed the gym is closed and has been for some time yet the website still lists it as open.  Your option is to walk 4 blocks down the street.  The only reason I chose to stay here was for the gym so now not only is that a bit difficult but I am hanging out my window for cold air.  I don’t recommend the hotel since it could have been an easy fix and just move me to another room but that was never an option.

title: Saved only by the great location
text: Many have said the same, but it's obvious  the social media person gives a cursory, standard reply since my experience months later matches theirs. Hotel is super tired with a crooked tap, cupboard doors hanging off, porters nowhere to be seen to help when we checked in. The hotel is saved only by the superb location, very busy so they would have zero motivation to improve. No water provided unless asked, the vending machine on our floor  was totally out of stock. The tea and coffee facilities in room was horrid and absent. Staff were pretty friendly though,  except one. In conclusion the hotel spells of arrogant neglect.

title: En toute connaissance de cause
text: L'atout majeur de cet hôtel est son emplacement, au coeur de Times Square. Sinon, cela reste un hôtel dans Manhattan c'est à dire : cher avec chambre relativement petite (qui peut être bruyante selon la proximité avec l'artère centrale). Literie très confortable mais pour la chambre double, il s'agit de 2 lits de 140. Robinetterie vieillissante, décoration vieillotte, restaurant fermé. Pas de porteur de valise, pas de frigo dans la chambre, un seau à glace avec glaçons à disposition à l'étage. En conclusion : pas à la hauteur d'un 4 étoiles européen. Service de correct à très bon selon les employés. De nombreux commentaires mentionnent des problèmes de carte (encaissement d'une caution avec l'empreinte), ce qui n'a pas été notre cas mais j'avais indiqué lors de notre check-in que je paierai les taxes de séjour et resort taxes en cash. En conclusion : je recommande pour un premier séjour pour être au coeur de Times Square en fonction des offres plus pou moins avantageuses, sans s'attendre non plus à des services exceptionnels.

title: Reclamo por cobro y no extorno de Garantía.
text: Hotel bonito y céntrico. Pero debo dejar constancia que no se me avisó del descuento que hicieron al registrarse en el hotel. Me indicaron en el check-in que me retendrían $ 40 por noche por garantía y que me lo devolverían a mi tarjeta de crédito al chek-out (o a los 7 días después).  A la fecha no hay ningún retorno del importe cobrado por 4 noches. El Hotel  aduce que me cobran por wi-fi mejorado (si en todo hotel  es gratis), servicio de llamadas de larga distancia o en ciudad (si yo no hice ninguna llamada)  Me alojé del 3 al 7 de marzo de 2023. Me siento muy ofendida. Tengan cuidado cuando tomen este hotel. Verifiquen sus estipulaciones no vaya a ser que les hagan cobros no estipulados y les hagan cargos por algo que no usaron.

title: Ótima opção para a primeira vez em NYC
text: Eu amei a localização, foi ótima para a nossa primeira estadia em NYC. O hotel fica em uma localização diferenciada e que proporcionou um acesso fácil a toda Manhattan. Eu não iria com crianças, pois fica em uma área muito movimentada. Apesar do movimento não tivemos nenhum incômodo com o barulho, a limpeza dos quartos foi ótima e a cama muito confortável. Atendente Sandra foi muito gentil no check in e mesmo com as limitações no inglês fez questão em tentar nos compreender e ajudar. Porém, os carregadores de mala precisam de maior cordialidade. A internet foi ótima, TV também (acesso ao Netflix). Fizemos um up grade para um quarto com vista para a Times Square (foi maravilhoso).

title: Staff listens to our room requests and exceeds expectations
text:
We returned to this same hotel to celebrate our son's milestone 30th birthday- it had been 10 years since our initial stay and we felt it was right to try the Crown Plaza again. It did not dissapoint!! The location is right in the heart of all things NYC - 
What made us SOO very pleased was how two staff members listened to our room preferences and were able to fulfill our request in getting 2 room on a higher level that also were close together or at least on the same floor. The Staff exceeded my exptations - I was delighted that both rooms were not only on the 37th floor but that they were right next to each other. One of our rooms had the amazing view of the Hudson River and had great extra space ( perhaps being and end room on the floor)- The rates were very reasonable as well, considering the location and being in the Theatre District. We cannot thank the staff enough for a pleasant and very memorable stay.

title: Very Positive Experience!!!
text: Excellent location for everything we needed and wanted to do - easily walkable to so many touristy places.  Great vibe on Times Square!  Facility met all of our needs and expectations.  Clean room and public areas.  Elevators ran quickly - hardly ever had to wait.  Coffee shop had what we needed at breakfast time - didn't use it for other meal times.  Staff very helpful whenever we had questions.  Really appreciated that we were able to check our bags until we needed to leave.  Would definitely return to this hotel!!

title: Fantastic stay, would reccommend
text:
Fantastic location, just one block from the centre of Times Square. We stayed on the 37th floor and was suprised how quiet it was up there. Two double beds in room, cable TV, good A/C, decent bathroom. Only thing that didnt work was the safe (however not a big issue). 
I booked on a black Friday deal so go a really good deal.
Nont they do take a large preauthorisation payment on arrival, however this was quickly returned in full within 24 hours of leaving.
Also CVS oposite the hotel which was good for picking soft drinks / beers for the room at cheap price.
2 minute walk to 'R' and '1' subway lines for quick connections to 9/11 and statue of Liberty.
Would certainly stay again without question.

title: Don’t believe the poor reviews, and excellent stay in an excellent location!
text:
We were a bit concerned about the hotel considering the poor reviews about lack of hot water etc. However, what we experienced was nothing like the recent poor reviews and in fact it’s probably about how you communicate with the staff to get the best experience.

So let’s address the hot water thing first. So the shower has clear instructions on how to turn it anti clockwise fully to get the hot water. Once you’ve done this you can then dial back the temp. Not a problem with the hot water, just read the instructions! It takes a bit of time for the hot water to come through if you’re using it off peak (3-5min) which is understandable. It was instant in the morning and evenings.

Staff across the whole hotel were superb and couldn’t do enough to help. The lady that checked us in was excellent, giving us tips on how to get cheap tickets from trusted buyers etc. the bar staff were always friendly and were excellent too, a nice relaxing place to go at the end of the day with nice views below!

Facilities were really good. I think the hotel has a gym and pool but those weren’t open when we arrived April 2023. To be honest I don’t think we would have used them anyway because the main attraction to the hotel is the central location, which is brilliant. We were out everyday experiencing NYC so wouldn’t have had time to use either anyway.

We went as two couples and the person that checked us in immediately recognised this so gave us rooms that did not have a connecting door in the 44th floor. The views from the rooms were excellent and the rooms themselves were very clean and tidy. We didn’t think the rooms looked particularly dated at all. If you want a modern looking hotel then look at the pictures. Bed and towels were changed everyday and bottled water given each day which was really good. The bed was really comfortable and very wide so we can’t complain at all!

We had a late flight booked so was able to use the bag holding room on the ground which was really handy and all the porters were friendly and helpful.

Overall the hotel was excellent considering what we paid which is why we gave it 5 stars! If you want a different experience then that comes at a cost so please don’t under rate a hotel because of that.

Thank you everyone at Crowne Plaza Hotel and we hope your recovery from the pandemic is a speedy one, we had a great time here!

title: Why charge the resort fee?????
text: Shower is freeeeezing  cannot understand why we are paying the extra resort fee. 40 dollars per room per (got 3 rooms for 5 nights) Apparently I've been told by Mike the manager it's for the WiFi . Will not  recommend  for my business travellers.  Tx

title: Clean Quiet Rooms for a Great Price
text: My experience here was everything that my experience at the nearby Intercontinental Times Square was not. To be sure, this hotel is dated as well but they are doing everything right with what they have. Prompt and easy check in, recognized and thanked for being an IHG Platinum member and given a great, upgraded room. I was on the 41st floor -- super quiet despite being right on Broadway. And the room was super clean! Very comfortable bed and pillows, plentiful towels -- all the basics were taken care of in such an outstanding way that it made you overlook the chipped furniture and dated carpeting. The Intercontinental needs to take housekeeping lessons from the Crowne Plaza's staff. A wonderful stay without a single hitch. It was exactly what I needed after a pretty terrible experience at the Intercontinental.

title: Gabriela greets you with a smile
text:
Gabriela Peralta provided the best housekeeping service I have ever received.  She was friendly and professional.  And, she did an excellent job keeping our room in tip-top shape.
 I'd give this hotel and its staff a "10"

title: Would return; great hotel.
text: The hotel was a great location. It was clean. Our room was what we booked. The staff was friendly. Check in was smooth. Nothing "wrong/bad" happened. Yet, nothing amazing or 5 star worthy occurred. There are multiple floors with inoperable ice machines so if you do visit, I would ask which floors ice machines work so you won't be on a scavenger hunt like I was. It was a good enough experience to return if I want to stay in the center of Time Square.

title: Terrible staff
text:
Terrible service. Rude receptionist.
I am staying here for 3 weeks, checked in last night. Receptionist blocked my card for extras without asking for my approval. I had no water in the room, no minibar, room service was off and i was after a 20 hours trip, dehydrated and jet lagged. There was no hot water in the room either. If the management is as rude as their stuff I doubt this comment will be read or taken seriously.

title: Great option near Times Square
text:
Pros:
- Easy check in process with friendly staff.
- We were assigned a handicapped room, which was very spacious. The bed was comfortable.
- Nice view of the Hudson river.
- Loved the shower, which had fantastic water pressure.
- Quiet location up on the higher floors.
- Nice clean room.
- Good wifi, which you connect to with a password. They provide you with wifi details upon check in.
- Good value for the price.
- Great location near Times Square, but far away enough where you aren't disturbed by the street performers.

Cons
- None.

title: Not 4 star
text: Reception staff are rude, house keeping was rubbish, they don't clean rooms properly, very dusty and forget to leave towels. Hot water was like playing Russian roulette, if it was hot shower quickly, as it could be cold 10 seconds later. Rooms are very tired and need attention. The concierge were great though, very helpful. I have stayed in better 2 star hotels. I will not be back here and certainly wouldn't recommend it

title: Waiting for a refund for 3 years
text: Well. It is coming up on three years since this hotel canceled our reservation because of covid. We have a lot of promises to be refunded but have not see one nickel yet. When will this hotel make good on its promises to issue a refund?

title: Buena ubicación en pleno Times Square
text:
Muy practico y funcional si quieres estar bien céntrico y próximo a todos los lugares emblemáticos de Manhattan. Bien comunicado por subway y bus.
Las habitaciones amplias y camas muy cómodas y limpias. En el lobby tiene un bar con vistas a Times Square.
El desayuno se puede comprar en la cafetería y tiene servicio de parking en el hotel.

title: Don’t stay here.
text:
Very ideal location for time square, staff are friendly however they’re really bad at giving back refunds which a taken from a credit card. 

Very hard to get hold of once you’ve left the hotel. 

Wouldn’t recommend due to this as my credit card is now asking for this money which should of been refunded by now.

title: Bad Experience in an expensive hotel
text:
My wife, two kids, and uncle all chose to stay at the hotel because of its local to the theater district. We requested a conjoined room because we have the two kids and wanted to be able to have the kids to choose which room they wanted to sleep in safely. I also noticed we chose to stay during St. Patrick's Day weekend, so we wanted to arrive before the parade. We emailed the hotel about this and they said it shouldn't be a problem to do early check-in, but it may take a few hours. We arrived at 9am and thought we should be able to get a room by noon. We checked in when we arrived and our rooms were not yet ready and we were also told that it shouldn't be a problem to get a conjoined room. They said check back with them at noon. We had them check our bags and we went off to walk around. When we got back, we checked on our rooms and they said that they were still not ready and said they should be able to get the rooms ready after 3pm - we had been waiting since 9am at that point and were exhausted. Finally, we checked in again at 3pm and our rooms were ready, but they didn't get us our requested conjoined rooms that they said shouldn't be a problem. 

We finally get into our rooms, but discovered right away that there was no toilet paper and no towels - were they really prepping the rooms? There also was no refrigerator or microwave, which should be an automatic when paying the ridiculous amount of money they were charging in this supposedly great hotel. We have stayed in IHG hotels in the past and have NEVER had this problem. We had to call several times to get these things taken care of. We have a daughter who is Type 1 diabetic and needed to have a refrigerator for insulin storage. They were going to charge us 35 bucks a night for the refrigerator, but finally caved when we said it was for a medical reason. These things should be free when it comes to staying in a hotel like this!

We were also charged fees that I've never seen on a hotel bill - BEWARE of this if you choose to stay here. 

My family will NEVER stay at this hotel if we choose to come back to NYC.

title: Fantastic hotel loved our stay
text:
Cannot fault this hotel or its staff. 
Myself and 6 of my friends stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and we loved it. The staff were so welcoming and helpful. The rooms had fresh towels each day . 

I would like to mention the reception staff in particular Rhoda and the manager on the night of our arrival on the 15th of March where there was a mix up with our room due to British airways poor service. 
The staff who helped us that night were Angels  thank you so much again. 

Beds and pillows were sent from heaven ! So comfortable

title: Great location, sneaky fees
text:
Great locations, sneaky policies. That sums up this hotel.
Crowne Plaza has perhaps the best location in midtown, close to Times Square. Employees in the hotel are courteous, helpful. 
All of that goes to vain when they do not disclose a $40 resort fee or what that fee entails to a customer. Quite shameful.

title: Staff member recognition
text: I stayed in the hotel over the weekend with my partner , the breakfast was amazing , and a staff member was absolutely so polite the whole time and always made sure everything was okay I believe her name was sara.

title: LACK OF RESPONSE FROM  NEW MANAGEMENT OR SHOULD SAY NO RESPONSE.
text:
We were booked from 17-21 of february 2021 when covid hit since then they promised a refund that was never honoured.We have since sent many emails and have phone them
on numerous occasion to stay there for our credits with no response. While we where in New Work we went to see managment  to discus our  problem and again they promised that the manager would get in contact with us well its been 27 days and still no response, I would not recommend staying at there hotel with the little respect they have shown us.
SHAME SHAME SHAME

title: Not safe, bad management, poor customer service
text: Worst hotel!! You can't even get a hold of the front desk or security. This is a safety issue on top of other things and management is nowhere to be found. I will NEVER stay at an IHG hotel again, what a shame

title: Not the same Crowne
text: I really wanted to prove other reviewers, wrong about this hotel bc had stayed here a few times before for work, pre-Covid and enjoyed it very much. Great restaurant great views, good service clean rooms. However on this trip, spring break with my kids, it is been the worst experience. I should’ve kept my booking with M social. My flight was canceled for the first day, American Airlines fixed everything, but it was painful trying to get the Crowne to help me out, considering that the airlines caused my flight cancellation. However, they got it resolved and I thought good, thank you for the understanding even though it took you some time, this will be a good trip. However, I got to my room, it definitely does not have a great time square view even though I paid extra for it for my kids, and the cleaning service kept taking our towels without replacing them. By the second night, getting back late at 11:30, I had to call them at 11:45pm for towel for the morning. after 50 minutes, at 12:38am had to call again to get the towels. I stayed up till 1:15 waiting for these towels (e didn’t even have a hand towel!). We also have never had consistent hot water, showers are so painful, we have to get in and out within five minutes, or wait. 15 minutes for the water to get hot. We’ve had maintenance come up a couple of times, but it has not resolved the issue. Don’t even think about having two people take back to back showers. Imagine a group of 3?!. It’s just not been a great experience and it’s definitely not worth the money, there are much better hotels for the same price or less, that are updated and have working rooms. So upset i decided to stick with this hotel despite the recent poor reviews. That’s what i get for not listening to google…

title: Great hotel!
text: Clean and spacious room, friendly and accommodating staffs, great bartender (Martin) and it is close to everything (restaurants, Broadway shows, subways, stores, etc…).  Just 1 perfect hotel!  We will definitely stay here again if we visit NYC in the future.

title: Horrible management
text: The location is great but, as read in other review, the state of some rooms is deplorable.  The AC was not working, and the heat was blowing at 80 degrees.  When requested to fix or replace the room, the staff kept saying we will look at it.  Whenever I called back, they had no record of any conversation. In addition, the staff was just rude. No other way of describing it.  After 2 days of supposedly working on it, came back to the room at 11:00PM only to find the room window opened. This was their solution. NOTE: 42 floor window opens widely. This is a huge safety issue. When we asked for a different room, the manager said that the hotel was old, and that is it. He also said to let him do his job when asked what was taking so long. This is unacceptable and the "Crowne Plaza" should not associate with this management.

title: Lies lies and more lies
text: Very disappointing communication from this hotel and IHG. 3 years now and still no refund after our cancellation due to covid. We were guaranteed our refund within 90 days then 120 days and so on, this was just so we wouldn't be in the time frame to request a credit card charge back. Shame on you crowneplaza and ihg group, you have done this to so many people.

title: Solid hotel - steps from the heart of Times Square.
text: Great location - can't say enough about how centrally located it is; main spaces look great; stayed for a couple nights and first room had a bit of a plumbing issue so asked to be transferred to another room for second night which was fine.  Solid hotel all in all.

title: Super disappointing stay
text: This was our first trip to NY and I was happy to find a Crowne Plaza smack in the middle of Times Square. I wanted to love this hotel There were so many choices around and, in hindsight, I wish after the first night I would have moved to another hotel. First, upon check-in, where we were told we were getting a "complimentary upgrade" to a corner room, we were given a dirty room. Pillows and linens were all over, debris on the floor, the bathroom had not been touched. I called downstairs and it took almost 30 minutes for someone to come get us and bring us to a different room. Of course, this one was a standard room but at least it had been cleaned. It was also super hot. At 10 pm in the middle of January, with temps outside in the 20s-30s, I thought all I would need to do was turn down the thermostat. Wrong. It was already set to 65, but the temp in the room was 78. I called downstairs for the second time in the first hour since arriving. Maintenance came up and told me there was no way to turn off the heat, no way to switch to cool air, and the only way to cool the room down would be to open the window. I was shocked that the window would even open. It sure did. No screen, tons of grossness around the entire inside of the window frame, and now we could hear every single noise coming from Times Square, not to mention the damp air from the ongoing rain which made us both feel awful in the morning. Opening the window only cooled the room down a couple of degrees. It was still way too hot the entire time. I tried to ask again about a different room and was told they are all the same way. At 9 am the first morning, while we were still sleeping, someone was banging on the door like the building was on fire, By the time I was almost at the door to open it, housekeeping was opening the door on their own. Thankfully I had the safety bar engaged so they couldn't open it all the way. I opened it and the housekeeper just stared at me. I told her that we would not be out of the room for a couple of hours and she just huffed away. I ended up putting out our Do Not Disturb sign for our whole three-night stay because at that point I was not interested in having someone in my room while we were out. On Day 3 I called down to ask for clean towels and for someone to come grab our trash. Neither happened. I called again and added a request for more coffee in our room. Again, nothing. The staff was all super rude the entire time we were there and no one seemed to care about the issues we were having. Blank stares and short answers were about all we got. Once we were home, I contacted IHG to complain about the hotel. They said they would contact the hotel directly to have someone call me. I got one email from the hotel asking me to call them. I called numerous times and was never able to ever speak with management there. They obviously do not want to hear any feedback. Besides the location, this hotel offered no reason for me to ever consider staying again.

title: Times Squares best!
text: This hotel not only has an amazing location in the heart of Times Square, but the staff are exceptional! And if you’re lucky enough to have a Times Square view room, you are in for a real treat. When we checked in, Freddy was absolutely exceptional! He was my first real impression of New York City and I honestly couldn’t have had a better, more friendly, more helpful first impression. Thank you Freddy!

title: Great staff, central location, no complaints
text: I had a last-minute relocation from British Airways to the Crowne Plaza and after reading some reviews I was a little nervous - however the experience was great, check in was simple and we had a lovely concierge (Nana) who was so helpful and friendly, the hotel has been closed for a long time so a little dusty around the edges but not enough to cause a problem. The coffee shop opened early every morning for fresh coffee, pastries and bakes (reasonable priced too) the bar was open daily with bar food alothough the restaurant was closed (we had no intention of eating at the hotel anyway). The rooms where big and had great views of Times Square, they where also remarkably quiet (air con and heating all working fine) checkout was super simple and the resort fee was taken from the deposit so no hassle, all of the deposit was refunded immediately. Left luggage was a godsend and the team could be more helpful in directing us to the airport. The only downside for me was the location, on one hand you couldn’t be more central and if it’s your first visit to New York, it’s perfect, this was our third time and in hindsight somewhere a bit quieter would have been more suitable - all in all a great experience and the staff at the hotel where fantastic

title: THE CROWNE HAS GONE DOWNHILL!
text: We have stayed at the CROWNE PLAZA TIMES SQUARE for many years. It was our favorite hotel while visiting New York City a few times a year. This is our first visit back since they re-opened in November. It was VERY DISAPPOINTING! Our room 1610 was very small and dark and dingy. The website advertised that the rooms were renovated so upon check-in I asked the girl if we were getting a renovated room? She promptly let me know that none of the rooms have been renovated since 2010. I explained that on the website they are advertised as such. She said that was not the case. Going up to our room the first thing I noticed is how dark it was in the room…,,when I opened the curtains they were hard to open because one of the plastic liners that keeps the light out was ripped. When I finally got it open, I realized how filthy the curtains were. UGH The room was clean, but very old. The bedding was new, thank goodness, and the towels looked all fresh with a new fresh shower curtain. It was cold in New York City this past weekend going down to 33°. We went and grabbed a bite to eat and when we got back the room was 65°, we had put the heat on before we left but it never moved. Our vent was blowing cold air. We called down and engineering came up. The gentleman was very sweet and he told us that in an hour we would have heat, that the whole system kicks on at a certain time, and it was really out of his control. THREE hours later we still had no heat it was still 65° in the room and we were freezing. We called engineering again. They came back and this time the gentleman told us that he was going to get us a heater for the room that we could plug-in so we would have heat. He said the heat was adjusted according to the central office, and it only flips on when the outside temperature gets very cold. I guess crown plaza doesn’t realize that 33° outside IS very cold. He brought the heater back and thankfully that got us through the Weekend! The room  heat did kick on around 1 AM but never warm enough to shut the portable heater off. The price of this hotel is very expensive and I did not expect subpar accommodations. The housekeeping department was very sweet and consisted of a very nice lady. We were staying two nights so after the first night, I told her she didn’t have to do the room we would make the bed but I needed fresh towels. the poor lady felt bad telling me that she had no hand towels and no washcloths. By the way, this was 10 AM in the morning it was not late in the day, so why she didn’t have any I have no idea. She said she would bring them back later, but she never did. From start to finish. also, the restaurant is still not opened. They definitely need to open the restaurant it was pouring raining and we really didn’t feel like going out, but we had no choice because there was nothing to eat at the hotel. The bar opens at 5:30 which they should open this earlier in the day if the restaurant is closed. also put back the chairs in the waiting area. People need to be able to sit down while their family is checking in. Everything else in New York is open why the delay in all the amenities at this hotel??This was a very disappointing stay at the Crowne plaza. I will be going to the Marriott Marquis  when we come back later this yesr!! CROWNE PLAZA should up their game because there are plenty of hotel choices in New York City.

title: IHG should be embarassed
text:
I recently completed a 4-night stay and all I can say is "Wow." Like, wow, why are they even open?

I stayed at this hotel several times about ten years ago and I don't think one ounce of maintenance or TLC has been put into this hotel since then.

The problems start with the entrance. The Broadway entrance is completely closed off. Even if arriving by foot like I did, you have to use the entrance between 48th & 49th and compete with all of the vehicular traffic. Be safe!

I understand that it's winter and a lot of hotels have a central cooling system that rotates with the seasons, but the level of heat in the first room I checked into was akin to a swamp. Hot and muggy don't begin to describe it. I went down to the front desk and was able to switch to a corner room.  Given the option, I highly recommend one of these rooms. The views are panoramic and was even able to get the room temperature down to 76 degrees at one point! I almost had to use a blanket.

Want to wash your face after a long trip in? Forget it. They didn't have wash cloths our entire stay. We tracked down housekeeping several times during our stay and they never had them. I called down the front desk at one point and they offered to bring some up.  That never happened.  Maybe the front desk didn't know they don't have them either?

The room is tired. Really tired. It looks like it woke up after a rough night of partying in 1996 and needs a shower. The furniture is all dinged up and foreign hairs were all over the bathroom. 

Also, and this is a first for me, I was charged their $40 per night "Service Fee" on a reward night reservation. Nowhere on my original reservation was this impending fee notated and the front desk made no mention of it at check in. I use reward night stays at dozens of hotels every year. This just NEVER happens. I'm not sure what you get for this service fee but hospitality and wash cloths aren't one of them.

I've reached out to the General Manager for an explanation of this service fee charge. It's been over a week and no response.

On the bright side, the location is still great for going to see Broadway shows. That's the only positive thing I have to say about this hotel.

This hotel needs a lot of work and can't recommend staying there until they get the basics right.

title: Incredible location
text: The best thing about the property is the location - right in the middle of Times Square. If you are looking for something there, this is a great spot. The second best thing is that they have parking adjacent to the hotel. You literally park your car to get your bags out and give the key to the attendant. In a city like NYC, this is worth gold. Property is a bit outdated, staff was very friendly and attentive and the hotel itself is huge and was very busy when we were there.

title: Checked out after 4 hours
text:
This is the worst IHG property I have ever stayed at. There was no air conditioning or hot water in our unit. We called front desk and they sent up a service guy who laughed and said “you just need to open a window.” As for the hot water? He told us we needed to “literally let the faucet run for a full 5 minutes and you will have hot water.”

Ok…. So we open the window, go to a broadway show, come back, and our room is still 78 degrees. At that point I am furious because I can’t sleep in a room that is warm and muggy… so we go and check out and booked another hotel.

Front desk told me I would still have to pay for my room, which is insanely ridiculous because we had it for less than 4 hours…. But I paid and left, checked into the Muse, and slept comfortably.

title: Remboursement
text:
J'attends toujours  depuis 2 mois le remboursement de ma caution de 300 dollars ! Soi-disant encaissé par erreur
le 16 décembre 2022 j'ai reçut un mail de leur part en me disant  que le remboursement sera fait en 10 jours depuis plus de réponse

title: "What A Racket & Rip Off"
text: This hotel is nothing but a complete rip-off. I made my reservation back in November 2022 received a confirmation number. Sixteen days before by arrival date I had to cancel due to a schedule change with work and had a cancelation confirmation. Never even placed a foot in this hotel. These crooks will not honor the cancellation confirmation, reply back to the IHG Group, issue credit back to my card. Filed a dispute today. BE WARNED

title: fraud!
text: so to start off, when we arrived there was hair all over the floor, shower, bathroom and sink. i washed it away and wasn’t too bothered but then we found a fake nail on the carpet! obviously wasn’t cleaned at all. but again we binned it and carried on. everything was fine until i checked my bank on my second last day and £1000 had been took out of my account unauthorised, we went to reception and we’re helped by Donald and his manager who came to the conclusion that they though our room wasn’t paid ( which it was) so because of the trouble we were told we didn’t have to pay any service fees and when checking out our receipt should be blank. upon leaving it was in-fact blank. now two weeks of being home i’ve checked my bank and again £400 has been took out when i’m not even in the hotel! i’ve phoned the hotel to be greeted with no help at all and after about 20 minutes on hold they are claiming it’s service fees that we weren’t even meant to be paying! i’m having to now take it up with the bank as fraud since i can’t get any answers from the hotel! i’ll never be stepping foot near this company ever again and neither should anyone else!

title: Convenient location, clean and spacious rooms-going back!
text: This has to be by far my favorite hotel in NYC and I am returning tonight. I stayed here last Christmas and find the location ideal-watching a show, seeing the sights and even going to the new Urban Hawker food court is so convenient . The staff are friendly. Evelyn checked me in and out! Rossa was also very kind with my requests. The staff are attentive, Ismael was the other staff who took the trouble to make sure my key works-all the way up on the 36th floor. This will be the hotel I would stay! Thank you for the good experience, memories.

title: LE PIRE HOTEL DE TOUTE NOTRE VIE !!!!!!!!!!!!!!
text:
HONTEUX !

Lors de notre arrivée le 03/01/2023, nous avons fait un dépôt de 400.00$ pour une soi-disant "caution". Cela fait exactement depuis le 10/01/2023 que nous attendons le retour de cet argent ! Ensuite lors de notre retour en Belgique, ils m'ont encore débité +- 280.00$ donc nous sommes à un total de 680$ en plus de notre voyage.

Lors de notre départ, nous avons demander s'ils ont fait le nécessaire pour faire le remboursement de la caution car c'est un pays hors Europe donc cela peut prendre du temps, sauf que la quasiment deux semaines après nous n'avons aucune nouvelles !

Lors de notre tentative de contact, l'hôtel en question confirme que nous avons des frais pour consommation de snacks, appel téléphonique, consommation au bar, frais de service, etc... Lorsque nous demandons le relevé de tout cela, plus de réponses !

En plus de cela, les dames de chambres n'ont pas nettoyer pendant 3 jours la chambre lorsque nous y étions, ma compagne a dû le faire, elles viennent à 7h00 du matin alors que les gens dorment ! Pas de frigo dans la chambre, personne n'apporte les valises dans notre chambre, impossible de regarder la télévision et j'en passe ! 

C'est vraiment une honte, d'ailleurs à ce jour, nous portons plainte contre la chaîne d'hôtel, nous allons mettre des avis négatif partout ou nous pourrons en mettre, et faire joindre cet avis à notre agence de voyage pour qu'il voit le désastre de ce merdier !

title: No heat. No improvements. No gym.
text: They've closed the front door to this hotel on Broadway and you're herded to the pull through instead. It's a concept used in very large hotels in Manhattan. it's mid-block. This hotel just reopened and it shows. Nothing is really ready. No gym. No heat. Harsh lighting and uncleaned carpets in the hallways and rooms. They had 3 years. It's a massive hotel. But they had 3 years to go to every single room and make it all right. It's not. The front desk was a bit mean girls all huddled up when no one was there and chatting with each other as you're checking in. HI - I'm the guest. How about full attention to the check in process? Saying that, they did move me to a large room based on my status with them. And the agent did, finally, acknowledge me but not as a frequent stayer.  But that larger room came with a draft and the requirement of a floor heater to get the room past the 69 degree point. The hotel was kind enough to grant a later check out, but i'm supposed to have a guaranteed 4 pm check out, as a member of their ambassador program. Wasn't allowed. The gym available was at a sister property 10 blocks away. This hotel needs a refresh (which would take 3 years....which they already had available and didn't take advantage of).

title: Nice big room and bathroom
text: The hotel was lovely and we had a view of the Hudson River. I wasn't aware of resort taxes so that was a bit of a shock as I thought we had paid everything before we arrived. But there was £40 per person per night to pay. Nice big rooms and housekeeping every day/new towels. The only thing i would say is no kettle or fridge in the room and no dressing gown. 4 Lifts but we had to wait quite often and for a long time but I guess the hotel was busy over the Xmas period.

title: Great start to the new year.
text:
Always sceptical when I read reviews but decided one had to be done. 
Stayed New Year’s Day to the 6th January 23 for daughters 21st. 3 staying on 46th floor
Room was double and sofa bed. Excellent facilities and great room. 
Little tired looking but otherwise fantastic. 
All staff were fantastic and really helpful. 
Big shout out to the bar staff for keeping us entertained
During a quiet spell. 
No restaurant as closed but the coffee shop was open and did a good variety. 

Excellent location. Easy to get about and use as a base whilst in NYC.

title: Disappointing stay
text:
We stayed at this property the first weekend in December for a two night cost of $1260 including a “resort fee”. This is advertised as a four star accommodation but only the price is actually four stars. When we arrived, the hotel bar and restaurant were closed as well as the workout facilities. The hotel was understaffed and the escalator was inoperative. We received the wrong room and the entire experience was truly disappointing. At the time, the hotel did not disclose on their listing that these facilities were unavailable and they were not completely reopened but this did not prevent them for charging full price. We requested a compensatory discount from the manager John Acosta who agreed to credit one night stay but did not actually process the credit. In the end, we were forced to file a credit card dispute to recover our refund.
Stay away from this property…

title: Excellent Location…
text:
We stayed here for Christmas (23rd to 27th Dec) during our trip to NYC for Christmas and New Year Holidays. We moved to Marriott Marquis for the New Year (which I will review separately). 

This hotel has one of the best locations in case one wants to be close to Times Square. Rooms are good sized if we consider this is right at the center of everything. Try to get Times Square facing rooms on higher floors. I got one as they upgraded me to a corner room recognizing my Platinum Elite status. This gave us some amazing views of Times Square (though view of ball drop wouldn’t still be feasible).
Staff are friendly and they even arranged a electric kettle quickly when I reported there was none in the room.

The Big Bus Stop is close by. Also close by are several eating places, Starbucks, Krispy Kreme, M&M World and a CVS.

The only issue is when I booked the hotel I booked for breakfast included rates. However we were disappointed when at the time of checkin they informed us that their restaurants are not yet functional and they wouldn’t serve breakfast. They did accordingly reduce the room tariff at the time of check-in but this is still not a good situation to be in. If they were not sure of serving breakfasts, they should have made it clear at the time of booking. I (and maybe many like me) might have possibly not booked a stay in that case, as when one is on a holidays the best thing is to be sure of a convenient sumptuous breakfast to begin the day with. In this case it was a daily challenge to go out and have breakfast somewhere else. I consider it an unethical business practice to allow bookings with a breakfast included plan (to attract customers) and then not serve breakfast. It’s some sort of a cheating I must say as when we land up at the hotel, at the lapse moment we don’t have a choice but to check-in.
And this is the only reason I have given this hotel a rating of 3, else this would be a 5

title: Good stay in great location
text:
We stayed at the Crown Plaza, which used to be our go-to hotel, once again after not having been in NYC  since the pandemic. Apparently it shut down during the pandemic and reopened in November 2022. The restaurant is still not open, but a breakfast bar is set up in the mornings with great pastry (mmm, that cherry danish!). You can take your good into the bar area which looks right out into the side of Times Square. Currently the Broadway entrance is closed, so you enter through the doors where the car dropoff is.

The location at TS is fabulous as ever. We were upgraded for free to a spacious Times Square view room on the 43rd floor thanks to our IHG Reward status, which we appreciated. That was fun. Everything about the room was excellent, including that it was cleaned every day. Only suggested improvement: the in-room coffee needs cream and sugar! And you should be aware that there is ppppno mini-fridge or microwave if you need that. (We had medication that needed refrigeration but we just put it on the window sill.) 

I had heard complaints about non-resort ihg hotels
Charging a $35 resort fee. Sure enough, our bill had a $35 a night “service fee” added. For what services? Ridiculous, just up the price. Hope this will change. Also, we noted there was no IHG priority line at the front desk.

All in all, tho, a good stay!

title: Decent hotel, but won’t stay again!
text:
I am split with this review!

We arrived at this hotel after our travel company changed our hotel at the last minute. We arrived after a long journey. My booking was for my husband, myself and our teenage children. We had a booking for four rooms and we arrived at 8pm.

When we arrived at check in, they asked us to pay $375 per room. I’m not sure about you, but I don’t have that kind of money spare. When I said I couldn’t pay this, they said they would cancel my booking, even though I had paid upfront. We were not made aware of this and after checking the website again, it’s not mentioned anywhere on there. Also at 8pm at night one of our rooms were not ready. The first gentleman was very unhelpful, but thankfully Evelyn took over. She said if we couldn’t pay, they would cancel. Again I explained that we couldn’t afford to pay this. Seriously, who could!!! I explained that it was all my children and did we have to pay this for every room. Again, yes. She then said she would speak to her manager to see if she could reduce it to just the resort fee of $40 per night. Might not sound a lot now, but would still amount to $800 for my family. I am disgusted that they think this is ok. I dread to think of young people turning up here without a back up! Our options now were to pay the $800 or look for a new hotel at 8pm at night with our children in tow, pay for another room and then wait for a refund. So our only option really was to pay this. I just want to make everyone aware of this as we were now down a large chunk of our spending money for nothing! As our room wasn’t ready, we got one room upgraded. This was room 45/09. It has a nice view of Times Sq. 

I am unsure what the resort fee was for as nothing was open.

I tried to speak to a manger again a couple of days later as had been trying to see if it was mentioned on website. It’s not and I asked her why. She just shrugged her shoulders. She was so unhelpful and very rude. Suppose that’s why she got the managers job. She told me to go check the paperwork, unfortunately I must have binned this in our room at some point. 

Such a shame as our room was lovely. Good view, amazingly comfortable bed, clean room. Room cleaned daily and fresh towels daily. Lifts were always only a few seconds away. 

Check in seems to take forever.  There is always a queue and always very slow moving. This is also why I waited a few days to try to speak to someone again. Always too busy! 

I heard many people moaning about this fee of $375, so not just me.

I wouldn’t stay here again because of this fee. Shame as good location. But who can afford to pay more than they paid on fees for a flight and room?

title: Brilliant base for our trip!
text:
We were moved to the Crowne Plaza from our original hotel (Row NYC) by our travel company ahead of our trip and reading some of the reviews about the Crowne Plaza, we were a bit concerned about the quality of the hotel.  Well...we needn't have worried.  

The Crowne Plaza was fantastic.  From the friendly, helpful staff to the very spacious room we had, the hotel was everything we needed for our festive family break.  

Room was clean and very spacious compared to others we have stayed in in NYC.  Room was cleaned daily with fresh towels left everyday.

We were on the 32nd floor and never had to wait longer than about a minute for the lifts.

There was a $75 per day deposit taken when we checked in but that was only held on our card for a few days then released back to my account so know issues there.  There was also a $40 per day service charge/resort fee to pay at check out but we knew that at time of our original booking which although a pain, we knew about it in advance.

The bar in the hotel was open for a period of time each day and the small takeaway diner/cafe was open each day from early till around 14.00hrs.  We never used the takeaway but there were always queues when we passed.  

The entrance to the hotel off Broadway was closed meaning you had to enter via the entrance off  W48th St or W49th street.  This was no issue either like we saw in other reviews.  Entrance was always well lit and you were always greeted by the friendly door staff inside.

The location of the hotel is brilliant, right on Times Square, minutes walk to subway and loads of eating places etc. etc.  You really are in the heart of Times Square.

Honestly couldn't fault anything about our stay.  We had a fantastic Christmas Trip and the Crowne Plaza certainly played a part in that.

Thank you :-)

title: Time to find a new hotel
text: This used to be our go-to hotel when we came to NYC for theater pre-Covid. We are back for the first time post-Covid…and never will I stay here again. The drapes look like something was munching on them while the hotel was closed, and we had no towels…not one! I found someone from housekeeping who was very nice and apologetic but said she had none to give me. I complained at the front desk and got two bath towels…still no wash cloths or hand towels. Light bulbs are burned out, shades are crushed, the one print on the wall is in a rusting frame. Place is gross!

title: Amazing stay
text: Such a lovely hotel, great service, lovely bar area, location is fantastic, deposit back on card straight away, never waiting longer then 10 seconds for the lift , thanks again will definitely stay here again

title: Déception
text:
Nous avons passé 5 nuits en décembre 2022, 2 chambres en famille.
Pas de gel douche le premier (rupture de stock selon le staff) alors que nous avons payées 600 euros par chambre et par nuit pour un service lamentable. 
Nous devions appeler le nettoyage certains jours car ils n'étaient pas passé.
Les chambres sont vieillottes, les meubles abimés, eau chaude capricieuse pour la douche, certaines ampoules non changées...
La bouteille d'eau minérale d'un litre à 7 dollars...
La nuit nous entendons les bruits d'ascenseur depuis les chambres.
Nous avons eu le sentiment de nous être fait arnaquer.
Le seul point positif est qu'il était central et pratique pour visiter.

title: AMAZING THANKSGIVING STAY
text:
I went during Thanksgiving 2022 and had such a low price for the stay compared to any other places around Times Square at the time. At first I was wary and filled with unbelief because of the pricing but the room and service is amazing. The concierge was very helpful and nice. The room was a decent size for a few days stay in New York City. The sheets were clean and well made and everyone was friendly. The streets the hotel is on could be shady at times but nothing to worry about at all. 
OVERALL, I would highly recommend booking this place for any trip.

title: À éviter!!
text:
Il est inadmissible d'avoir des chambres aussi vétustes avec du chauffage non fonctionnel, des baignoires peintes pour cacher la misère et j'en passe!!! Ne venez jamais ici.
Les fenêtres sont horribles. Et non isolées..
Aucun frigidaire dans la chambre. Le service est médiocre.
Vieux tapis, tâches sur le plafond, douche non étanches...

title: Granting a Request Above and Beyond!
