text: I checked in on Sunday, December 18 for a romantic getaway. My girlfriend, in the city  on family business, was to join me for the night. When checking in, I casually mentioned to the desk associate that I would appreciate a room with a Times Square view, She said that she would see what she had. By the time she was done, Onelia had not only placed me in a Times Square view room, she had assigned me to a corner room on Floor 42! The windows adjacent to the Times Square view afforded a view of the Hudson River. I purchased fresh flowers (red roses of course!) for the room, and met Alice at her friend's home several blocks away. We walked back to the hotel arm-in-arm, and rode the lift to Floor 42. Alice was quite taken aback by the view; we were both taken aback by the luxurious king bed, the generous pillow menu, and the soft and absorbing towels. Our romantic getaway was enhanced exponentially by Onelia's taking the time to grant a very simple request for a room "with a Time's Square view."

title: Unprofessional, unlawfully holding money, GM Natalie Bogan ignoring everything - do not pre pay at this hotel
text:
I have been in contact with the hotel
since they cancelled my family holiday in April 2020. Despite having all in writing and constantly chasing the hotel for my refund the GM Natalie is ignoring everything. They are rude, unprofessional and I think people should know about the hotel’s policies and procedures.
My refund is not in dispute - the hotel closed during covid and I was informed the refund would be 6 weeks later. Almost 3 years later and still nothing. My guess is that they are treating other customers the same? I would not recommend this hotel in any way - in fact I would avoid prepaying anything as they have held my money now for some time. It is like I have been scammed.

title: Dec 22 crowne plaza for the nyc shopping trip
text:
Was moved here from another hotel. 
Staff were brilliant and so helpful. 
Was given a city view room which was stunning. 

About a 3 minute walk from Times Square and attractions. 

Only the breakfast bar was open during our stay but didn’t affect us. 

Rooms are a great size. Very clean and modern. Beds are the comfiest thing I’ve ever slept in. 
I was on the 40th floor so whilst I couldn’t hear street noise we didn’t hear hotel noise either. 

Would definitely stay here if I visit nyc again.

title: Great hotel
text: We booked a package deal through BA and wasn’t supposed to be staying here. BA changed our hotel last minute and it made our trip. Upon arrival the hotels systems were down and took a while to get back running which wasn’t ideal but no real big issue. The hotel manager waved our first night of hotel tax and couldn’t apologise more. Staff were very friendly and always happy to help. The hotel was right in the middle of Times Square and had great views. It was a very comfortable sleep and quiet for NYC traffic. We hardly heard anything on the 18th floor. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Non scegliete il crowne per le vostre vacanze a NY
text:
La struttura dell’hotel è vecchia, la moquette è usurata e sporca, l’acqua calda nel bagno finisce dopo la prima doccia, al lavabo arriva un filo d’acqua ,nonostante una segnalazione al giorno per tre giorni non è cambiato nulla.
 inoltre appena arrivati nella stanza che ci avevano assegnato abbiamo trovato le confezioni dei saponi aperte con i saponi usati e sollevando  le lenzuola dei bei capelli lunghi e tracce di make-up. Da consigliare??? Fate un po’ voi…

title: Do NOT stay here! Not accommodating and everything is out of order! Disgusting
text: Find new hotel!! Old and run down. Staff was not happy. I paid for two rooms. The rooms are terribly hot, dirty and old looking. No glasses, no water bottles. We asked for a mini fridge they brought us one w food spilled all in this.

title: Pick different hotel
text: Very disappointing, checked in at 4:30 pm and only one of our rooms was ready.  Had to wait in line 30 minutes for check in because only 2 people at desks. Second room was supposed to be ready at 5pm, waited in line again, not ready yet. Came back at 7:30 pm, even longer line and I refused to wait again.  Manager was rude and not helpful, no one answers phone for guest services, many extra charges added on that were not reflected in original price. Rooms are old and in need of updating, restaurant is closed, could not even get a bottle of shampoo. Housekeeping had her cart in front of one room for 4 hours on our floor, if you knocked she answered the door but could not give you shampoo but offered extra lotion instead??? Do not stay there, so many other hotels to chose from, you are fooled by name, there is nothing Crowne or Plaza about this hotel.

title: Fantastic hotel right in the heart of Times Square
text:
We were moved to this hotel at last minute due to our original booking no longer accepting reservations and I’m so glad they moved us here. We arrived and everyone was friendly and check in staff had us checked in in no time. We paid fee to be updated to a corner room and I could definitely recommend. We were given a room on the 37 floor and our room looked over the red steps at times sq and we could see the Empire State Building from our beds - it was unbelievable! Our rooms were cleaned to a great standard and my goodness the beds were sooo comfortable and the pillows were unreal ( I’ve tried / and failed to find out the pillow brand, they were that good I would love to buy some !! ) the hotel is as central as it gets so be prepared from some noise, cars honking / fire engine/ ambulance sirens but we were so tired it did not keep us from sleep at all. Concierge helped us hail a cab - which we were grateful for are we were new to the city. Shops on the doorstep and a handy cvs just outside the hotel for snacks / water. Restaurant was closed during our stay so cannot comment on that.
I would absolutely stay here again without question. If you could let me know the brand of pillows that would be great ( my husband is looking for something to get me for Xmas 🤣🤣)

title: Very pleased
text: Had no idea what to expect. We were very happy. Centrally located for what we wanted to do. Close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, etc. nice room. Very comfortable. Staff was very accommodating and put our family not only on the same floor but in adjoining rooms without us asking! Staff was friendly and helpful. A great experience. We will be back.

title: Great location in the center of everything!
text: Well located in the very heart of Times square, this hotel offers stunning views of the area. We paid extra fro a corner room and enjoyed a very sapcious and pristine room for the three of us. Be advised, none of the on site restaurants are open at thsi time. No fridges in the rooms, either. We felt very safe and would stay here again.

title: Awesome.  1 star reviews are bogus.
text:
Like others have said, I was transferred from The Row, and I also read all of the 1-star reviews.  I was worried!  

Fortunately, there was nothing to worry about.  This hotel was great!  Check-in was easy and they honored my previous arrangement.  No surprises or money troubles.  Parking was awesome.  It was easy to drop off and pick up, parking used a cool QR scan system, and included reasonable rates.  The room was great!  If I'm being honest, it did have a "used" feel to it...it wasn't "new", but that's totally fine (and normal).  Everything was "clean"!  The location is spectacular, that's obviously a selling point of this hotel.  Food available in the cafe in the hotel was great!  Checkout was easy.

So if you get transferred to this hotel from The Row, don't worry, it'll be ok :)

title: Great central location
text: I don't understand the 1* reviews here, and I was a little anxious about staying having read them. We were originally booked to stay at Row NYC but were changed last minute, due to the hotel being used to house families. The hotel was lovely! Great central location, check in staff were very helpful and friendly. We had two doubles in our room, which was clean and safe; an ensuite with shower, bath, toilet and sink. No issues with key cards or our stay at all. A breakage deposit is taken when you check in, and the resort fees are deducted at checkout- this should be returned within 10 business days. The restaurant on site is closed as is the gym, but there is a little cafe on site which is open. We stayed on the 42nd floor, lifts were regular. Front entrance onto Broadway isn't open, but this is no hardship. We were able to leave our luggage after check out too, and we were offered a car if we needed one to be called (we took the train). Would definitely stay here again.

title: Prima hotel met slechte WiFi
text: Fantastisch groot en gunstig gelegen hotel. Schone en ruime kamers! Vriendelijk personeel. Echter geen WiFi in de kamer. DIV keren voor gebeld en gevraagd bij de receptie. Uiteindelijk telefoon nummer gekregen van ict moeten we zelf maar bellen. Dit laatste lijkt me meer stukje service dus niet gedaan.

title: Why are there 1 star reviews ?
text:
Ok so we just arrived back after 4 nights here this passed week for Thanksgiving! I was absolutely dreading the stay after we read reviews in the airport Wednesday before we flew. We had been relocated from the Row - I cannot understand any of these 1 star reviews! 

We had a seamless check in - the girl was SO helpful. $35 a night resort fees which I would dispute since most of the hotels amenities are closed for maintenance- restaurant, pool and gym. They allow access to a gym in a hotel only 5 minutes walk up the road but it really wasn’t sufficient for what we wanted so we trained in a Crunch Fitness just a few streets down.

The room was clean and tidy, the girl who cleaned our room daily was so lovely, she had our routine sussed out the 2nd day and didn’t come for knocking for housekeeping till we had left. We were on the 36th floor, never had issues with the lift, or Wi-Fi, or noise or anything! 

I really cannot fault the stay! I would stay here again. The location couldn’t have been more central, right in the heart of Times Square!

title: Stay clear!
text:
Worst hotel, avoid if you want a good hotel. 
Dirty, staff very poor, no pool use, WiFi doesn't work in room. The list goes on. 
I would not recommend to anyone, the rooms are extremely poor especially for a 4 star hotel.

title: Hôtel vieillot et sale
text:
Hôtel bien situé dans Times square mais À EViTER ! 
L’hôtel est vieillot et sale. Avions retenu un séjour de 4 nuits et sommes partis au bout d’une nuit . 
Le mobilier est désuet et abîmé, la baignoire abîmée, les rideaux déchirés, un coffre fort d’un autre siècle, des moquettes sales et des murs moisis dans la salle de bain.
Pas de petit déjeuner ni restaurant . 
Nous parlons ici d’un hôtel crowne plaza 4 étoiles … au prix par nuitée d’un 4 étoiles …. Malheureusement il s’agit d’un motel médiocre !
A Fuir pour ne pas gâcher votre séjour . 
Dommage car cet hôtel, était, il y a quelques années tres agréable … mais ça a bien changé ..

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
I have returned home today after a 5 night stay at The Crowne Plaza. Like many others we were transferred to this hotel from the Row. I was initially really unhappy as the reviews I read were not great but I will speak really honestly. I have visited New York over 22 times and have stayed in numerous hotels including the Row
When it was the Milford Plaza I have more  often stayed at The Edison over the last 10 years. When I was advised I was being transferred I called BA and asked to be moved elsewhere they advised me that I could either take the swap or have a refund we had our hols booked so decided we would still go and give it a shot. 

Upon arrival we checked in with a really pleasant man on the front desk he was very friendly and knowledgable. The room was in 38th floor and you were always able to get a lift without queuing. The room was clean and tidy and kept in good order. The bed was really comfortable. The maid service was daily and I cannot say there was things missed it always looked cleaned upon or return. We like others had issues with the loo but it was fixed immediately. I really can’t complain. When we checked out we were billed $200 for city tax I did think this was hefty and when the hotel was changed I can’t remember being advised if there was a difference in how much it was ? I can’t remember paying that much before but that is my only gripe I would 100 % stay again it’s a lovely hotel with a lovely vibe the location is amazing and the rooms are really clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly and approachable. I would book again in the future.

title: Good location
text:
Well positioned hotel with really lovely, helpful staff.  Unfortunately no bar open, only a patisserie style breakfast available for purchase.
We were relocated after the original hotel we booked was taken over by Gouvernment to house refugees.  Our booking was miscommunicated to Crown Plaza and we were booked a double room.  As I was travelling with my Daughter it wasn't ideal.  The staff were really helpful and we were moved once a room with two beds became available.  
Hotel located right in center of Time Square.  Transfer from JFK by easy access taxi which are waiting just outside the door.  Thirty minutes costing about 65 Dollars plus the expected 20% gratuity.  
Hotel well maintained and very clean.  Would recommend.

title: Awesome
text:
Awesome location right in the middle of Times Square, rooms was nice and bed was comfortable.
Nice hotel would stay again as perfect location for everything.
Buy a 7 day subway ticket and you can hop on and off as many times as you like etc

title: Avoid at all costs (Hidden fees and theft)
text:
Had the unfortunate experience of staying here when our original hotel was unable to host us due their facilities being updated.
Honestly wish we were allowed to stay in the original hotel, as the Crowne's facilities were non-existent. The bar and restaurant were closed for our entire stay, as well as the gym and the pool. 
To reiterate, there were no facilities open to us as guests at all, not even the cooldrink vending machines on our floor.

This was then followed by being locked out of our rooms twice during our stay, and having to wait over half an hour each time for the non-existent manager to be found and re-activate our key. The second time this happend was increadibly alarming, as they did not ask for any proof that it was our room, they just gave us keys. I shudder to think that anyone could have asked for a key to any room.

House-keeping was also very off-putting, as litter was left lying in the room, but very special care was taken to re-arrange our underwear.

The cherry on top has to be that once these issues were raised, they agreed to waive the hidden fees and "service charges" for everyone's stay. Despite this promise, and not charging anyone else in the group, a full 8 days after checking out they took the money from the card they kept on file. Calling their customer experience line has been futile, as they promised the management of this hotel would reach out, and yet they have failed to do so after multiple calls. I'm having to raise this as a fraudulent charge as they are entirely unwilling to keep to their word or communicate with us.

title: Awful Customer Service and terrible experience for a very $$$ with no faculties
text:
Requested room type unavailable on check but a suitable alternative provided. When trying to gain access to the room the key card didnt work so had to head back down to reception to which i was then told 50% of the rooms had an issue and all didnt work. They sent for an engineer who was a very nice man but his tool to gain access to the room was a coat hanger than had been undone and bent into a very odd shape. After 10 mins of messing about he forced open the door. We were told that they would fix the keycard access in the next hour. So after dropping our bags we headed out. When we returned 8 hours later and desperate for sleep after our transatlantic flight the keycard didnt work again so i headed down to reception which was awash with people all unable to gain access to their rooms.
 
I decided to head straight to the front office manager's desk, he was polite and very apologetic and said he would send the engineer and was sorry it hadn't been fixed yet. 1 hour later with my wife asleep in the corridor at this point we finally had access to our room courtesy of the same man with a coat hanger. We were then told the key card entry would be fixed while we slept.
 
Next morning our toilet was blolcked and backing up into our shower (see pics) :-(
I headed to reception to get it rectified but not before i tried our door again. Guess what it still didnt work!!!
 
I went back to see the front desk manager John as the lady on reception didnt seem to understand i now had to issues and coulndt guarantee me a room that the keycard would work in. John sorted me out a room move to much nicer room and one where the keycard worked. Why didnt they just do this in the beginning?
 
I asked for a full night's refund for the first night's stay for $476 and IHG Platinum member. John settled on refunding me the $120 resort fee for the whole three nights stay. Whilst this is reflected on my final hotel bill nearly 14 days later the refund hasn't been processed.
 
I have called IHG who cannot reach the hotel by phone, email or fax. They don't respond to my emails. Yet seem to respond to TripAdvisor Posts.....wonder why ?
 
Whole thing is a farce, and the brand is a complete detriment to the IHG name. We have stayed here twice before in 2018 and 2012 as the location is amazing but we will not stay again. I am in the process of a claim back via Mastercard to get a full refund for the whole stay at the moment. It will take time but worth it as this hotel is a disgrace.
 
To follow up on previous reviews there is no bar or restaurant just a grab and go that closes at 2pm. The bar is all tapped off with signs up for future development. The hotel was largely mothballed for covid and some of the staff admitted it is chaos as there are lots of issues.
 
I plan to raise an official complaint with IHG as this hotel is damaging their brand significantly.

title: very disappointing reservation!.....
text:
Even I made my reservation 6 months prior to my trip.....I received last minute CANCELLATION.......so I had to look for other option but more expensive due to time
When I was in NY...I passed through the CROWNE PLAZA and was CLOSED
I believe still is close!......I do not know why they continue promoting

title: Wouldn’t recommend.
text:
Location is great being right in the middle of Times Square but as far as positives that’s about as good as it gets. 

Safe in our room didn’t work on arrival, asked multiple times for it to be fixed but they never did fix it. 

Hotel itself is very dilapidated; smoke alarm hanging off the wall, taps broken etc, no vending machine on any floor stocked with water. 

Staff were also not the friendliest or most welcoming. Very blunt, and condescending tone.

title: Great location smack facing m and m world and stop 1 for Big Red bus tour
text: The hotel only recently opened. Our first room we had blocked toilet so they kindly upgraded but unfortunately was to high for my husband 36 floor. They then gave us a similar room on 19th but the internet connection wasn’t available therefore we were on the move again finally settled on the 18th. We stayed here seven years ago and returned for the great location. Staff were very pleasant and were accommodating to our needs. Rooms a decent size for New York.

title: So far not good
text:
I have a reservation for 3 nights next week but it is impossible to get a response to any of my emails requesting info on transfers.

The website says the hotel re-opened 1st November but "there are limited dining options". When I finally phones the front desk (from UK) i got through to IHG reservations who told me there are absolutely NO dining options, not even breakfast, which as an IHG Diamond Elite member is so annoying as it is included in my room rate.

Let's see in 2 days time and hope I will change this review to 5*

title: Upstart
text:
Stayed at this hotel for three nights, leaving tomorrow. Had problems with room key being deactivated two nights in a row but staff helpful to resolve.
Tonight asked for help getting subway to airport tomorrow. Asked guy with grey hair to write it down. Then he left us to sort out a pizza delivery. When we asked if he was helping us he said he was just doing us a favour so we told him not to bother. Customer service appalling.

title: Impossible to reach
text: This hotel is extremely difficult to get in touch with despite supposedly now being open since the 1st of November this year. My situation with them has been a complicated one, as this was not even the hotel I originally had a reservation with. My original hotel I had booked was the Row NYC, who told me a week before my visit that they could not accommodate my stay and that they relocated my reservation to the Crowne Plaza Times Square and gave me their reservations team email to check the details of my supposedly new reservation. I sent 3 or 4 emails over 4 days and didn’t get a single response, additionally went through 10+ hours or transfers with customer service representatives for IHG only to never reach the front desk for the CPTS. Eventually I did get a hold of them and their front desk staff that answered the phone sounded inconvenienced by me calling. After confirming that I would have a room here, even though I still never had it in writing/email form, I decided to cancel my reservation with the Row NYC (original hotel) only to find out that for some reason canceled my stay with the CPTS. Nobody once communicated this point to me. After finally just booking a room at a new hotel, I finally got an email confirmation from this hotel with my reservation number. I’ve tried again to get in contact with them to make sure that I get this canceled and not charged to my card (if that info transferred over from Row NYC). Long story short this hotel has terrible communication not only at the local level but at a global IHG customer service level. Would NEVER book an IHG hotel ever again. If the Crowne Plaza Times Square reads this review, I’d like you to check your reservation’s and info emails and please respond.

title: Bad Customer service from IHG
text: Like everyone else on this forum, we were cheated out of our refund after Covid cancellation April 2020. Unbelievable that no one will help including IHG. I will not pay for a stay at an IHG property until I get my refund and will make sure to tell everyone I know to avoid crown plaza and IHG. We purchased thru the IHG website. When I purchase other products that are supplied by third parties we work thru the booking agent. What happens between the vendor and them is their issue. IHG is just blowing smoke. Its also interesting that there are positive reviews for 2022 when the hotel is suppose to be closed. BOTS anyone?

title: AVOID IHG hotels
text: I've been waiting for over 2 years to be refunded for a prepaid reservation that Crowne Plaza cancelled due to COVID. IHG should be ashamed for not stepping in to right Crowne Plaza's wrong. I've emailed multiple times and get the same excuses. Avoid IHG hotels because they will not make things right if you have a problem.

title: Cheated
text: Like everyone else on this forum, we were cheated out of our refund after Covid cancellation April 2020. Unbelievable that no one will help including IHG. I will never stay at an IHG property again and will make sure to tell everyone I know to avoid crown plaza and IHG.

title: Still waiting for a refund for cancelled trip (COVID) in 2020
text: Our stay was cancelled in March 2020 due to COVID and we were promised a refund.  Numerous dates were promised and passed without any contact and still no refund (September 2022).  Hotel has now been sold and I can't get an answer as to whether the new owners are responsible for refunds.  IHG as a parent company has been useless, claiming his is a franchised property and they can't assist, even with a credit to use at another IHG property.

title: Lots and lots of emails and still no refund after taking over a £1000 -all for my daughters 18th!!!! Disgusting !
text: We had a call Dec 2019 to ask for full payment for our booking in April 2020 - paid and excited as a surprise for my daughter. Then COVID happened and was told will get refund within four weeks, then 12 weeks -then as soon as they reopened. Still now 2+ years later still no refund despite promises. Emailed CEO passed back to hotel, five different managers emailed all promising refund and still nothing -disgusting behaviour from a large hotel group!!!!

title: Waiting for refund from 2 years ago
text: Still waiting for a refund over 2 years after our cancelled trip, we have still not heard a thing?  Does anyone know if IHG have a complaints department we can deal with?  I really expected better from a large hotel group like this.  Our trip was cancelled due to Covid travel restrictions.  We were originally told refund would come through in 90 days!

title: Over 2 Years and Still No Refund
text:
I reviewed this hotel back in January 2021. As yet still no refund. The hotel still isn’t open, yet they seem to be getting great review, interesting! When IHG read my review Deborah R. replied to say she had sent me an email?  I never received it and would be interested to know where the mail was sent.  I tried to call IHG head office to speak to the CEO (Keith Barr), I was told he doesn’t take calls.  So, I emailed him and guess what, no reply!

I am going to New York next month to have our long-awaited family holiday, staying at the Westin, which I should have done in the first place.
Can you tell me when I will get my money back, please? I know you don’t really care but some communication is long overdue.

Below is the original review, for what it’s worth.

I am simply fed up with this hotel. I live in the UK and back in February 2020 I booked 2 rooms at this hotel, staying August 24 – 27 2020 (3 nights) at a total cost of $1508.88. Due to the pandemic both bookings were cancelled on 23rd June 2020 and cancelation numbers were given for both bookings, at this time I was told I would need to wait 60 days for the refund to come through. It is now the beginning of January 2021 and still no refund.
I have called the hotel numerous times and get the same story of “please bear with us your refund is coming”, they even gave me a case reference number!! that was until the hotel stopped answering calls as I believe they are now closed. So, I called IHG corporate in the US who were very sympathetic but managed to cut me off 3 times. Do you they have any idea the cost of calling the hotel or IHG corporate from the UK and explaining why I am calling again and again? I am an IHG gold member and get treated like this, what’s the point in joining the program. To leave, so called “valued customers” without any help or communication is a disgrace. I hope to be staying in New York this coming August 2021, guess where I won’t be staying!

title: Wonderful experience!
text: I loved my stay at the crowne plaza. The staff was incredibly welcoming and super friendly. Special shout-out to Ashley at the front desk for being so kind and patient. There was even a wifi outage in the whole city and they handled it so well and made sure I was super comfortable while I waited to get checked in. The room felt very clean as well. Would for sure recommend and come back again!

title: It's was awesome, would come back after checking others.
text: It's was good experience maybe i didn't get the goosbomb as i expected , i might come back again, after trying others hotels let's see what mood swings in next tour, I would love to come here. But not as couple. I would come here as solo trip, it's best for solo adventure not for couples

title: Location
text:
I stayed here in June for my first trip to NYC. The hotel is perfectly located right in the middle of everything. 

The room was basic (as expected) but clean, which was the most important part for us. 

When I come back to NYC I’ll definitely be booking to stay here again.

title: Good rest is possible
text: Anyone traveling for business will find trains and connection to JFK Air Train very good to come in and check out of this hotel. There will be noises as the location is so central. I have to commend them for clean rooms.

title: No refund from Crowne Plaza after cancellation. They have taken my money!!
text: After numerous requests for a refund and numerous responses saying they will be refunding my money. Well it has been one lie after another and no refund as of this date June 20, 2022. My inclination is that they don't intend to refund my money or any one else's money. I feel they will bankruptcy all the claims. Reservation paid for in Nov. 2019. Cancellation confirmed on March 12, 2020. Refund to be made within 6 weeks. It has been two (2) years and three (3) months. NO REFUND.  Presently they have stopped communicating.

title: No refund from covid cancellation….shock!!
text:
Covid refund!! 

Still waiting for a refund 2 years on, constant excuses via email… haven’t had this problem with any other company. Appalling service and puts me off booking with IHG ever again as they’ve done nothing to help. Appears I’m not the only one with this problem.

title: Still waiting for Covid Refund
text: February 20, 2020 I booked a room with Crowne Plaza Times Sq, for May 1st-3rd. On March 21, my cancellation was confirmed due to Covid outbreak in New York.  I have several emails going back and forth with hotel mgrs stating I would get my refund within 6 weeks. Eventually emails stop being replied to. Contacted IHG, they were not able to help. Also filed a complaint with BBB. Anyone had advise on how to get my money back?

title: In New York's beating heart
text: Probabilmente tra gli hotel più centrali al mondo. Questo hotel non è solo a times Square, è nel centro di times Square. Hotel classico, elegante e, naturalmente, a molti piani. Noi avevamo una camera al 42esimo piano, con una vista ovviamente incredibile, su tutta New York; Stile newyorkese classico, semplice ma comunque d'effetto grazie alla vista. Servizio ottimo, a disposizione anche una piscina carina e un ristorante/bar per niente male. Le camere sono insonorizzate, i rumori della city that never sleeps noni sentono mai. Consigliato per chi ama la frenesia e la vibrante vita del cuore di New York.

title: A Luxury hotel in the middle of the city
text:
Was there for 3 nights.
Nothing bad can be said about Crowne in such a location. Right there in the middle of Manhattan.
pros: very central location
cons: expensive, busy with not so much friendly staff (not all, and also understandable with such a busy city) 

(8.19)

title: Hotel cancelled my reservation two weeks before my stay was to begin.
text: I made a reservation for this hotel back in September, for a stay in early December.  Last week I received an email stating my reservation was cancelled.  I tried to call hotel directly, got a message that the line had been disconnected.  So i called the IHG 1-800 number, and they said the hotel was booked, but then I said I made this reservation over two months ago.  She sounded surprised.  She tried calling the hotel, got no answer.  So she made a reservation for me at another hotel, but no discount given for the trouble they caused.  Oh, and this seems to not be an isolated issue.  I read a review where this happened to another person.  This used to be a dependable hotel, not so sure anymore.

title: Still closed
text: Should have checked the reviews lately as I have stayed here in the past.  Booked a reservation (in June) for December 11-13.  Got an email today saying they are still closed.  Now all hotels in NYC are booked for December weekends or are outrageously expensive.  Called IHG and they had no idea this hotel was closed.  They did not know why my reservation was canceled.  I wouldn't believe anything about a reopening date.  Don't book until you see reviews where people are back in the hotel.

title: Warning! Do not book here!
text:
Despite what their website says this hotel is CLOSED. 

After making a 5-night reservation online well in advance, I had the awful experience of arriving at the hotel to check in on 11/18/2021 only to find the doors locked. No signs! No information to explain… 
I had my reservation number and I called the phone number listed on their site. The person who answered said they could not find my reservation but could book me at another Crowne Plaza property! I suspect “bait & switch.” 

Fortunately I had stayed in midtown for business in the past and called another hotel to secure a room. 

I wonder how the IHG corporate entity can possibly think they can get away with such irresponsible business practices. 

I have stayed at IHG properties in numerous US cities before. After this experience I will never even consider them again.

title: Closed
text: They took my reservation and then a week before my trip to NYC I got an email that my reservation had been cancelled.  No answer at the hotel phone number and no information from the reservation office.

title: Shady hotel
text:
Made reservation for marathon. Show up to Crowne and they say the hotel is closed. Even the Uber driver said, you want to go there?  They are open now?  IHG, parent company, couldn’t even reach the main line to the hotel when they tried to call.   Per IHG website, you could make a reservation, but the one dude in the lobby said “we are closed, should not have let you make a reservation “

Zero stars for crowne and IHG for not keeping track of their brand

title: Avoid IHG and Crowne Plaza
text: The hotel failed to inform me that my reservation would not be honored due to a closure over 5 months after said closure. They are die to reopen Dec. 1, 2021 according to IHG Customer Service. Don’t believe them - they lie and try to get into your pockets for more money

title: The hotel has been closed all along and they cancelled a few weeks before my reservation
text: So mad at this company right now. I booked my award stay early September for mid November. My reservation was a few weeks away and now they cancel because the hotel will be closed until November 30, the email said (been hearing it's actually til end of year)  I look at reviews here and looks like the hotel closed again at least since October if not earlier!  It might have been closed when I booked it and I had no idea. Why am I hearing about this now? Now, of course, there's much less availability for reward nights. If I had known the hotel was closed I could have picked one of the other hotels I was interested in. Now I'm stuck with what was available.

title: They cancelled last minute
text: Several months ago I booked a stay for late Oct 2021.  At the last minute they canceled and said it was because they would be closed through Dec 2021.  Good heavens!  Why take my reservation if you were going to be closed?  Finding a last minute, reasonably priced reservation in the location we wanted was not a simple thing.  I've very disappointed.  This caused unnecessary stress and I had to drop everything to deal with it.  Won't consider them ever again.

title: Apparently there is no customer service.
text: It seems from reading reviews I am not the only one that still hadn’t received a refund from a COVID cancellation almost 2 years later. Was suppose to stay back in May 2020 and have religiously called IHG since there is no number or email that works for this hotel as it’s “closed.” I have a case #10482933193 and every time is talk to IHG Customer Care I always get the same response, “we thank you for your patience at the fine the hotel is not open and will not be able to issue a refund until the hotel reopens.” It has been almost 2 years that this company has been able to hold on to my money and provide absolutely no services. Wasting my time and countless others time having to continuously call and every time I call it’s the same response. It was the hotel will be open 11/2020 than 1/2021 than 3/2021 than 6/2021 than 7/2021 than 10/02021 now 11/2021. Of course I can go reserve a room for 12/2021 right now, but I can’t get a refund from 05/2020. Lastly, it appears the only way to even get a response from this business is to write bad reviews or blast them on Twitter. text: I have been attempting to get a refund from this hotel since May 2020. I had left multiple messages for the billing department and never heard back from anyone. title: Worst Customer Service
text: I will never stay at a Crowne Plaza ever again!  I had a reservation to stay at this hotel July 2020.  I tried for months to get a refund because of COVID and was told no. title: GREAT VIEW!
text:
My teenage daughter and I stayed here in February 2019 and not March 2020 (TA doesn't allow a poster to choose a month and year that's more than a year ago).  I've been to NYC many times, and my daughter had been a couple of times prior to this trip; however, I've never chosen a hotel in Times Square before.  Since our trip was focused on seeing a few Broadway shows, I decided to try this Crowne Plaza and used my points to pay for it.  I received an email about a week or two before the stay that asked if I'd like to request an upgrade for an additional charge, and I quickly sent that in.  I knew it wasn't guaranteed, and I wouldn't be charged if I didn't get the upgrade.

We took a taxi from LGA to the hotel and arrived right around the stated check in time, and the line was LONG. It went pretty quickly until the group right in front of my daughter and me got to the desk.  It was a group of 5 friends who were very upset that the hotel had lost their reservations. The front desk staff called a manager out to try and sort it, and it was discovered that they were at the wrong IHG property.  Honestly, how does someone (let alone a group) take a taxi to the wrong hotel? I was very impressed with the front desk staff as they handled this very difficult group.  Not once did they lose their smiles or tempers, and I didn't even see them roll their eyes once (as I was doing behind them). 

After that group was sent on their way to their correct NYC hotel, my daughter and I were able to check into our room.  I was immediately thanked for being a Platinum, being so patient waiting, and told that I did receive my upgrade.  The wonderful check in employee (I wish I remembered his name) told me that he was putting me in his favorite room that was eligible for the upgrade.  He also gave me vouchers for free breakfasts each day for my daughter and me and A LOT of drink vouchers to make up for the inconvenience of standing behind that group. Our check in was quick, and I was very impressed with the entire staff that I encountered.  They were very welcoming and a great asset to the Crowne Plaza.

My daughter and I went up to our room, and we couldn't believe the view! We had a corner room with huge windows that overlooked Times Square, and my daughter's reaction was worth every dime I had spent on the upgrade (which was, I think, around $50 per night).  She immediately claimed the bed that was closer to the windows and kept talking about how lucky we were to get this room.  When we went downstairs to start walking around the city a bit, we stopped by the front desk to thank the gentleman who checked us in.  He was thrilled that we loved the room, and I'm sure he'll never know that for my daughter, it made her birthday trip even more magical (she still mentions our room 2 years later).

We did have breakfast in the hotel every morning, and the buffet was wonderful. Also (since I had so many drink coupons), my daughter and I visited the bar area a few times (she ordered her Sprite, and I ordered my lager), and all of those employees were great and engaging. 

The beds were very comfortable, and the room (aside from the fantastic view) was wonderful. If you're in NYC once Broadway opens again and this hotel does, too, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here. I do hope, however, that IHG investigates exactly what has gone wrong with refunding so many guests' deposits. At the end of the day, it impacts how travelers view the IHG brand.

title: False advertising - So much deceived
text: So much deceived by the false advertising around this hotel, and from the IHG group. I booked for a stay in June 2020. I had to cancel in April 20 due to the Covid crisis and I was promised to get a refund, inline with the advertising on the IHG group (mother company of Crowne Plaza). title: No Refund

title: IHG/Crowne Plaza Not honoring their policy and processing refunds.  Citing associates on lay-off.
text: Of course my reservation for July was cancelled as the hotel was closed for the pandemic.  I received my cancellation in late June. It's been over 4 months and still have not received the refund.   The IHG cancellation policy states  "If you cancel a rate which required a deposit or payment in advance, we will do everything we can to process your refund as quickly as possible. Refunds ... may take up to 90 days for hotels to process from the date of cancellation...."  So far it's been 120 days and I received this reply recently.  ". Unfortunately, the Hotel remains completely closed, with all of its associates on lay-off, awaiting an infusion of Capital from its lenders. There is still no firm timeline to provide as to when the Hotel will be able to continue processing refunds."      Unacceptable.  I know of no other chain that is holding customer's money hostage as is Crowne Plaza IHG.

title: No Refund/No response

text: Like other posters, I have not recieved a refund for a May trip that I cancelled in April. title: Amazing Stay and Great Location
text: I travelled here with a friend to celebrate our 21st birthdays. We opted for the Times Square view room, which cost more but it was worth it. The view was amazing. The hotel is lovely and clean, we could not fault it in anyway. Excellent location and  had great staff, who were very helpful. We are already planning our return trip to New York for some time next winter and will definitely be returning to stay at this hotel.

title: Great views
text: A hotel with great views that is centrally located. Very nice quality rooms and the staff were great on check-in/out and when we ordered room service. title: Horrible Business Practices
text:
I had a hotel reservation booked for April that was cancelled due to Covid.  I was assured a full refund.  Weeks went by and I received nothing.  I called and was told 90 days because the hotel was having trouble accessing money for refunds.  As a single mother, I too was impacted by Covid, and I found this an exorbitant amount of time to wait.  Still, I waited.  After 90 days- no refund.

I called a few days later and I was told that the hotel was closed and I couldn't speak to anyone until 8/31.  This is UNACCEPTABLE.  I was given a number for the business offices.  I called and left a DAILY message for over a week with no response.  I am confident that my money would be taken for a reservation and yet my money that was owed to me has still not been refunded.  This violates their return policy that is published on their website.

I find this hotel's business practices manipulative and dishonest.  I am disgusted to see the needs of a hotel with a $7million revenue put ahead of a customer.

This hotel has lost me as a customer, but it has not lost me as an advocate for fair treatment until I get my refund.

title: Great location! But need to improve on friendliness and customer service of staff
text: The hotel is located at the centre of activities and walking distance to where we want to go in midtown. The hotel wasn’t that visible though maybe because the entrance is not on Times Square and it has boarded all around the ground floor so I wasn’t sure if it was part of the hotel property.

title: Lost property

I contacted the hotel upon my return home asking if my purse was handed it as it was in the safe.  I completed an online form and submitted.  I have not heard anything from the Crowne since submitting the form so really disappointed.  My fault for leaving my purse and English cash but it would not hurt for a response. title: New York City trip
text: Great hotel, great location, walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, a Dunkin Donuts, M&M's World, Hershey World, and several Subway Stations! Very nice fitness center too! People were friendly, place was clean! Line of taxis right outside the hotel!

title: Horrible Customer Service and outright lies
text:
I’ve stayed at this hotel several times.  Due to COVID I had to cancel my trip, after receiving an email stating they would refund me my full amount due to the circumstances.

That was on March 15.  I was told it takes up to 2 weeks.

No Refund.  I contacted them and they said 21 days

21 days passed no refund.  I contacted them.  They said 6-8 weeks.

No refund.  I contacted them, they said by May 15.

On May 15, I contacted them again and they said it’d be another 90 days.

No one clearly knows what they are doing.  I can’t get anyone to call back, even after leaving several messages.  E-mail responses are just basically form letters that don’t address why I was told several lies.  One even had my name misspelled.  

I understand we are all dealing with a lot right now, as a matter of fact, I’ve been under stay at home orders since early March and have been working from home processing refunds for my job.  To be told I would be refunded, then lied to as they kept moving the date shows they do not value customers.

I will never stay here again, which is sad as I enjoyed the hotel for the most part.

title: Nice hotel in a great location

The location was perfect, 1 block from time-square, brilliant.  The only disappoint aspect was when we took our luggage downstairs to get a cab to the airport we were offer the hotel van which we declined due to the price and were then told to walk out to the street find our own cab.

title: Auntie/Niece Trip
text: I took my 13 year old niece to NYC for her birthday. The hotel was just what we needed. The room was spacious by NYC standards. The room was a little worn, but nothing that should prevent one from staying there. We were upgraded to a higher floor upon arrival and given food and drink vouchers for everyday of our stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Can’t beat the location. Because COVID was just starting to shut things down during our trip, we spent a lot of time in the room and we were very comfortable watching tv (love their TVs so we could watch our own streaming apps). My only complaint would be that you can’t control the room temperature. I like a cool room to sleep and I woke up hot every night.

title: Perfect Location
text:

The only downside was the extra charge on the room per night on top of the rate we already paid when we booked, which I wasn’t aware of, but this is quite common in city hotels.

When I come back to NYC I’ll definitely be booking to stay here again.

title: Ideal para ver Nueva York

 Lo único negativo que las habitaciones son pequeñas, pero suficientes para descansar después de patear NY.

The location was perfect and close to everything you can get in and out and go anywhere you want it quickly the only thing I could say was a negative was that accommodations in the room could be a little bit better for the price but all in all we had a lovely stay

title: Great service and family friendly experience
text: Really great family experience for kids first visit to NYC. Fantastic location, and exceptional service from Tofael at Brasserie 1605. Recommend the breakfast buffet and his service made the experience that much better. Overall, very responsive and friendly staff.

title: Overall Perfect!
text:
My husband and I absolutely enjoyed our stay at Crown Plaza Hotel in Times Square Manhattan. Although I have visited other Crown Plaza’s locations, this particular location has confirmed that all of their chain of locations are all phenomenal. 
   From their cleanliness, exclusive lobby area, awesome location, and outstanding customer service (Freddy was the best!); I will definitely make this my number one pick when choosing a hotel in New York. I can return again and again. Therefore, I highly recommend this hotel to someone who loves great room city views, close walking distance to shopping stores/restaurants, and a great atmosphere and attentive customer service! Their text messaging customer service system was very impressive. Crown Plaza is my all-time favorite hotel!

title: Ideal location, excellent service
text:
We checked in straight from JFK at the peak of check-in time on 1st January 2020 having been travelling for more than 24 hours (from Brisbane). At first sight the long queue for check-in did not offer much hope of seeing a bed for a couple of hours.  The first of our surprises at the Crowne Plaza was how well organised they were. The queue moved astonishingly quickly and we were in our room inside 20-minutes. In New York City you can't expect large rooms but the one we had was more than adequate, clean and fresh.
'Snack' time in the bar/restaurant in the lobby was surprise number 2. By NYC standards the prices are more than reasonable.  By anyone's standards the portions were huge.
Breakfast was the next surprise.  An array of fresh fruit, cooked food, cereals and anything else you might want was all readily available in the buffet. Staff were on hand all the time should you need anything.
Easy walk to the Christmas tree, Macy's and all the other stores as well as Broadway theatres so no complaints on location either.
The only sour note was the imposition of a very heavy "resort tax" levied by most NYC hotel.  We knew about it so no surprise but I am wary of locations that export their taxes, No difference, economically, to taxing their exports.  Not the hotels fault but it makes for a black mark against New York.
Having said that, if you have to go to New York City you won't be disappointed with the Crowne Plaza.

title: Amazing stay
text: I really enjoyed my stay.  The staff is very kind and patient (especially Anna from the dining room!).  The rooms are spacious and clean, the food excellent, great location, the conceriage is very helpful. Very recommended!

title: Quick stay
text: Nice hotel directly in the heart of times square. Prime location that is walking distance from mostly everything and literally across the street from Junior's cheesecake. Freddy was the 1st person we met during check in and his customer service was phenomenal. Our room was great and the views were spectacular.

title: Beautiful Hotel with an amazing view of Times Square
text:
This is a beautiful Hotel with an amazing view of Times Square
Full recognition of my platinum IHG membership with free upgrade to a beautiful "corner city view high floor" room with an amazing view of Times Square. 
Also i received a 25$ coupon to use at their restaurant.
The location with the Times Square just around is amazing.
Also i got a special price of 16$ for the breakfast which was a nice breakfast full of varieties.
Really a perfect stay in the beautiful times square.
Big thank you to Mr. GRANT FABER the FRONT OFFICE DIRECTOR who made my stay an Amazing one in Beautiful New York.
When i return to New York with my family, this will be my first choice hotel for sure.

title: Falta de transparência nos valores cobrados
text:
Estivemos pela segunda vez hospedados no Hotel Crowne Times Square A primeira vez ficamos por 3 dias em 08/2019 Até então naquela época fomos bem atendidos,hotel super bem localizado,um bom Breakfast,enfim resolvemos ficar hospedados mesmo hotel!!Que decepção!!Tinhamos( eu e o marido)pedido um quarto com vista para cidade e pagamos por um valor maior que o da minha filha (pq ela e o marido não fizeram esta opção)Até ai tudo certo,mas ao entrarmos no quarto que era exatamente ao lado do quarto da minha filha ,voltei na recepção e disse que havia um erro:que me cobraram por um tipo de quarto e me deram outro,que até iria ficar ali porque era do lado da minha filha mas queria a diferença que tinha pago a maior!!Pagamos no CASH!!A moça da recepção me imprimiu uma folha com valor idêntico ao que minha filha tinha pago e disse que no checkout a diferença seria devolvida!?Ficamos hospedados por 7 diarias!No dia do checkout ela me imprimiu o valor que tinha pago a maior e me entregou!!Questionei sobre o valor que tinha pago a maior,ela me disse que não sabia de nada e nos mandou falar com o gerente!?Este fez vários cálculos e nos disse que deveria agradecer pq tinha pago menos que deveria e me apresentou uma nova conta com um valor maior do que tinha pago no 1º dia!!A diferença era o equivalente a quase 100 dólares!!Saimos de lá com as mãos abanando,me sentindo usurpada,impotente com a reviravolta de toda a história!!Essa semana,3dias apos estarmos aqui aparece no meu CC a cobrança de um valor de quase 90 dólares!!Sendo que no quarto não havia frigobar,nao solicitamos nenhum serviço de quarto,e como falei,pagamos em dólares no dia que chegamos!!quando chegamos no hotel além do valor pago pediram pra pagar uma caução de 400 dólares,que resolvemos por ser um a caução nao pagar e sim passarmos o cartão de crédito 😡😡que segundo nos informaram seria cancelado automaticamente depois do checkout!!Tivemos que entregar em contato com o banco pra tentar cancelar este valor!! INCOMODAÇÃO DESNECESSÁRIA!!NAO PRETENDEMOS FICAR MAIS NESTE HOTEL:Além de nos cobrarem um valor maior,usa indevidamente o CC numa cobrança de um valor sem veracidade
Uma pena,um hotel bem localizado,que  deveria cativar os hospedes,e por conta de um valor ínfimo para um hotel daquele porte, se recusaram a devolver e ainda tentaram nos intimidar dizendo que o valor cobrado foi menor do que deveríamos ter pago!!!

title: They don’t take care of their customers.
text: Because of health reasons, we needed to cancel our hotel room for March 13 that we already paid in full. Grant F. is now saying that it’s not transferable or refundable even though nothing was on our confirmation. Stand by your product and take care of your FUTURE CUSTOMERS.

title: Excellent service, location and accommodations
text: Loved this hotel. Stuff is extremely attentive and courteous. I had the best check in experience ever with Victoria! and breakfast buffet is delicious, thanks Tofael who gave us a great service. I would definitely come back.

title: Amazing!
text:
We recently stayed at the Crowne plaza for 3 nights, and with us being first timers and we arrived in the city late in the evening, we was both tired. My boyfriend emailed ahead of our stay, and upon check in, we got upgraded to a king room and was given some drinks vouchers. When we arrived into our room, we was amazed, nice sized room, very comfortable bed and very clean! The reception staff were always polite and helpful with any query we had! The concierge at the hotel was also amazing, sorted us out sightseeing passes, told us what buses to take and even marked a map for us so we wouldn’t get lost. Then on check out, we could leave our luggage downstairs, and they still allowed us to eat and drink in the bar while waiting for our transfer! This hotel completely exceeded my expectation and would most definitely stay here again if we ever have the opportunity to come to New York again! 

Thank you Crowne plaza 😇

title: Disappointing
text:
This was my second time of staying at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square, the first time being 4 years ago, and this time was hugely disappointing to say the least.
I was staying here (both times) with my sister, my mum and my auntie for three nights.

We were here celebrating my mum’s 65th Birthday and my aunties 70th so I had emailed the hotel two months before our arrival informing them of this and they replied saying that if any upgrades were available then we would be upgraded at check in.  This didn’t happen even though the hotel didn’t seem full but never mind, it was just one of those things.

The room we did get allocated was extremely small for four of us but again, just one of those things.

On our first night, we hardly got any sleep as the connecting door in our room to the room next door was constantly rattling.  It sounded like there must have been a draft that was making it shake.  However, we managed to resolve this ourselves by sticking two pieces of cardboard in it (as shown on the picture).

The next day, we found that we didn’t have any hot water coming from the bath or shower.  After trying for quite a while to get it hot by letting it run, we had no joy so informed reception on our way out.
When we returned late that afternoon, it still wasn’t working and wasn’t even sure if anyone had even attended our room to attempt to fix it.

After this it was reported another three times and there was only one time we were in the room when an engineer arrived, which was on the last evening.  The engineer explained that to get the shower running hot you had to run the sink tap for 5 minutes and then run the bath tap for 5 minutes and then put the shower on and it will be warm.   How ridiculous is that??  He seemed to think it was common knowledge of that is what you need to do??  

Once the water in the shower was finally running warm, the pressure was terrible which meant the two of us who have very long thick hair were unable to wash our hair as the pressure was just not good enough.
To not have hot water for 3 nights and 4 days of being in a hotel is totally unacceptable. 

The staff on reception were very polite each time we reported it but the service of actually getting it fixed was non-existent, until the engineer attended on the last evening to give us the instructions of how to get it warm.
There were no drinks vouchers, or nothing waived from the resort fee, so it wasn’t great having to pay another £100 on check out for the hotel when we hadn’t even had hot water, which you would think is a basic requirement.

On our previous visit 4 years earlier, we had no problems at all which was why we returned to the same hotel.

Unfortunately, we won’t be staying at the Crowne Plaza when we next visit New York.

title: Great customer service during Breakfast
text:
We have been staying at the hotel for the last few days and have received great customer service from Tofael at breakfast. He made our stay very pleasant and thoroughly enjoyable as he was very helpful and made sure we had everything we needed

Thank you

title: 3 night stay and location is brilliant!
text:
Stayed in a room with 2 double beds which was spacious and on a higher floor with views back to 49 and 50th streets. Locations is fab. Had some tacos night 1 in the bar and pleasant service and cocktail.
Handy to be able to get a takeaway coffee and tea downstairs with salads and yoghurts. The foyer is pretty dull but the room was impeccably clean, no noise from below and staff all helpful 
Plan to return

title: Sort the glazing !
text:
First time in New York as a solo female traveler 
Check in easy though I knew about city tax this wasn’t mentioned in check in and I received I bill
under room door the night before check out .Small point but maybe mention this at check in 
The reception,bar and restaurants are lovely , modern and styled beautifully.I found the staff in all areas to be friendly and approachable.They have a small area where you can purchase such things as theatre tickets 
The hotel is fantastically placed , in the centre of Tomes Square and round the corner to a subway 
The room , large with the biggest comfiest bed I’ve been in Large shower room with toiletries and a hairdryer.The linen and towels were changed on a daily basis 
Down side ! There was an adjoining door to the room next door and I could probably join in the conversation with the inhabitants!
The windows also could do with extra glazing for sound proofing I was on the 4O th floor The  street sounds very quiet however the noise from the air conditioners ( I’m assuming that the noise was this ) sounded on occasion like there was a plane engine outside and I was woken frequently by this noise 
All in all enjoyed the location , just sort out the glazing and ask guests if they mind having a room with an adjoining door 🚪

title: Great birthday weekend!!
text:
Well not everything was perfect but the hotel made it right and that is what counts.  We had an issue with the air in our room, it kept getting warmer until our room was 76 degrees. The hotel offered to change rooms or bring in a small portable ac, which we chose and it worked perfectly. 
The great things are the staff, everyone from the front desk to the bar staff and the concierge were great to work with. The location could not be better, everything within walking distance is fantastic. 
Will definitely stay here again next year for our annual NY trip.

title: Great location
text: We booked the traditional rooms on 36 floor for 2 nights and 4 nights at the city view room after we returned from Niagara Falls. The location is great with subway stations at a stone throw. The room is cold for our 1st 2 nights even when the temperature shows 27 degree. The warmer is working well for our last 4 nights. The room is clean but not really what I expected for a renovated room. If you order items online and send to the hotel, do note that there will be a storage fee. The hotel doesn’t store luggage overnight when we travel to Niagara Falls and return after 2 days.

title: Big birthday fun!
text:
The location was great.  Awesome view of Times Square

Had a late check-in because of flight and the front desk people were very accommodating and helped us settled quickly so we could rest up for a fun weekend.  Overall the staff were excellent and were quick to provide great service.

The concierge was super helpful with lots of suggestions for sights and great restaurants.

title: Business trip
text: Staff in this hotel surprised me with their friendliness and even kindness! Breakfast room was quiet and staff attentive and welcoming. I didn’t expect this from a large chain hotel in a tourist spot. Being a frequent traveler, usually avoiding chain hotels, I truly feel I want to recommend this hotel and thank the staff for a pleasant stay.

title: Tan bueno como siempre
text: Quisiera destacar la atención de Erika de la recepción. Dispuesta a ayudar y acogedora en todo momento. Incluso llama a los pasajeros por su nombre. Muchas gracias a Erika.  Lo mejor como siempre la atención del personal del restaurant en el desayuno.  Muy atentos y cariñosos.  El servicio entregado por ellos desde la recepcionista del restaurant es impecable y muy detallistas.  Siempre cariñosos. No le doy los 5 puntos solo porque deberían tener un frigobar en la habitación.

title: First Family Trip to NY - perfect location
text: Spent 4 nights here and it was perfect for us as a family visiting NY for the first time. Right in the centre of Times Square we were 2 mins walk from the square, 10 mins walk from Rockafella tower and 15 mins walk from Central Park. Gotcha’s to watch out for are hotel tax, $35 per room per night, for us with 3 rooms that was a $480 cost we had at check out. Traffic is crazy, if you get a taxi to JFK make sure you give yourself lots of time if you flying in the day, Cars are bumper to bumper. As Brits we are used to tipping but not to the degree that is expected in NY, much higher levels of tips expected and for everything! Didn’t spoil a wonderful trip for us though, we visited 911 memorial, statton island ferry, rockafella tower, ice skating, Hard Rock Cafe, saw a show on Broadway and Central Park. My kids are older (over 21) and went off doing own thing as well. Hop on bus a great way to get around and see the city. NY did not disappoint.

title: Great location, clean rooms & friendly employees
text:
We stayed as a family of 3, my wife and daughter (12yrs). 

We arrived mid afternoon on a Saturday, check in was quick and easy and the lady on reception was welcoming. We had a room on the 39th floor, two double beds (small doubles though so be warned) which was plenty big enough for the 3 of us as we didn’t plan on spending much time in there. 

Location is great if you want to be in the hustle and bustle of Times Square, it was our first visit and we wanted this but it may not be everyone’s cup of tea. Coffee and Tea facilities in room which was great, and the food in the restaurant and bars was perfectly acceptable. The Cuban sandwich and chicken wings were awesome from the Broadway Bar... 

We only had breakfast once and it was fine but expensive and with a million options in the area we wanted to try other places everyday. 

The bar and restaurant are quite expensive but probably average for the area $10 for a pint of IPA for example so a couple of drinks for the 3 of us after a busy day and we were looking at around $60+ every night. 

The shower was awful, no pressure and the controls were either ice cold or lava so was difficult to get a decent flow going. But that was our only complaint.

Big shout out to Tony in the Broadway bar! What a absolute gent he was. Friendly, energetic he made our evenings when in the bar after a long day exploring, keen to hear what we had been up to and giving useful recommendations - the world would be a much better place with more Tony’s in it. 

Overall good hotel, and a very pleasant stay. We would likely book again.

title: Hôtel vieillissant devrait être rénové,chambre vieillotte et pas d’eau chaude pour la douche
text:
Séjour pour 1 nuit à la date du 22 février donc je réserve 2 chambres lit king size et vue sur Times Square pour finir notre séjour à New York après avoir séjourné au riu plaza Times Square si j’aurais su dans lequel je serais resté car au top donc on arrive au Crowne plaza et la déjà déception la facade de l’hôtel est en travaux (non inscrit sur le site) donc obliger de passé par le parking pour rentrer dans l’hôtel donc ça commence bien après voilà le Check in les chambres devaient être donné à 15h et la une seule est prête l’autre ils sont seulement entrain de la faire bon on va dans la chambre faite et la déception ce n’est pas la chambres que j’ai réservé car j’ai payé pour avoir une vue sur Times Square j’ai quand même payé plus cher qu’une chambre normal avec lit simple et chambre vieillotte moquette sale donc on redescend à l’accueil il est déjà 16h donc on leur explique la chose que ce n’est pas la chambre que j’ai réservé et la réception font semblant de pas comprendre obligé de demander à voir le manager pour qu’il nous explique comment se fait il que c’est pas les chambres qu’on a réservé donc il commence à regarder pour nous changer les 2 chambres et au bout de 30mn à 40mn de plus donc presque 17h on a nos nouvelles chambres et la pareil déception ce sont bien des lits king size mais toujours aussi vieillotte le mobilier devrait être changé et parking de la vue du 36eme étage on ne voit qu’un petit bout de Time square et parlons de salle de bain la douche impossible d’avoir de l’eau chaude donc pour ma part quelle déception les photos de leur site est trompeuse rien à voir en vrai si vous voulez un hôtel sympa
Bien placé à Times Square vous  avez l’hôtel riu plaza Times Square qui est moins cher et avec un super déjeuné compris dans le prix des chambres pour le Crowne est à fuir

title: Excellent
text:
Stayed for 4 nights Feb 2020. Absolutely no complaints.Check-in was easy and informative, our room was spot on with views over Times Square. It was clean, beds very comfortable, nice bathroom, hot shower and large TV for catching NBC morning news before heading out for the day. 2 free drinks vouchers were given to use in the downstairs bar which was lovely. Fabulous location for getting around the main attractions, easy walking distance of ESB,TOTR,Macy's and right on Broadway.
Would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

title: Anniversary Weekend
text: First time in NYC for me and my husband to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We were not disappointed with Crowne plaza hotel. Perfectly placed for anyone wanting to walk to Times Square, Central Park and Rockefeller centre. We used the hop on hop off bus to visit other attractions as we’d bought the New York City Pass.  We didn’t eat in the hotel as there are so many places to choose from within walking distance. We did enjoy drinks in the bar in the evening, very relaxed and lovely staff. We booked the hotel car to take us back to JFK and cost us $90 with the 20% tip! Would highly recommend this hotel

title: Impossible to reach hotel management.
text:
I am trying to get any proper feedback from the property regarding my lost and found since more than a month now. 

I checked out from the hotel on Jan 17 and the very next day I contacted the hotel regarding some items i left behind and asked to ship it to my home address at my cost of course. 

Since then i have sent numerous emails and filled the required paperwork, called several times however did not receive any proper reply neither the confirmation when/if i can get my items. 

I asked several times to provide me with contact details of the manager who can assist and do a proper follow up however this  request was totally ignored. 

I even tried to contact the general manager - but did not receive any call or email back. 

If anyone from this hotel who actually cares about customers reads reviews - i would appreciate if you could get in touch with me. 

Emre Cankurtaran

title: Excellent location
text:
The location is excellent! Everything is reachable by foot. The entrance to the hotel is from the garage, however you can enter from both street sides. 
The hotel has a bar, where you receive a complimentary drink once per your stay.
The room was very comfortable with a nice view though there were not enough toiletries for 2 people (of course, we've asked for more). The hotel doesn't have an adapter, so bring yours (charching phone with usb is ok, but quite a problem if you have a laptop).
The variety in breakfast buffet wasn't huge, but you can find what to eat anyway. Great green smoothies!
City taxes are high.

title: First time in NYC
text: My daughter and I had a fantastic trip to NYC. We had great service from Omelia G., who went the extra mile to answer my questions and make sure we were settled! The hotel is perfectly located for Times Square and the exciting things we had planned. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating when I had questions about the air. On future visits, we will definitely return to this Crowne Plaza.

title: 50th Birthday Break 2 couple's with teenagers
text:
Booked the whole holiday through BA & they were excellent including pre-booked airport transfers. Everything 100% through BA. Now the Crowne Plaza, Times Square!! If you expect a warm welcome & friendly service simply forget it. Rooms very basic (only to sleep so no big deal) Although in need of major updating, & cleaning service not great either. As a group of 8 we all felt of the same opinion.
Definitely NOT the American welcoming  experience you might expect!!

title: Très déçus du niveau des prestations et du service
text:
Chambres dégradées avec revêtement de baignoire très abîmé, propreté limite, besoin de rénovation.
Service lamentable et personnel peu aimable !
Restauration moyenne et hors de prix.
Seul l’emplacement est parfait !
Bref idéal pour la localisation et le côté pratique avec enfants mais très décevant même pour 4 étoiles => niveau 3 étoiles de base pour infrastructures et service

title: amazing!
text: School break at the Crown Plaza and it was amazing we had a room over looking Times Square and the hotel is so clean and beautiful and the staff was amazing ...easy check in and we even got free breakfast which was not included ! room 1601 was awesome

title: Room amazing. Staff appalling.
text: We booked this hotel last minute so had to go for a upgraded room we normally wouldn't have gone for. So room was quite expensive but was lovely and large, modern and very clean. Staff were rude at the best of times. Location was great, right in times square. Would not stay here again.

title: Nice place to stay
text: We stayed 4 days and the room was clean, updated and the staff was fantastic. We ate in the hotel 2 days and the food was wonderful! We ordered room service one night and they delivered it quickly! They allowed us into our room early and offered us late check out. Will return there again. The location is perfect to walk to just about everything.

title: فندق كراون بلازا تايمز سكوير
text:
يقع الفندق في منطقة التايمز سكوير ويوفر إطلالات جميلة في بعض الغرف والاجنحة على الشارع الرئيسي للتايمز السكوير
مساحة الغرف تعتبر كبيرة نوعاً بمقارنتاً بفنادق التايمز سكوير
الفندق نظيف وجميل ومرتب والسرير مريح

title: Trip to NYC
text: Stayed at the Crown plaza. It was fabulous. The staff were amazing and the room was incredible. We enjoyed the whole trip, the staff was incredible. It was a perfect fit for our trip. We saw 2 plays and were so.near tonthe hotel

title: Amazing trip
text: Going to New York, the Crowne Plaza Hotel is the hotel to book. My partner and I were very fortunate to have stayed here for three nights to celebrate our anniversary. We couldn’t have asked for a better hotel that was centrally located to everything. We were able to walk everywhere such as Central Park, the MET, fashion district and the meat market district. We had a magical dinner at Restoration Hardware. The staff at the hotel were absolutely friendly, helpful and ensured our celebration was a memorable event. We were fortunate to receive a “room with a view” on the 46th floor, breakfast and drink coupons and assistance in purchasing two spectacular broadway shows and an unbelievable recommendation to a wonderful Italian restaurant near by called Chazz Palminteri. I defined recommend this hotel to everyone.

title: Crowne Plaza is the place to stay in Times Square!!!
text: Our family was in town to see Frozen Broadway Musical. I chose Crowne Plaza for the location and it did not disappoint. It could not have been easier to get to the show. They also provide valet parking which was incredibly convenient. The gentleman that checked us in was professional, personable and efficient. Room was very clean, beds were very comfortable and the view from our room was great! We had room 1824, nice corner room with views of skyline, some water and some street views. Very quiet for the most part. It was a Saturday night, so of course, a couple of guest came in a little late and you could hear some talking and doors closing, nothing out the ordinary. Room was stocked with nice bath products. I met one of the housekeepers and she was so friendly. Another note on location, this hotel is perfect, right in the heart of Times Square. It will now be my first choice whenever I am in NYC.

title: Credit Card Transactions
text: After checking out of the hotel and advised that no monies were owed and all holdings against my card would be realised, monies have been taking from my credit card. Before booking the hotel were very quick at responding to my emails with enquires, however they are now ignoring emails asking why monies have been taken from my credit card.

title: Absolutely amazing customer services
text: I have to say thank you to front desk staff Sandra Esp. She was absolutely amazing. I was extremely tired and confused when checking in. She took her time b with my family and  was very patient and very professional. She made the check in process one of the highlights of our vacation.

title: Excelente
text:
Muy bueno.ubicacion excelente y atención muy esmerada .hacia mucho frío.asi que 10 mil puntos la calefacción. No le pongo 5 estrellas x que no tiene frigobar en la habitación. 
O al menos una pequeña heladera donde guardar algo.

title: Crown plaza
text: Located very centrally has an unbeatable advantage! We enjoyed our stay there and would choose to stay there again!  Although it’s location we were not bothered by noise and  were close to the metro, buses and taxis.

title: Oh dear!
text:
Okay, so luckily this is a city break and the amount of time spent in your hotel room is minimal and that is a good thing in this instance 

Good points 
hotel is in a fantastic location 
Breakfast was great 
Hotel manager does sort out problems which is always a plus- at least they want you to enjoy your stay and are happy to deal with any issues 
But 
This was a 3 night break and even though  I appreciate things can happen and am grateful for the manager trying to put it right I would prefer a great, cry issue free stay without any stress!!

Bad points
First room was very basic and in need of a refurb~ dirty stained floors and walls, the bottom of the bath was half peeled away (not very nice!), wall lining peeling off in bathroom and toilet flush not working properly- think basic motel than 4 star hotel. 
We asked for a new room and were given another room.
This room was better but food was all over the floor eventually house keeping came to clean ~ yay! 
Checked the linen and it was very dirty (red brown stains!!) so we had to get fresh sheets which we changed ourselves 
Dirty stained towels not great :( 
Shower leaking 
Heating not working properly so room was cold. 

Management gave us breakfast vouchers which was a nice touch etc but would prefer a clean room pleasant reception staff and a hassle stress free stay. 

There are so many hotels to choose from when visiting this amazing city and next time we will definitely be choosing somewhere else!

title: Hit or Miss for a Quiet Night
text: Rather unpleasant stay one night due to obnoxious guests having a 4 am family tantrum lasting about 15 minutes in the hallway. No security despite hallway cameras and a phoned in complaint by my neighbor.  The hotel is simply too large for security to ensure guests comfort. The second night was  affected by noise, this time from adjoining room guests, due to large gap under the connecting door which allowed unwelcome  conversation to easily penetrate our room.  By the way, adding to the aggravation in the middle of the first night, was the absence of that telephone plastic add on where important hotel service phone numbers are conveniently found in emergencies.

title: Fantastic location, brilliant view
text:
Myself and partner have just come home from a 6 night stay at the crowne plaza Times Square, as others have said this hotel is in a fantastic location, near to multiple subway stops, restaurants and shops. 

We paid extra to have a view of Times Square and the room was very spacious and clean, as others have said, there is no fridge in room, and for price of stay you would expect water in the room. We had a large walk in shower in bathroom, most morning we were up at 7 and had no issues with temperature of shower, how ever when we did get up after 8 the shower went from freezing to boiling hot and back again constantly! 

As I booked the hotel through British airways the “resort fee” was included so I didn’t have to pay this. However .... I would have been quite annoyed if I did ... during our 6 night stay I couldn’t say we used one facility that would warrant nearly $300 of resort fees!

title: The Crowne Plaza in Times Square is the best place for you to go
