text: The Crowne Plaza in Times Square is the best place to go for a visit, to eat, and to stay in Times Square, absolutely awesome, first class in everything, great service great atmosphere great people, go there for sure

title: In the heart of everything
text:
Recently I had the pleasure of visiting the Crone Plaza Hotel on Time Square and what can I say, the staff and management were fantastic and very helpful with every enquiry that I had. 
My room was very well appointed, spacious and yet everything was close to hand, if I have one draw back, it's the sleep quality of the my bed, I prefer a hard mattress but I will not hold that against the hotel.

The food, good sized portions, had the steak and the chicken, they were to die for, top marks to the chef.

Overall my impression of the Crowne Plaza, 10/10, would I come back again, dont need to ask my twice, yes, in a heart beat

title: Perfect Place
text: This hotel is absolutly in the heart of Manhattan. If you enjoy walking, you can reach everything on foot. We had a nice and big room and it was very clean. It got daily cleaned. Water is not provided, but it is drinkable from the tub. The beds are very big and great to sleep in. We did not have breakfast. If you want to have something little to eat, there is a special place in the lobby. Staff is very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed staying at the Crowne Plaza Times Square and can only recommand it.

title: Terrific location, great service
text: The hotel is directly across from the M&M store, which makes it easy to find.  It's just around the corner from several theaters-we walked to see Hamilton and Wicked.  We also walked to the MOMA, Hard Rock Cafe, and Ellen's Stardust Diner.  Convenient coffee shop downstairs also sold hot cocoa and wine :-)  Victoria at the Front Desk was very friendly and helpful.

title: 2nd year in a row - the place is getting old
text:
Actually I am still convinced that for what you pay, you get a decent hotel in a very good location.
The location, right at Times Square is prefect to start you're day exploring NYC.
Having said that, there are some things you should know. The hotel is getting old. Rooms are very clean, but you hear your neighbors every move.. which is not always as nice..
If you go back to a hotel for a second or third time, it's always nice if they notice that.. here they didn't.. its the small things.
Overal a good hotel, which is getting dated. Could use a renovation in my opinion.
And for everyone who is complaining about the "resort fee": It is mentioned everywhere. Don't come here giving a 1* review telling you didn't know... For that fee you can use the pool, fitness,...

title: リーズナブル
text: ニューアーク空港からUberでアクセス。外観が工事中だからか、最低USD100程度で泊まれる。立地を考えればかなりお得だと思う。混み合っていること、エレベーターの数が少ないことは致し方ないところか。朝食は質量とも標準くらいだと思う。

title: Nice hotel, crazy expensive
text:
This hotel is nice.  Rooms are a good size and kept clean.  Beds are comfortable.  Location can't be beat. Within walking distance of everything in Times Square, Hells Kitchen, etc.  Close to great restaurants and shows. Service is great.

Two cons that stood out to me were: 1. lack of a mini fridge/microwave in the room.  No place to take leftovers from the surrounding restaurants. For the price paid, this should be standard.  2. Excessive fees.  There is a resort fee of about $40 per night regardless of whether you use the gym and/or other facilities or not.  Also, the breakage deposit is $150 per night if you use a credit card.  It goes back to your card at check out, but it's ridiculous...

I would come back to this hotel only if I can find a deep discount or special rate.

title: Best trip
text: Had thee best time in nyc , this hotel was best experience very central great location , the staff go over & beyond especially Anna she made our experience that more special treated us like family thank you so much ... Danielle , Ellie & Ollie 🇨🇮

title: Night in the City
text:
Every around holiday time we spend a night in NYC.
This year we stayed at the Times Square Crowne Plaza.    All aspects were top notch.  The room was spacious and clean.  The staff was friendly and professional.     We drive in so we took advantage of the valet parking which was easy, from drop off to pick up.    At the time, the hotel was undergoing some renovations, but to their credit, this did not impact the visit in any way.   Excellent stay.

title: Busy hotel in a great location
text:
First time stay in NYC and at the Crowne Plaza. On arrival it was quite busy but expected for that time of the year. Check in was efficient and room was quiet, comfortable and clean. On site gym was good and had plenty of equipment to use.
Location is amazing, central to everything.

We tried getting something from the bar area downstairs once but seemed very understaffed and ended up leaving after about 10 minutes of not being seen to, other people waiting were also commenting on the delays.

Still our stay was enjoyable and would stay again, the staff we interacted with were professional and courteous.

title: Busy Hotel
text: The first encounter upon checking in was very rough.  Arrived at 1 am and got a very bad room with 2 queen beds (requested 1 king bed).  The next day, Omelia G. fixed the bad experience, and assigned a much better room.  Thanks, Omelia!  Over all, decent hotel and in a central area of NYC.

title: Expectations exceeded!
text: I had to come to NYC for a work conference and needed a hotel close to where the conference was being held. Unfortunately this meant staying in Times Square which I always try to avoid when in the city. Booked this place because I found a good deal on hotels.com and wow, my expectations were far exceeded. The staff were all so nice, especially Omelia G. who made me feel so welcome and at home as soon as I checked in. I was very pleased with the system they have of texting you to ask how everything was going, if there’s anything they could do, etc. Had this been an automated service it might have felt intrusive. But it seemed to be real people on the other end and that made it feel like they genuinely cared. I only had one request (to leave a couple water bottles in my room) that I asked for via text and when I returned that evening, there were the water bottles. Room was spacious and comfortable, particularly for a mid town hotel. Shower was great. The Grind and Go area was very convenient. Room service was quick and the food was pretty good! All in all I was extremely pleased. While I likely won’t stay in Times Square on future trips, if I ever do, I would absolutely stay here again.

title: Vraiment bien !
text:
Nous avons passé un court séjour à NYC et j'avais choisi cet hôtel en fonction de son emplacement. 
Rapport qualité-prix excellent, accueil chaleureux, chambres spacieuses, pas été dérangé par le bruit car bonne isolation (pas parfaite mais sincèrement bonne) literie, linges, propreté tout OK. 
Le Wifi mériterait d'être amélioré on a eu de la peine à se connecter, mais sinon juste très bien.

title: Worce and DANGEROUS!!
text: This was an absolute disgrace! I stayed there with my wife and 2 toddlers. It was by far the worse hotel experience we've ever had! The room was dirty! Unorganized & unsafe! Our first room had broken glass on the floor putting my children at risk, and if that wasn't bad enough there were exposed electrical live power cords which our child discovered, God knows what could have happened if we didn't see it in time!!!! The amount of time we had to wait for these matters to be attended to was ridiculous, included broken door locks.. cabinet door broken.poo on the floors.. The list goes on and on.. you could even say that they don't care! The kids were uncomfortable and unable to sleep until my wife cleaned up the room and made it safe enough for our children to be put to bed. I highly do not recommend this hotel. The staff are uneducated unprofessional and rude, they offered us a compensation of 50% which we never received.

title: Le nettoyage zero
text:
Un séjour de 6 jours dans cette hôtel 
La wifi est bonne
Le petit déjeuner j’ai pas testé 
L’emplacement idéal pour tous 
Mais pour le nettoyage de la chambre ça se résume a faire les lits et sdb rien de plus
Par mon expérience je me tjr un mouchoir sous les draps pour savoir si il regarde change rien
Pour l’accueil a la réception le strict minimum

title: Very friendly staff, great location
text:
I’m so impressed with how friendly the staff is here at the Crowne Plaza, particularly Onelia G.  I didn’t expect that in New York City, but she’s from the Dominican Republic where everyone is friendly and outgoing.

The room is great, the lobby bar is fun and the view is fantastic. And being right in Times Square gives access to everything.

title: A great 2020 new year eve for new decade
text: The hotel is located at very close center of time squares, I spent a wonderful new year eve with my friends. When we checked in at front desk, I found I get the bed type wrong. While Evelyn was so helpful to help try to correct the room type and upgrade the room to a fantastic view for time square side, with lot of vouchers and coupons for membership benefits. The room is standard and the service was good, even at the very busy new year eve period. It is very convenient to go to time square, Moma, and subway stations take you to NY anywhere.

title: Great Stay
text:
This hotel is in a great location when visiting New York.  Had a room directly looking over Times Square.  Staff were very helpful.
Room was clean and comfortable, would recommend as a base when visiting this city.

title: Best View
text: We stayed at Crowne Plaza for our 4th year anniversary and we had the best time staying there. Great view and staff! Sofia made our anniversary even more awesome. We really recommenced this place to everyone!!

title: Central but service and lack of hot water disappoints
text:
We stayed in the CP for Christmas, and sadly found it not up to scratch with the majority of reviews on here. 

While the hotel discounted our stay by one night one in recompense, I really wish we’d stayed elsewhere. 

After arriving 23 Dec I found the shower cold in the evening which I reported. The same again on the 24 Dec on which day we reported it twice, followed by another cold shower on Christmas Day. We were finally moved after reporting it for the fourth time, to a smaller, noisier room opposite the lifts, with little help offered to move our belongings. The shower in the original room was also dirty with hair on our arrival. 

There was clearly no communication between different shifts on FOH and no communication with us about why the problem had not been rectified. Each and every time it was down to us to raise and no one followed up to ensure it had been fixed. Apparently attempts had been made to fix it but no one had bothered to communicate with us. 

There are better places to stay in Manhattan.

title: Flott beliggenhet, men slitt og gammelt.
text: Flott beliggenhet og en hyggelig pris. Prisen ligger lavere enn de fleste rundt i området, men ikke uten grunn, hotellet trenger renovering. Gammelt og slitt. Anbefaler rom med utsikt over TimeSquare, nydelig skue på kveldstid. Hadde rom i 23etasje, her opplevde vi lite støy fra gata. Mulig for sen utsjekk mot betaling.

title: Optimistic for next time
text:
I have mixed feelings about the CP of Times Square. Let’s start this out on a very strong positive: the staff. Specifically, Grant, John and Krisch. I hope IHG knows what assets they are to these men as they are exactly the type of people they should strive to employ. I was pleasantly surprised by their extreme professionalism when assisting me. I didn’t expect a text to reach out to me checking in, seeing if there was anything they could do to make my stay better. Sure, being and IHG Gold Elite member ensures a little extra recognition but these are just great guys who know how to make you feel like you’re at a 5 star hotel even when you’re not. Speaking of not, the rooms really lack here. Unfortunately, the HVAC didn’t work and the room was mid 70’s as opposed to mid 60’s where we like it. We had several other troubles with the room, too. We would’ve traded rooms but my son was too tired to deal. The phone line to call Valet went right to voicemail and a full voicemail at that. For the extreme prices they charge to park, that’s frustrating. There is no real lobby as far as lots of seating for people watching, relaxing. Just the bar area. The adjacent restaurant has the advantage of having a front seat view of Times Square yet it’s a plain white room and empty..and closed often. So odd. The location of the hotel is certainly a plus. Near everything! The no-frills coffee grab-n-go area is well stocked with some delicious Italian coffee and very fresh croissants. No place to sit and eat which is a
shame but really well made stuff and not awful price points, especially compared to the very high prices at the Broadway Bar. I really felt welcome here. It makes me want to come back. Until they update and repair the rooms, bathrooms specifically, I am thinking I may try another IHG run location for now but I am hopeful to return here at some point. Thanks again to the people who made sure I’ll never forget the Crowne Plaza to be a worthy option.

title: Très bien situé
text:
Le gros atout de l’hôtel : sa situation, très bien placé pour visiter New-York.
Ses plus: chambre spacieuse, très bonne literie
Ses moins: besoin d’un rafraîchissement : moquette, salle de bain. Insonorisation : préférable de ne pas avoir de voisins bruyants.
 Bar sympa. Petit déjeuner : bon mais cher pour ce qui est proposé ( 28$)

title: outstanding costumer service
text: Upon my arrival at the hotel on Jan 14, 2020, I learned that my room would be sightly delayed because the last occupant checked out late.  The front desk employee was Donald Mei and he was extremely gracious and helpful. When he learned that my room would be not be ready for another 30 minutes, he came over to me in the lobby and provided comps for drinks and breakfast. His personality and attention to the delay was extremely appreciated.  I would stay at the Crowne Plaza again since the culture of the hotel is to provide superlative service to its guests. My stay at the hotel for three (3) nights was outstanding and this employee's  attention to detail was greatly appreciated.    Sincerely,  John McLernon

title: Fantastische locatie, verouderde kamers
text:
Hotel heeft een perfecte ligging! Tussen een aantal theaters in en midden op Times 
Square. Kamers wat verouderd en niet super goed onderhouden wat jammer was (los handvat bij een kast, gordijnen die niet helemaal dicht gingen, bad wat beschadigingen had) Verder wel schoon en fantastische bedden! We zaten op de 40ste verdieping en hadden uitzicht op Times Square. 

Helaas had dit hotel geen mini bar wat meestal wel is bij een 4 sterren hotel. 

Qua locatie dus perfect maar de kamers zijn niet wat ik gewend ben van Crowne Plaza (heb er meerdere bezocht oa in Berlijn en California)

title: Great Location & Experience
text: Room was lovely - good size for downtown New York.  Everything you would expect from a Crowne Plaza and most important to us was the location - we were right beside everything.  Just across the street was the stop for the sightseeing bus which was really handy as we used it to go to the various attractions.

title: Great stay in the middle of Time Square - Very Busy; Spacious Corner room
text:
Although I have been to NY and Time Square many times, for this visit, I wanted to stay in TS and the CP was a great choice.

Hotel is big, very busy and loud, but staff try to do their best with this organized chaos in this mega hotel. 

Check in was great, I was given a drink voucher and a discounted breakfast due to being an IHG member. High floor, corner room with lots of windows and natural light and a small view of TS . Room was comfortable, very spacious and what seems a fairly recent renovation. Bathroom was simple, modern and functional.

We slept like rocks due to all the walking and sightseeing, but beware that there is a lot of street noise, but that is the small price to pay for fantastic view and location.

title: Excellent location on Times Square
text: Excellent place to stay based on location to Times Square and Broadway. Check in was ok and getting to room was ok. Room was about average. Shower in the bathroom was better than average. Bar and Food area were good. Concierge was very helpful. If the wind is blowing elevators are sketchy but not bad. Other than that elevators are very fast. Over-all not bad because of location.

title: Un buon compromesso...con vista!
text: ...nel cuore di Manhattan, l’hotel è piuttosto grande e le camere ai piani alti danno una vista su NYC davvero notevole e spettacolare .La presenza della moquette un po’ ovunque toglie quella sensazione di pulito e di igiene ma si sa che la maggior parte degli hotel è così. Le camere sono abbastanza datate ma confortevoli. Ottima la colazione con scelta ampia e piuttosto varia. Personale gentile.

title: The Best hotel in Times Square - By far!!
text:
We visited in July (so Apologies for the late post) - but I only found the card of the Manger yesterday which prompted me to write a review.

I can’t praise this hotel enough! We stayed in New York for 9 days in the summer as it was our anniversary and also a treat for our 21 year old son, who had just graduated from University.

We’ve stayed in Times Square four times previously (at the Millennium, Belvedere, the Riu and Hilton) all very good establishments, but this hotel was perfect. 

The location was awesome - great views of Times Square , the room was large clean and spacious - even though there were four of us. We were on a very high floor - it’s 46 storeys high, which was great for a views of Manhattan. However, don’t worry - as there’s an express lift to cater for all.

This hotel is huge, but the staff still manage give it a personal touch for every guest. The Manager Jonathan Rodriguez was amazing, always out supporting his staff and speaking to guests. He and his team ensured we had a great time at the hotel! Thank you!

The bar and the restaurant are pretty cool and the breakfast is pretty awesome too.

Definitely recommend - Five Stars!

title: Great place to stay when attending events at Javits.
text: Loved that there was such attentive and friendly check-in staff on hand. We were provided with water and a glass of champagne on check-in. Sweet!  We had a couple rooms for our group, and we came early to drop our bags to do some sightseeing. One room was ready and they let us put our luggage there and gave us a chance to freshen up before spending the afternoon touring. We were so grateful.

title: Time Square Delight
text: Great location to Time Square and Broadway, we had a great view from our window. The staff and service was very professional and the rooms were clean and tidy.  I would recommend and we will definitely stay there again.

title: Excellent location, decent room
text: I had 2 night at this place as part of a work trip. As you would expect, the location of this hotel is its major selling point. Just outside Time Square and Broadway theatres, this place is busy with people. The room I had was decent. Good size, clean with a limited view of the city views. It served its purpose well for me. There is a nice bar at the lobby level and heaps of food/drinks options within 15 min walk.

title: Amazing ! Felt like a celeb
text: After been booked into a shocking hotel round the corner we called in the plaza hoping we could book in straight away ! Freddy was amazing ! Booked us in at a great rate , what a room ! The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are clean , very well looked after and the views are amazing , every staff member we spoke to and saw were all very helpful and happy , I couldn’t recommend this hotel enough it’s brilliant and I can’t wait to go back ! They give you vouchers for free beer ! And money off your food ! Why would you not stay here !!!

title: Love the stay
text: I enjoyed every minute of it. Very clean and spacious. The bar is beautiful and the service is impeccable. This is my first time ever staying in the Crowne plaza and when I come back I'll stay here again and I'll tell all my friends and family about it.

title: My go to  Hotel in Times Square
text:
Visited my favorite NYC Hotel mid-December and remembered why its always been one of my favorote places to stay.
 
Not just locaton which is right in the middle of Times Square with acess to all the shows, shopping, Christmas Tree and restaurants, but the Property itself and its people who are all super. From Executive Assistant Sylvia Geronimo who has always been my go to person that takes care of everything good at the Hotel, Ana the Hostesss at the Breakfast Buffet and all the employees who remember my family and I whenever we visit, the front desk that’s fast and effieicnt with check-in and out and ensuring vouchers are given out, the bar which has a great view with friendly bartenders and servers and the Assistant Managers who are always there to help. I almost forgot Housekeeping and all the other employees who really make this place hum. Thanks to GM Sanders for making this stay for my sister wife and I another awesome stay.
 
Just a couple of updates. The Breakfast Buffet has now incresed from $10 to $16 but still a good deal.
I receive questions about lack of a gym. Actually through its afiliation with one of the sports club, it provides access to a huge variety of equipment as well as classes.
 
And finally lets all hope Sylvia remains in place as she really does help GM Sanders with outreach to IHG members that make us want to stay again and again (as well as recomemnd tis propey to others as I continually do)

title: Great location- fantastic staff
text: Traveled to NYC for my daughters birthday. Fantastic location right at Time Square. Our room 1701 was a corner and had a great view! Victoria at the front desk made our check in special- she is amazing- happy birthday month Victoria!

title: A great place in Times Square
text: I am an IHG member so I like to stay at member hotels for points. Crowne Plaza Times Square is always a great place to stay. On this trip in particular, my check-in was with Sandra, who went out of her way to make me feel welcome. Upon arriving in my room, I received a text asking if my room was acceptable. They even sent up some bottles of water for me.The beds are comfortable. The pillows fantastic. I do love this hotel.

title: Stay
text: Stayed here for 2 nights nice hotel lovely staff and right on times square would stay again place is spotless and very close to theatres and restaurants all around the times square area staff were very helpful

title: super place to visit
text: hotel was easy to find.  Deak staff was helpful, bar staff was super friendly and accomodating, and the concierge was patient an humerous.  literally the only issue with mt stay was that my room key was deactivated. 5 minutes and the problem was solved.   everyone should stay here!

title: Nel cuore della Grande Mela
text: Nel pieno centro di Times Square, un albergo comodo, camere spaziose. Il buffet della colazione molto buono e variato. Un bar con vetrate che permettono di vedere i carelli luminosi e la strada. Lo staff molto attento alle nostre necessità.

title: Meraviglioso
text: Posizione fantastica, vista incredibile grazie anche alle vetrate di ogni camera. Colazioni varie e ricche in una sala con vista direttamente su Times Square. Chiedo alla direzione la ricetta della colazione giamaicana con verdure piccanti! Squisita!! Non riesco a trovarla su internet. Spero di tornare presto.

title: Holiday
text:
The hotel is nice. They have a nice view, very central. 
The only thing I was taken aback is the fact there is no fridge in the room, if you want one its chargeable.
The hotel was nice enough to give us one for free as I need it from my meds. 
Over all one of the best hotels and location in New York to stay at.

title: Ponto maravilhoso
text: Segunda vez que fico nesse hotel . Ponto otimo, sem barulho, os atendentes , garçons, camareiras sempre gentis. Defeito não tem geladeira no quarto e a iluminação interna  do quarto é bem fraca . Custo benefício muito bom.

title: Crowne Plaza made my 50th extra special
text:
What can I say the Crowne Plaza really looked after me and my husband for my surprise 50th birthday. As soon as we arrived for my birthday they gave us free drink vouchers for a couple of alcoholic drinks and also some free cocktails and also gave us two When we arrived as it was for my 50th birthday the reception team were lovely they gave us some free drink vouchers for our stay and two free breakfasts which was so lovely and made the beginning of our trip extra special  so thank you. When we arrived at the hotel we couldnt believe how big it was with either an escalator or lift to take you up to the reception area. 

The hotel was lovely so modern and right in the heart of Times Square with fantastic views. We were on the 35th floor and the views were amazing. The room was so clean, modern and big. The rooms have black out curtains, are warm and the rooms are made up with clean bedding every day. Big TVs with hairdryers too.  The beds are so big like super king size so we had a fantastic sleep all week. Fresh towels are put out in the bathroom each day and such a nice touch the  complimentary small toiletries in the bathroom. The showers are so large and hot water so quickly. 

One day was so magical as it was snowing all day so the views from our room was amazing looking down from so high up. The hotel was lovely decorated all for Christmas and we ate in the hotel  restaurant once and the food was nice. The bar area was extra special as some lovely views so sit near the front to look over Times  Square. Lovely touch near the lifts was a food/drink area where you can buy wine, coffee and other refreshments, fresh danishes for breakfast, lunches like sandwiches and baguettes and salads, lots of yummy cakes. We took a couple of cheese board boxes to our room one day which was lovely and the hotel are very flexible if you take food back to your room which is nice from outside places. 

The concierge was extremely helpful and helped us book some sight saver passes which saved quite a bit of money and they helped out with us getting to and from places and provided maps too. 

When we checked out the receptionist asked when we were leaving and gave us some more free drink vouchers for the bar to get a drink each until our transfer picked us up directly outside the hotel for the airport which was very kind. 

So all in all the Crown Plaza we can’t thank you all enough you made this 50th birthday for me extra extra special and anyone wanting a fantastic stay in the heart of Times Square, New York we recommend here as the staff are lovely and friendly and the hotel is so modern you’d struggle to find somewhere as good. Thank you we loved it but so sad to leave but you made a couple from Nottingham, England have such a special memory that we will treasure always.

title: Don't know if I'll be back
text:
Obviously the hotel's location is unbeatable. Right on Times Square. Restaurants, pharmacies, stores...everything is right there. The rooms are clean and spacious by NYC standards. We spent 10 nights there with two children and we were all very comfortable. We were also given a complimentary fridge when requested.

Issues: heating. It's central. Rooms are HOT and the only way to cool them is to open a window. Yes, an open window in Times Square. It didn't pose that much danger for my children but with younger I'd be nervous. The sounds of the city didn't bother us but sirens can be loud and bother others. Also the staff isn't nice, at all. I had 2 separate reservations to cover the 10 nights and I was first told we wouldn't need to switch rooms, then we had to switch and in a hurry. We lost some stuff because we had to leave the room. The general manager was very rough and not interested in helping the situation. We were given a higher floor and TS view to compensate but their attitude was a definite turn off. I'd rather stay at the other hotel we've used before where we've never been treated badly. Hotels aren't cheap and you expect a level of professionalism that this hotel apparently doesn't have.

title: Great location, nice people, small gotcha
text: We enjoyed our time here.  Walking distance to many famed NYC places & the staff is great with advice.  Comfy beds, clean rooms, and good food.  The gotcha is the built in 18% tip in the bar and restaurant which they say is for parties of 6 or more but apply when there are 1,2,3, or 4 people.  Given the expected NYC higher prices for food that 18% can add up quickly.  Other than that, I recommend this hotel.

title: Average but great location
text:
This Crowne Plaza is in a great location to lots of activities and sights seeing. There are positives and negatives to being in Times Square though! Everything is at your fingertips but it’s more expensive, including every meal you’ll eat, and there’s lots of noise and crowds.  I was here for work, and needed to be near the 1 train and the E train (to get to and from JFK’s AirTrain) so this fit the bill. 
Was the hotel clean and comfortable? Yes. Did I sleep well? Yes. They had free WiFi and a gym.  But it was just average for me.  It didn’t have some of the basic things I expect when I travel (I should say I usually stay at Marriotts). It didn’t have a mini-fridge, which would have been nice and seems to be almost a given.  For the large size of the lobby, I was really surprised and disappointed that they only had a handful of chairs for guests to sit in. The hotel is 30+ stories, not sure how many guests it holds, but the only place to sit other than your room is in their bar/restaurant seating. To me that’s very inconvenient, especially if you are in town with a large group and you are waiting for people to assemble in the lobby. There were always just groups of people standing around, and I don’t know about you, but when I go to NYC I put on 15-20,000 steps a day, so I like to sit when I can 😃. 
Another thing I thought was strange was that the shower water took a very long time to get warm. I called maintenance and the guy who came up told me I just had to run it for a long, long time and it might get warmer (doesn’t this go against their “sustainability goals”?) If not call back tomorrow and they would change the cartridge.... um why would I have to call back tomorrow? Put in a work order, that’s your responsibility not mine. I also requested that the ice maker on my floor get fixed, and he showed me that it was making ice but not spitting it out. He let me take as much as I wanted but I was told it wouldn’t get fixed, there were other things to do. Previously, the front desk people were apologetic about the ice and told me I could go up or downstairs... of course I can, and that’s why they are getting an average rating.

title: Great place to stay IF you can get a deal or otherwise afford it.
text:
We stayed here over New Years.
Friendly, helpful staff, good housekeeping. Obviously location is good for Broadway 
shows. Short walk to Radio City and 5th Avenue; subway not too far away.  A great place for a party or event in the middle of things.  Fire dept around next corner that lost many firefighters on 911 and a Staples two doors from that to mail home all the stuff you bought in NYC !

title: Clean, bright, well-appointed room
text: We stayed on the 22nd floor and had a corner room with a view of the river (if we had ever had time to look out of the window).  The room appeared to be recently updated.  It was very clean and comfortable.  We asked for and speedily received several extra pillows, so service was great.  (We like lots of pillows but most people would find the standard four to be sufficient.). We also like a well-lit room and this one had more than adequate lamps and wattage.  The check-in was efficient and friendly. The location is convenient to theatres, restaurants, the subway and even delis and shopping.  One more thing - the elevators were fast and there was virtually no waiting.  (I attended a conference a few hotels away and their elevators were a nightmare. So the Crowne gets an A+ for theirs.)  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location, delicious food, excellent service
text: Perfect place for a late lunch or brunch. A great view from a window table, a nice selection which even worked for Our pickiest eater.  The drinks are strong, but some creative new options.  Tofael gave  5 star service!

title: Breakfast Buffet
text: The breakfast buffet was very good. Tofael my server was excellent! The Staff member who helped me with questions on how to find things with my phone was exceptional. A great way to begin your day. I would recommend staying at The Crown Plaza, Times Square, New York City.

title: GREAT LOCATION FANTASTIC CHECK IN EXPERIENCE
text:
This is a great location if you are going to the theater. I stay in hotels 10-12 nights a month,  I have had my share of uninterested, personality challenged front desk agents..
Onelia who checked me in did a fantastic job making me feel welcome, answered all my questions put a smile on my face.

title: Convenient location and great service!
text: This hotel has become a go-to hotel for my trips to NYC for work. I often go to several Broadway shows while I am here,  and this is so centrally located for that...and close to all the subways! Plus you can walk to midtown or central park, or enjoy good food in Hell's Kitchen! The front desk staff has always been so friendly and engaging, which is not always the case in this city. On this particular trip Brunilda was the awesome person who checked us in and welcomed us back home! She was super fun, personable and made checking in a delight! This is one great example of the encounters I've had while staying here.

title: Worse experience with an IHG hotel ever
text:
The only good thing to say about this hotel is his location direct on the Times Square. After great experience with Crown Plaza hotels around the world we werde expecting a prefect stay, as usual. Unfortunately it wasn't. The hotel has an ugly, dark lobby. Check-in was distant and it seemed we were disturbing. The we got the first room, which should have Times Square view. Well, the view was on the Times Square - if you press your face on the window. From the 40th level you don't really see anything but the windows  of the opposite buildings. The other thing was the room itself: wallpaper came of the walls, bathroom was dirty, all furniture were damaged. The windows was not closing completely. The room was tiny and so was the bathroom. After complaining we have got a similar room on the 36th level with better view on Times Square. The furniture were not as much damaged as in the other room. The bathroom was cleaner, but the wallpaper dissolved of the walls.
OK, there is one more good thing we can say about the hotel: the breakfast was good.
The price-performance ratio was unacceptable. Never again!

title: Fantastisk beliggenhed, men latterligt dyrt og lidt slidt
text:
Beliggenheden kan der ikke sættes en finger på - lige ved Times Square, men det betaler man godt nok også for!!! Usd 370 for 1 nat, 1 person.

Jeg kommer ikke igen. Fed gym, og cool med lille pool (til voksne primært).

Værelserne er slidte og armaturerne sad løst, både i bruser og ved håndvask. 

Et rip-off i min optik. 

Jeg ved godt at hotellet på Manhatten er dyre, men det her var over grænsen niveauet taget i betragtning.

title: Can't get more convenient
text:
For a romantic weekend getaway (romance optional) to NYC to see some Broadway shows, there is no better place to stay than this hotel. We were seeing Hadestown and the line to get into the theatre was literally right outside the hotel door. It took all of 5 minutes to get from the hotel lobby to our seats and that's because we stopped for drinks at the theatre bar. Two drinks cost us $58 but that's a separate review...

The room was amazing and the services was top-notch. I ordered room service and it arrived fresh and hot in under 15 minutes. I was impressed.

title: Why have I notatayed here before??
text: Hotel is in a great location, proximity to Times Square, Broadway, shopping...(and oh yeah my business meeting)....is perfect. Clean updated andlarger than your usual NYC room. Bar is nice too! I checked inamd was greetedby the nicest front desk rep, Brunilda - thanks for the welcome!! I even get my IHG points..... all-in-all a successful visit. Looking forward to returning for pleasure! ;)

title: NYC
text: Great location, poor service.  Rooms were too hot with zero ability to control temperature.  Called down for service and it took hours and multiple calls for someone to come up. Charged extra for Time Square view, not worth the angle

title: Excellent location - friendly welcoming staff
text:
We booked this hotel based on location and price, we were not disappointed. We could walk everywhere from here, Times Square not ideal for everyone as it's so busy but this was our choice and we're glad we did. It's so close to all attractions/subway/buses etc and you really are in the heart of it all.

We stayed 5 nights, had a lovely warm welcome at reception who gave us some vouchers to use in the bar/restaurant, had upgraded us to a room overlooking times square and arranged for a complimentary fridge in our room which was a welcome touch.
The room was smaller than expected with 2 double size standard beds for 3 of us, including our teenage daughter. I would have expected king size beds but it was fine. A very small wardrobe, ok for a couple of nights but we struggled for space for 3 of us over 5 nights, we had to hang 3 or 4 things on each hanger.
A good size bathroom and great shower.
The room had fabulous views overlooking times square, we were on 44th floor out of 45! This did mean we could hear no noise.
All the staff we came across at the hotel were very friendly and informative, they all went our of their way to help you and give you information on local attractions/ directions and other helpful tips.
The hotel bar and restaurants always seemed busy, we did take advantage of our free drink, the service was great and the wine was excellent, a nice vibe and atmosphere in the bar.
The room was cleaned every day and was spotless, all public areas also very clean.
The lifts were always in good working order.
My only disappointment was the check out, this was chaotic and we queued for over an hour to leave our bags with the concierge, this meant cutting into our time on our last day.
Overall a great hotel, great staff, great location, great value and I would definitely stay again.

title: 4 night stay.
text:
This is our first stay here but we regularly use crowne plaza hotels. This hotel was good but not the best one we have stayed at. BUT still up there in quality and cleanliness. We had one issue with one of the two rooms but the issue was quickly sorted out without any fuss. 
My only real complaint was the price of drinks in the bar, drinks in New York are expensive but they seemed to be higher than I would of expected (and yes I know hotel bar drinks are more expensive).
Over all a good hotel and extremely convenient for Times Square.

title: Last minute trip price was right!
text:
Smack dab in the midst of the city that never sleeps! 
Valet Parking onsite no in and out but you won’t need the vehicle $(70.00)
Subway steps away. 
There’s an app on the phones to help you get from a to b.
Heart of Times Square/theatre 
Freddy was a delight at check in and took care of us very nicely!
Thank you !!!! 
Although the line was lengthy it moved quickly . 
Bar area was facing the busy street fun to people watch.
Rooms were adequate clean and quiet.
Views are amazing! Have fun!

title: Disappointing
text:
I have stayed in this hotel multiple days, several times a year, for several years. This trip was a sun-wed. I have always found the location convenient, the hotel clean and maintained, and the service good. 

However, this trip was a series of disappointments. There were 3 issues

First, on arrival at my room, I found myself disappointed in the cleanliness of the room. Crumbs and food debris on the desk, the floor had not been vacuumed, and there were water stains on the sink vanity. The worst feeling was when I opened the dresser drawers and found items and paper waste from the prior occupant. But the linens and towels were fresh and having had good experiences in the past, I thought I would wave it off and it would be cleaned the next day. I carry sanitizing wipes with me when I travel so I cleaned a bit myself. 

Unfortunately, it was not. For the entire trip housekeeping was way below par. While the bed was made, towels replaced, and the toiletries replenished, the floor continued to be an ongoing problem and surfaces were generally left uncleaned. 

Second, maintenance has been allowed to fall behind. The lamps had shorts and blinked if the table was bumped. Wallpaper was stained, paint chipped, etc. 

But the final straw was when a loud customer moved into the room next to me, others in his party in other rooms on the hallway.  It went on with arguments, doors slamming, loud music, screaming, TVs blaring, etc. from 10:30 pm to 4:30 AM.

I called the front desk, the line had been turned off for the night. I tried concierge, bell stand, housekeeping, lost and found, even room service. Every line either went to an answering machine or busy signal. I tried calling from my cell to the local phone number-busy signal. I called the 800 number for the chain, they put me on hold then hung up on me. This went on for hours. I finally called another IHG hotel on Times Square and asked for security and explained the scenario. To their credit they contacted the hotel and someone came up and told them to quiet down. Not fifteen minutes later they started back up with the noise. I tried all of the phones again- same problem - answering machines and busy signals. I finally went to the people’s doors and threatened each one with calling the police. They then settled down for the night. 

Needless to say, they have lost my business.

title: Great Location & Customer Service
text: We had a great time staying here during our first visit to NYC. Onelia went above and beyond making us feel welcome and provided us with great customer service. The room we had was nice and spacious. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: great location ..old style rooms
text: Great location of the property but the rooms and facilities are old ..so if you are looking for best location at Times square no hotel can beat this place but the rooms are really old style and facility and people are the same as well !!

title: Xmas stay
text:
Stayed here from Xmas eve for 5 nights ,this hotel is perfect if you want to be in the centre of Times Square for us it was far to busy to get to the hotel from afternoon onwards in the streets leading up to the hotel 
  The hotel itself is very busy room was a good size with 2 very comfortable beds which we needed as we walked about 40 odd miles in total .Being a platinum elite member I was given various vouchers for breakfast etc which was a great saving as we used breakfast every day apart from Xmas day as my daughter wanted to try Hard Rock Cafe  just 5 mins walk away which we all enjoyed as well good to visit .
   All in all the hotel is great needs updating in some rooms which they are doing at the moment they are refurbishing the entrance at present . I would recommend this hotel for future travellers and you know what your getting with Crowne plaza

title: La piscine du Crown Plaza Times Square
text: Pour les nageurs qui cherchent désespérément un hotel avec piscine à Manhattan, hormis les palaces, le Crown Plaza Times Square est top. Une vraie piscine urbaine attachée à un Club sportif fréquenté par les New-yorkais. Et l'accueil que m'a faite au desk Victoria Martin fut aussi friendly.  Je conseille cet hotel.

title: The BEST visit ever!
text: I want to thank the staff at the Crowne for a wonderful stay. Elvin greeted us and helped secure our luggage before check in time, imran was a fantastic representative at the front desk- polite and professional! Kim, the bartender, was so much fun that we really didn’t want to leave! Ritchie made us feel like we were the only customers, even though the area was busy!  Finally, we got to see Ali at breakfast, always so nice!!  There is something special about this place and it’s all about the willingness of the staff to create relationships, even if it is brief! For us, we keep coming back for the very reasons mentioned. A special thanks to Mr. Sanders and Ms. Geronimo. Their kindness made our visit the best ever!

title: The Best!!!
text: We took our niece  to New York stayed here  love the views of the Hudson River!!    Staff very helpful!!   Location location   Time Square   down the street ,could not be beat for the price   walk out the door  and lots to do!!!

title: Great view
text: The crown plaza is grand, it offers great views with friendly staff and easy check-in. I'm glad I chose this place it's very good for what I was looking for, they offer airport transportation and everything I need is available.

title: Great location
text: This hotel is central in Manhattan for exploring the city. Close to everything and all very walkable. Great room with very comfortable mattress and nice sized bathroom. Friendly staff. Good and fast check in and out.

title: 初カウントダウン
text: 初めて参加しました、10時間以上も待てないのでホテルを近くで取りました。すごく近いわけではないけど意外にホテルから出て横から入ることが出来ました（ホテルキーを提示）いつもテレビで見ていたのですごく感動しました、今年は暖かかったみたいでそんなに苦痛ではなかったです。

title: Great experience!
text: We reserved 5 rooms for 2 nights at the Crowne Plaza located at 1605 Broadway. I have nothing but good to say. We arrived earlier than the check-in time. We were 13 adults and 4 children.....we had all our luggage and needed to leave it somewhere to begin exploring New York. RHODA at the check-in counter was amazing! She was professional, courteous, and very nice and was able to give us 2 of the 5 rooms. Rooms are super nice with the City view which is what we reserved. Beds were extremely comfortable and rooms were large and very clean and nicely decorated. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect location
text:
This was our first trip to NYC and for a long weekend. We were in the perfect location for all the things we wanted to see or do. Everyone at the hotel from check in to check out were helpful and friendly. We were always greeted with a “good morning” or “hello”. We were always offered help or direction. 
I think the only complaint would be that it was hard to regulate the heat in the room and there was no hot water for early risers to take showers. It just took awhile. And the friendliness of the staff made up for all of that.

title: Another terrific weekend stay
text:
Winding down our “holiday” weekend stay in NYC..... shout out to the fabulous Crowne Plaza Times Square.  This is the fifth year we’ve stayed here and just are so at home here..... we love starting our days with the breakfast buffet overlooking Times Square....then wandering off easily to Central Park, Fifth Avenue, Bryant Park...and the Theatre (TKTS booth is 1/2 block away) and restaurant districts.  Everyone from reception, to lounge staff, house keeping and guest relations has been top notch ..... 

i will add I had read a few negative reviews before arrival.....we were aware that if our room seemed warm for our taste we could crack open a window and we could call and request a fan be brought to our room. We did call housekeeping for a fan and had it within 15 minutes of the call ....our room temp was comfortable and we liked the circulating air. 

My travel chatting friends know I am a big fan of the IHG hotels branded CC and the platinum elite status that comes with having that card is the icing on the cake when you stay at properties like this which go out of their way and tell you they value your membership and being part of their family!!   The greatly discounted vouchers for the buffet breakfast are a favorite status related perk for us..... and we always appreciate the room upgrades often offered.

title: avis
text:
j'ai beaucoup son emplacements et sa beauté selon moi le rapport calité prix y ai.
Je recommande à ceux qui veulent faire un tour la bas très belle vu et son emplacements et parfaitement bien placé 
en couple ou seul très bonne accueil

title: Perfetto
text: Posizione strategica a pochi passi da time square,il Crowne Plaza e quell'hotel che cercavamo per passare una settimana nel cuore di New York..Non posso dire nulla del ristorante perché abbiamo solo fatto colazione ma l'hotel comunque si presenta bene,pulito,camera e bagno molto profumati e ben arredati, letti super super comodi!!

title: Staying here again!
text: Everything about this stay was perfect!  Check in, the room, the location, the security, the bar, the internet, the TV, the bed, pillows, toiletries, etc.  We will be staying here again!!!  We were so lucky to even receive drink vouchers for the bar upon check in, as well as free phone calls anywhere in the world.  THANKS!!!

title: SUPERB customer service
text:
ALSAH/ABAH! I can't say enough about her. She provided such effortlessly superb custom service with concern of my needs. The line was long and she had been working on her feet for over 12 hours..(I asked her..it was Jan 1)and she made me feel as if I were the only person in line..without holding up the line. Her smile was warm and welcoming.  Her customer service should not be without acknowledgement or rewarded. She's is the reason I will choose this hotel again. Thanks again for your superb service..keep it up. 
Jennifer:Columbus,Ohio

title: Great Service
text: Stayed here in early December 2019.  Great location, lovely hotel but most importantly the service was excellent.  Onelia on reception greeted us and set the tone.  She could not do enough for us and ensured we were well looked after.  Will be returning for sure!

title: Claire is the best
text: Spending Christmas in time square was amazing for my family and I. But the cherry on top came from our room service attendant “Claire”. She provided great service and went above and beyond to make our stay pleasant. I would recommend Crowne Plaza Time Square and don’t forget to ask for Claire. (L’union fait la force)

title: Out of date !
text:
We booked here as a family , a good base for what we intended to do on a short trip. 
The check in was ridiculous, after a long flight & journey this just tipped us over , queuing to check in , couldn’t use toilet until checked in or get a drink. Finally got checked in & made our way to the room. I booked a family room. The beds must of been the smallest doubles ever ! The room was very very basic , the bathroom was not nice and the taps were hanging off , a shower in the bath with a vile curtain & walls were not cleaned well, toiletries were a joke & the towels while a few were not freshly laundered, more like they had been left days. The coffee machine didn’t work & had missing parts , the beds made me itchy & the lighting was dull even though 4 lamps couldn’t see well. The light switch was wiggling all over not looking very safe !
The bar was busy , however we all had a burger which was good. Drinks overpriced & hotel while in great spot totally overpriced. The only great thing was our server jodane.... the only staff who smiled & she made the short stay bearable!
Being a crowne plaza I thought we’d get a save bet but totally not worth it.

title: What a view!!
text: We stayed in a corner room (3313) and it had an excellent view ! Abah at the front desk was so friendly and helpful , she really made our stay so much better . She was so funny - I was actually laughing out loud during our check in process . Thanks for making our stay so enjoyable. We love the location and the hospitality Crowne Plaza and Abah, we will definitely be back

title: New Year Trip - Best Ever!!!
text:
We visited NY with family and stayed at the hotel from the 28th December for 5 days. The hotel is very central and very welcoming. As an Elite Spire member, my husband was gifted a daily $25 voucher towards food / drinks to be used in the hotel - we used it for breakfast at the cafe and just made up the difference with cash. We also received 2 drinks vouchers per room which was a nice gesture.
The rooms are spacious and light and perfect for a city break. We generally spend very little time in the room when we have such a short time in a city so we didn’t have any complaints here. If you’re interested in using the gym, it’s really good. I used it twice. It has so much equipment, I just wish I’d had more time and energy to use it more!
On New Year’s Eve we did the Starry Night package which was truly awesome. Our waiter was extremely attentive (sadly didn’t catch his name), which meant that our glasses were never empty. The food was delicious and there was more than enough choice for everyone. David Kanters, the Hotel Manager was brilliant, a real credit to the hotel. He couldn’t have done enough for us. His continued care and kindness enabled us to have the best night ever with so many amazing memories! Thank you David!

This was a bucket list trip and New York, Times Square, you did not disappoint!

title: great hotel and service
text: We stayed during the Christmas holiday. We arrived early (at 11:00 am) and couldn’t check in until 2:00, so we checked our luggage with the bell captain. The line was about 75-people long, but moved so quickly, the bell captains were fast and super friendly despite the constant line of guest checking luggage. We checked in very smoothly, the room was clean and nice, the cleaning staff did a great job each day. The rooms were very quiet, I never heard a sole despite the hotel being at capacity. Overall a very pleasant stay.

title: First trip to NY
text: The hotel was nice a bit noisy so try and get a room up as high as you can, but you are located in the middle of Times Square so walking is most convenient to most sites.  The room was nice and very comfortable bedding.

title: Should not be rated as a 4 Star hotel!
text: So disappointed in The Crowne Plaza Times Square! It had three things going for it, the sweet lady who cleaned our room, the bartender, and the view! Their lack of customer service amazes me! We were told that we would have complimentary breakfast, that was not the case! I was also told that there was a shuttle, just call when we landed and they would send one, not the case! Anytime we asked a question we got 3 different answers! The hotel was excessively hot, no AC. The front desk said if we were hotel, top open a window! We were on the 37th floor! I called back down and they brought up a box fan. The room itself looked like it needed updating and the hotel lounge chairs were worn and torn! I guess I was expecting something more from a 4 Star hotel at Christmas!! I would never recommend staying here to anyone!!

title: Great location, poor hotel
text:
First the positives :

Great location - right in the heart of Times Square

Room was OK - clean, although took ages for the shower to run hot water

Negatives :

The restaurant is awful - overpriced (well over $100 for very average burgers and french fries and a couple of beers). More disappointing is the staff attitude, which is awful. Went to the bar to order a drink, only to be told to find a table from where I could order from and then wait over 30 minutes to actually place an order. This continued throughout my stay, again awful attitude, given the wrong bill. If you stay here, avoid restaurant and bar at all costs.

Saying that the check in and check out process wasn’t much better, with staff attitude very disappointing.

There is also the issue of the blatant con of charging over $35 a day for a gym you will probably never use, phone calls when you use your mobile and a one off free drink in the worst hotel bar I’ve ever been in.

My advice is avoid. There are other hotels in within close vicinity and would recommend trying these before going to the Crowne Plaza.

title: Nice but better service would have made it better.
text:
Eager to escape to NYC for a pre-Christmas holiday week-end ,we wanted to try some place new that had a good locatioin. The Crowne Plaza Time Square certainly fills that bill but unfortunately  there were things that added up and distracted from what other wise was a wonderful trip.
+On the positive side, the Crowne Plaza is perfectly situated on Broadway and 48th in the heart of mid-town. The property is impressive with a great bar that overlooks Times Square. The rooms fine and the sports center is terrific.
However, the service lacked on several counts.
1) Before arriving ,  we had trouble getting through to the front desk. I attempted to call the hotel directly  to find out where to check in with a car. (including while on route) and finally was told to just pull in on Broadway.  However , when we arrived we discovered that construction blocked entrence and it took 25 minutes driving around the block several times to find the unmarked entrance. The lack of information by the staff handling the phones, given the hectic Manhattan pace, was upsetting.
2) The concierge desk was a joke. Either no one was there, or there was a long line or when you left a message which they promised to return they did not (three times) (Thank God for the internet.) Finally when I actually spoke with a concierge person, she was not helpful at all.
3) In trying to get a cab to Brooklyn, after asking the doorman, we waited twenty minutes before being told that cabs didn't go there.  Irked , I resorted to Uber and thank God, for they saved our reservation.        

Manhattan at Christmas time is magical and the hotel over all wasn't bad, it's just that even given the stress of the fully booked conditions, the communication with its guests  about basic information should have been better.

title: Great Thanksgiving Family Stay
text: Our family of 4 visited NYC during Thanksgiving - first time being in the city for the holidays.  Our hotel stay was great and honestly our check-in with Erika Navedo started our amazing trip. It can be tough working during the holidays, but Erika was awesome to meet and talk with while checking us in. She was so friendly and we talked about everything from local restaurant recommendations, to funny stories with our families during the holidays.  Thank you Erika for welcoming us to NYC - happy new year to you!

title: Prachtige plek op Time Square
text: Dit hotel is werkelijk fantastisch gelegen midden op Times Square. De kamers zijn super ruim, zeker voor New York begrippen. De bedden liggen prima. Hoge standaard, schoon, gastvrij. Vanuit het hotel bent u snel bij alle mooie attracties die deze stad te bieden heeft.

title: Freddy is Fantastic!
text: We just checked out today. We went for an  impromptu overnight stay with the kids. We were lucky to get a room (we were told we got the last room in the hotel) since we booked the room at 10pm the night before so my expectations were low knowing the hotel was full. We got to the hotel at 12:30, early and well before checkin so I wasnt expecting much. I was so lucky to get Freddy at checkin. He checked in my family immediately, upgraded us to a beautiful, modern corner room facing times square on the 42nd floor. He took care of getting us a rollaway bed and a few extras we needed. Everything was perfect and he even accommodated a late check out for us as well. We had a fantastic stay at the hotel thanks to Freddy's hospitality and outstanding customer service. We will definitely be coming back!!!

title: Absolute Scam
text:
Service Charges - a con job!

If you read their website it states Free Internet, How ever if you check out services charges you will discover you have to pay for this free service, amongst other things one is unlikely to use.

The service charge is an absolute con, be aware of this companies tactics when you book, you will not get charged what you expect.

It’s just another way to drive up the room rate and of course taxes apply.

Dirty tactics I say

title: Big apple visit
text:
Great hotel as it is centrally based. Check in was seamless. Victoria at check in was very efficient. Family with 2 kids, Room was on 26th floor. Found room well appointed. A fridge would have been welcomed. Breakfast was good. We had dinner on the night and last night in local restaurant. Waitress was fantastic and food was good.

Only downside. If you think you getting a quiet nights sleep.... this is Times Square... 
 it is alive 24/7.

title: Christmas visit
text: Room ok if you stay on high floor facing times Square. .good view...bar too small for the crowd..location good as close to all facilities..very good connection with bus or metropolitan. .we enjoyed our stay as a lot to do or to see

title: Horrible
text: We booked 2 beds and when we checked in they said they only had one king bed and a pullout.  The pullout was filthy and the phone didn’t work in the room to call the front desk. the check in staff was so rude and no accommodating.  Not only did they not try to give us a discount they overcharged us. We immediately checked out and found another hotel in the area and it was so much better.  Clean. Helpful staff and very accommodating.  Crown royal Is overprice for garbage dirty rooms and rude staff.

title: Disappointed
text: Second Christmas spent in Manhattan. Wanted to stay in Times Square this year. Hotel Crowns Plaza appeared to be the place!! Fantastic location, amazing view from our room on 34th floor. Here the superlative ends. Practically non existent customer service. No hotel info on room, needed to ask for internet conection, we all know how important this is for keeping in touch with relatives. Most TV programmes at a premium!! Facilities in room can be equated with basic Travel Lodge or Premier Inn in UK. Take away cups in room for tea and coffee, artificial creamer, instead of milk. Miniature utilities in bathroom, not replaced during four night stay. No fridge, plastic or wood utensils. Restaurant buffet breakfast charge a whopping 32 dollars per person. Who the neck eats this much food!?

title: Great service staff but facilities and service could be improved
text:
My husband chose to stay in Crowne Plaza because of its great location and within walking distance to Broadway theatres.  My  husband and I with our two grown up kids checked into the hotel and stayed for 5 nights.  We booked two rooms through a third party operator and found out when we arrived that one of the rooms was cancelled.  The first front desk officer who served us was not helpful.  He said he could not do anything for us as the hotel was fully booked and asked us to talk to the third party operator. We tried to contact the third party operator but they also could not explain why one of our rooms was cancelled.  We went back to the front desk and this time, another front desk staff, Donald served us.  We repeated our predicament and explained that the third party operator could not help us.  He showed empathy and helped us to check his records again and spoke to his manager (I think it was John) to see if they could reconfirm the guests list and see if there was anyway to free up a room for us.  and promised to get back to us within an hour.  We were informed within an hour that they have found another room for us but it was on a different floor.  We took the room anyway, as we desperately need another room for the family.  Without us asking, Donald offered to check if he could arrange for us to have rooms on the same floor the next day and even arranged for our luggage to be moved to the new rooms as we would be out the next day.  

As we had initially requested for a double bed room for our kids, they could only find a room with King sized bed.  Donald offered to move in a roll in bed at no extra charge.  That, I thought, was good service recovery.

Unfortunately, when we checked out, we did not check the bill carefully as we were rushing to catch an early morning flight and found out later that we were charged for the roll in bed for all five nights after all. We did not mind paying for the rollin bed but I thought it was a good initiative at first but poorly executed.  

For one of the rooms, we also had problem with the bath room.  The water took a very long time to get heated and it was very difficult to adjust the water temperature.  

We were glad to have met Donald and his manager who were really helpful.  Had wished that the service is consistent across all aspects.

title: First trip to NY
text: This hotel is right in the middle of Times Square so you are within walking distance to everything depending on how much you are willing to walk.  The hotel was nice but be aware when checking in and don't let them try to talk you into an upgrade on your room with a view of central park.  I had to go back down to talk to front desk to let them know I had NO view of the park and had them take the extra $20/night off.  We didn't eat at the hotel but the bar was nice and they had a coffee shop but my wife and daughter didn't care for their fancy coffee so find a Starbucks around there they seem to be everywhere.  Also try to get a room as high as you can it can be a little noisy remember you are right in the middle of Times Square so be prepared

title: Los package and very rude
text: The worst hotel staff I ever seen. I sent xmas gift from Tiffany's to my friends that were guests at the hotel. Hotel staff lost package. I spent 2 hours on the phone. They kept sending me from one person to another. Than they were extremely rude. I would change management entirely. Gives bad name to the hotel company. Concierge, front desk, manager are rude and careless.

title: En el medio de Times Square
text:
El hotel merece la puntuación de 5 estrellas por la atención del personal, destacando a Sofía quien nos a ayudado de maravillas.
La ubicación de este es buenísima.
Lo único que no nos pareció excelente fue que no pudieron guardar nuestras valijas por 2 días mientras íbamos a Washington y luego regresar.
En conclusión se los recomiendo!

title: Very Disappointing
text:
This hotel was not good. I just can’t imagine how anybody could give it a good review. It wasn’t terrible but definitely not good. 
We just had one thing wrong after another. I came with my husband and 2 teenage daughters. 
Day 1 - We arrived early evening and decided to just eat in the hotel. The service was average and the food lukewarm. We ate it anyway as we were hungry. Not good enough for over $100 for a few burgers.
The room was average (a little tired with beds that were too soft and had roll together). 
Day 2 - We got up really early as we only had 2 full days here and had 9am tickets to an attraction. We couldn’t shower as the water wouldn’t warm up. We called reception. It took 30 mins for somebody to come. 
The manager agreed to move our room and gave us some breakfast vouchers for the next day, a bottle of cava and some fruit. 
Day 3 - Again, up and out early after a very good breakfast (they got this bit right). After 8 hours walking, we got back to our room. It hadn’t been serviced. So we had a bathroom full of wet towels. We had to call and ask for fresh ones. The hotel did waive the service charge but we hadn’t been serviced anyway. 

So all in all, for our €470 per night we had:
A room change
No hot water in first room (in the end, after running for 10 minutes, it did warm up. Who waits 10 mins in a hotel to run the water before showering!)
No room being serviced and coming back to make our own bed with damp towels.

In a nutshell, the hotel is understaffed for how busy it is. There were 2 staff on reception. It took over 30 mins to check in and 30 to check out. The manager was nice to us and tried his best to make things right but he seemed resigned and used to the complaints. 

I will definitely visit NYC again as I love it. However I would recommend choosing a hotel a little further away from Times Square. You don’t have to be that close.

title: New York City at Christmas
text: We had a corner room with two glass walls on the 46th floor overlooking Times Square. Perfect location to see all the lights and sights. Room was very clean and spacious. The breakfast buffet was pricy but compared to New York prices not bad. Large selection and hot and good. Great location central to favorite sites. Wonderful stay.

title: ATENCIÓN EXCELENTE
text: Estoy escribiendo esto para destacar la atención de Sofia quien nos a ayudado realizando todo lo que le solicitamos e inconvenientes con entusiasmo.Tambien gracias a ella nos pudimos comunicar ya que es bilingüe.

title: Wouldn’t stay anywhere else
text: Had the pleasure of staying here during the weekend of December 13th. Perfect location to the theater we were going to , Radio City Music Hall, & other tourist spots! Check in was pleasant! They text you throughout your stay as a way of checking in. This was something I had never experienced and I travel frequently! Breakfast & dinner were delicious at the two onsite restaurants. I would definitely stay here again!!

title: Excellent Registration Desk Staff
text: Hotel location, facility, and staff were exceptional.  Front Desk Agent, Imran was prompt, courteous, and professional in resolving our reservations at our check-in.  We're grateful for his assistance.  Views from our room were fantrastic.

title: Little price
text:
We stayed in this great hotel,
beautiful and large bright room, functional bathroom, quick check in, good bedding we slept very well
very very  good value for money , 
we will come back with all my family

title: Mixed feelings
text: Unfortunately this hotel messed up our rooms twice and made check in a bit of a nightmare after a long journey. Otherwise it was a nice hotel considering its a large and mainly impersonal place. Rooms good size. The bar area is really good, comfy and top service.

title: Perfect location and cozy ambience!
text: First time to stay at this hotel. After almost 24 hrs flight to NYC, check in process was not as swift as I expected although our online reservation was accurate. Front desk staff was courteous and the concierge staffs were helpful. A decent size room with clean and comfortable bed, linen and pillows. All fixture were running well. Internet access which important for us during our business stay in NYC was speedy and reliable. Food was so-so but our favourite is the cozy lounge facing Broadway. Perfect location of this hotel since it is close to so many attraction and easy access to public transportation. At the end of our trip check-out process was speedy. Overall experience: wonderful and a highly recommended place to stay in NYC!

title: Awful Beginning; Wonderful Ending
text:
We have stayed here so many times, actually a few times this year alone. The start of this trip was very disappointing. The girl at the desk was very rude and would not even make eye contact with us. When we tried to joke and make conversation, she would not even look at us. Because of our IHG membership, we always get early check-in. When we asked about this, she said, “come back at 3pm.” So, we left upset with the way we were treated. We give our full attention, love and support to individuals every day of the week. We expect the same when we actually get time to relax.
In the meantime, we received a text asking how our room was. We were puzzled since we couldn’t check-in yet. 
We went back to the desk and dealt with another rude and cold employee. When we got to the room, it was not what we always have. We went back down and the guy would not accommodate us or make changes. 
After texting back and forth with an IHG rep, a manager finally called us. We explained the entire situation and she was very accommodating. She apologized for the behavior of her employees and moved us based on our request within ten minutes. 
The bellmen who helped us that day were the nicest people we encountered. They had big smiles and wanted to make sure everything was great. We gave generous tips to them for smiling and being so nice.
Our day was made when we went to the bar and were served by Kim. She is always so nice and makes our day. We truly feel valued and like we matter when we talk with her.
The next day we saw our favorite employee- Donald Mei who always goes above and beyond to make our stays just perfect. After day one, we vowed never to come back here again. However, after talking to him, our minds were changed.
Joanie in food service was also wonderful and made our dining experience awesome. 
This hotel is lucky to have Donald, Kim and Joanie because they make us want to come back again instead of switching and going to the nearby Marriott.

title: Cozy, warm, clean, food amazing, location perfect
text: Having stayed twice in the hotel both for business and family holiday (with 2 kids), I can sincerely recommend this hotel. The location is just so convenient. You eat breakfast overlooking the Times Square, The metro stations are few meters away. it is in the middle of the city yet very quiet and warm. Rooms are spacious enough, very clean, convenient, beds are just perfect. Bathroom excellent. Breakfasts are amazing! Huge choice of options, no big crowd, just perfect. Staff is helpful. My check-in experience with Omelia G was exceptionally pleasant. She was quick, knowledgeable, practical, smart and with a big, big smile. Altogether, a wonderful experience, would love to go back and kids loooved it.

title: All about the Location
text: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza for a week in December 2019 on a Room Only Basis. The room was very average, Room service was poor, customer service was poor (although Concierge were very helpful) and eating facilities within the hotel were overpriced and not worth paying the extra. On the good side the room was a decent size but most importantly the location of this hotel is pretty much perfect. Right in the middle of Times Square and within walking distance of Central Park, most of the theatres and the Rockfeller Centre. Despite the other issues if I was returning to New York I would go back to this hotel.

title: Amazing one night stay
text:
Very short stay using rewards points.
John checked me in and was so warm and welcoming.
Room was huge, clean and perfect for my stay.
Bed was so comfy and the coffee maker greatly appreciated.
Was sad to check out as It was such an awesome hotel, with great staff and perfectly located.

title: Awesome
text: The room is very comfy. The bed and pillows ditto! The Staff is very friendly and makes sure your stay meets all expectations. The breakfast buffet is outstanding. The restaurant doesn't take reservations and then night we wanted to go they had a private party booked!😮 We ate in the lounge area and it was very good food along with the service. The room we had was a excellent view of Times Square! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

title: Great hotel in great location
text:
Visited this hotel many times, it has great location in the Times Square but still quiet and big clean rooms 
Great stuff, big thanks to Sofia in the reception for her great job!
Love the breakfast  in the hotel. 
Happily recommand this hotel for both business and pleasure visits

title: Perfect Location
text: This hotel is perfectly located on Times Square and has an excellent breakfast restaurant, Brasserie 1605 and bar, Broadway 49.  A daily Service Charge of $35 is added to your bill (around $40 with tax), which comes as a bit of a surprise, but appears to be standard in New York. Highly recommended hotel.

title: Great location and staff
text: My family stayed here in November. The location was very convenient, a block off of Times Square and close to many Broadway theaters, subway lines, and restaurants. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Onelia G. at the front desk was especially great. We had a problem with our reservation and she stayed after her shift was over to help us sort it out and found us space when the hotel was very full. Really outstanding. Rooms were clean and quiet. Good exercise room.

title: Central location
text: My daughter and I stayed here for 5 nights in November 2019. The location is great as it is quite central if you’re exploring NYC. It’s very close to Broadway so it’s perfect if you’re watching shows. The subway station is only about a block away. There are plenty of places to eat around the area. The room itself is quite old but we got an upgrade and was given 2 double beds so it was nice. We walked to Central Park, Rockefeller, 5th Avenue for shopping and other places. I will definitely stay here again if I visit New York again.

title: Great Base for exploring New York
text:
I booked this hotel as on the map it looked central to most things to enable us to make the most of a short break to New York.
We arrived and found the ground floor screened off as there is building work going on.  This just means that you access the hotel from the car drop off area, no real problem.
Check in took a while with only 3 people on Reception, but not excessive, and Imran was welcoming and explained the Resort charge to us.  He then found us a room on the 34th floor in the corner overlooking the city.  It was a really pleasant room and I didn't have any of the issues with it looking tired.  Imran also gave us our vouchers fro the free drink that comes as part of the resort fee and vouchers for a reduced rate breakfast as I am a Spire Elite member.  This makes the Breakfast $16 each and is all inclusive.  No issues with overcharging or wrong charging, everything was as expected.

As I said a really easy location to sightsee from, a couple of blocks from the Rockerfeller Center, at the top of Times Square and so also easy access to the Hop on Hop off bus stops.

Only a couple of niggles, the first was when I exchanged my free drinks voucher I was asked if I was taking the drink to my room.  A "Yes" meant that although I was in a Crowne Plaza, I was taking drinks to my room in plastic tumblers.  Is that really necessary?
Also, the building work restarts before breakfast finishes and on one morning someone was angle grinding stone or something and the noise and smell was obvious in the restaurant.  I get that there has to be building work but it should be timed around restaurant opening hours.

Otherwise a really relaxing base in a busy city, close to everything and with a fantastically comfortable bed.

title: Excelente opção Manhattan, mas cuidado com a Resort Fee
text:
O hotel é localizado em plena Times Square, com tudo que você precisa em volta em termos de diversão, restaurantes, burburinho etc. 

Quartos com vista perfeita da cidade, espaçosos, limpos e aconchegantes. 

O único ponto negativo é a tal da Resort Fee. Ridícula essa mania de alguns hotéis em NYC cobrarem essa taxa que não tem vantagem nenhuma para o hóspede. 

Uma das coisas que a tal da taxa inclui são ligações internacionais gratuitas. Quem quer fazer ligação internacional hoje em dia do telefone fixo do hotel, sendo que qualquer celular faz a mesma coisa se conectado no wi-fi....DEPLORÁVEL.

title: Always a Pleasure
text: We’ve stayed here for several years in a row now and probably will never stay anywhere else. It’s so convenient to everything we want to do.
