The only time we need transportation is to/from airport and if we go to 911/Statue of Liberty. The subway is very convenient as well. I would like to personally commend the dining room staff on their customer service and friendliness. Tofael has been our waiter almost everyday this trip and has been in the past as well and he goes above and beyond to make sure we have everything we need. The lady who seats us is also a joy to speak with. So sweet and friendly. Year and after year we look forward to breakfast here because of the staff. The food is great too though! We love Crowne Plaza and NYC!

title: Great location, big rooms, awesome Gym
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights, check in was easy, rooms are massive for NYC standards and the place was clean.
Big tv in room that hooks up to mobile phone so that you can watch Netflix etc.
The hotel bar/restaurant was a little disappointing but there are lots of other places to eat as you are so close to Times Square. 2 minute walk to subway and the hotel offers airport transfer for about $60.

For me, the best part of the hotel was the gym. It has 4 separate rooms with lots of cardio equipment, squat racks, smith machines, barbells and dumbbells. My girlfriend joined in on a body pump class.

title: NYC Christmas trip
text: The staff was very pleasant and helpful! The rooms are ok but they are starting to show their age and they need a refresh. Slow bathroom drain. Latch off window. No fridge (I kinda expected for the price) Absolutely a great location.

title: Location...location
text: The best location!  Service was very good.  Quick response to requests.  The atmosphere was touristy but not over the top.  The one complaint.  Amazingly they ran out of regular coffee for the room coffeemaker!  Only Decaf!  Really?  We will return for the location anyway.

title: Amazing
text: Went up for long weekend to see Rockefeller Tree. Stayed at this gem located in Time Square. The hotel is beautiful. We had a king room which was beautiful and the staff was amazing. Made you feel welcome and was very friendly.

title: Nice place to stay
text:
Room was nice and clean. Quiet. Wanted a refrigerator for a place  for my doggie bag.
I faced the river so nice view but quiet. I would stay here again. The location was convenient  for shopping and the theaters.

title: Great Midtown Hotel
text: Great hotel in the heart of Midtown NYC and Times Square. Easy walk to many places. Incredibly nice and helpful staff are welcoming when you arrive. They made sure my arrangements were set up correctly for an enjoyable stay. The theater district is right around the corner and there are endless food options. All in all the Crown Plaza is a wonderful experience all the way around.

title: Doug
text: Hotel is run down. No AC   Front desk called and said they could bring a portable AC in but the window would have to stay open for the exhaust  then you hear all the noise from the sirens. I wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone especially at 400.00 per night.

title: Recent Stay at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square
text: I recently stayed at this hotel in advance of a meeting in NYC. The hotel is trying to keep people inside the hotel for drinks and dinner and have a lot of discount cards for users. It's very useful for visitors to New York City. This is a lovely, well-situated hotel with excellent service.

title: Maybe not the best place to stay
text:
If money is not a factor in your stay and you just want to be in or close to Times Square, this is the place for you.

Pros: close to Times Square and all that stuff. Decent room, but I've had much better in 3 star hotels. There is a room safe.

Cons: no microwave or fridge in room. Downstairs breakfast buffet is 16 dollars with their "coupon". Long waits for front desk, long wait for the single concierge they had working. Uber and Lyft drivers dont know to come to area "beneath" the hotel where the taxis pickup and drop off. The drivers try to go to the front or side of the building, but the front is closed due to construction, and the side is not where people can exit the hotel from. There was no AC, so they gave us a portable AC unit shown in picture, but it vents outside the window, so trying to cool a room with an open window doesnt work!

title: Great hotel!
text: This was the second time have used this wonderful hotel for my groups stay.  The staff is very nice and helpful.  We did have a problem with getting part of our luggage delivered in a timely matter, but we did get it.  The breakfast restaurant staff were wonderful and the food was very good.  The location is perfect and everyone loved their stay and visit to NYC.

title: this review is for the bartender Jason!
text:
first time ever in new york for me and my boyfriend. 
arrived at crowne plaza times square, fast friendly checkout, dropped bags off in room and headed for the bar! 
we were both beyond excited and we received a welcome from bartender Jason like he was an old pal. 
basically, the guy is amazing. 
his attentiveness, his banter, his service EVERYTHING was just amazing and every day we were there we looked forward to seeing him. 
i myself am a waitress and my boyfriend head chef and we have never witnessed such amazing service. 
he’s an asset to the hotel and deserves major recognition!!!
we actually can’t wait to return to new york, and the crowne plaza just to see Jason. 

Thank you for making our visit extra special we love you!! 

enzo and steph xxxxx

title: Sehr gutes Hotel
text:
Wir waren fünf Nächte in diesem Hotel und sehr zufrieden. Die Zimmer sind geräumig und sehr leise - wir haben immer gut geschlafen. Unser Ausblick aus dem Fenster ging Richtung Hudson River.
Das Hotel ist zwar nicht nagelneu, aber extrem sauber. Ein typisches amerikanisches Hotel - genau so, wie wir es gerne mögen. Die Lage ist hervorragend! Wir waren auch oft an der Hotelbar. Sehr freundliches Personal und leckere Snacks! 
Ich kann nicht nachvollziehen, wie jemand dieses Hotel als "heruntergekommen" beschreiben kann.

title: NO LO HAGAS
text: Asqueroso. No limpian desde que abrieron. Se cae a trozos. Extremadamente sucio. Carísimo para su categoría de motel. Los empleados van a linea con el hotel. Sin refrigerador en las habitaciones. La tv no funciona. Deprimente 5 noches 3.000 usd.

title: Omelia G
text: Omelia was very gracious, pleasant, and accommodating. She made us feel very welcome and made me want to come back here again. She gave us advice on things to do. And tips to help us save money. Very grateful for her.

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
I arrived on Sunday 1st December with my two daughters, we were celebrating one of my daughters 40th birthday. 
We were attended to at reception by the very lovely Sophia, who could not have been more helpful, explained everything regarding the $300 hold on my card of which a $160 was for resort fees. On realising we were celebrating a birthday she went above and beyond and arranged for a bottle of champagne and massive slice of chocolate cake to be delivered to our room. Thank you so much Sofia, you are an asset to this hotel.
We had a traditional double/double room , which was lovely , with plenty of space. Our maid service was also excellent, plenty clean towels etc.
I don’t understand the reviews saying staff are rude and unhelpful, everyone we encountered was helpful and friendly.
Great hotel, highly recommend and if ever manage to return to NYC , I would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

title: Juliette Saved The Day!!
text: I made reservations on line for a coworker and I at the Crown Plaza. When we arrived-having flown in from Arkansas, we discovered they had sent same confirmation number for both and reserved only one room. After going to front desk, the Manager, Juliette, took us under her wing and took care of getting us another room. Did not expect that level of hospitality in NYC and am extremely grateful that I was proven wrong.  Concierge was also very helpful, as was Ming, the bellman. I would highly recommend this hotel for location, well appointed rooms - but mostly for their incredible staff!!!

title: Great Customer Service
text:
We had wonderful customer service thanks to Onelia with the Front Office.  We had hot water problems with our first room when we checked in, and she bent over backwards to find us a new room (which turned out to be even better!), and compensated us as well with breakfast vouchers.  This was our 35th anniversary and we had never been to NYC before.  She even sent us complimentary champagne and fruit dish!  Onelia was awesome, and we won't hesitate to go back as long as she is on the staff!!!
The location is wonderful, and the breakfast buffet here is OUTSTANDING!  Book your next vacation here....you won't regret it!!

title: AVOID, staff and management lie and are rude. !!
text:
Hotel staff and management have completely let this hotel and the crowne plaza’s brand down big time. 
Checked in by Donald Mei, who asked for a accident deposit of $50 per night of stay. Was assured this was the only reason for the deposit and was guaranteed our money back at check out. 
This Was a LIE. 
They kept $40 per night as a “hotel charge” 
Spoke to the manager John Acosta who was very very rude and didn’t want to know.  We was lied to and he refused to even acknowledge we was lied to. 
I have taken things further but please be aware of their hidden extra costs which they don’t tell you about. 
DO NOT believe the accident deposit as they will just keep your money !

title: Location,Location, Location!
text: An excellent property to enjoy the wonders of a Christmas in New York.  An easy walk to all the main Christmas attractions (Rockefeller Plaza, Radio City Music Hall, shopping) and Broadway shows.  A quick taxi ride from Penn Station is a plus.  NYPD does a fantastic job with traffic control and pedestrian safety, very safe area, day or night.  Hotel is extremely efficient in handling the busy holiday crunch.  Newly appointed rooms, clean and a very nice morning buffet breakfast (Note: The IHG Hotel Awards Program offers discount vouchers worth signing up for).

title: Fabulous stay
text: We arrived on 1st Dec. Check in was so easy. Sophia at the front desk was so welcoming and even sent up a birthday treat for me from the hotel with a card. Rooms were clean and spacious, was in a great location. There were some great places to eat only a couple of minutes from the hotel on 8th Avenue. Check out was a doddle and they arranged transportation to the airport. All in all a fabulous stay and would definitely recommend it.

title: Perfect location, hotel needs a refurb
text:
Certain parts are looking tired, room was clean which was what was most important. Can’t expect luxury as this hotel is a lot cheaper than most, the beds are also comfy :) 

Staff are friendly & helpful wouldn’t recommend drinking at the hotel though the drinks are expensive and not nice (cocktails) Can’t beat the location, we weren’t spending much time in the room anyway so it was great for us

title: Beautiful Hotel and Great service
text:
Our stay at the Crowne Plaza was very enjoyable. The room was clean/comfortable, the location couldn't be any better, and the view from our room was gorgeous. 
Michelle is a awesome asset to your front desk. She made my family feel special. Her smile is contagious. Thank you for your hospitality and help, Michelle. Happy Holidays.

title: Hotel Check - In
text:
The check in at the Crowne Plaza was excellent. I was greeted by Onelia, mi quisqueyana favorita, who was fantastic. We were given a nice room on the 40th floor with a nice view of Times Square. It couldn’t be nicer.

Onelia made the start to our visit a pleasure. I would recommend the Crowne Plaza for your next stay to NYC.

title: Unauthorised charges
text:
Very dissapointed in this place, upon arrival we had to wait 1 hour as they could not find my reservation which was made 3 months earlier but eventually we got checked into a disabled access room as that was the only thing available.
Next day we had to re pack and in all fairness all was fine untill today dec 6th when lloyds tsb contacted me about a vast sum leaving my bank.
When i checked in i was made aware that i had to pay a $300 security deposit and that is the only thing i used my debit card for in this hotel.
My room was booked via ihg rewards as i am espire elite member so cost me reward points and not cash.
When i checked out i was handed a bill with zero balance as i knew i was in credit and they actually owed me $44.
Was horrified today that after being back in the Uk 3 days they without reason have taken over £1000 out of my account in 4 separate transactions which has now escalated to lloyd's fraud dept and i have had to cancel my card incase they take anymore.
If they can do that to me being an ihg member then they can do it to anyone.
Had a great time there but this scam by the hotel has ruined it for us.

title: Great Front Desk and Great Location!
text: Evelyn front desk was fantastic lovely lady so helpful! All staff smiled and were very approachable. Nice hotel with great location. Food Emporium is just round the corner great for snacks and sandwiches to start the day on! Hot food and cold beers too! Rooms are a bit tired need a little updating but very clean our cleaner came every day and was superb very clean! I got 2 free drinks vouchers on arrival glass of wine and a beer lovely! I really enjoyed the bar area great cocktails! They even provided us with a fridge for our boy's meds! You feel safe in New York now and we used the "Big Bus" to get around to get our bearings great idea! 9/11 memorial is a must visit. We used the subway a lot great way to get around quick if the traffic is bad. We used Yellow cabs only to and from JFK $52 flat rate add in tolls and tip equals $65 best way to get to hotel and back for sure! i needed to buy a special whisky for friend and found "SHON 45" to be very good and short distance to hotel.on 8th Ave!

title: DO NOT HAVE THE BREAKFAST!
text:
On our third day we decided to have breakfast in the hotel Brasserie - I would describe it as very basic and the poor quality, to a point I had to discretely remove a mouthful of waffle from my mouth. The bill for this for 2 people was $89 which is approximately £75.82. 

I have stayed in a number of top hotels all over the world and I have never been charged this.

I have also stayed in many Crowne Plaza hotels and I have never been charged this.

Such a shame as the hotel is very nice but I feel this is completely unacceptable! Would not recommend.

title: Best front desk ever!
text:
Recently visited NY for the first time we stayed at Crown plaza Times Square. The hotel is great and location is awesome though we did have some heating issues (room kept being cold) ... however Erika at the front desk was the best and most amazing ever. She is friendly and warm. Felt like I knew her my whole life. My gf and I got engaged, she let us check in early from and overnight flight and was overall great. Send some strawberries! We just wanted to say thanks! 
Also Edith helped with reservations! Shout out to both!

title: Could be better
text: We stayed here during Thanksgiving. Evelyn was fabulous at check in, upgrading our room, giving drinks and breakfast vouchers - couldn’t have asked for more. Room could have been cleaner and is definitely tired - bed was very comfy which is just what you need when you’ve been out all day. Service at the bar was good. Beware the cafe area though - paid 5.44 dollars for a bottle of water! Most disappointing though is the service we have received since check out - stupidly we left 4 items of clothing in the wardrobe! Although we checked out at 8.30am - we did not collect our bags until 2 30pm - giving the hotel ample opportunity to contact us about the items. I have been trying for the last 3 days to reach them to arrange for the items to be returned with no luck. Put a dampener on an otherwise great trip to NY.

title: Excelente Atención de Ornelia G
text:
Todo nuestro viaje estuvo perfecto en este hotel. Cerca de todo a unos pasos de los mejores lugares de NY.
La atención de Ornelia G excelente felicitaciones.
Estuvo para ayudarnos en todo momento 
Recomiendo 100% Alojarse en este hotel
Lo que faltaría mejorar serían las camas un poco incómodas.

title: Great service at front desk
text: I joined family for a long thanksgiving weekend in NYC at the Crowne Plaza.  After the first night staying with others, I realized I needed my own room.  Onelia G was there and was incredibly helpful with my very last minute reservation!  Rooms were clean and service in the hotel bar was attentive.  Only complaint I have is the high price of the breakfast buffet!  Way too expensive for very standard fair.  Find a diner instead.

title: Fantastic View
text: We paid for a TImes Square View room and we couldn't have been happier!  Small but that's normal for NYC, and CLEAN.  They held our bags until our room was ready.  LOVED that I got a text telling us we could come back and get in our room BEFORE our matinee show!!  Overall, a great experience.  Only thing we wished for was a fridge to hold our dinner leftovers!

title: Ótimo
text: Segunda hospedagem. O hotel diz que vc pode fazer o check in a qlq horário, tendo disponibilidade, vc já pode ir pro quarto. Ao chegarmos, a atendente disse que dentro de 1h já estaríamos acomodados. Deixei o número de telefone, já que ela disse que poderia me ligar pra avisar, e eu estava com uma criança. Não ligaram. Voltamos e estava tudo pronto. Nos colocaram num quarto no final do corredor, o banheiro estava em manutenção, com peças e fios jogados no chão. Não tinha água. Carpete com mau cheiro. Liguei e pedi que nos trocassem de quarto e rapidamente resolveram. A entrada do hotel estava em reforma, o que não incomodou. O hotel é ótimo, fica próximo a tudo. Tem restaurante no lobby. Wi-Fi bom. Recomendo!

title: Merveilleux !
text:
Cet hôtel est idéalement situé, en plein Times Square. Les chambres sont très calmes et spacieuses, très confortables, la literie est idéale. Notre chambreau 43ème étage avait une vue époustouflante. Le personnel est très serviable et sympa, même pour les personnes qui ne parlent pas bien l'anglais.
Je recommande cet hôtel et j'espère y retourner🙂

title: Busy
text: This was convenient for meeting family and going to the theatre but it seemed if anything too crowded. The overall site is being redeveloped or refurbished so it is a bit of a mess. I felt the reception staff were under pressure.

title: Hugely Disappointed
text: The photos speak for themselves. Rooms are old and drab.... this was 4119,and at check in was told i had been given a lovely room!!! broken drawer, chipped bath, and damaged desk, check in was painful and long after 14hrs of travelling,this was a special trip and we travelled all the way from Spain for Thanksgiving , and at over $500 a night I don’t expect the room to be in this state!!! And we are IHG loyalty members!! AVOID

title: No refund of deposit
text: Although the room was lovely if a little pricey.although they took $75 per night on my credit card this has to date not been refunded although I left on the Saturday my friend was staying an extra night. This has ruined what should have been a wonderful stay at the hotel.

title: BEWARE....$30+ per day service charge!!!!!
text:
Stayed here, great location and near subway.  Whole stay was overshadowed by the mandatory "service charge" of over 30 dollars per day!  
The Service charge includes, use of spa facilities, high speed wi-fi, local and long distance calls plus 2 "complementary" drinks ( although you are paying for them in the service charge!!)
Overall hugh dissapointment due to hidden service charge for stuff you would most likely not use if you are in NYC for a few days, as you 'd be too busy sightseeing.
Avoid this hotel unless you want to be ripped off!

title: Nice Hotel
text: Fantastic room with the best views of Times Square and funnily enough Mo Salah , room was very spacious and had all amenities , had a complimentary voucher each for a drink in the bar which was a nice touch , clean and comfy and also had on hand a Cunard Rep which was grand as we had just got off of the QM2 . Great location and we loved going around the corner to Lillie's Victorian Establishment [ Bar]

title: Think twice before booking
text: The rooms are in desperate need of a refurb , they are a great size but depressing to stay in . Windows don’t shut properly and the wardrobe is nothing more than a small cupboard with 5 coat hangers ????? Room was cold despite the thermostat saying it was 70f . And as for holding $75 per night and then being told it will take up to 5 days for it to be clear in my account again ...... don’t even go there . We checked out and moved to another hotel where I feel happy to return to each day .

title: Always a great place to stay
text: This is our 4th or 5th glorious stay. Central location, comfortable and great staff.  It is walking to central park, shops, museums, times square, subways. I cant imagine staying anywhere else when I come to NYC

title: Ok rooms; pretty dreadful ambience
text: Our room was ok, but with major refurbishment taking place, it was also cold and unwelcoming downstairs. Reception wasn’t great either. Not recommended till they’ve finished their works. The bar was actually ok, but they seemed to have closed their main restaurant except for breakfast.

title: Amazing hotel
text: This hotel was by far the best hotel I was fortunate to stay in. The staff were very friendly and efficient. The food in this hotel was delicious. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone and will definitely be going back.

title: Che vista
text: hotel in piena Time Square, pulito ed elegante, ottime le colazioni ed il personale qualificato! vista da favola! Cercate di farvi assegnare una stanza in alto per ammirare tutta new york dall’alto!!!

title: Room is extremely hot; found pill on the floor
text: Our room is uncomfortable hot. We are all red faced & sweating. Thermostat says “service” yet the refuse to send anyone to check it. Hallway is 20 degrees cooler. They told me to open the window. We are on the 20th floor with young children. Did I mention my son found a pill on the floor? 🤬

title: Awful
text:
I’m an IHG member with Spire Ambassador status. I typically give around 120 nights business a year to IHG, as typically, their hotels are reasonable. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels in dozens of countries, so I have a good idea of the standard of such properties. From a Crowne Plaza virtually anywhere outside USA, you can expect good service and look nice, well appointed rooms. 

The staff I experienced in CP Times Square are, in general, rude and more so than the famous reputation that precedes this city. Check in was inefficient. The girl that checked me in was rude, with a zero ‘can do’ or helpful attitude. She told me I had my Spire benefits. Maybe that was her way of greeting me as a loyal guest. It certainly isn’t the way she was trained to greet her loyal guests, but then, like everything about this hotel, a half hearted effort is apparently enough. I was then handed a few vouchers for drinks and breakfasts, which didn’t even have my correct status printed on them. But ok, I can live with that. 

When I asked later in the stay if I could extend my check out, I was asked to pay a $75 fee. Then conveniently it ‘wasn’t on the system’ that I had status. 

I was charged a 15% tip on a rubbish $40 breakfast, because a rude and quite frankly lazy waiter poured a coffee and brought me the check. Don’t buy breakfast here, it’s pathetic, and for that money you can eat like a king across the road at Juniors. They sell it on the view, and in case you hadn’t noticed already, any building in Times Square with windows has a view of Times Square, even Starbucks, where an equivalent breakfast to the one I had cost $9, with better coffee and better food. Just a note - my voucher brought the rip off cost of a terrible breakfast to $16, but I was still charged a service fee on $40, which meant that breakfast for one person was still more than $21. Again, you can find good food on TS for Less or equal, but also service with a smile. 

Rooms are tired, dirty, poorly appointed, poorly maintained, noisy and old. I understand it is a high throughput hotel - so are many of their hotels where at least they make an effort to keep them looking good. A tip for you, fellow travellers, don’t look too closely at anything in the bathroom ;-) 

Then there was the water issue. Alex (Social Media Manager) - before you harp on that it was ‘out with your control’, don’t talk such nonsense. I bet you have a generator for when there is a power outage. I live in a country where all hot water is supplied to hotels cold. As it is in most of the rest of our world. There are solutions, and just because your overcharged property doesn’t invest in them, that isn’t ‘out with your control’. That’s ‘lack of planning and investment’ and ‘pure profiteering at the expense of your guests’.

The one positive from this experience - there are many taxis around that will happily take you away from this dump.

title: Crowne plaza times square
text: I am very happy with the service at the front desk we received from OMELIA G. Super friendly, everything well explained and professional. I really recommend this hotel. This is a unique experience. A+++

title: Hotel in pieno centro di New York
text: Hotel situato in Time Square decisamente utile per la visita della citta' un po' meno se si cerca un luogo tranquillo e riposante. L'hotel è comunque molto ben insonorizzato e dalle camere non si sente assolutamente nulla dei rumori provenienti da Time Square. Colazione ottima (per lo standard americano), camere pulite anche se non enormi: eravamo in una stanza quadrupla per 2 adulti e due ragazzi. Non consigliato invece il ristorante, dozzinale, caro e .... non ci siamo proprio. Abbiamo soggiornato per 5 notti e ne ho un buon ricordo.

title: No hot water for over 2 days!
text:
Haven’t taken an ice cold shower in a long time but this hotel gave me that pleasure for 2 nights.  Also didn’t offer any compensation whatsoever.  It was blamed on the city infrastructure but to a paying customer I would assume you’d have a backup hot water mechanism.  3rd world stuff in the heart of NYC!  

Adios forever Crowne Plaza Times Square!

title: Birthday break
text: Went here with my wife and daughter check in tryed charging for service charge which we already paid when booking nobody helped with our bags found room 2small double beds all the room needed updating the only good thing about this hotel was the location and excellent bar service wouldn’t use again unless it had a reverb

title: DO NOT VISIT. TERRIBLE.
text: Had a business trip with a group, 8 rooms total. One of the travelers arrived about 1pm on Nov 19 and was told that there was no heat or hot water due to a steam explosion but it would be turned on by 3pm. Rest of group arrived at 5pm - still no hot water but told by 8pm or midnight latest. Then a letter slipped under door overnight saying 6am and give us 45 minutes to get the hot water throughout the hotel. Needless to say we all left the hotel at 730am with NO HOT WATER, NO SHOWERS and OH YEAH NO HEAT AT NIGHT and NO BLANKET, just a thin sheet. The hot water and heat never came on. We hosted our meeting un-showered. Gross. I heard people in elevator saying they hadn’t had hot water for days. Really?!? And you’re still checking people in?!? Tried to call front desk, no answer. This hotel is run down, mismanaged, unprofessional and unethical. Pay more, stay elsewhere and enjoy NYC. This place is a dump.

title: Worse than an en-route motel is a mismanaged unsupervised hotel
text:
I’ve never been to a motel but I know you get better than this at a motel! 

Positive points: 
walking distance to subway and Times Square

Negatives? Let me count for you! (Read till the end as I have the worst part the last
1- stains on the bed sheets
2- soap scum all around the bathtub, and bath tile specially close to the shower standing area
3- stain (probably from rusty soap dish) on the sink counter
4- sticky black mark on a towel
(Some towels look wrinkled, I’m not sure if they’re washed)
5- the windows are not tight. You can literally put a hand in the gap. so you hear all the outside noise, as well as the breeze and the wind sound that comes in
6- no ventilation in the room (I guess because there has been no need to put one with the faulty windows)
7- the table lamp on the night stand has a primitive button and the light blinks and you don’t know that it’s on until it turns on automatically in the middle of the night! So you can’t basically use it
8- the only thing you get at the room is a cheap no-name coffee machine with 2 paper cups (which if you use them they usually don’t put new ones back) and a pair of no-name coffee and tea bags to put in the machine. I’ve been to a holiday inn express once for a business trip and they had Keurig coffee machine with real pods! 
9- the hotel has been out of hot water for 2 consecutive days so far, and I have contacted them at least 5 times so far. They’re not responsive. I’m still waiting for the hotel manager to contact me, as they offered, and I have not received a single phone call from even a concierge in the hotel! 
They say there’s a water breakdown in the NYC area that has caused the issue. This is unacceptable for me. Such huge hotel is expected to have a backup plan for any similar issue. What if you don’t have electricity? How can you live without hot water for 2 days??? You should have your own boiler, or hot water tanks or whatever it takes not to cause such problems for your guests! The weird thing is that they even don’t offer any type of compensation! 
They just sent a letter last night promising to fix the issue, and then another one in the middle of the night that the hot water will be back this morning not later than 6:45am, and as of now, 8:05am, there’s still no hot water.
We’re here to stay for 9 nights for a family trip and both my husband and I have arranged for a couple of business meetings as well. We both went to our meetings unshowered yesterday and we don’t know how to appear in our meetings today!!! 

Briefly, we tried to be cool and don’t take the first 8 big negatives seriously as we wanted to have fun, but the last one and their irresponsibility, is not tolerated any longer. 
This hotel is not worth even a one night try and a penny per night.

title: Great for camping
text:
On the morning of Nov. 19, 2019 - I tried to workout on the 15th floor, since they told me at checkin there was a very nice gym. 
It was closed.
The gym doesn’t open until 6:00 am which is great if you’re here for sightseeing and breakfast in bed, but not great if you have to set up for an 8am meeting.
I guess it’s good that the gym was closed though because my room had no hot water.
The staff told me there was no hot water in half of New York, so I suppose it’s true.
I asked for a comb and toothbrush. They dropped off the toothbrush, no comb. The concierge told me he checked in storage and couldn’t find one. When questioned further I asked if there were any combs in the entire hotel 50-some-story hotel. He told me there was not one comb in the entire building. (Yes, I specifically asked him this question). So I suppose that is true as well.
Honestly I felt like I was staying in a Motel8, the amenities were so striped down. 
They charge you per page for printing- (the DoubleTree does that for free).
I was super excited to come to the Crown Plaza hotel, because it’s supposed to be really nice. It didn’t feel really nice.
One star on this one is generous.

- Single Business Traveler

title: Hot and stuffy...dismal review to come.
text: First time to New York from Canada...booked the Crowne Plaza for the location, close to Broadway and right in Times Square. That was good. We arrived on Sunday, November 10, 2019. We walked into our room and it was hot and stuffy. The temp was set at 60 degrees and it was 75 in the room. My husband, daughter and I were quite disappointed as we had a 5 day stay planned. Our room was clean, beds comfy but the heat was unbearable for sleeping and the window only opened a crack...zero ventilation, so disappointing. I could not sleep...got up to get a drink of water around midnight and I spotted a cockroach on the bathroom counter...might have come through the drain. I got him. Anyway, early morning, we went to the front desk to see if we could improve our room. The girl, Michelle I believe was very kind. She explained that the heat had to be turned on and the A/C was off. She knew we were very set on improving our situation, but she said there was little she could do. We told her that we would go to another hotel and let her know if we found one. She understood and graciously agreed to waive the early departure fee of $100. We were able to get a room for our remaining 4 days a few blocks away at the Marriott Marquis. We went back to get our things and check out at the Crowne Plaza. Lots of renovations there, when we went back to get our things, the jackhammer had started so I hope they get things nicer there. I would not stay there ever again unless the ventilation system is redone. We actually talked with a guy in the elevator as we went back up to our room and he said the same thing, hot and stuffy. We were so happy to leave this hotel.

title: Warm, wonderful front desk staff
text: Just visited for work and I could not have been more tired when I arrived - so it was a true testament to her kindness, humor and patience that Onelia managed to get a smile and laugh out of me. The room, hotel and gym are all nice and well located, but it was Onelia that earned these five stars!

title: EXCELLENT LOCATION - watch for all the extra fees and charges
text: Great location. Updated rooms and bathrooms. Would recommend and would stay again. Nothing really remarkable, just solid clean, safe, modern, convenient. Only option for breakfast is the $36 buffet. No A la Carte menu. Although, there is a little "grab and go" pre-made food station.

title: Excellent members of staff
text:
I would like to tell everyone about my experience at the crowne plaza times Square new york. Myself and my partner Christopher experienced excellent customer service on our recent stay especially the bar staff. All members of staff gave an excellent service but two members of staff stood out to us by giving that little bit extra.
We spoke to the manager Nerry who was lovely and told her what excellent service we had received.
The members of staff were Rahi and Michelle because of these members of staff giving that extra special customer service we will definitely be returning to the crowne plaza. Thank you for a fantastic time.

title: Great
text: Omelia G was great. So accomodating and friendly. We checked in without any hassles and problems. And she was fast in processing our checkin. Thank you very much miss Omelia. And thank you for the complimentary drinks

title: Birthday Trip to NY
text: Excellent location, steps away from all attractions on our itinerary. Service from concierge, house keeping, check-in was excellent! Daily breakfast at the hotel was super expensive and quality not worth the cost. There are other options around the corner. However, our daily host and server Tofael made our experiences more positive. Thank you Tofael!

title: Great central location
text: Check-in was quick and efficient and the agent was very helpful, giving us advice on various things.  The room was good with a large bed & t.v., coffee maker etc.  Would have liked a fridge though.  Found the shower a bit difficult to manoeuvre but was pleased to see the toiletries.  Wasn't too impressed with the bar/lounge area but enjoyed the free drink.  The hotel is in a great location and there is a small cafe area.

title: En el corazón de la gran manzana
text:
Escogimos este hotel por su ubicación justo en Times Square. Si bien no es barato, la comodidad de salir del hotel y estar en el centro de todo, justifica el precio. A media cuadra de las taquillas de teatro, o de la partida de los Hop on Hop off bus, las grandes pantallas y ver pasar a gente de todo el mundo, cualquiera sea la hora. Nuestra habitación en el piso 22 con vista a Times Square y Broadway permite comprobar que es la ciudad que nunca duerme. Vale la pena pagar mas por tener una habitación con esta vista (US$432 taxs incl. por noche), que incluye el edificio donde se celebra cada año nuevo y el Empire State.
El personal es muy amable. la habitación y sus camas son excelentes. Bien insonorizadas. El desayuno buffet  es bueno. Llegamos antes del mediodía y nuestra habitación ya estaba lista. WIFI en la habitación a veces  no conectaba, debiendo salir a áreas comunes.
Volvería a este hotel sin dudas.

title: Celebración de Cumpleaños de Mi Comadrita Laura Helena Salazar
text: Excelente servicio y atención fe Omelia G el hotel está en una muy buena ubicación y la atención de reitero del Omelia más que excelente todo está muy limpio en la habitación  estaremos 5 días más que perfecto

title: Amazing service from Omelia G!
text: Omelia was great! After struggling to get from JFK to the hotel, she was a very pleasant surprise. She was very kind and great at what she does. Fast service and very knowledgeable. Give that woman a raise!

title: Emplacement ideal, vue sur new york impressionnante
text:
Emplacement ideal, à Times square, à 2 pas du metro, proche Central Park, proche MoMA, century 21...
Possibilité de faire de nombreuses activités à pieds
Hotel propre, vue impressionnante (plus l'étage est élevé, plus la vue est incroyable)
Salle de sport, piscine
Employes sympathiques

title: Better options than this hotel
text:
You so much want to write good reviews, but every once in a while you are thankful for TripAdvisor for a forum to warn potential guests to stay away and stay somewhere else.

Let’s start with the positives as it is important to be balanced and fair.  I choose this hotel as the price and location was attractive. In addition, I am a spire elite level member at IHG.
Check in was relatively quick, but I can imagine with a large hotel and just three agents, I could see a long line.  I mentioned to the check in agent, there is a special sign for elite IHG members, but no one manning the location.  That’s a shame, and hopefully against corporate policy.  The check in agent was a pleasure.

The negatives 

I noticed the bed sheets were stained.  I know, ugh. Few things are more troubling.  I spoke to Heather who apologized and was sending a house keeping supervisor immediately.  After waiting 20 minutes, I had to go to a meeting.  I called again and spoke to Patrick who apologized and said a MOD would call that evening, and we set a specific time.  NO CALL.

That evening, we used our free drink coupons for wine and snacks.  When we asked where the snack was, which was described on the coupon as nuts..., the waiter said we could go to the front desk for a package of pretzel.  Yes, we were in the lounge with waiter service but we should get up to get a package of pretzel.  Kind of shows you what service to expect at this hotel.

While problems may occur, it’s how a property responds to these issues.  This hotel just doesn’t seem to care.  So far, two managers failed to respond.  It gets worse.  This hotel texts you if you are elite.  I texted FIA to let her know no one ever responded and she said a manager would get back to me.  AGAIN, three hours later, no response.

I call AGAIN at 11am and John Acosta says the hotel failed, and he can offer a free breakfast.   I mentioned to John, that this was an unusual offer since breakfast closes at 1030 am.  Yea, wow.  He said it would take 3-4 hours for a manager to call me.  That’s the level of service to expect.

Please see the photo attached.  While this hotel seems to be recently renovated, you can expect stains on the bathroom vanity.

If only this hotel seem to care about their guests especially elite members, you could hope your problems could be addressed.  As the repeated service lapses , unwillingness of managers to respond and frankly unhygienic housekeeping issues, I would find other places to stay.

title: Great hotel in superb location
text:
Everything about this hotel is excellent  - the location, the staff, the facilities. From arrival to check out we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
We had two Times Square view rooms which although a little more expensive are well worth it for the fantastic view.
The hub of the city is right on your doorstep here and the buzz in Time Square is amazing. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and the food  is really good
Big thanks to Victoria on reception who looked after us so well on our arrival.

Couple of minor things which made me rate this as very good instead of excellent
- As we are a family we had requested adjoining rooms more than six months in advance of travelling. When we got there we were located on 30th and 42nd floor which was disappointing and could not be changed
- At check out times the lifts become very busy - more than a ten minute wait
- When checking out I noticed on our bill that we had been charged for breakfast for the six of us each day which came to almost $1000 despite breakfast being included in our package. When I queried this it was rectified straight away however this is the second time this has happened at this hotel and had I not paid attention to the bill it could have resulted in a significant overspend

That said I would thoroughly recommend this hotel

title: Wedding anniversary celebrations
text:
Fantastic customer service on check-in. We were offered a room upgrade to a Times Square view. An hour later a bottle of Prosecco and a fruit platter arrived with compliments from Rosa. 
These thoughtful extras started our family trip in the best possible way! Thank you Crowne Plaza.

title: Fantastic Service
text: Good rooms, good location.  The staff were super friendly and made the stay a real pleasure - Omelia G on the front desk definitely gave a 5 star service and was very helpful in ensuring I had everything I needed during my stay.

title: Great location and great staff
text: My sister and I stayed here for 3 nights.  We were upgraded to a corner room with a view on the 46th floor.  The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom has double sinks( each in their own counter).  Plenty of room for the both of us.  The location was within easy walking to see several sights.  And if you needed a taxi, they would get one for you on the ground floor.  The breakfast was delicious with plenty to choose from in the buffet.  Will definitely stay here again if we go back to NYC again.

title: DISAPOINTED
text: We Stayed At This Hotel Room 3506.From 24TH 0ctober 2019 Untill 27TH October 2019..It Was Disgusting.Huge Stain On Mattress.  Lamp had Dirty Stains On,lamp was also Broken..Dirty  Taps On Sink In.  Bathroom ,Wallpaper Falling Off Wall in Bathroom,Hairs And  Dirt In Most areas of the room,Shower Only Trickling water.We Complained Numerous times but we were ignored.. we were  Offered Just A Free Breakfast Which  Was Disgusting.We Eventually Got Another Room  3109 Which Looked Onto Times  Square..If You Accept Unacceptable Dirty Rooms not worth the money They Would Just Leave You In It...Don't Accept Anything Less.The Lobby Is Nice But The Rooms are not As Nice As They Look..Dont Be  Fooled...

title: Prima locatie
text:
Voor ons als stel en als gezin een hotel waar we al 11 jaar graag naar terug keren. 
Niet vanwege de luxe kamers, of het geweldige ontbijtbuffet, maar puur vanwege de ligging. Centraal gelegen, aan Broadway en dicht bij Times Square.

title: Midweek visit
text: Stayed in a corner room - not sure how we snagged that but was nice.  Great view of Times Square.  Received some coupons for breakfast buffet.  Was good but service was great - Tofael was our server and a great source of local information.

title: Tout ce que nous voulions
text:
Un hotel situé en plein coeur de New York, sur Times Square, c'est exactement ce que nous voulions. Les chambres sont honorables. Nous avions demandé des chambres dans les hauts étages. Malheureusement il n'y en avait pas à notre arrivée mais nous avons été changés le lendemain. Dans les étages plus bas, les chambres sont communicantes et donc bruyantes mais plus haut (nous étions au 36ème) c'est très calme. Un hôtel sobre et efficace. Évitez les petits déjeuners sur place et privilégiez les épiceries du coin pour faire le plein de viennoiseries, café et fruits.
En bref, juste ce que nous voulions

title: The check in was very fast
text: We appreciate very much the hospitality Politeness of the stuff at the front desk especially Evelyn her smile always very helpful genuine efficient and always ready to help and also, we want to mention Rhoda’s help

title: Ubicación Nada Mas.
text:
Escogimos este hotel para una noche y estar en pleno Time Square pero sindicas por lo que pagamos no creo que lo recomiende y que tampoco regresemos a este Hotel.

Habitación piso superior y con Vista Time Square eso es un engaño una esquina del hotel con vistas limitadas, primero me ofrecieron en la planta 16 y es la planta mas baja después de la 15 y me negué y solicite piso mas alto pues solo conseguimos planta 22 y la habitación 2202 con vistas limitadas a lo que pagamos y vistas a la parte trasera del hotel.

La llegada a este hotel es caótica la recepción es un caos solo 4 personas para hacer el Check-in largas colas y después de llegar del aeropuerto te encuentras con esto pues nada grato, el personal nada de simpatía en ningún momento y fue una gran desilusión haber escogido este hotel y con un precio de 380$ la noche con desayuno.

La habitación esta muy vieja muebles rotos y obsoletos, moquetas feas y algo sucias, el polvo reina en todas partes, lo positivo la cama lo demás no merece la pena pagar nada en este hotel.

Desayuno en la planta del Lobby bien surtido poco pero bueno el servicio como si no hubiera nadie.

El check-out hicimos el express pues en la recepción a las 11 de la mañana es la hora de dejar la habitación con esas las colas eran impresionantes, dejamos el equipaje en consigna hasta coger el vuelo por la noche.

Conclusión es pagar o tirar el dinero en este Hotel sin dudas no merece la pena tirar el dinero con la cantidad de hoteles que hay, en este me sentí engañado y estafado por la habitación pues no era lo que yo había pagado, pero en este hotel que llenan todos los dias no sirve de nada quejarse lo mejor es que la gente sepa donde se meten y lo que pagan.

Nunca Mas Crowne Plaza.

title: Great service!
text: Victoria checked us in and Brunilda helped get us into our room early after a red eye flight. The hotel service could not have been better! Location was great and we had a great view of Times Square. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Excelente ubicación y servicio
text:
· La ubicación, la comodidad de las camas, el desayuno, la predisposición del personal excepcionales, especialmente de Ana la maitre del desayuno.

 · Es un hotel de algunos años que necesitaria alguna modernización en su mobiliario pero en general esta muy bien. la ubicación excepcional, en el centro de todo. Con todas las lineas de metro a mano.

title: Don’t stay there
text: I stay in Times Square often and mostly at Marriot Marquis. I chose to change up and it was a horrible mistake. Shower handle broke, most plugs in room didn’t work , AC didn’t work. I called down one evening and asked them to send someone up to check AC. Came back 4 hours later and still not working. My grandson then realized they had opened the window. They left no note or message. I called front desk and the person answering the phone said she would get with night manager on duty and call me right back. No call or follow up. Went down the next morning and spoke to the guy in charge of front desk and when I told him the situation he just looked at me like I had a horn growing out of my head. He said “I’m sorry, can I buy you breakfast “. He then told me that the AC’s weren’t working but the hallway was nice and cold. Next morning left at 5am and had no hot water. I travel a lot and I would say this is more of a 2 star hotel and not worth the money. Seems to be poorly managed all around.

title: Great location and staff very friendly
text: We stayed here for a few nights to catch a broadway musical, great staff, clean rooms, close to several restaurants, shops and theaters. Recommend this hotel. Beds were comfortable. Close to the subway, like half a block and you can go anywhere. GREAT location.

title: Customer service
text: We Had an enjoyable experience with all the staff at the Crowne Plaza. Which I totally did not expect for me Times Square New York hotel. Breakfast was delicious with great views of the streets below. having never been to New York Waze research many hotels. We will stay here again.

title: Great location - service not so great
text:
We checked in as part of a group booking. We arrived at the hotel on Friday evening and it was chaotic. There were plenty of reception staff but only two dealing with our group. We were all blocking the reception up with our luggage and I am sure there could have been a better process. 
My room was noisy. Sirens blaring and lights flashing and I had two poor nights sleep. The first night we asked for some tea and it took us over 25 minutes to get it. My coffee machine in the room was broken. I reported it but it never got fixed. The hairdryer didn’t work though they were quick to bring me a replacement. The shower was great the bed pretty comfortable but not been able to make a drink in the middle of a sleepless night is a disappointment to me. The hotel is in a great location it just needed to raise its game on handling group bookings and seeing to the finer details. One member of staff told us we couldn’t take a drink to our rooms!

title: Très bon hôtel sur New York !
text:
Rapport qualité prix très bien ! 
Vue incroyable depuis les chambres, emplacement central dans New York ! 
Petit déjeuner excellent ! 
Personnel au top et accueillant ! 
Piscine et salle de musculation incroyable ! La salle fait au point 500m2 minimum

title: Disappointed, repeatedly
text: I'm sorry to have to report this was a disappointing hotel. The location is great. Heart of Times Square, close to so much--as other reviewers have said. BUT 1. no hot tub 2. toilet didn't work and wasn't fixed after cleaning 3 no room fridge (unless you want to pay $50) 4. no outlets for USBs anywhere in the room and last but not least, at 1:30 am my room was SO hot I had to get up and call the front desk. I was told that the a/c was off in the building and I'd have to open a window (on the 43rd floor) to cool things off. I did not sleep well at all that night. Front desk staff for check in was all right, but in general the staff was aloof and not very friendly. Unimpressive, I'd shop around and try someplace that has a few more amenities.

title: Great hotel, some great staff, Shane about some of the ‘front of house’ staff.
text: This hotel is a fantastic location and good rooms. I stayed last year hence why I chose it this time. However, some of the ‘front of house’ staff need re training on their approach and customer service as they can’t deal with a pressured environment therefore snap and show incompetencies. In particular, their ‘director,’ Grant Faber, is a bully who shows zero empathy or understanding for his guests. Due to his ‘power,’ he made our check in very uncomfortable and made us feel very unwelcome. There were 3 separate hidden charges that we have taken up with our travel agent but he took great pleasure in making us pay. There are other ridiculous comments that him and his co staff made but I have no interest in writing it on here as I have made an official complaint therefore IHG can deal with them. If you check in with this hotel, I hope you’re not unlucky enough to have him. If you get someone else, then your stay might be pleasant. On a separate note, the breakfast staff were great!

title: Good Food, Good Drinks, Good Location
text: On the 8th floor, there’s a beautiful lounge overlooking Times Square that’s right in the middle of the theater district. With its expansive seating and superior location, It’s a great place to meet family and friends before and/or after a play. Even though they were busy, the staff was friendly and helpful. Food and drinks were served in a timely manner.

title: NYC
text: Right in the heart of Times Square close to restaurants and shopping.Rooms are clean and large views are great not overpriced for NYC. Great bar ok dinning.Would recommend to anyone. Friendly staff good parking.

title: Five star service
text:
Excellent service throughout the visit....from check-in, extra water, directions, recommendations, etc. 
Onelia G was very helpful and friendly at check-in.  Thanks!
Room very comfortable and clean.  
We will definitely stay here on future visits!

title: Weekend break
text:
Booked this on ihg app.
Positives. Location, room size, breakfast vouchers and dining credit as part of IHG rewards programme. Good breakfast. City views from 41st floor.
Areas for improvement.  Unfortunately there was a considerable amount of dust on all surfaces which was really surprising.  4 miniature bottles of toiletries for 3 guests was not enough to meet the requirements.

Staff at check in and breakfast were helpful and friendly. Concierge arranged airport transfer. This is a good hotel in a central location. I was just a bit surprised with the dust in room. It did not impact my stay as we only slept in the room. I would return purely for  location, breakfast and room size.

title: Ideal location for me
text: When I go to NY I go to the theater every evening. My favorite show is Chicago, which plays at the Ambassador's, right across the street... this is a huge hotel, quite impersonal. I normally prefer smaller, boutique hotels. Two subway stations nearby (on 49th and 50th Street). I was assigned a big corner room on the 42nd floor. With views of the Hudson and the Pencil Building. It was very quiet. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was quite small. They do not provide Q-tips or umbrellas. The coffee in the room is bad. The milk is the powder kind. No complimentary water unless you ask for some. The whole building needs a refresh. Everything looks tired and used.

title: Excellent location, great hotel
text: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 5 nights and loved it. The hotel is on Broadway, near Times Square and the room was very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the maids were excellent. Our room was on the 39th floor with double aspect views - fantastic. The breakfast was excellent - so much choice - and the staff were great. Thank you to all the staff for a great experience - highly recommended.

title: Terrific Check-in Help
text: I wanted to compliment Omelia G, who provided expert help with a gracious spirit.  She is a real credit to your company!  She simplified what could have been a complicated situation and kept me closely apprised throughout.  GREAT customer service!

title: 3 Nights in the heart of Times Square
text: Spent 3 nights in NYC starting with our anniversary night and a couple more exploring NYC and the broadway shows, with a room in Crowne Plaza as the base.  The main access is blocked due to ongoing repairs but the signposting is inadequate leading us to drag the luggage around looking for the entrance.The room was quite nice, the location is excellent. Breakfast spread is okay but the service can be improved. Long queues to be seated, lukewarm coffee and harried waiters. Check-in and check out are quite smooth. Was charged about 40 Dollars per night extra for 'service charges'  (I had fully paid upon booking by Hotels.com) which was a bit of a surprise (am sure the fine print mentions this somewhere) since I have not encountered this before. The food in the bar was tasty but the service is slow. Price is isn't exorbitant by NY standards. The best thing about the place is the location - all theaters are a short walk away. Getting cabs is quite easy as  many are parked next to the hotel. Overall, an enjoyable stay, with minor complaints!

title: Le mille luci di Times Square
text:
Perfetta location se si visita New York per pochi giorni . Soprattutto se é la prima volta . Immersi nelle luci e i rumori della città, vicino ai teatri per vedere un musical , tutti stupendi . L’hotel comodo anche se un po’ vecchiotto .La nostra camera al 40 piano camera d’angolo, un po’ più cara ma scenografica .Il personale della reception estremamente gentile , una bella sorpresa . Onelia grazie ! Thank you for your kindness and professionalism  !
Déborah

title: Summer trip
text:
My experience with this hotels location, service and staff is that this is a true gem of NYC, great place to say the least. The staff was very friendly and Knowledgeable of the city attractions. The staff was PROACTIVE!! Worth every dollar in tip and cost!. Hats off to the staff and GM.
I would also like to state (it is surprisingly kids friendly) and quiet.
All that downtown, time sq.. it should cost more for the staffs efforts.
Regards
One happy customer (non employee)

title: My FAVOURITE NYC Hotel!!
text:
I have stayed at The Plaza, The Waldorf and Four Seasons and by far Crowne Plaza Times Square is my favourite!!! I have now lost count of the number of times we have stayed here. My requested preference is always the corner room, with glass walls on the right angle looking down on Times Square and looking at the Hudson from bed!!!! I believe these are the “02” rooms.
I was last there in August’19 and there is major work being done on the lobby so access is temporarily from the driveway, but you still cannot beat this hotel for location, comfort, service and safety.

title: Really bad service
text:
Their luggage transfer service to the room is very bad 
I got my luggage in just 2 hours after requesting many times
Imagine the harassment when you have travelled 24 hours and you reach the hotel fully tired

title: Excelente
text:
2ª vez q ficamos no Crowne nesta época 
Absolutamente perfeito 
Desde a recepção a saída 
Sem contar na praticidade da localização, lojas, metro, opções de alimentação
No centro da Times Square
Vale muito a pena preço preço

title: Returning to Our Favorite Hotel
text: We returned to the Crowne Plaza - Times Square Manhattan to celebrate our anniversary and to see Broadway shows and visit museums. The location of the hotel enables us to walk to most of the places we want to visit. We have stayed at this hotel for many years and the staff is absolutely fantastic!  From Juliet Chang, the assistant front office director, to Chef Willis and the managing director, Mark Sanders, we are treated as family. The accommodations were excellent, our room was spotless and the excellent service continued in their dining facilities. We look forward to our return to “our home away from home!”

title: Amazing!!!
text: We casually mentioned that it was my birthday when we were checking in to our room, and when we got back from an outing they left us a sweet note and a piece of cake!!! Everyone here is so kind and sweet! I would definitely stay here again. :)

title: Great trip with a perfect location
text: Our second stay at the hotel. We loved it last time and it didn’t let us down again this time either. Nice size room with no noise from other rooms. Bathroom decent with a proper hairdryer. Reception staff friendly and helpful. Went over and above expectations when our young daughter was ill one night telling us not to hesitate if we needed any medical assistance- luckily we didn’t. Great location with supermarkets, bars and restaurant row just a couple of blocks away. I’m sure we will visit again- hopefully sooner rather than later.

title: Very Good Stay
text:
This is a centrally-located large hotel in Times Square and Midtown. Public transportation is readily accessible, since Times Square/42nd Street has the most subway lines running through it in the entire city.

The IHG Crowne Plaza brand offers fairly similar accommodations across the brand. But, being in New York City, this means that something like a refrigerator costs extra. In this case, $30/visit. I wasn't happy about that, especially since my wife is a Platinum Elite Member. Also, where other Crowne Plazas have Keurig coffee makers with good coffees, this one had one of those basic coffee makers with basic coffees.

I am guessing that all of this is to channel you downstairs to their coffee bar, which is very good. We were given coupons to use at the coffee bar, which did help, and was appreciated. But, you do have to watch the hours, which are pretty short on the weekend.

The room is good, and is similar to what you get at other Crowne Plazas. We requested and got a room further away from the elevator, which was a good idea, and kept things quiet. We paid and got the view onto Times Square. You are in the upper half of Times Square, which means that you are looking right to see the square. The view is good, and you do have to walk behind the couch to get to the window to see it.

Overall, a good visit, and will consider returning.

title: Anniversary and birthday trip
text:
We stopped at the Crowne Plaza Time Square in New York for mine and my wifes 40th birthday  and 5th anniversary.  We arrived and was welcomed by a lovely lady on reception that explained all details and what we could use.
We were on the 20th floor with a view of time square, it was really nice.
The room was spacious and relevant for what we needed, it was tidy clean and the beds were very comfortable. 
Our room was cleaned every day by a lovely lady who was polite and helpful.
The reception staff were very helpful when I had to ring the shuttle service for the return trip to the airport.
I would recomend this hotel to anyone that wants to be close to time square.

title: Best location and staff!!!
text:
I stayed there two nights on business. The bar staff, porters, and bellmen were all amazing! The location is amazing, I wanted to catch a show and it (Book of Mormon) was right around the corner, so I mixed a little #bleisure in!

Best part (following worst part) was my experience with Al and Rudy from security who arranged to have the brand new jacket I forgot in my room shipped back to me! The fact that it was turned in speaks highly of this hotel as it was brand new and expensive, and the superior service Al and Rudy gave to arrange its return was truly appreciated!

title: Good Hotel, Great Location for Times Square
text:
Having stayed in New York a few times, once at Greenwich Village and around the corner from the Empire State, it would be interesting staying in the heart of Times Square. To be fair, the location of the hotel is right in the middle of Times Square, and to be fair, I prefer the quieter Greenwich Village. Times Square at all times is hetic, but if you like that, you will love this hotel.
Check in was easy and straight forward, but the Resort Tax at 40 USD per night is steep - and this is starting to anger many travellers to the US - it's ridiculous. 
The room itself was nice and big, with a comfy king sized bed with a view to the side of Times Square.
There was coffee making facilities which was refreshed every day, as well as large LCD TV.
In addition there was a safe which looked like something from the 1970s - and at a guess, another extra you had to pay for. 
The bathroom was spacious and the shower was more than adequate - there was no bath which may put people off. 
We had a drink in the bar, and was no more expensive than some of the establishments we had a drink at in Manhattan. 
Would I stay here again? No. And that's not the hotel that's at fault, as there are better places in Manhattan to stay.

title: Disappointing room but great location for NYC
text: Recent visit to NYC with my family. We stayed in a Times Square view room which was one or two up from the basic room. It was a room with 2 double beds and overall it was far too small for 4 people, even if 2 were young kids. There was one small cupboard with about 8 hangers in it and four small draws in another cabinet. We had to live out of suitcases for the week as we simply couldn’t unpack. Reception said that all rooms were the same so we couldn’t move. The rooms were also tired, shower wasn’t great and an odd smell in the room too. It was a great location just overlooking Times Square but the hotel room was disappointing. Good restaurant downstairs. I won’t be going back.

title: Central for everything
text: Great staff team room comfy but needed a little TLC. Disappointing supply of coffee in the room. Food and drinks in hotel expensive and menu  was very restricted. Hotel is in a great location for absolutely everything.

title: Great location, okay otherwise.
text:
Stayed here with my family for a weekend in the city.  Location is very convenient to the theater district and parking is available.  It was great to be right in Times square and the room had a great view of it.  The staff was very courteous and responded to a couple of requests (extra coffee, towels) in a very timely manner.

The room itself was a decent size, but was showing some wear and tear.  The glass top of the bureau/storage/television stand was completely disconnected from the bureau itself and sliding around, the drawers did not align well, and there were a lot of scratches and dents in the furnishing in general.  The sink faucet leaked, and the faucet in the bathtub was twisted to the side.

Overall, this is not a hotel I would go back to.  It was somewhat moderately priced for the location, but other options nearby are in better shape at this price point in the midtown/Times square area.

title: Girls Trip
text: This hotel is in the heart of everything. You can literally walk to anything and everything. The hotel is very well kept, clean and current. There is so much to see and do in this city. Shopping, Broadway shows, bakeries on every corner, Starbucks on every corner. This is definitely one hotel we would return to.

title: Above the city
text: Our room was right over Time Square. Wonderful view. An indoor pool, which was nice, since you usually have to travel out to a club to use their pool. We were able to watch GMA and many performances from our room. When booking, ask to be near the top.

title: Amazing hotel right in the heart of Time Square
text: My Partner and I went last week.  Some of the other hotels we went in seemed "too big" and impersonal and although this hotel was obviously very big, it had a cosy, friendly feel about it that just made me feel at home. One of the bar staff was a bit moody (the one covering the middle part of the bar) but the bar staff member near the escalators was absolutely perfect.  The breakfasts were amazing, the rooms were spotless and the whole experience was fantastic!! Thank you so much! I hope one day to return.

title: Hotel pessimo non conforme alla categoria assegnata
text: venduto come buona struttura ci ritroviamo con una camera scadente, polverosa, bagno datato con lavandino rotto. Non frigobar in camera acqua dai distributori automatici. Hotel non conforme con la classe assegnata e personale poco gentile. Forse andremo via prima del previsto.

title: New York break
text: Stayed here for the week, still here, very good clean room on the 24 th floor ( probably helps being a platinum member) cleaned every day, good cafe on site and good breakfast buffet, great views of Times Square. Very central and find it easy to get everywhere. Definitely be back again.

title: Merci à Ana!
text: Hôtel situé sur Times Square avec une vue incroyable ! Merci au personnel du petit déjeuner surtout à Ana qui est une personne incroyable ! Vous serez bien accueilli et servi. N'hésitez pas à monter au 46eme pour la vue 😉

title: Great Hotel!
text: This hotel is a great place to stay because of its location, right in Times Square. You can walk right out the hotel straight into Times Square. You’re only 5/10 minute walk away from the Rockefeller Centre & Radio City, short distance to 5th Avenue. All the tour buses pick up in Times Square too so not far to walk if you’re getting on and off one. We were on the 37th floor with an amazing view of the city. The hotel staff were really nice and friendly! They were all super helpful and gave us great recommendations, helped with cabs etc! Room was a great size and relatively clean. My only issue was that the bathroom wasn’t as clean as I’d have liked it to be. It was lovely coming back in at the end of the day to freshly made beds, fresh towels! At one point our key cards stopped working because we had gone through security at the Empire State Building but the staff were super quick and helpful at getting us new ones!

title: Why consider any other property?
text: Fantastic experience from arrival to departure. Check in was a breeze and the front desk staff was very pleasant and proficient in their roles. We felt like valued customers and the environment was a welcome change to most NYC hotels. They took the time to ensure we were aware of the many amenities provided as well as gave advice on some local must experience places. All in a great weekend away with a property that cares and understands about customer satisfaction. See you next time.

title: Great hotel
text:
Stayed here for a family trip at the beginning of April. (Apologies about the delay in review)

The hotel offers a fantastic location right in the hustle and bustle of Time Square, but set just enough back that it’s not too crazy as soon as your out the door.

A bit of a queue to check in but nothing too crazy, maybe a 5 min wait.

We were on the 33rd floor (I think - top floor anyhow) and had a Time Square view.

The view was great, especially as we had one of the corner rooms which gave us a view thro the buildings of the Empire State Building.

The rooms were clean and although we could hear the occasional siren from the street this wasn’t anywhere near loud enough to effect our day or our nights sleep.

Plenty of space in the room, important when you have 2 little ones with you.

The bar area had a good vibe, fair price for the location and the food in the bar was good.

A great experience and this is why I have gone with 5 stars. The hotel was good (4 stars) and when you add the location it can only ever be 5 stars. A fantastic place to stay if you want to be in amongst it and not too far from all the sights.

title: Super Hôtel super restaurant
text: Super hôtel. Les équipes sont agréables et soucieuses d’offrir un service de qualité. L’équipe de restauration est particulièrement sympathique notamment Tofael et Ana qui se sont bien occupés de nous durant notre séjour.

title: Room not ready and terrible staff on reception
text: Mediocre hotel saved by good location.  Don’t expect help with your bags.  Room not ready for several hours post check in and argument with reception as to whether we could have the key (or come down, join always long queue when they could be bothered to get in ready).  They never did let us know when they had cleaned it despite chasing and no apologies.  Breakfast poor, shower hot and cold but bed was comfortable and hotel generally quiet.  Better options nearby I suspect.  Not the usual US customer service we have received in the past in other locations.

title: Tökéletes fekvés, átlagos hotel
text:
A Hotel a Brodwayn, közvetlenül a Times Squarenél van. Az elhelyezkedése ennek megfelelően tökéletes. A főbejáratot renoválták, így a szállodát csak valamelyik mellékutcából, a parkolóház lejárata felől lehetett megközelíteni. A személyzet alapvetően segítőkészséges volt. A szoba fekvése és a kialakítása valóban kiváló volt.
Azonban a szoba berendezései, felszereltsége, a színvonala egy átlagos európai 3 csillagos szálloda színvonalát is csak éppen hogy elérik. Maga a Hotel belső része is elég rideg volt, egy felújítás , kellemesebb dizájn mindenképpen sokat javítana a vendégek hangulatán.
Összességében, ha valaki ragaszkodik a tökéletes fekvéshez és kilátáshoz, akkor némi kompromisszum fejében azért megfelelő választás lehet.

title: Great place, stellar staff and good old-fashioned common sense - yey!
text:
My family had 2 rooms for 4 nights at the Crowne Plaza and there wasn't a time when we were left wanting - the hotel room was the perfect background to a busy weekend. It had what we needed and expected, when we needed it, but otherwise let us focus on each other and our events. 
The cherry on top of this hotel sundae was placed once we were back home and realized some clothes had been left in the room. I called the central number that night and got to a live person after only 1 menu prompt and about 20 seconds of holding - that alone seemed like a miracle!  I was then transferred to the Security staff who promptly looked up housekeeping notes in their system and found record of the items left in our room. SUCH A RELIEF when simple systems work the way that they should.
My information was taken, I was told what to expect and from whom (Randy or Al would follow-up with me via email the following day, from there we'd complete the paperwork needed to return the clothes). 
Sure enough, the follow-up happened as promised and my clothes were sent via FedEx. Any delays were my fault for not responding as quickly as Al and Randy did.  What a great experience from clean, simple, common sense - easily worth the price of the room.  Thanks again guys! 
Heidi

title: Best hotel location
text:
This is the second time my friends and I have stayed at the Crowne Plaza and loved it.
The location is perfect for walking to Broadway shows (6 minutes) to Times Square (one block away). The hotel is beautiful and the staff (especially the front desk clerk Victoria whom we had the pleasure of being check in both times) are stellar.I would highly recommend it to anyone.

title: Donald
text:
Thanks to Donald at the front desk I had such a great stay! I recommend this hotel to everyone and the staff is amazing! 
It’s right in the city, walking distance to anything you could possibly need. 
I would stay here every time I visit New York! 

Thank you Donald!

title: Great hotel with the view
text: We originally booked at Radisoon next to Rockefeller plaza, but decided to checked out after only one night and $400 wasted. It was not to the standard we expected and too small to fit 2 people. I was able to book the room in CrownPlaza last minute and it was great without the doubt. For $200 (plus city fee), we got huge room with view, but quite enough to sleep through the night. I guess the trick is to ask for high floor. In any case, if you member of IHG you get the breakfast for $16 all you can eat and 2 vouchers for free drinks. Hotel has swimming pool and several bar/restaurants.  I would highly recommend this hotel due to the location, room space and great service.

title: Suprised and impressed with the upgraded service
text: I've stayed at this property numerous times over the years and the service started out great in 2014 and slowly deteriorated until my recent visit.  I was in town for a long weekend with my sister and decided to give this hotel a final try due to it's location.  After my initial confusion entering as they have lost their first floor entry on Broadway, I was pleasantly surprised to find a short wait time to check in.  I am allergic to down and usually have a hard time finding a hotel that will remove the down before I arrive.  My room was down free and ready upon my arrival!  The staff texted me almost immediately upon check in and continued to monitor my stay throughout the weekend.  I relied upon that text connection for a few requests and was pleasantly surprised and delighted at how easy they made my stay.   I hope they continue with their new and improved customer service as I will definitely be back!!

title: Emplacement de rêve. Pour le reste : Il est temps de songer à rénover cet hôtel !
text: Notre chambre était la 3318, seule la vue est top ! La chambre est spacieuse, mais pour le reste : pas de frigidaire, le mélangeur est mort (la douche à prendre soit glacée soit brûlante), et tout est réduit au minimum. Heureusement que nous avons profité d'une braderie de ce dimanche soir, sinon la même chambre aurait coûté le double voire le triple, c'est juste pas possible !!!! La localisation de l'hôtel est le seul point fort de cet établissement. Nous avons dîné d'une soupe et d'un burger dans le restaurant de l'hôtel, c'est très moyen.

title: Wonderful experience
text: We had originally booked a room at The EconoLodge, Times Square. Within 20 minutes of check in I knew I could not stay there, it was beyond terrible. I checked TripAdvisor and contacted Crowne Plaza. Spoke with Wanda in customer service. I was so distraught, we had planned this trip for a year and traveled for many hours. I was concerned that we had no hotel in New York. What a miracle worker! She managed to get us a spectacular room for less than the original room we had at EconoLodge. Everyone at Crowne Plaza was great and Wanda really turned our trip around. I will never stay anywhere else. Kudos!

title: 3rd stay at the Crowne Plaza Times Square
text:
After my last visit that Isis Arruda helped arrange for me I decided to contact her again as we wanted to return as we were celebrating our 23rd Anniversary. 
Isis made sure we had a great room and we did. We was on the top floor looking out to the Hudson River. 
Our stay was perfect in every way. 
WiFi is good too! 
Even though we absolutely love this hotel we was out exploring so much that we were hardly in the room. 
We used our vouchers at the bar and it was nice to see that the bar staff hadn’t changed from our last visit in 2015! Had a good chat with them and you’ll get lots of tips from them too.  
The hotel was under some construction work I think as the front of the hotel was closed off, not sure if that’s a permanent thing or not?!?
As much as the hotel is lovely and in the best location I’m wondering if they are going to be updating the rooms any time soon? They’ve not changed in the last 9 years I’ve stayed there. 
Apart from that, I really can’t fault this hotel. The staff are all lovely and accommodating, the facilities are fantastic and you won’t get a better location than this. 
Subways are just minutes away, theatres on the doorstep and some fantastic places to eat too!! 
If you pick this hotel you really won’t be disappointed!! 

Massive thank you to Isis and everyone at the Crowne Plaza Times Square 

Gemma & Michael Bailey xx

title: Worth the price 100%
text:
We flew in from Florida and booked at Hotel Pensilvania for $289/night, WHAT A DUMP! 
We got our money back and just decided to treat ourselves to the Crowne Plaza, which ended up to be double but...WORTH THE MONEY. 
We went to the hotel to check availability, found a room, booked it over my iphone and in less than 20 mins, I was in my beautifulllllll hotel room. I was serviced by this PRINCESS named Victoria at the front desk. I accidently put 2 people instead of 3 on my reservation, but she accommodated all of our extra needs and explained each voucher and benefits. She was super helpful and lovely. Checking in was such a positive experience. Hotel room is sparkly clean, the view is amazing and the beds are clean and fluffy. The location is AMAZING as well.
