We will book here for every visit to NYC.  We'll make sure to plan in advance next time to get better rates, but we gladly paid double, so worth it. There are actually few hotels in NYC that are decent, this one is probably the most impressive!

title: Birthday visit
text: Great hotel from the brilliant staff at check in to the fab housekeeping staff nothing is to much trouble rooms were a great size bed was lovely and comfy which is what you need after a long day walking to sites food was ok . Drinks in the bar were good not bad prices we will definitely come back

title: Good Hotel
text: Our flight was cancelled and Onelia at the Front Desk helped us to stay another night in the hotel. All in all very nice people and a good tasting breakfast and dinner there. The hotel has a good location and you can get to all your favourite sights in just a few minutes.

title: 46th floor
text: My husband and I visited NYC for dinner and a show for our Anniversary.i selected the Crowne Plaza in Times Square because it was close to the show and restaurant.The stay was excellent! Becaus it was our Anniversary and we are IHG honors members we got a corner king room on the 46th floor! The view was incredible! The room was super clean and smelled clean.And it was a huge room on the top floor.We had the breakfast buffet both mornings we were there and the food was delicious and a nice variety.The staff was very nice. and accommodating we received vouchers of $20 each for drinks at the lounge both dates The hotel is in the perfect location in the middle of all the action of Times Square and we were 2 blocks from theater. Everything was excellent! The only thing that was missing was a mini fridge. We would definitely stay again!

title: Great hotel near all the sights
text: Great hotel. Very convenient for getting around. Rooms were clean and well equiped and breakfast was plentiful. It was very busy when we were there in Dec 18, but we had a fab time and the views from our room were spectacular.

title: Excellent place with great staff
text:
I’m not a stranger to NYC hotels, I come here almost every week but this is my first time in the Crown Plaza Times Square.
Everything here is great but I’m writing this review mainly for the check in process with Onelia G. She was great and she was able to accommodate all my requests quickly and with a great smile all the time. Best check in process in NYC I’ve ever seen.
Thank you Onelia!!

title: Heart Of Times Square
text:
Arrived at the hotel a little earlier then check in time and was greeted at reception by the IHG members check in, they had noted my request for early check in and were able to offer a room straight away, the check in agent was very helpful and gave all the information needed about the hotel.

The room had a view towards the hudson on a high floor and was a good size by New York standard, the decor of the rooms is a little more traditional and will probably need a freshen up soon to keep competitive. Room had a large tv, coffee maker and storage space enough for a long weekend trip. Bathroom had a shower above the tub. 

The hotel itself offers facilities you would expect from a full service hotel including a gym in partnership with the New York Sports Clubs (was huge) and use of the pool (hours are a little restricted if you are out sightseeing all day). The dining options of the coffee shop and bar both offered good service and quality a price expected  for a crowne plaza. 

All members off staff we encountered over out stay were helpful and friendly. 

Check out was very smooth and quick

title: Great Hotel for Familes and Theatre Lovers!
text:
Everything was lovely from start to finish for our stay here. It's not often you see photos from a hotel advertisement that actually match the room you booked. Our stay at Crowne Plaza was just that! Evelyn at the front desk could not have been more helpful, especially since we needed to add an extra day. Highly recommend room 3301 for the BEST CITY VIEWS! Overlooks Times Square with a wall of windows, but noise isn't too much of an issue. Comfortable beds and fresh linens daily that were top quality. Location can't be beat for theatre lovers like ourselves. There were no hidden fees like we've experienced at similar hotels down the street during checkout. Excellent stay all around. 

Five stars!

title: Best Value
text:
Nice rooms
great location
very good breakfast 
good bar and lounge
if you choose to stay in midtown around times square, no better choice than crown plaza. for 250$ per night, it's the best you will find. 2 times we tried other hotels, that didn't compare to this. Nice staff. hotel is normally fully booked so don't expect any special attention or upgrades.

title: Very dissatisfied
text:
Since we were only staying in NYC for one night and my sons are older, we decided to stay in Times Square.  We typically stay at the Marquis but it was very pricey for the date that I had in mind.   I called ahead to make sure we get a roll away and that you could have one in a room with double beds.

I was checked in by an unfriendly front desk employee who informed that I could only get a roll away in a room with a one bed.  I explained to her that a person from the hotel told me otherwise.  She was not apologetic and then proceeded to charge me for the roll away!  

We came in late and ordered room service - all of which must’ve been sitting under a lamp.  Typically, I would’ve chosen to eat out but we were exhausted.  The quality was poor.

Lastly, we valet parked our car for which they charge a premium - I expected the charge and have no complaint for the charge they quoted me.  That was fine.  Parking is for 24 hours.  (However, in my past experience hotels will let you stay a little over the exact 24 hour period- The  Marquis for example.  They charge less and they allow for some wiggle room about departure.)

When we were finished with our sight seeing, I called the number on the card for our car.  They instructed me to call when I was ready for the car.  The number was out of service.  I called repeatedly from my own phone and from my son’s.  Eventually, I went down to valet where they charged me another $30 for being late .  Thirty minutes - all of which was spent trying to contact them. I explained this to the cashier and he said too bad.  Pay for your car or we won’t get it.  

I’m sure the hotel will say the valet is separate from them. However, when you partner with another business you have the responsibility of ensuring that they provide good service on your behalf. 

Overall, I was unhappy with my stay and feel this hotel nickels and dimes you.  

Did I mention that the shampoo and conditioner was the smallest bottles that I’ve ever seen?

Crowne Plaza, do better.

title: Dated
text:
The location of this hotel is right in Times Square so great if you need to be in the thick of things. The rooms are very dated and in need of modernisation. Breakfast was lovely but quite expensive without vouchers. There is a $6 fee to receive a package which is not great to be honest. 

My husband had a small accident when we were there and the staff were amazing by organising a taxi to take us to the ER and advising which hospital to go to. They phoned the next day to check that all was ok.

The room was dusty and I think that the servicing of the room during the stay was the bear minimal to be honest. The bathroom had mould growing round the sealant

title: 5th time here!
text: This is our 5th time staying here, we visit the city every other year. We absolutely love it! The hotel is clean, great views, the staff is so nice! The breakfast buffet is great and has options for every one! Tofael, one of the servers, remembered us from 2 years ago. Welcomed us every morning with great conversation and recommendations if new places to visit! We can wait to be back!

title: It doesn't worth the money
text:
We booked via booking.com because the reviews were good and the pictures show nice rooms, not very luxurious but with normal furniture looking new.
And we paid an extra to have view on time square.
We got the room advertised but 10 years after the picture taken.
The carpet was extremely old and consumed,. All the wooden furnitures with the surfaces eavily damaged as well as the tub surface (this was really really bad for the money we payd over 350$ per night). The bathroom was very old too and the wardrobe was very very small.
The cleaning workers were good and the position is perfect if you want to fell the life in times square.
But definitely it doesn't worth the money we paid.

title: Great staff, excellent service, hotel needs a bit of renovation
text:
The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are clean.
It is starting to look a bit worn;the pool is particularly shabby.
That said, the staff make up for it.
Travis in particular in the breakfast restaurant was excellent. Really helpful going out of his way for me. 
The front of house staff and the bell captain were faultless. 
I’d definitely return.

title: Definitely would return
text:
The hotel is in a great central location. 
All the staff are fabulous, especially Oneila and Victoria at the front desk who helped out with a few things over the course of our stay.  
The view from the room onto times square was great, the room itself was big enough and overall clean, the only negative was the carpet had quite a few spillages and sticky marks on it. But overall a fabulous hotel and would definitely return.

title: Excelente
text:
Escolhi pelo TripAdvisor e não me arrependi!
Ótima localização de frente para m&m!
Não fica no prédio da Hershey’s como li em uma avaliação, isso me confundiu no primeiro dia.
Otimas instalações!
Box tem abertura no vidro para vc regular a temperatura da água do lado de fora!
Nunca tinha visto!
Staff competente check in e check out expressos.

title: First impression makes a lasting impression
text:
Onelia Green is an asset. Understanding going the extra mile for the client will produce revenue for the firm. Will definitely be returning. 

Looking forward to a follow up visit, recommending other clients as well. 
Thank you.

title: Great location
text: Great hotel, large comfortable rooms some with excellent views. Very good location with easy access to Times Square, Fifth Avenue and Rockefeller Centre. Restaurants and shops close by including Ellen’s Stardust Diner.

title: Pleased Guest
text: We have always enjoyed staying at the Crowne Plaza Hotel when visiting New York. However, this visit was especially lovely due to the superior service of Omelia, the desk clerk.  She helped us with some special requests and was friendly, professional and helpful.  Thank you, Omelia, for giving us a nice start to our trip.

title: Business trip to NYC
text: Very happy that the Crowne Plaza at Times Square was in policy for my business trip. Great location right next to Times Square. The room was comfortable; though the mattress was old and probably needs to be replaced. I loved that there was a NY Sports Club (NYSC) location on the 15th floor; worked out every morning and that really helped start my day with more energy.

title: Location is Everything in NYC!
text: My first time visiting New York and I’m so happy I picked this hotel. It was perfectly located to everything I wanted to do. The service was 5 star. The employees under the direction of Agathe are very professional and personable. They deliver that 5 Star experience that make you want to come back again and again. I know I could have stayed anywhere in the city but the value you receive at this hotel and the friendliness of the employees from the bellmen, the front desk, concierge, and servers/bartenders in the restaurant are what separates this hotels from their competitors.

title: Honeymoon
text: Imran was very helpful in checking my wife and me in for our honeymoon trip.  Helped us get into the perfect room so we can rest after long trip. We had an amazing view of Times square.  Appreciate his customer service.

title: More clarity would be nice
text: We had an over all nice stay, but if I were a first timer, I think there are a few things that could be clearer. There IS a valet parking service on site but the price isn't easily found while looking on the website. BOTH onsite restaurants have gluten-free options though the prices are higher than area restaurants. The highlight was an awesome bartender named Martin! He was helpful, pleasant and professional.

title: Absolutely Perfect
text: Absolutely perfect from check in n to check out! Victoria at the front desk was friendly and knowledgeable! Our room was larger than any room I have had in NYC, nicely decorated and our beds were extremely comfortable. Perfect location, walked to Macy’s, The Lion King and dinner! Our Girls’ Weekend couldn’t have been better!

title: Celebrating twins 18th birthday in NYC
text: Picked this hotel based on proximity to Hadestown and could not have been more pleased. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. Clean,  comfortable rooms and close to everything. If we return to NYC, we will be back. Thank you!

title: Wonderful hotel
text: The hotel was clean and located perfectly. This has been my favorite stay in NYC so far. The breakfast was amazing with so many options for meals. Tofael was an excellent server, very personable. He kept things clean and was always attentive. The concierge was quite helpful as well. What a great time already! I will definitely return to this hotel.

title: Omelia G is the best!
text: Omelia was extremely helpful and I will for sure come back here again because of her! She has made our stay in New York that much better. We will definitely come back to this hotel! Thank you Omelia!!!

title: Another great stay!
text:
I like to stay at this hotel when I’m in NYC as it’s central to everything and of course Times Sq! The IHG rewards offers guests amenities like vouchers for food and drinks and makes the stay a bit easier for a business traveler. 

The front desk experience is always nice and friendly which I appreciate after a day of travel and work.

I’d recommend getting the Breakfast with the room as they have a very good buffet with a lot of choices and fresh offerings.

I also like the bed and bedding, very comfortable and always spearmint clean baths rooms are stand outs!

Enjoy!

title: Una estafa! Me cobraron 6 dls por paquete!! No por envio!! Cuidado!!
text:
Realice un pedido por Amazon, y vino en diferentes paquetes. Y me cobraron 6 dólares por cada paquete. Pedí un cable usb que salió 3 dólares y me cobraron 6 en el hotel. Hable con el manager del hotel, explicándole que no lo decía en ningún lado en la reserva el cargo(sino no hubiese hecho el envio)y la falta de lógica de lo que estaba sucediendo, y de manera burlona me respondió que esa era la política del hotel y que ellos cobraban porque debían pagarle a los empleados. Le explique que deberían tener en cuenta el tamaño o peso del envio para realizar el cargo y ademas, DEBIAN COMUNICARLO DE FORMA CLARA AL HUESPED. Nuevamente, de manera burlona, me manifesto que el cargo iba a efectuarse de todos modos ,que debia quejarme con expedia, que era donde habia hecho la reserva. CUIDADO CON LOS CARGOS OCULTOS DE ESTE HOTEL. BAJAN LA TARIFA EN ALGUNOS SITIOS WEB Y DESPUES COBRAN CARGOS EXTRAS. LAMENTABLE.

I place an order through Amazon, and it came in different packages. And they charged me $ 6 for each package. I asked for a USB cable that came out 3 dollars and they charged me 6 at the hotel. I spoke with the hotel manager, explaining that It did not say the charge anywhere in the reservation  (if I had not made the shipment) and the lack of logic of what was happening, and mockingly replied that this was the policy from the hotel and that they charged because they had to pay the employees. I explained that you have to take into account the size or weight of the environment to carry out the load and also, YOU MUST COMMUNICATE IT CLEARLY TO THE GUEST. Again, mockingly, he told me that the charge was going to be made anyway, that I had to complain with expedia, which was where I had made the reservation. BE CAREFUL WITH THE HIDDEN CHARGES OF THIS. LOWER THE RATE IN SOME WEB SITES AND AFTER EXTRAS CHARGES CHARGES. REGRETTABLE.

title: Maggie of O’Fallon Illinois
text: I would like to commend the staff of Crowne Plaza Hotel for doing an amazing job to return a package which was left behind last April, 2019. I would like to especially thank the Director of Security Mr. Al Valdes for handling the package with great care and also Ms. Sylvia Geronemo for taking extra effort to contact me and find a return address for the package. For all your help I am most grateful. It is always nice to know that you are in good hands staying in a hotel in which good service is a priority and the care they put into their job. For that alone, I would not think twice staying and recommending your hotel to family and friends every time we visit New York. God bless you guys for the good that you do!

title: Hotel crown plaza time square
text:
The front desk worker, Victoria took care of us from the moment we came to the hotel, and was so kind, and professional, and started our vacation in the most marvelous way.
The hotel and Victoria in particular started our vacation on the most amazing way.
We wish that in every hotel we will visit we will meet workers like Victoria.

title: Great location
text: You cannot beat this location as I had a view of Times Square from my room on the 38th floor.  I thought the maid service was excellent and the breakfast buffet was alright. (Be sure and get some discount tickets at the front desk or breakfast is very expensive.)   I caught cabs right outside the hotel and got around the city just fine by taxi and by walking.  They offered to take me to the airport in their private car but a taxi cost much less.  I was also able to use their business center to print off my airline tickets.  I would stay here again when visiting NYC.

title: Good stay -  but the resort fee is BS.
text:
This is not the only hotel where I have encountered the resort fee -   did not make use of any of it.   A few days later I stayed at another IHG hotel, the Eventi,  which does not charge these stupid fees.   Just incorporate it into the rate and dispense with the foolishness.
     Having said that, otherwise my stay was fine, other than I prefer smaller and less gigantic hotels with over bustling lobbies and public areas.   My room was quite attractive, and I liked the chaise chair.   I was on the 42nd floor, the highest I have ever stayed in a hotel and enjoyed the views looking out over the Hudson.   The employees I encountered were friendly and welcoming.
      The current arrangement makes the main entrance hard to find.   It seems there is some construction going on, but I was expecting an entrance on Broadway, and had to hunt around for the entrance off the side street driveway.   Poor signage.

title: Waren jetzt das dritte Mal in diesem Hotel
text:
Aber leider waren wir diesesmal ganz und garnicht zufrieden.Wir hatten ursprünglich ein anderes Hotel gebucht.Aber Thomas Cook hat uns einen Strich durch die Rechnung gemacht.Deswegen haben wir ganz kurzfristig was altbekanntes gebucht.
Dieses Mal waren wir im 44.Stock,dem sogenannten Elite Floor.
Aber davon haben wir nichts gespürt.
Der Bettbezug hatte irgendwelche grauen Streifen,die von der Bügelmaschine kamen.Die Putzfrau hat es sofort gewechselt,aber auch das nächste hatte die gleichen Streifen.Also wurde nochmals neue aufgezogen.
In der Zwischenzeit haben wir einen Blick ins Bad geworfen und uns dann entschlossen,der Putzfrau nochmals die Chance auf eine gründliche Zimmerreinigung zu geben,welche diese dann auch sofort wahrgenommen hat.
Es kam aber kein Wort der Entschuldigung.
Generell war das Zimmer in einem desolaten Zustand.Nichtschließende Schranktüren,schrägstehende Tischbeine und ein sehr abgewohnter Zustand.
Hier wird es Zeit für eine Renovierung.
Einzig das Bett ist klasse.
Das Frühstück im Hotel war gut und reichlich.Nutella oder Erdnussbutter gibt es nur auf Nachfrage.
Wir haben abends an der Bar etwas gegessen und müssen sagen,dass es dort mit am besten war,was wir in New York gegessen haben.
Unseren nächsten New Yorkbesuch werden wir nicht mehr in diesem Hotel verbringen,da das Preis-Leistungsverhältnis ganz und garnicht mehr passt.

title: Excelente Ubicación
text: Me hospedé en este hotel durante 2 noches, su ubicación es excelente porque está cerca de todo, te permite disfrutar a pie Nueva York, sobre todo para personas que tienen pocos días para disfrutar la ciudad. La atención es muy buena por parte del personal. Logramos un muy buen precio por lo que se los recomiendo, no es moderno pero vale la pena hospedarse.

title: Crowne Plaza Times Square
text: Great location and we had a really nice room, good size for the location.  We had a late dinner and the meal was excellent and affortable.  Also the bar lounge was really nice and the drinks were reasonable priced.

title: Muy bien ubicado
text:
Excelente ubicación, habitaciones amplias y bonitas con linda decoración 
Lastima que el servicio de limpieza no fue muy bueno. No reponen el papel tissue y no dejan las toallas suficientes para todos los huéspedes

title: New York in autumn
text: Came with friends as a sidetrip after a week-long medical convention in Nashville. My 5th time in NYC but my first time to stay in Crowne. The entrance at Broadway is getting fixed so take the 48th or 49th St to get to the main entrance.  The lobby is one floor up, check in was fast with the friendly front desk clerk. Our room is on the 42nd fl overlooking Barclays bldg and Broadway Ave. We booked a room for 3 with 2 queen beds. Cost is roughly 400usd per head except resort fee everyday which amounted to 50usd per head for a 4 nights. Inside the room, there is a small wardrobe cabinet where you can roll 2 med size suitcases. It has an ironing board and iron inside. There is a coffee maker, a safety deposit box, free wifi, drawers for clothes, hair dryer, toiletries, bath tub, but NO mini ref. For the complimentary water bottles, you have to dial guest services for them to bring it to your room. There is a busted vendo machine outside our room and an ice machine. We didn’t avail of the free breakfast because the hotel is right in Times Sq where breakfast places abound. M&M world is across it. Parking is pricey during weekdays till 8pm. The hotel offers SUV service (huge Chevy Suburban) to the airport which is an hour or so during peak hours (we left Wed 8am) and costs 128usd except tip. An additional 10usd for every extra airport terminal (my colleague got off at Terminal 8 first before my friend and I were brought to Terminal 1 of JFK).

title: Mediocre Stay
text: The location was great.  Room was not up to my standards.  The bathroom was dirty, the towels were dirty, and the shower was old and had patches missing from the bottom.  The room also smelled musty.  The staff was more than helpful.  Took our bags before the room was available and assisted me with questions.  The valet was joke.  It said to request your car by calling a number and no one answered.  When I called the front desk they said you must go down and ask for the car.  I have never been to a hotel where you had to physically go to valet to get your car.  Otherwise the hotel was nothing fancy.

title: Conference weekend
text: Crowne Plaza Times Square is a very comfortable upscale hotel, located in the theater district and also right beside the conference meeting space I was attending. The view from the room was phenomenal - city view of Times Square. Room was clean, staff was courteous, bed was comfortable.

title: Time-   A great place to stop in and enjoy the moment 😉
text: Time has an excellent selection of wine and cocktails to chose from.  Great service and the music, the art and the environment is inviting, stimulating and comfortable.  I am visiting Spoleto from America and I wish there was a place like this at home.    I highly recommend it!!!

title: Ubicación perfecta
text:
Se trata de un hotel en pleno Times Square, habíamos escogido un habitación con vistas a Times Square y planta alta, y las vistas eran fantásticas.
Eramos una familia de 4 y la habitación no era excesivamente amplia, aunque para estar en NY era más que correcta.
Al hotel se le nota el paso del tiempo, necesita  reforma.
A la llegada nos entregaron cupones para el desayuno , que lo teníamos incluido. A pesar de que íbamos a desayunar con los cupones, el hotel cargaba los desayunos en la cuenta. Los dos primeros días lo reclamamos y nos lo quitaron, pero el último día la sra. a la que reclamamos no estaba conforme y se empeñó en cobrarnos los desayunos, y nos costó muchísimo que no nos cobrasen los desayunos. Fue muy embarazoso. 
El desayuno era completo y variado, aunque con lo que pasó no nos dejó muy buen sabor de boca.

title: New York - Ombelico del mondo
text: Abbiamo soggiornato 6 notti in questo hotel. Arrivi e ti accorgi che l'hotel risponde esattamente alle tue aspettative. Abbiamo prenotato due camere e l'addetta alla reception che si è occupata di noi è stata veramente professionale. Ci ha cambiato le camere originariamente assegnate (a suo avviso erano ad un piano dal quale la vista non era "all'altezza" e che per un soggiorno di 6 notti "meritavamo di più") dandoci due camere al 30° piano veramente confortevoli,tutte 2 con una bella vista e zona relax con divano. Una delle due era ad angolo nella zona divano e aveva la vista delle foto. Veramente un ottimo soggiorno. L'hotel è sulla broadway quindi a due passi da Time Square e dai teatri e ottimo punto  per raggiungere tutte le attrattive e i luoghi di interesse. Nulla da eccepire: pulizia camere,rifornimento giornaliero dei prodotti per il bagno e cambio asciugamani, macchina caffè/te con bustine rifornite giornalmente, sale per colazione,aperitivi e cena (se volete fermarvi in hotel) . Personale efficiente e gentile. Ottimo hotel!

title: Wont be going back
text: This is my 5th time at the Crowne Plaza and i have to say the last, this hotel is tired, rooms are not nice, i was in room 3205, my room was only made pleasant by the house keeper who came in every day, on entering the room on arrival there was a very damp smell which could  have had something to do with the fan in the bathroom not working so the ceiling got covered with condensation, there was a double socket on the wall near the bed and when plugging in a charger the whole outside plate swivelled round, my main issue with the hotel was the staff, never have i been so rudely spoken to, couldn’t name one member of staff behind the desk who actually talked to me or my friend politely, I definitely don’t pay good money to be treated like that, i also think that all customers with a reservation should be informed that there is major renovations going on outside and that the front door is actually closed off so entrance is in the car park where taxis are dropping off and picking up.  Me and my friend travel to new york every year for a girly trip we spent the last day of trip looking round for a new hotel for next year. Having said all that the staff in the bar/restaurant are very sociable and the lady on the ticket desk (Corinne) is great, so helpful, maybe you should get her to give your staff at the front desk a few pointers on how to speak to customersIts such a shame as this hotel is in the best location and in the past has been great.

title: Wonderful Stay During "UN Week"
text: Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan is a terrific location-location-location for work and fun. It's in the absolute heart of Manhattan and a quick walk from almost anything you'd want or need. I was there in late September (perfect weather - balmy evenings, beautiful days). Absolutely every hotel room was booked because it was UN Week & POTUS Trump was in town. Great room on the 39th floor with a great view. Great staff. Great B'fast buffet.

title: Resortavgift???
text:
På detta hotell tar man ut en obligatorisk ”RESORT AVGIFT” på 40 dollar per rum och natt, något som höjer rumspriset med cirka 400 kronor per natt, och vad får man.
1. Fri Wi - Fi. Ok, men förmodligen världens dyraste.
2. Fria telefonsamtal. När alla har egen telefon?
3. Tillträde till ”New York Sports club” (Ett gym) som turist ett      par dagar i en storstad har man förmodligen andra prioriteringar
4. En fri öl eller ett glas vin i baren. 

Även om du inte utnyttjar något av detta så måste du ändå betala detta plus ett svinpris för ett ganska simpelt (typiskt amerikanskt hotellrum) men ett fantastiskt bra läge vid Times Square.

title: Our Server Made It Memorable!
text: Tony at Bar 49 added the personal touch that the registration desk lacked. He was personable, attentive and went the extra mile. Thanks so much Tony! I think you need to train the other staff especially the front desk.

title: Haven't stayed here yet (oct 21)
text:
WOW! 
first I would like to say is i haven't stayed here yet so I can't say thing about staying here yet.

I'm trying to so the easiest thing ever and that is just add a NAME to my reservation I called 3 times.
The first time I was just on hold and was never answered and it just clicked.. 
The second time it just clicked was never even out on hold.
The third time I was transferred 4 times until finally I talked to someone. He told me he was front desk i asked to add a name he said ok that's fine I gave him the name I wanted to add and then put me on hold and never came back to me and just clicked after being on the phone for 35 mins waiting. 

I am really disappointed of the costumer service so far and I'm not even there yet!! wow this is just giving me bad thought about this hotel already! 

I WILL SHOW PROOF OF THE CALLS I MADE WITH THE PICTURE I HAVE

title: Great time in Time Square
text: Not done with our trip yet.. but I couldn't wait to leave our review. My wife, kids and myself have to thank and commend Guy Seth at the Brasserie 1605. I cannot remember any other single time where we specifically looked for someone to attend to us. If the food were to be described as a creme dessert.. Seth's is what put it over the top and made our experience creme brulee!!! It's the little things that he offers that count the most. If it's his choice that's fine.. but if our voice sways or counts.. Seth needs to be made a permanent full-time employee!!! We will be back this summer and you better believe that we are going to be looking for Seth. Do the right thing Crowne Plaza Time Square. NYC and the world in general needs more Seth!!!

title: Amazing hotel and staff
text: I stayed at the hotel for a business trip and really enjoyed my stay thanks to the location, hotel service and amazing staff. Particularly, Adaliz who is a member of the front desk team. She went out of her way to ensure we had a smooth check-in and out. In addition to recommending local sightseeing. I will definitely return.

title: Great location
text: Great location to get about NYC. Perfectly adequate room but no view of Times Square. Comfortable bed and pillows. Good breakfast. Ana always got us a good table. Only downside was scaffolding all across front of hotel so had to use back entrance.

title: Great service, great hotel
text: We stayed here for four nights.  Loved this hotel.  Clean, comfortable rooms.  The housekeeper really paid attention to detail, and the staff was friendly, efficient and attentive. Our server in the lounge, Joanie, was truly amazing.  We came back every evening because of her.  She was friendly, helpful and very attentive.  Highly recommend this hotel.

title: A Better Experience Than In The Past But Still Average
text:
I had decided to stay here despite negative experiences in the past. Room was quite small and price remained expensive. Was on a high floor nonetheless. Had no issues with anything in the room, except this was the smallest room in this hotel I stayed in.
Overall though it probably was still not worth it. I would rather stay at a cheaper hotel e.g. Holiday Inn Express or elsewhere. 
Also what is wrong with the pool! Why is it so cold? Isn't the heating apparatus working?

title: Fantastic hotel and location
text: Stayed at this hotel beginning of September 2019 to celebrate my wifes 50th Birthday and our tenth wedding anniversary. The hotel is centally located with easy access by either foot/bus/tube to all the major attractions (hotel is right next to Ambassador theatre where we watched 'Chicago'). Going into our room we found a hand written note from the hotel manager wishing us a special stay which was a very nice touch. Hotel and room were very clean and the staff wre extremely helpful. We just had a fantastic time here and would recommend the hotel to anyone. Also on this trip we stayed at another IHG group hotel in San Francisco (Intercontinental, Howard Street), which was also of the same high standard.

title: Super séjour, emplacement de rêve pour un touriste
text:
L'hôtel, situé en plein Time Square, est vraiment de bonne facture.
Son emplacement en fera un point de chute idéal pour des touristes découvrant la ville.
Le petit déjeuner est excellent. Je recommande les chambres des étages supérieurs, ainsi que les Corner Room si possible pour profiter des plus belles vues de l'hôtel

title: Fantastic staff!!
text: From the moment of our arrival until our departure, everything we experienced was fantastic. We had the pleasure of having Victoria check us in. She was personable, efficient, and answered all questions we had. The friendliness and expertise of staff continued with Corinna the concierge. Thanks to her we had great seats to Lion King and easily found our way to the US Open in Queens. Even though I never had direct contact with housekeeping, our room 2608 was immaculate. We will definitely stay here when we return and will recommend to others.

title: Nice hotel in the middle of Times Square
text: Very well located hotel. Room is big for Manhattan standard. very clean. Breakfast is very good, with fruits, cold cuts and cheese, salmon, eggs. Very convenient. The concierge service also is very helpful and the ladies there very polite and kind.

title: Great service, awesome location
text:
Check in was speedy and because of my IHG membership we were given an upgrade.  We were also given drinks and food vouchers which was an unexpected but welcome surprise.

View from the 36th floor was amazing, food in the restaurant was good.  Really nice bar area.

A word to the wise about the pool, it is part of a gym and usually pretty packed so not suitable for a relaxing swim.

Really good stay overall.

title: Ottima scelta
text: Grazie ai consigli della nostra agente di viaggi , siamo approdati in questo hotel. Centralissimo , veramente comodo per chi vuole vivere intensamente Manhattan. Le camere sono abbastanza spaziose , considerato che in questa città di solito sono veramente piccole, il Bagno pulito e spazioso. Consigliatissimo.

title: New Year Day
text:
Spending 4 nights at Crowne plaza Manhatan. it was really our perfect stay during our US Visit. we have a comfy room and a bet huge for our family.
reception was to crowded due to many guest but still they able to accommodate all their guest.

Memorable stay at we spend on new years eve.

looking forward on our next US visit.

title: Everything perfect
text:
Pleasant room overlooking a city intersection where live music is played. In addition to the table area there is also a bar counter where you can sit for an aperitif.
Varied menu and generous portions cooked with good quality ingredients, the service is friendly and polite.
For a dinner, 30 usd is enough, excluding drinks and tip.
Booking recommended

title: Super hôtel avec un emplacement au top
text: Je reviens d’un voyage de 7 jours à New York avec 6 nuits dans cette hôtel où nous avons été très bien accueilli avec en prime un verre d’accueil au bar de l’hôtel. Nous avions une chambre avec vue Times square au 25ème étages, la chambre et la vue était top même si la moquette mérite d’être changée car vieillotte sinon très bien, bonne literie et petit plus tv connecté avec chromecast intégré. Seul point négatif le ravalement en cours de la façade avant de l’hôtel.

title: Amazing location
text: Stayed here with my sister and mum for a five night break in September 2019.  Hotel is in a prime location overlooking Times Square. Modern style, brilliant sized rooms and sparkling clean. Staff were all friendly and welcoming. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: 4th time still didn’t disappoint
text: When booking a hotel in New York the main thing my family look for is location.....this hotel has it, across from Times Square in the centre of everything it’s the perfect position for exploring the city, 4th time staying and heading back in December, clean good size rooms, fantastic amenities and amazing views, been to other hotels in NYC previously but wouldn’t even consider looking at others after we found Crowne Plaza!! Customer for life

title: Comfortable room, terrible service
text:
In addition to the room rate advertised online, there's a mandatory $40 per day fee for access to wifi, gym and two drink tickets. This is terribly overpriced and kinda shady. But typical for Time Square NYC.

The room is clean and comfortable, and would have been happy had the hotel staff not have been a nightmare throughout the week long stay.

The cleaning staff took all of our stuff out of the room and put it in lost and found thinking we abandoned the room. When I came back to discovery my items, wallet, bathroom supplies were gone, it was a shock. Went to hotel front desk and they said that if there's not a lot of stuff in the room they think it's abandoned. They assured me they would notify the cleaning staff to not do it again.

They did it again.

Needless to say it was very frustrating.

title: Superbe
text:
Très bel hôtel, chambre spacieuse dans NYC très bonne literie, chambre propre, nous avons eu une superbe vue (car nous avions réservé vue sur Times Square)
Restaurant très bon 
Emplacement idéal pour les adeptes de Times Square

title: Très bien situé ,ais....
text:
Avions réservé pour une chambre avec 2 its pour 3 personnes, nous étions au 22 ième étage, la vue était très belle,donnait directement sur Times Square. Cet hötel est très bien situé, étions à proximité de beaucoup de restaurants, de plusieurs boutiques et de toute l'activité de Times square. La nuit cependant, c'est très bruyant. 

Le service à l'accueil était bon à notre arrivée, le service de bar également.

Si je ne donne pas une meilleure note, c'est à cause de notre femme de ménage, nous avions 2 débarbouillettes( nous étions 3) et avions payé pour 3. Nous lui avons également  demandé de nous donner juste du café régulier au lieu de 2 régulier et 2 décaf mais non seulement elle n'a pas tenu compte de notre demande mais le lendemain n'avions que du décaf... Notre chambre n'était pas très propre non plus.

Cet hôtel a besoin de  rénovations Dans notre chambre, notre bain était tout plaqué, très petit et très tâché,  aucune de nous ne s'est risqué à en prendre un .

Quand nous avons demandé notre service de navette pour l'aéroport, on s'est fait dire que c'était impossible, qu'il fallait le demander 24 heures avant….

Après 3 nuits dans cet hôtel, nous étions contente de repartir.

title: Competent support from receptionist Sandra Esp
text: While staying here my husband took ill and Sandra helped me to extend our stay and organised a kettle and bottled water to be brought up to our room.Catania, who serviced our room was very sympathetic and cleaned our room immediately  so my husband could get into bed as soon as possible

title: 1ST VISIT TO NYC
text:
Came here with my wife and two sons, 21 and 14 and we had a great time. Hotel was a big part of why we loved New York. The service from checking in (Rhodda) the bar staff, the house keeping and the breakfast people was outstanding. Also the guys downstairs who looked after our luggage on our last day and sorted out a cab for us to the airport. 
We had a lovely room on the 38th floor with plenty of room for 4 of us with lovely comfy beds with a view of the city and the Hudson River. 
Best of all is the location! Unbeatable for anyone visiting NYC for the first time. 
Will definitely return in the future.

title: Desilusão!!!
text: Péssimo atendimento! Chegámos ao Hotel e não fomos recebidos por nenhum funcionário, apesar de haver vários funcionários encostados ao balcão a olharem para nós a assistiram ao nosso stress em encontrar os elevadores...  pelo que percebi só recebem os clientes se lhes derem gorjetas!!! No check-in não perderam tempo em retirar do cartão do crédito cerca de 500 dólares para cobrir eventuais estragos no quarto! As fotos do Hotel, dos quartos no site...mostra uma realidade mas pessoalmente o meu coração gelou, Hotel horrível, quarto  péssimo, carpete negra de sujeira, banheira em péssimo estado...tudo tudo tudo mau!!! Fujam deste Hotel, as 4 estrelas devem ter sido forjadas, fujam e não olhem para trás!!!! Por causa deste Hotel a nossa estadia em Nova York ficou comprometida ao ponto de não querermos voltar a Nova York!!!

title: Good stay for the most part
text:
We just stayed here this past weekend and had an overall good experience. We stayed on the 20th floor room 20-16. We originally booked a king size room but for some reason when I got there I was put in a double room. They quickly fixed that but I ended up getting a joining king room instead. The joining king room's door was extremely thin and we could hear conversations from the other side of the room, 20-18. Our neighbors for all 4 nights kept us up. The room was clean was extremely clean for the stay. 

The price for the room was just right with all accommodations you get with it. This includes cleanness of the room, being next to times square, by subway station, and a couple of places to eat inside. We canceled our Hilton reservations to stay here that's how impressed we were with the room along with the price.  I would gave this hotel a 5 star if they didn't try to put me and my wife in a double bed room and the joining room which has a very thin joining room door.

title: Surprise comfort fantabulous stay
text: Evelyn, at the check in made my day n my whole stay superb. Quick check and very corteous and friendly and proactive. i got a room view that I wished for, elite floor upgrade, complimentary buffet breakfast, vouchers n recognising gold elite members n all of that makes one feel special. Thank you Evelyn. The hotel is perfect location, a block away from noisy times square yet quiet n peaceful. A very busy lobby but superbly managed, from valet to security n room service all great. The guest service quickly took over a minor issue I had over my earlier booking confusion and as always IHG has always given good surprises to loyal guests. At the price n value for money we pay, I can easily say Crown Plaza is a cool place. Grind & co burgers a must try n breakfast at ground level is good too. Keep up folks n hope to catch up soon.

title: Great location
text: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza on a long weekend with work colleagues. The rooms were spacious for Times Square. The 25th floor doesn’t afford views of the city but we  found the location ideal for Times Square and the subway connections.

title: Best Location & View for the Money
text: Didn’t disappoint!  Loved our well-appointed corner room over looking Broadway & Times Square! Convenient to everything that speaks NYC! The customer service was exceptional!  Will be back for sure sooner than later!

title: New York Times Square
text: Great hotel, perfect location and cleanliness and service was fantastic. If staying in Times Square, this hotel is great!!! Would highly recommend!! Make sure you see a Broadway show, we saw Chicago and the theatre was just steps away. Also grab a ticket for the hop on hop off bus, there are plenty of guys selling tickets on the corners close to the hotel.

title: Location, location, location
text: There is a great view from the dining room overlooking Time Square but they stop serving food way too early -- too bad because I was starving when I arrived. My room was no big deal and it was $550+/night. Overall, I was not impressed with the place other than the fabulous location.

title: Outdated & overpriced with poor quality
text:
I just stayed here for a business conference.This hotel is outdated and needs a major renovation. I would never stay here again.
I had a room on the 38th floor facing the Barclays building (I had blackout curtains thankfully). Even on floor 38, you can hear the street pretty well.

As soon as I opened the door to my room, there was a weird smell. The room was just perfunctory with nothing special about it. 
There were stains on the carpet, dust everywhere, the wallpaper was peeling, and there was no refrigerator in the room. The furniture in the room was nicked and dented, it smelled like old wood, so I didn’t put my clothes in the drawers. The hangers were even ratty and the iron had limescale all over it. The sheets were damp. The thermostat was odd too-no matter what I set it at, it was stuck at 69 degrees F. The coffeemaker was in the cabinet and at that point would never use it. There was no minibar or any snacks.
Even the luggage rack was taped with a gauze bandage.

There’s a Starbucks across the street and Duane Reeds and Walgreens everywhere, so you can get what you need. There’s no sundry shop, but there’s an ok Grind & Co little shop they give you 2 $25 dollar daily vouchers for. They also give you 2 cocktail vouchers— I didn’t even bother.

I’m not a tourist, so I wasn’t into all the other Times Sq stuff.

When I have to go to this conference again, I will not stay here.  The WiFi is slow and the conference area is outdated as well.

This is not a 4 star hotel... this is a motel with hotel prices.

title: In the hub
text: Surrounded by dazzling lights in the heart of Times Square but a quiet place to return after the hustle bustle of the city. We were on the 26th floor so all was  peaceful. Breakfast was good and you have the choice of breakfast in the restaurant or buying from in-house counter and using the hotel lounge. Staff very pleasant and very helpful with any questions or information needed. Would certainly come back to this hotel.

title: Square View
text: The reception staff member was FANTASTIC, made us feel at home, the room overlooked Times Square, it was a good size plus clean and tidy, beds were much better than most hotels, nice reception area with well stocked bar and plenty of tables, bathroom very clean with lovely soft towels, breakfast at hotel was excellent

title: Mike Sneyd
text:
I recently had a 5 night stay at the Crowne Plaza in Manhattan NYC. 
On my arrival I discovered that through a mix up with the agency I used in the UK and their US counterparts my hotel booking had been cancelled.
The hotel, instead of washing their hands of me as the mix up was not their fault. Not only allowed me to stay, but helped me sort out the problem and the following night, having fixed the mix up with the agents I had used, gave my wife and I an even better room to stay in for the remainder of our stay.
This is such a wonderful hotel in every respect, from the rooms to the amenities offered, with such friendly staff
With regard to the members of staff, I wish to give a special thank you to Victoria Martin, Val Henry and Juliet Chang for the help they gave in making our stay one of the best ever. They were so professional, so friendly and their help went far beyond what could have been expected. 
So i can thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting Manhattan. There is no better place

title: Worst stay ever
text: I had flight delays and was supposed to arrive around 3p-4p. I ended up not getting in until 5am. I called several times to see what my options were and the staff was rude and said I could give up my room of 4 nights or pay for the night I wasn’t actually there. Ok fine. I’ll pay for 4 full nights. When I arrived I was given a room that had mold growing on the ceiling above the bed. I requested another room. I was given a temporary room and told that my room with two double beds would be reassigned to me the next day. I went down at 10am and made sure that it’s was known what my room situation was and that I would be back in the afternoon to be given keys to my new room. Came back at 4:30pm and was told that no room was approved for me because I booked through booking.com. I had to have a long conversation with the Assistant Manager who told me I booked an ADA room and I couldn’t just ask for a two double bed room because I messed up. I told her I didn’t that I was given an ADA room because of mold on the ceiling in the room assigned to me when I arrived. I had to show my booking reservations to show I was not lying about my reservation. I finally got a room and was told they would waive the $35 daily service fee that covers Wifi, etc. Well good thing we could never even get on the WiFi because it was so bad. The new room I was assigned to had mold all over the bathroom. See pictures below. After so much trouble and poor service previously in sucked it up and didn’t complain. When you stay at a hotel such as the Crown Plaza it is known for its prestige and cleanliness. I’m paying $1800 for 4 nights for a dirty room with mold. I will never stay at this hotel again. I’ve stayed at LaQuintas that we’re nicer than this and more than half the cost. Don’t pay for a room with a view because the hotel really doesn’t have a direct view of Times Square. You have to lean over and look way down the street to actually see Times Square. It’s a good location, but don’t pay for the view it’s a waste of your money.   They also do NOT offer airport transportation.

title: Another fabulous stay
text: We enjoyed yet another wonderful visit to the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan.  Front desk staff is AMAZING!  I received frequent texts about my accommodations.  I needed my room serviced at a specific time, which was not a problem.  Beautiful rooms.  Excellent service.

title: 직원들이  친절합니다
text:
오래되었기 때문에 룸컨디션은 조금 떨어집니다 
그러나 직원들은 굉장히 친절해요
호텔안에 카페나 바 등이 있어서 식사하기 편해요

title: Hidden fees
text: The receptionist Evaline literally said to me and my wife that third party reservations come with a "resort fee" of 40$. WTF is this fee for. The price was advertised for 160 a night but I actually paid 260$. Nothing on the website said anything about a resort fee. I will never stay here again in my life with this predatory hotel. Overrated and overpriced. Very basic value for money.

title: Wonderful place!
text: Wonderful hotel in wonderful location.Such a lovely place with fast and pretty good service.The rooms are clean and design is stylish.We spend lovely moments there. We are recommended this hotel for our friends and relatives, will come again.

title: Деловая поездка в Нью Йорк
text: Замечательный отель Crown Plaza, отличное расположение в центре города! Очень понравился ресторан с хорошими завтраками и отличным персоналом! Мы жили в отеле почти месяц и чувствовали себя как дома! Ali, Tareq, Tofael, Rahman, Ana спасибо вам большое из Москвы!

title: Very good location. Excellent breakfast. Repeat guest.
text: Very good location on Times Square. Easy access to subway station. Friendly and helpful check in staff. Excellent breakfast. I am a repeat guest at this hotel, my children love visiting this hotel whenever we are in New York.

title: Great location but it’s a bit dated
text: The hotel is situated right on Broadway / 7th Avenue, just 50yds north of Times Square so the location is fantastic. The rooms are fine but the reception decor is looking is a little tired. They have a little cafe inside (closed on Sundays which is a bit annoying) and a bar. I’d definitely stay here again purely because it’s right where the action is.

title: Super stay !
text: Stayed here from Sunday to today 5 days , it was a swift check in with a lovely gentleman on the reception desk, he welcomed us and also had a bottle of wine sent up to our room for my husbands 60 th birthday. We were in room 3119 as we entered I did think the double beds were quite small at first glance but actually we really settled in well with a lovely view of time square looking down onto juniors pancake house. The beds and pillows were so comfortable and the bathroom was very clean as was the whole room , in-fact really impressive how the staff came in every day cleaned the room , made the beds to a high standard . There was a lovely cafe with beautiful  cakes, coffee etc every single member of staff were very happy to help and said good morning or evening and what was so nice is they didn’t push the ill so everything for you as long as you give me a big tip like some hotels in NYC that we’ve stayed at but made you give them more as they weren’t rude about it . Mike took out cases to store them who was such a lovely man a real gent . Also the hotel kindly gave us a late check out . All in all we really loved this hotel and especially the staff . Well down team , I’m very fussy and you all did great ! The restaurant and cocktail bar looked great bit didn’t try them as we were out most of the day  thanks from the roberts family !

title: Thanks to Ms. Sandra Esp - reception
text: We always stay at this hotel whenever we arrive to New York. This time we came for 5  nights. The location of the hotel is great, & the rooms are comfortable. We appreciate especially the worm welcome & great help & attention we got at the reception from Ms. Sandra ESP, who helped us to get the room that we liked. Thank you!

title: Perfect!!
text: We stayed here for a quick week in the city, and thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. It’s perfectly situated in Times Square, close to theaters, restaurants and subways. Our room was very spacious. The hotel staff texted us shortly after we arrived to inquire about the room. This means of communication worked wonderfully when we found our room short a towel and later when we had a problem with a clogged sink. Both issues were resolved quickly. The wifi was quirky requiring a renewal each day, but that was a minor inconvenience. The room was clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. We’d stay there again.

title: In the Heart of Times Square and the Theatre District
text: The location is amazing and convenient.  Rooms were clean and nice.  Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  You are right in the heart of times square where all the hustle and bustle is.  Theaters just a hop, skip and walk away.  8th street has many restaurants that are amazing.  Morning coffee and breakfast, just a short walk with, too many choices.  The metro is pretty much, right there to get you to wherever else you want to go explore!

title: Fab hotel
text: Fantastic place to stay in NYC. All staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms had great views. Pool was good for our children. Price was reasonable compared to similar  hotels in the area. Thank you for being so accommodating. We would recommend.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Hi! I have had really bad experiences with the hotels in New York. This time I stayed with Crowne plaza! It’s amazing hotel with nice aroma , it’s very clean and most importantly the staff is really nice. I wasn’t feeling well, but they provided me help with everything. The guy at the front desk names Imran, upgrades my room with nice time square view. Also Mahfuz made sure I got special tea for my sickness. Very highly recommended this hotel! Do try, they won’t let you down .

title: Great hotel in Times Square
text: Two co-workers and I stayed at the Crown Plaza for an education conference and had an amazing time. The hotel is centrally located right in Times Square and within walking distance of everything (Rockafeller Center, Central Park, Broadway, etc.). The hotel itself was modern and the rooms were very clean and had a great view of the city. There is a fitness club within the hotel, which is a nice feature; however, the pool there is definitely for lap swimming only (not to leisurely hang out by the pool).

title: Lovely hotel
text: Lovely hotel in the heart of Times Square. Nice clean spacious rooms friendly and prompt check in. Bar really nice for a drink. No problem I’m leaving your luggage if needed. Nice restaurant to eat in. Great views of the city from the rooms

title: Celebrating my Friends Birthday
text:
Let me start out by saying I had booked the Marriott Marquis for two nights that weekend at the $255 teacher rate, due to unforeseen circumstances we couldn’t stay two nights and I had to modify our reservation to one night. When I did that the room price skyrocketed to $750 for the night!! So I canceled and started looking at other hotels. I remembered I had always wanted to stay at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square so I checked there first and became and IHG member, for free, to get the best rates and some extra perks. Their price for the night $245 senior discount rate! So I booked it right away without looking at the TA reviews because you could cancel the room up to 24 hours in advance so I figured if the reviews were bad I would just cancel. 
The reviews were pretty decent except for a couple of them talking about the front of the hotel having construction. So I called ahead to make sure it wasn’t going to interfere with our stay. I spoke to Sandra who assured me it wouldn’t and she would put us on the higher floor to alleviate any concerns I had about noise. I also told her we were celebrating a BD. 
When we got to the hotel we had to enter through the side of the building, which is not a big deal at all. Our check in was quick and easy. Special thanks to Victoria who knew her job, was professional, kind and enthusiastic that we were there! Our room was not ready because we had arrived early but they texted us when it was ready and that was great! I texted back if they could make sure the AC in the room was on blast because it was a hot day and we were walking around a lot and they replied: “ Yes of course! Is there anything else we can do to make your  stay comfortable?” Yippee! 
 We got so many freebies! We each received one hotel voucher for buffet breakfast worth  $35 each, a $20 voucher that we could spend anywhere in the hotel including bar and restaurant, and four drink vouchers valued at $15!!! We were so happy!!!!! 
When we got to the room we were pleasantly surprised that they had upgraded us to a corner suite!! The room was icy cold as just like we requested!  The room was very nice, bathroom a little small, but big enough to move around and feel comfortable. The bathroom does not have a separate door from the shower area, it’s all together. We had forgotten our toothbrushes and they came to the room immediately with complementary brushes and tooth paste. 
All hotel staff was pleasant and able to answer any questions we had. The hospitality and the feel of being in a smaller hotel for being such a big hotel was incredible! Our normal stomping ground is usually  the Marriott Marque in Times Square but the service we received here outweighs their service! So next time I book at the Crowne Plaza!

title: Times Square dream
text: Such an amazing place to stay . You are literally on Times Square . Ideal location . Rooms were big for family of 4. Service was good . Staff were friendly . Easy access to basically everything . Breakfast is expensive, I would suggest eating out as there are plenty of places to eat at a quarter of the price . Tons of shopping places around the corner also !!  I’m going there again without a doubt

title: Couldn’t fault our stay!
text:
JAMES on the check-in desk (on 21st Aug 2019) was my first encounter with the Crowne Plaza, Times Square’s team - what a SUPERSTAR! He was polite, welcoming, listened & heard. James made us feel that nothing was too much trouble.  Perfect check in, excellent customer service! 
We didn’t eat at the hotel but the bar staff were really efficient and pleasant too.  We regularly had drinks and occasionally had dessert there. 
LIFTS were in full working order and fast.  

ROOM: I’d booked & paid extra for a Times Square view room & got a corner double double (Room 3601) with a fabulous view of Times Square, including the Empire State Building. Really pleased. 
• Beds (& pillows, 4 per bed supplied) were very comfortable but are a small double.  
• Hairdryer provided in a bag on the bathroom shelf, it’s a proper fairly powerful one not one of those wall hose things! 
• Bathroom, well lit & clean. Fixed shower head over a bath tub. Clean heavy shower curtain. 
• No issues with the air con, worked perfectly throughout. 
• Lots of power points provided. All the lamp stand bases on the desk, the TV dresser & the bedside drawers (which also included a couple of USB ports too) had the facility to plug in. 
• Two luggage stands included. 
• Small closet space with around 10 wooden hangers provided (we used one of the clip ones to hold the curtains together were they met in the corner to prevent that light gap!) 
• Usual laundry Bag provided (we didn’t use the service) 
• Corner arm chair, small coffee table & a desk plus chair provided. 
• No kettle but a drip machine that you could use the provided tea or coffee bags in (or your own teabags if you’re British!) Cups are disposable, wrapped in plastic.  White sugar sachet, sweetener, packet creamer (no milk), plastic stirrer & a paper serviette come packaged up (in more plastic...!) feels wasteful, should be provided separately.  
- No water bottles provided.  
- No fridge included but available on request.  
- No Iron, available on request I think (I pack in a way where I don’t need to iron when I arrive!) 

CLEANLINESS: excellent, well maintained room, not tired or dated.  
• The usual toiletries, tea/coffee & towels replaced without fail, housekeeping were great and done by lunchtime or earlier (we were always out during the day to be fair). 

LOCATION: fantastic on the doorstep of Times Square TKTS red steps (which is the section our room view was of) with the Subway on 50th just a couple of minutes walk away. 
Scaffolding is still up so entrance is to the side, under the tunnel. 

SUMMARY: Some of the reviews had worried me but I honestly couldn’t fault it.  It’s not the highest end luxury & my expectations for city hotels, given the numbers that go through them are low but this was certainly not a shoddy hotel in my experience & did live up to the Crowne Plaza brand.  We had a jam packed itinerary for the week, you really just need a place to lay your head in NYC but even the kids started calling the room ‘home’... lovely to return back to each evening with our tourist sore feet and buzzing heads.  
Thank you to the CP team, you excelled!

title: Great value in NYC!
text: An excellent choice for visiting NYC! Fantastic location, clean, and comfortable. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the pool experience. We chose this hotel specifically in part because it was one of only a few in our price range with a pool, but when we went to use it, we discovered it is a lap pool that is part of the health club with very specific rules. Not at all your typical hotel pool (no lounge chairs, no shallow end for kids, etc.). In spite of that we loved our stay and I will recommend to anyone who asks!

title: Excellent Location
text:
Wonderful location. The hotel's health club was my most favorite. 

The breakfast needed the availability of more vegetables which I was looking for in the morning. I believe the management of the hotel should look into it.

title: Location, Location, Locaiton
text:
My husband and I stayed there a week for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. The location was perfect.  A long block from multiple subway stations, a long block from a huge grocery store, two long blocks from the parade & Rockefeller and reasonable walking distance to Central Park, Macy's and everything else you want.  The staff were all so nice and gave us great tips on places to ear.  This was my husbands first trip to the city so I wanted to keep him in the center of it all.  He loved it!  Bonus we had a view of Times Square from our room.  Only small down side was the heat was a bit to hot for our room and you cannot control it with a thermostat.  
The beds were super comfy and the room was very clean.

title: Great experience
text:
Me and two of my daughters stayed at the hotel for four nights
Everyone was very nice and helpful specially the lady at breakfast (Ana?)
Had a great time. Location is perfect  
I was also given vouchers for drinks that I was able to exchange for other beverages

title: Fabulous!
text: I stayed 5 nights in July - and had a marvellous time! The hotel bar/restaurant was the highlight. Tony was our server every night and treated us like family - gave us tips about what shows to see, what cocktails to order . . . I will definitely be back! Thanks so much, Tony@Bar49!

title: Birthday Celebration
text: Stayed in NYC on August 31 & September 1. Quick 2 night stay. This hotel is amazing. From everyone at the front desk to the wonderful bar & breakfast brunch. Everyone had a smile on their face. Wish I remembered the name of the bartender on September 1st but recommend Barbacon because we wanted a dinner out that we could walk to & did not disappoint! Had a corner room 3102 that actually had a hallway. Lol. Beautiful view of Times Square. Definitely will stay here again

title: Très bonne hôtel
text:
C’est la seconde fois que je vais à cet hôtel. J’y étais déjà allé un an plutôt en août 2018. Tout d’abord l’hôtel est extrêmement bien placé sur Time Square. Certes le quartier est un peu bruyant mais c’est New York quoi, la ville qui ne dort jamais !

Le prix des chambres est cher mais elles sont confortables et bien équipées. La literie est agréable, il y a beaucoup de prise électrique et le wifi fonctionne très bien et il est compris dans le prix de la chambre. Un point positif quand ont sait que certains hôtels de NYC qui sont encore plus chère facture le wifi une fortune. Ma télévision ne fonctionnait pas très bien et il y a plusieurs chaînes que je ne recevait pas. C’est un peu dommage que Netflix (ou un autre service du genre) ne soit pas proposé, ça pourrait vraiment être sympa.

La salle de bain est grande et propre. En revanche je trouve dommage que l’hôtel ne mette pas des distributeurs automatiques de gel douche et shampooing pour remplacer les petits flacons qui sont à la longue très polluant. Mais bon ça ne reste que mon avis.

Le personnel a été sympathique et serviables avec moi pendant mon séjour. L’hôtel est doté d’équipements appréciables comme la salle de sport et sa piscine. Cette piscine intérieur est destinée avant tout à la natation et non aux loisirs pour les enfants. Le bar du lobby de l’hôtel est un endroit sympathique pour prendre un verre et manger.

Enfin je trouve un peu dommage qu’il faille payer un supplément pour avoir une chambre avec la vue sur Time Square. En 2018 j’avais eu la vue sans payer de supplément, en 2019 je ne l’ai pas eu et la vue sur Hell’s Kitchen était franchement pas terrible. Dommage...

Quand je reviendrai à New York je prendrai probablement de nouveau cet hôtel que je recommande franchement.

title: Debió ser un gran hotel
text:
Ubicación en Broadway con la 49. Allí, en medio de todo el caos neoyorquino. 
Hacíamos noche antes de regresar a casa. 
Pese a estar un poc más alejados, sin duda, la zona que más nos gusta es la de Nomad..
Pagamos el suplemento de habitación con vista a Times Sq.
Ok, nos asignaron planta 34 pero las vistas son esquinadas.
Hotel que, me parece, tira de su ubicación para competir ya que sin estar demasiado viejo ni sucio, necesita una reforma en habitaciones y pasillos...
Debió ser un gran hotel. Ahoras, es un buen hotel con excelente ubicación.
No tanto en la planta noble con el Broadway 49 (lobby bar) y la Brasserie 105 (creo) donde sirven desayuno y comidas....Con buenas visitas a Times Sq desde la planta noble (un 2º o 3º piso de aquí). 
No repetiría.
En el business centerr (único hotel de los 3 en los que hemos estado), a pagar si quieres navegar.. solo permitne imprimkir (gratis) tarjetas de embarque. ni siquiera reservas de tours o simple fnfo del hotel.
El wifi, gratuito, de lujo. Como casi todas las wifis abiertas de USA.
Poco más añadir. Buen servicio de Consierge y maleteros.

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
Located at the Duffy Statue end of Times Square the entrance is tucked away underneath the hotel which makes it less busy and frantic than it otherwise might be.
The service is main chain efficient and orderly. Room was very clean and comfortable having a view of both Times Sq and the Hudson River.
Obviously this part of NYC is busy 24/7 but the noise was never really intrusive even with a busy FireHouse just one block away behind the hotel.
Can't vouch for the restaurant but the bar wasn't madly exorbitant.

title: One night was enough.
text: In the middle of building work which made things very difficult, staff were very unfriendly and unhelpful, putting luggage in storage till room was ready meant that we had to go down in a lift out of the building and round the block to get in at the back of the hotel, no offer of help. Room was tired and sheets on beds were damp,

title: Tony
text: Crowne plaza time square. Walked in to hotel reception when we arrived and thought really nice bug it ended there. The lifts feel like there going to break down and then we got to our Hotel rooms which were very poor. We were moved rooms 3 times so far. All the tables and units were all damaged with doors on cupboards not closing properly. Dirty carpets and in one room the bath had the enamel coming away and over all the paint work in hotel and room was very below par. So in general not a 4 star hotel in my eyes, far from it

title: Bucket List
text:
Always wanted to visit New York 
The Marriott Marquis was the best. This is a very nice place to stay. Right in the middle of everywhere we wanted to see and and everywhere we wanted to go. We had a great time!

title: Get ready for a not nice surprise
text:
My reservation was made through a well known website, and all was fully paid in advance. However once at the hotel an additional  charge of $35 per day was charged to my credit card prior to check out. The reason given was this is a standard “service fee for  gym access, welcome drink at the lobby bar, and high speed internet”. I claimed to the customer service of the hotel as I never asked for this, had no drinks at the bar, and internet was included in my paid room rate. The guy in charge of customer services (Chris) confirmed this fee was not applicable when I claimed. However at check out they kept the service fee charge of $35 per day. Had a long discussion with the reception manager (who was very kind) but the charge remained and their excuse was “this is charged by all hotels in New York”, which it’s completely false. 
They charge this “service fee” to everybody in addition to whatever you have paid or rate you have reserved (and this is not a city or county tax, simply a overcharge of Crowne Plaza). Be aware of their trick and assume you have to add $35 per day to your stay at Crowne Plaza Times Square. Very unfair and tricky.

title: Great Location
text: We celebrated our 50th wedding anniversary.  Check in was fast, Great room overlooking Times Square.  The staff couldn't have made us feel more special, especially Ruben Hernandez in the Security Department.  We would stay here again.

title: Fuyez!!!!! Une honte pour une enseigne digne de ce nom!
text:
Hotel trop vétuste! Besoin d'un gros rafraîchissement!
 Un mot, Fuyez!!!!!
 Pour un 4 étoiles c'est juste du foutage de gueule!
 Nous avons fait confiance a la référence crown plaza mais au final ça ne vaut rien!
L'hôtel est en travaux et l'entrée se fait pas derrière.
  -La moquette dans les étages est pourrie et la déco imprimée dessus est quasi plus visible tellement c'est usé.
-le tourniquet à l'entrée n'est pas automatisé il faut toujours le pousser pour entre et sortir.
-une piscine aussi est accessible mais attention ca reste un bassin pour le sport et ya des lignes d'eau installées.
 Résultat, si vous y aller pour la détente et non pour faire des longueurs vous risquez de gêner les vas et viens des pratiquant...
-4 ascenseurs permettent d'accéder aux étages mais ils sont parfois longs à venir et sont toujours pleins de mondes!
- lors de notre réservation nous avons demandé de lit simple et ça n'a pas été pris en compte on est arrivé avec un lit double.
À l'accueil nous avons dit que ça ce n'est pas ce qui a été demandé et ils nous ont dit que sur la réservation ça n'a pas été précisé nous avons donc l'effort de rappeler Expedia et le conseiller au téléphone nous a dit que ça bien été transmis.
Ils nous ont donc apporté un lit simple en complément mets le confort reste à désirer!
 Et nous l'avons donc pas utilisé.
- dans la chambre il n'y a pas d'éclairage permettant d'avoir une bonne luminosité dans la pièce.
 Cependant il y a 4 lampadaires dans la pièce un peu partout et je trouve ça pas pratique du tout car lorsque nous arrivons au soir dans la chambre il faut faire toute la pièce est allumé tous les lampadaires pour espérer avoir un maximum de luminosité alors que ça pourrait être tout simplement remplacé par une lumière standard au milieu de la pièce qui permet un éclairage général.
- côté hygiène la salle de bain n'est pas propre du tout.

 Les joints sont noircis la robinetterie ce n'est pas du tout fixer et on peut même observer des fuites d'eau.
- le matin au réveil lorsque on prend sa douche on retrouve quelques petite mouche sur les parois de la douche il faut leur mettre un peu d'eau pour les faire fuir.
- le pommeau de la douche n'est pas tout à fait bien resserrer ce qui fait que c'est difficile de régler la bonne température.
 -

title: Good location, but not the best hotel
text: This hotel was perfectly fine, but I was a little underwhelmed. We were a party of 10 requiring 4 rooms and were told that the rooms would be ready by 3pm, which was fine. However when 3pm came only 3 rooms were ready resulting in 2 people having to shower in someone else's room. Several hours later a room was offered, but had 1 king sized bed when it was supposed to be a twin room, so we were left waiting again for the final room, which obviously wasn't ideal. The rooms were fine when we were in, our view was of the river which was lovely. The rooms were quiet and clean, with plenty of room and a large bathroom (with a great shower). The lighting was good which is always a bonus, with plenty of mirrors. The location was the reason that we booked this hotel, as it's literally in the middle of everything. There are plenty of bars and restaurants a stones throw away with plenty of choice. The hotel is in Times Square so you are surrounded by the hustle and bustle of New York which is great. Taxi's were easily available, and the hotel will request one if not. The staff were very helpful with recommendations on what to see, when to go and we managed to get discount tickets within the hotel which was good. I would recommend staying here, I think we just got a little unlucky with the room situation because there was a convention on so the hotel was more than likely to be fully booked.

title: Perfect location
text: Stayed here for five nights while visiting NYC, and while I wouldn’t spend too much time in Times Square itself (too many beggars, oddballs and hucksters for my liking, especially after dark), it was perfectly located for all of the places I wanted to visit in midtown Manhattan. My room was located on the 20th floor, and while I heard the occasional police siren or traffic horn in the night, otherwise I could not hear any noise from Times Square. I generally wouldn’t pick a hotel that has so many rooms but I enjoyed my stay here and have nothing to complain about.

title: Posizione strategica ma:
text: Sono stata con la mia famiglia in questo hotel perché avevo letto che era un 4 stelle e in una buona posizione però non sono rimasta soddisfatta! Camere vecchie  da ristrutturare ogni giorno la card per aprire la stanza si smagnitizzava la doccia che non scaricava l’acqua gli asciugamani erano sempre pochi visto che eravamo in4 . ogni giorno 40. dollari da pagare per dei servizi mai usati ! Ascensori lentissimi L’unica cosa positiva è solo la posizione .

title: Efficient, welcoming and great breakfast experience
text: Very comfortable room with view of the Hudson. Excellent restaurant, snack and bar service. Efficient reception, despite large amount of guests. Best experience at breakfast time. Travis is so welcoming at breakfast time. He works hard to ensure you have all the food and drinks you require and that you are completely satisfied. He is a great source of information for tourists new to New York like us.Hotel is very central, easy to get to museums, Broadway etc. Vibrant.

title: Superb
text: Went to eat here with my daughters while on an 8 day trip to New York. The food was really good although we did wait abit but it was really busy. Our server was friendly polite and so cheerful. Plenty of stuff to look at here aswell,only downside was it was super noisy but there was alot of people there. Definitely will visit again

title: First visit
text: My son and I stayed here because we were seeing Hadestown at the Walter Kerr Theater right next door. This Hotel definitely didn't disappoint. Parking on-site, comfortable beds, great views from our room, and a very knowledgeable and friendly staff always willing to help. What more could you ask for? Thank you for making our first NY experience and unforgettable one! 👍👍👍

title: Super zentral gelegenes Hotel, aber in die Jahre gekommen
text: Wir waren das erste Mal in New York und wollten gern ein zentrales Hotel haben. Dieses Kriterium erfüllt das Crowne Plaza absolut, es liegt direkt am Times Sqaure in Manhattan. Service war freundlich Wir haben ein Zimmer im höchsten Stockwerk (46) bekommen. Wir hatten direkten Blick auf den Times Square, absolut grandios. Das Zimmer als solches ist leider sehr in die Jahre gekommen. Der Teppichboden hatte einige Flecken und war eher grau als strahlend. Klimaanlage hat gut funktioniert, allerdings sehr laut, nachts haben wir diese ausgeschaltet. Stauraum für einen Aufenthalt von einer Woche mit zwei Personen war zu wenig. Leider waren auch zwei Schubladen defekt. Auch im Badezimmer zeigten sich deutliche Abnutzungserscheinungen (siehe Bilder). Betten war sehr bequem. generell war das Zimmer sehr laut, da so hoch gelegen hörte man die Klimabelüftungen auf den umliegenden Dächern, aber dafür der oberste Stock und grandiose Aussicht. Sofern man der Putzfrau täglich $ 3 bis 5 hingelegt hat, bekam man zwei Flachen Wasser. Einmal haben wir vergessen Tip hinzulegen, da gab es dann auch kein Wasser. Frühstück haben wir im Hotel nicht genommen, es gibt in direkte Lage in den Straßen ausreichend günstigere Frühstücksmöglichkeiten. Fazit: tolle Lage des Hotels und je nach Zimmer eine tolle Aussicht, leider sehr in die Jahr gekommen und dafür eigentlich viel zu teuer.

title: Classical Times Square visit hotel
text: The hotel is a few steps from the Times. There is an ongoing renovation at the entrance on broadway so we had use the vale entrance. The hotel has a nice view rooms available. Our check in was very nice and smooth. Thanks to Rosa from front desk, we had a kind surprise of a drink-set for our anniversary.
