It was a cool surprise for us waiting at the room after a long day in the city. We had booked a times square view room and we get a fine room overlooking the square. This was my second time visiting the same hotel.

title: Situation
text: Très bel hôtel, super bien situé. Tout ce fait à pied. M&M, Hershey, Carlos bakery. Mme Thussault, théâtre  . Le prix des repas par contre très très cher. Petit déjeuner pour 2 pour 85$ US. Par contre petit resto tres abordable pas loin.

title: Summer break
text: Just spent six fantastic nights in this top quality location and hotel. Excellent throughout from reception to the young gentleman in the fashion bar who was the most polite young man I have met in a long while. I do wish you can pass on my regards to the young man. The cleaning staff also excellent with a very high standard of customer service firm just a good morning to any help that is asked of. Hotel is spotless with a good breakfast. Superb location. Will be very highly recommended to family and friend and also my large workforce colleagues. Anyone from the United Kingdom would be foolish to book anywhere else in Times Square than this magnificent hotel.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Overall my partner and I were extremely satisfied with our experience at the Crowne Plaza. We were given an amazing corner room and the front desk staff were very friendly, kind and helpful. The location is easy to find as well. When we were checking out, we asked if they would be able to check our luggage for the day so we could sight see and come back to pick it up. The front desk staff said they were happy to take our luggage and to check it downstairs. When we went to check it, the staff there asked us “where we had heard that lie” when we inquired about checking the luggage. When we replied the front desk, they begrudgingly took our luggage. Other than that unfortunate experience we had a great stay and are happy to come back.

title: Crowne Plaza
text:
This is my 2nd time staying at the Crowne Plaza Times Square and I was very happy we did.  We were a group of 7 and fortunate enough to have adjoining rooms which made the whole trip easier.  Unfortunately I did not get names of the staff that we interacted with, but everyone was so helpful and friendly and if any of them give you recommendations for food listen because both of the ones we received were phenomenal.

With great service and an unbeatable location (especially if you plan on seeing a show, they are in the middle of most theaters) I would highly recommend  this hotel.

title: Terrible housekeeping
text:
This is a real shame because until you get to the room, this hotel is fine. Staff are friendly, service is good and breakfast is wonderful, though do make sure it's included in the rate because it isn't worth $35 per person - no breakfast is.
Also be aware they take a $75 per night pre auth on check in, even though there's no mini bar in the rooms. Seems like a racket to encourage you to dine in their one food outlet. Because they could easily put a block on room charges.
The problems really start when you enter your room.
It's probably the worst housekeeping I've experienced in any hotel at any level before.
The rooms are shabby, in need of some TLC. The taps are loose. There are holes where light bulbs should be but worse than that, they're just dirty. Layers of dust on shelves on entry and not cleaned throughout our three day stay, toilet had urine stains on the rim etc. 
Coffee cups and refreshments not replaced.
It all points to lazy housekeeping. 
We didn't even get a bed. It was a tired old job lot sofa bed that really had seen better days.
The hotel was undergoing major refurb works when we stayed. Would've been nice if we'd been informed.

title: Front desk staff needs training
text:
I booked this hotel for two rooms months in advance and even though everything turned out okay, we almost didn't get the rooms I requested. 

I knew our flight was a late night arrival so I called the front desk the day before to let the front desk know. It seems to me this should have taken 2 minutes, but the woman kept putting me on hold with horrible music playing until she finally hung up on me after I was on the phone for 1/2 hour. I called back the 800 number and they made sure my rooms were flagged for a late arrival. 

Due to weather delays we arrived even later than I thought - about 3:30 in the morning!!  So the woman tells me she has my two rooms with king beds. I told her that one room was supposed to be two queen beds. She asked " how many in my room " I said "two - but I'm with my son and he gets his own bed!!!"  She said the room had a pull out bed!!  I told her no - for that kind of money he gets his own bed. She said I should have told them and I explained that I actually booked these rooms over the phone and DID tell them exactly what kind of rooms I wanted. She said I should have called the front desk and booked it!  I then told her about my experience calling the front desk about the late arrival and she said they outsource that stuff!?!?!  I was trying to maintain my cool since I was so tired and just wanted this to work out well!!

A man at the desk next to her mentioned a couple different options she could give me so she got me the double room and then tried to make me feel bad by saying " now you messed up the room for someone else arriving later"!!!!  I just kept smiling because I was tired and wanted everything to work out well!!

The beds are very nice but the bathroom had hairs in the shower and on the floor!!  I was too tired to worry about that. There is no refrigerator or coffee pot and the cleaning staff gets very loud in the hallways very early!!  The location is perfect so I guess I need to focus on the positive!!

title: I’m impressed!
text:
I stayed from 20 Aug. to 24 Aug. at Room 3207. It is a very stranded hotel and very comfortable.  The most touch me is Ana who is served in Brasserie 1605, the breakfast restaurant of Crown Plaza. She worked very hard and touched.She is very patient with my sons. Her service is very professional and keeps it very clean. She is very kind to receive my sons, so that my wife and I can enjoy a wonderful breakfast.
She is also very familiar with New York and gave us many practical suggestions for the journey. I am a Marriott member. This time I was very surprised to book the Crown Hotel, but because of Ana's service, I will use this hotel as a resident choice for New York.

title: Excellent location and service
text:
Super location right on times square, our room was over looking the Times Square.
Breakfast was included in our room stay and the staff there were very courteous and helpful, Ana & Mahfus were exceptionally courteous and helpful and ensured we were comfortable and would help us with any of our weird queries. 
Would recommend to any person with a family to stay here

title: Excellent location
text: The location of the Crowne Plaza Times Square is excellent. You can walk right out of the hotel and you are in Times Square. The only reason I can't give a 5 rating is because the room was not ready at specified check in time. When we came back hours later, it still wasn't ready. I know sometimes things can happen out of our control, but we had dinner reservations and wanted to get in our rooms to change. Other than that, the hotel was clean and most staff was pretty friendly. I would go back.

title: Friendly Staff
text: Our time at the hotel was made enjoyable by some of the staff we met but most especially Anna at the restaurant during breakfast. She was such a pleasant individual and lovely to a fault. We enjoyed the view of the time square and because of its strategic location, we were able to visit different places by foot! Overall, our time there was good as we looked out for Anna everytime we went to breakfast.

title: Perfect location right in Times square
text:
This hotel is the perfect spot, located in the Theater District, between the 48th and the 49th street, right in Times square. When you exit the hotel on any of these streets you are just facing many theaters where are performing some of the famous and best Broadway shows.
Very busy hotel in Summer time with the tourists, it is very convenient, good accommodation and provides a nice coffee shop restaurant with good food and good service. But avoid the kind of deli corner at the reception floor, very expensive for what you get, getter have a short walk on the street!
Rooms offer large space, despite the furniture and the carpet are somewhat worn out, but it is ok. Bathrooms are large and clean. I had a little concern about the floor structure that you can feel worked somewhat and is not flat anymore and this is a concern especially when you are staying in a high rise.
The price is reaching the expensive range but not the luxury range and it is a good value price compared to some other hotel in the area with better prices but a very bad experience I had 2 years ago.

title: מלון נהדר
text: חדרים נקיים מאוד, צוות מעולה ואדיב מאוד , התארחתי 3 פעמים ותמיד אותו שרות , הגעתי למלון בכל פעם ב08:00 אחרי טיסה ומיד נתנו את החדר מבלי לחכות עד 15:00 , ארוחת הבוקר נהדרת ועשירה מאוד במונחים אמרקאים , המלון יושב ברחוב 49 על שדרת ברודויי צמוד למלון תחנת רכבת תחתית 49 עם הקו הצהוב  , הטים סקואר במרחק 2 רחובות שזה  דקה הליכה , במלון יש בר ולובי פעיל מאוד ונעים מאוד בכל שעות היום התמונות הם מחלון החדר

title: Got to love it!!!!
text:
This hotel is located at the north end of times square.
Perfect for theaters and restaurants.  46 stories high and every floor is great.  
We have used this location for many years and everytime we are pleased.  Contributing to our happiness this year, were some noteworthy staff members: James at check in; Milton at the concierge desk; Jason, Kim, Philip, and Anthony - the great bar team; and  Travis in the  dining room.  All made our stay enjoyable.  Special mention also to Chris for his attention to our well-being.
We highly recommend this location for your best stay in Manhattan. 
Marva😇and Bruce 😎Topping

title: Great steak
text: Celebrating a birthday so chose TGI’s .... good choice! The steak was amazing as was the accompaniments. A wee bit pricey but couldn’t fault the food and the service. Waited 20 minutes to receive the food from ordering it which I thought was good considering how packed it was 🙂🙂

title: the worst hotel ever
text:
As you can see from the photos, pieces of paint were falling from the ceiling and the smell in the room was very nasty.
We stayed in this hotel for eight days and had daily problems with hot water.  We hardly managed to shower because the water was always cold.
At the elevators it was always crowded and you had to wait for good minutes to get to the room or to leave the hotel.
One day we had to go down 28 floors on the fire staires because the elevators were blocked and we waited more than 15 minutes.
We asked for our room to be changed, but we received one just like the first room.  In this hotel there is no refrigerator in the room which is inadmissible for a 4 star hotel.
The two beds in the room were so small that the children could hardly sleep.
The Internet was  pretty hard and was disconnected after a few minutes.
In short it is a hotel too expensive for the services it offers.

title: Hot mess from start to finish!
text: Our whole reason for going to NYC was for my husbands birthday. I called the hotel two days prior to arrival to arrange an amenity to be left in the room for his birthday. I was sent a credit card authorization form and a guest amenity form. I filled those out and faxed them to the number I was given. I called to make sure it was received which the fax never was so I emailed them to the person I spoke to on the phone and she forwarded to the food and beverage manager. The next day we’re driving to the airport and my husband receives a phone call from the hotel asking to speak with me. He already knows something is up now because I had to try and explain what I wanted the surprise to be over the phone. They told me they never got the form and I was transferred to someone in food and beverage. They also told me the my never got the fax or email and I told them the number on the amenity form I wanted which was a six pack of beer and chips and dip. Well apparently the form they had was different than mine because the choices for that number was different. I kept telling her what I wanted and she kept asking if I wanted a birthday cake. I was getting so frustrated I was ready to cancel everything and that’s when they told me they’d handle it. The next day we’re checking in and we go to dinner and realize our door doesn’t lock behind us. We go downstairs tell the front desk they apologize and call security to fix it right then. We leave for dinner and come back 2 hours later to find it had not been fixed. We’re infuriated now because our things had been unlocked for 2 hours. We get a hold of the manager who apologized and said she can transfer us to another room. So I pack everything up and during this time security comes and fixes the door in less than a minute. Why wasn’t this done two hours prior? By that time the manager shows up and asks if we want to stay in the room since it’s fixed now. Um NO I’ve already packed everything up. So we take the elevator to the different room only to find that room ALREADY HAD PEOPLE IN IT. By this time I’m just thinking all of it is a joke so manager comes back up there and sends us to another room with a “better view” we now go to the third room which doesn’t have a better view but whatever we were tired of moving. While we were in our first room we went to get ice and the machine didn’t work. I called the front desk and asked if they could bring some up and I was told to go down to another floor to get ice. Really?! I shouldn’t have to do that. This hotel has poor customer service and is not the luxury you expect when staying in Times Square. I will never be back to this hotel and will never recommend it to anyone.

title: Great Location. Don’t stay high up, Elevator Service Terrible
text: Booked this hotel as my meetings were directly across the street. The room was nice and clean and well appointed. I was very late for all my meetings because of the elevators, you couldn’t get on an elevator to go down. I think 2 of the four high rise elevators were out of commission. Tip, take the service elevators behind the employees only door, elevators were immediately available. Don’t dine there, food is just ok but the service staff are extremely unprofessional and cranky. So many nicer places to stay. Chris addressed my concerns by giving me a free late checkout, which was really appreciated, but not enough to make me go back. Location Awesome.

title: Bon sejour
text:
L’hotel Est très correct. Par contre les lits prévus pour 2 personnes sont étroits mais la literie est excellente.
Petit déjeuner complet et très bon. 
Les points forts: la situation parfaite de l’ hôtel et surtout l’ Accueil au bar et au restaurant. Un merci particulier à Ana qui a su nous accueillir avec beaucoup d’attention et de gentillesse

title: Lovely hotel in times square..
text:
The property is ideally located in times square..

Pls do not even consider keeping a car in NYC.. it will get very frustrating..

Most attractions / places are accessible by walking and Subway.. plenty of Subway options in close proximity to the hotel..

I would recommend the hotel to all visitors (individuals and families) planning a trip to NYC..

title: Location is superb, other aspects (if they matter) are fair or average!
text:
As mentioned in the title, the location is everything about this hotel. Being at Times Square is a great plus for this hotel, close to several attractions, sub-way station and city tour buses. As a matter of fact the Times Square is a good hub to start an activity or to return to at the end of the day to spend nice time. Major concern is about queen bed size which doesn’t fit by any means to two persons! We tried same bed type in other hotels at USA and found those to be a bit larger! We booked 2 Queen beds room for 2 kids and two adults and unfortunately a queen bid didn’t fit even the two kids!
Cleanliness is good but rooms are a bit old and need renovation. Hotel staff are helpful though they are also quite tough but still professional :) maybe due to the workload ! Checkout is sharp at 11 am, one hour extension is 25$ !! Tried to extend one hour and they insisted to charge 25$ per hour. I understand this is due to hotel is maybe fully booked. Check in was easy. WiFi is good inside the rooms. Overall experience is fair.

title: Huge complex
text: This hotel is big (nearly 800 rooms), a fact that makes any personal treatment impossible. The guest is a number, just part of the flow. It seems easier to get tourist information via social media (TripAdvisor) than through the staff, always busy. The rooms are clean, standardized, ceilings low. No particular charme nor view. Times Square is a busy place, full of tourists and we will not stay there again.

title: Service without smile
text: I’m being pretty generous here with 3 stars, the hotel location is extremely awesome and central we get to check-in early which is great the room is decent size but no bar fridge so if you need cold water at night you won’t have it. The check out was easy but the bell man Kam is terrible to dealt with I felt like someone force him to be at work no smile and terrible manner which wasn’t nice to dealt with when you are on holiday.

title: Great Location
text:
For a quick 2 nights visit to New York I thought it was best to stay as central as possible, and booked 2 nights for 5 people. Booking and room location was as asked for, and off course you can’t really complain at the location.

However the first impression when you arrive is not very good, and I guess it didn’t help when we waited in a line for more than 20 min to get checked in. Especially when you have just arrived in the US and want to go to bed. The rooms we had was typical the US , two large queen beds per room, big telly a long desk and one armchair. The room was booked to have a view to Times Square, and yes if you leant on the window and looked right you did see it, was that worth the extra money? No.

Woke up early next morning and no warm water in the shower, so it was a cold start for us all. Made the reception staff aware of this and it was fixed by morning 2, however not much of a compensation was offered for this inconvenience.... the bathroom and bedroom could do with a refresh, especially the bathroom where railings where hanging off the wall.

Breakfast both days was superb, and it I would highlight any staff groups it would be the breakfast staff. Great cold and warm choice selections of all you could want to eat and drink for breakfast.

We used the bar downstairs one late evening and it was pleasant enough. The hotel also had a good bakery / snack shop at reception level which was very good.

Would I stay here again? Based on the high price and other options of global brand hotels nearby, I guess I would try another one.

title: Decent hotel
text:
This is a decent hotel right in the thick of things in Times Square. There are several food options and the prices weren’t ridiculous. Overall the staff was friendly with the exception of one person in the restaurant-I believe she was the hostess or manager. She was downright rude and could be reminded how to properly treat customers. 
There was an anime convention while we were visiting which was a bit overwhelming but it was only for a couple of days so tolerable. 
The rooms are big for NYC which was great but a little tired with ripped curtains and musty smell.

title: Great Location!
text:
We stayed at the Crowne for almost a week while in the city. 
Loved the location. Close to great restaurants and theatres. 
Our room was ready when we arrived so we got to check in right away which was great. 
Staff was friendly and attentive. 
There were four of us (all adults) sharing a room and it was very comfortable. 
Slept like a baby every night. 
Have stayed here before and will definitely come back!

title: Great Location but felt property needed help
text: First off I know location is king, especially in Manhattan. But with that said you charge a certain amount your clientele expect their monies worth. Nowhere was I told this building was under construction made it hard for an out of towner to find the building. Once inside things where much better. Cleaner and more up to date, other than all of the lobby area windows covered in construction tarp. Check in took a bit as they were busy and there wasn't a large waiting line area so we all felt cramped. The check in process itself went fairly quickly but it the rep had to call someone to switch a room fro us(?) they did was give us two drink coupons for the small bar they have in the check in area. The room itself was clean and has an amazing view for times square.(which we had purchased). But the toilet paper holder was falling out of the wall. The shower on/off handle would spin and didn't seem to be bolted in?!?! We had reserved the room for 3 days and we were a family of four, they always seem to give only enough towels for three. So we called down and had some more delivered and they did promptly deliver them. But each day they cleaned our room they gave us less and less of everything. Started with 4 coffee pods and the final day we were there they left only one. Started with three sets of towels final days was left 2 sets. Just seemed very odd. Again the location was great being only steps away Times Square and a multitude of attractions and shops. But not worth the price we paid. Not only was the hotel expensive but we ended up paying more than $240 just to have our car valet parked through the hotel for three days. Again I know NYC is expensive but at some point you need to feel you got your monies worth somewhat.

title: HIDDEN COSTS!!!!
text:
We had stayed at a Crowne Plaza in Lake Placid a few weeks ago and were not entirely happy considering what we paid. Still, we thought we would try this one figuring maybe the last stay was a one-off anomaly. Well, the place was fairly run down. I don't think there were any problems that could have been rectified by the staff, certain things were too far gone. Maybe the mold on the shower ceiling, but nothing else. 

When we checked out, we learned of all the taxes. Many of them.  Not the hotel's fault; that's New York for you. Nickle and diming the tourist. 

You have to park in the parking garage which is a part of the hotel. I'll say it again because this is important. The parking garage is part of the hotel. 

We checked in on Sunday and out on Tuesday. $140 for that time. We hadn't gotten the car at any point so it just sat there. This is not advertised anywhere and it would appear the cost is part of your hotel stay. It is not. 

In checking out, we paid almost $200 more than we expected to after already dealing with high prices for everything over 2 days. The deal clerk said it's a different company completely and they have no control over it. EVEN THOUGH IT IS A PART OF THE HOTEL! 

I get it. It's New York and they can get away with it because there's no shortage of tourists. I would say stay away from the city entirely unless money is no object to you.

title: Tired, unfriendly and in need of TLC
text:
After staying at another hotel a couple of years ago I thought I would give this one a try as nearer to Times Square.
I am disappointed with the standard of decor in the rooms and public places. Some of the areas are ok and some need a good clean and modernisation.
We had a problem with our TV and the engineer responded quickly only to be scolded that a cable had come out from the back which clearly he thought we should know. He had to pull the unit out to sort it - that’s something you do on holiday - NOT! The guy who seemed Russian needed a course in how to speak to the hotel guests and provide the best service to customers. It was appalling how rude he is!
Safe is actually missing in our room so nowhere to store valuables unless we want to go to reception 33 floors down every time we need our money or valuables.
Carpets are tired as are some of the blackout curtains which have tears in them and windows are shabby.
On the plus side the location is good and that’s the best I can say on it.  Will return to the Sheraton next time on 7th Avenue in a heartbeat for comfort and cleanliness. 
Very disappointing.

title: Posizione top il resto nella norma
text:
Dalle finestre si vede il caos di Times Square con le mille luci che la distinguono tutto il giorno 
Questo basta per venirci
Il resto normale 
Camere un po’ vecchiotte soprattutto il bagno ma va bene così

title: Two Stars Hotel
text:
Rooms are stinky and not clean.. Don’t surprise seeing a piece of cookie under your bed waiting you. You can smell and feel the dusty everywhere..Exactly you like inhaling the dust while you are in the room.. cover sheets noticed with dirt marks from previous resident..
this reminded me of a two stars hotel in an area called Albat’ha back at the downtown in our country.. my people understand what’s I am saying.. guys it’s of the same style and concept of a two stars hotel.. my advise: they hacked you by the nice pictures on the websites. Or some people could be attracted by the location....It’s a trap! Get rid of your dreams. Don’t even think about it. Believe me, location is not always everything, especially with well connected dots all over the city

title: All about location!
text:
We stayed with your 2 kids at this hotel last july. The hotel is idealy located right on Times Square! Staff was really friendly, especially Donald at the reception who did everything to make sure we have a pleasant stay! 
The down side is the pool, really not as you see on the website... We went as the end of the day and the attendant said we couldn't go because we did not bring swimcaps... We decided not to go anyway as it is really not a nice pool and not kid's friendly. 
For the rest evertyhing was great, as i wrote in the title, you go there for the location! 
Ask for a corner room, you will have an astonishing view on Times Square!

title: Nice hotel
text:
The location is really amazing right beside Times Square and has comparatively large rooms with amazing views.

We were a family of four and were very comfortable in a traditional double with two double beds. The room was spacious and we had a great view to the north.

The downside is that the hotel, just like the surrounding area is crowded and often hectic. During our stay there was renovation going on on the main entrance so we had to enter through the "back" which was a bit annoying.

There is a swimming pool at the hotel but it requires the wearing of swimming caps and is mostly geared towards lane swimmers so we were discouraged from taking our children there although it would have been nice in the summer heat.

I would recommend this hotel for families and leisure travelers to NYC, would probably stay somewhere else for business.

title: Jonathon is a super hero
text:
Popping in to say that Jonathan sorted out my reservation fabulously.

I made a mistake when I booked my rooms.  What I wanted wasn’t available but Jonathan worked front desk magic and made it happen.

So far a great start to our weekend.

title: The best manager
text: I was visiting from UAE and the Manager Jonathan helped me so much with getting me a connecting room next to my 2 daughters when my travel agency failed to inform me that I needed a connecting package to guarantee this kind of room. Thank you Jonathan for swooping into action and making my stay  IN NYC very comfortable. If you go to the Crowne Plaza ask for the Manager Jonathan he is kind and will help you with whatever you need.

title: One night stand
text: Nice hotel, clean, fresh, great location, nice view. The lowest is 28th and still good. Jonathan at check in was 5 star. Very nice! Nice bathroom with soft lighting, fast elevators, plenty of outlets.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: The service was professional and pleasent, you could get coffee and a pastry at the coffe shop not having to run out first thing in the morning. It is near shoping and the theather district. I would stay there again.

title: Front desk and Broadway 49 Bar
text:
Sandra at the IHG Member front desk was superb!   She was a pleasant moment amongst the hustle.  Quick to help and make us feel welcome.   

Joanie and Anthony at the bar crafted an excellent espresso martini!  Quite delicious.

title: Great service from Front Desk!
text: Had really wonderful service from Sandra, who welcomed us at the front desk and gave us an early check in! The room’s great and the location’s wonderful too! :) will be back the next time I visit New York!

title: Underwhelmed by this hotel
text: After arriving from the UK we arrived at the Crowne Plaza the front main entrance is currently not in use which meant using the back of the hotel to access entry. Our room was on the 36 th floor it was adequate although slightly cramped for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. We slept well and the beds are comfortable. We wrongly choose to eat breakfast the following morning  in the hotel restaurant thinking of convenience to start the day of sightseeing. The food was of good quality with all the usual fare, the coffee however was bitter and unpleasant. The cost of all this amounted to $173.43 including service charges and the mandatory tip. This was the most expensive meal we had throughout our stay in New York and for a 4* mid range hotel we though it was extortionate. Needless to say this was our one and only meal experience at our hotel and it left us feeling underwhelmed about this place. For this reason I will not be recommending the Crowne Plaza Times Square yes it's location is the best thing about it but there are so many others to choose from and we just felt ripped off.

title: Holiday
text: I loved Time square. The city that never sleeps. Arrived very late in the evening. People enjoyed gathering. Late night souvenir shops open. If you're feeling hungry shops open too. Every few min, the huge big screen (if you're postioned ) shows you on it. Great night life

title: Opinión sobre el hotel
text:
Muy recomendable, muy limpio ; me gustó que incluyen el desayuno el cual es excelente.
Cerca del Hotel se encuentra varios opciónes para tomar el metro y moverse a un precio muy bajo por todo New York. A  pocos minutos de Time scuare.

title: Wont be back!
text: We were so excited to stay at the Crowne, big let down. Called to say we were checking in late, they were rude on the phone. Checked in and the gentleman checking me in was so incredibly rude, I’ve never been treated that way. He spoke over me when I asked a question and treated me like he didn’t have the patience to deal with us. When I got to my room I was even more disgusted. It was so old, out dated, and dirty!  I refused to use the shower due to the black mold and dirty towels in the bathroom!  We stay in the city year, enjoying every place, and this was the worst experience I’ve had! I will not be returning!

title: Sandra at check in
text:
Sandra Esp was amazing and really friendly at check in. Because we arrived early Sandra was super kind and let us check in early, so we could sleep after our long flight. She was also talking to us while we waited!
Thank you so much Sandra!
From Jess age 11

title: Debonair dancing on Broadway!
text: The hotel was in a good location in Times Square. We were on the 33rd floor, corner room and had a lovely view of the Hudson River. Room was clean and comfortable although the air con wasn't brill. We didn't air this issue with the hotel as we weren't in the room too long and the window was sufficient for night time. Sirens are to be expected and you soon get used to them!  The reception was very helpful as was concierge also the doorman.  The bar area was modern and comfortable, prices pretty average for NY, 2 wine, 2 Bacardi and coke, 2 cider and 1 mocktail, $98.00.  We didn't eat here as plenty of eateries in Times Square. Be aware both sexes need to cover their hair if you wish to use the pool. Lifts worked fine whilst there. Coffee machine in the room is vessel whereby you fill the top back part with water (one cup full) place cup in the hole in the front, you can place a tea bag or coffee bag (yes coffee bag!) in the pull out holder above the cup area, press button and hey presto a drink! Only powder creamer so we took our own milk pots! You can pop dwn to the canteen and get some milk and extra cups.

title: Outstanding IHG Platinum Elite Service
text:
Having been up since 3:00 a.m. and completely exhausted from travel, we were disappointed to find that, although pleasant enough, the front desk staff could not provide us with a room anywhere in the hotel. We went to get something to eat and then returned to the front desk to request a small refrigerator in our room, whenever it should become available. However, this time we had the good fortune to speak with Sandra at the IHG Platinum Elite desk.

When I asked about the refrigerator, her immediate response was “Let’s get you in a room first, so your husband can get some rest”. Within less than one minute, she had handed us a set of room keys and called to have a refrigerator delivered to the room at no charge. Sandra then thanked us for being Platinum members and sent us off to our room. Within five minutes of entering the room, Sandra personally called to ensure that everything was to our liking. As soon as I hung up the phone, there was a knock on the door, which turned out to be the refrigerator with two complimentary bottles of water.

Sandra is professional, thoughtful, and empowered. Rather than telling us what she couldn’t do for us (as her coworkers had), she utilized her resources to show us what she could do. Rarely have we encountered such courteous efficiency, in any hotel around the world. Someone with her customer service skills should be in management, but that would be a terrible loss to the hotel’s guests.

title: Great location and views from top floors
text: Spent two weeks here to fully explore New York. Service was good accommodation n was good for the high price but expected to pay a premium because of the hotels location. Ate out every day so cannot comment on the food offering. Try The Blue Fin Restaurant just down the block towards Broadway. Supeb

title: US/Canada Cities
text: Visited this hotel with my family of 4 whilst travelling to various cities in the US and Canada. Location was excellent. Considering the size of the hotel and it’s location, the noise was minimal. The only bad point was that the front entrance was out of action😞. I would have thought that repair work and renovations would take place out of high season. They kindly offered us 2 free drinks from the bar during our stay and we were able to order complimentary water to our room.

title: Nice amenities
text: Great location close to all the action.  Very clean and comfortable.  Fairly quiet for NYC.  The bar staff was excellent and knowledgeable in all things New York.  Overall good value for the location.  Comparable to most Crown Plazas

title: Peor hotel en Nueva York
text: Nos hospedamos del Viernes 26 de Julio al Miercoles 31 de Agosto, las dos veces que pedimos room service casi terminamos en el hospital intoxicados , tambien todos los empeados pesimo trato, muy groseros, mala  actitud , no volvemos, mejor quedense en el hotel w tiene mejor servicio ubicacion y todo

title: The best experience.
text: The best experience. While it was expensive and packed during Christmas holiday they upgraded my room to top floor and the view was amazing. The location was perfect. Service was great, too. One staff by the elevator was very nice that he warned me about the phone hanging in my pocket I might have lost. I would definitely stay again.

title: Freddy @ the front desk was amazing
text:
I’ll admit this is kind of a weird review for me in that as Marriott Bonvoy Titanium Elite members, my family almost exclusively stays at Marriott properties. 
However, last night my son and I found ourselves in the lobby of the beautiful Crowne Plaza Times Sq Broadway hotel and needed a small favor. Front desk agent Freddy went out of his way to help us and I wanted to recognize him and the hotel, because I had disclosed I wasn’t a current guest at the property. 
In any case, thank you Freddy and the entire Crowne Plaza team for saving our Saturday in NYC. 
We will be staying at a Crowne Plaza in the near future thanks to outstanding customer service from people like Freddy!

title: Perfecta localización
text: El hotel es hermoso con un amplio Lobby aunque un poco ruidoso, las habitaciones son formidables para mi gusto, perfecta vista para vivir la experiencia de estar en un rascacielo y tener un hermoso despertar con la luz del día en piso 44😚😚, el personal de la recepción no es tan cooperador para asistencia al cliente y el teléfono nunca lo contestaron cuando quise☹ ordenar alguna bebida, (aún recibiendo una hermosa carta por parte del director, es una pena) entiendo que pueden mejorar el servicio del minibar y el ballet parking para que el costo valga la pena

title: Great location and great value
text:
I spent months researching every hotel in the immediate vicinity of Times Square and finally selected Crown Plaza and I am so glad I did!  If you are looking for the best location on Times Square while being close to the theatres, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and 5th avenue and a good value, this is your choice! You are close to the subway stations can walk to many of the local sites.  There's no need to stay at any of the more expensive hotels on Times Square as the crowds are far worse the closer you get to 45th-42nd.  This one still has all the views with a little breathing room while you walk!   Those on the side streets, while convenient, don't have a view at all since they are shorter building facing side streets. 

While the hotel does have a little wear, it's really trivial.  Unless you are used to and expect extremely high end experiences only, you will find this one clean, well kept and perfect for your stay.  They are doing a bit of construction on the front entry which means you enter on the sides, but that seriously doesn't matter.   

We had a bit of a snafu with our Booking.com reservation, but Crown Plaza took care of everything. Big shout out to Val who contacted me while I was en route and reassured me all was still booked and we'd be taken care of and to Donald at the front desk who was super friendly, helpful and really a great representative of their hotel!  In the end, they honored our rate and gave us some complimentary food vouchers which was a huge help and got us to eat at their hotel each day.  Their restaurant, Brassiere 49, has a great view, good food and is the perfect place to sit and take a break during the day or a the end of the day.

If I had anything I would suggest they work on it would be 1)  The older gentlemen staff at Grind was NOT friendly, bordering rude and made me dread getting my morning coffee.  2)  When booking large kids groups, keep them in their own part of the hotel.  We had a room next to a kids group where clearly there were no chaperones as the kids were running around wild for hours in the evening and super obnoxious.  I had to call the front desk one of the nights and they sent security up...who handled it quickly.  But still, young teens should not be left to roam these hotels so freely and obnoxiously.  This could have happened anywhere, I just think the hotel should book them away from their other guests.

title: Dinner
text: We got dinner at the restaurant hotel and it was absolutely wonderful! We had a wonderful server--Rahi-- who went above and beyond. There was a birthday in the family and he tended to that as well, making it extremely special for our family. If you happen to eat here, make sure to ask for him; he exemplifies incredible customer service.

title: So Lovely
text: I stayed here for two nights while I did some sightseeing and a conference. I’ve stayed at other New York hotels and this one is definitely the best. So clean, so friendly, and so convenient. I was traveling by myself but there were a lot of children and families. I would definitely bring the whole family here. The price might look more, But it’s actually a value for the quality and service you get.

title: Very poor hotel
text: Poor hotel! Stayed here many years ago and was impressed, so I decided to return with my children.  What a mistake! The Receptionist was rude upon arrival and appeared annoyed I asked what was included in the resort fee, which is added onto the room cost upon arrival. Apparently, it entitles us to WiFi and two free drinks for the duration of our stay.   There are four of us travelling!  Two free drinks on a four night trip? Would I only get half a drink if we’d stayed one night?!The rooms are run down and outdated.  We’re currently sat waiting for somebody to deal with a blocked bath at 11pm when I was told they’d be with me straight away at 10pm.  I think the fact they’re so busy dealing with problems shows how dilapidated the hotel is. Save yourself and go elsewhere...!

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed for 5 nights - room  only. Great location, nice big rooms would definitely stay again. Plenty of restaurants at your doorstep with reasonable priced food and drink and a walk away from shopping and theatres.

title: Great Experience- Friendly Staff
text: Whilst drinking in the bar one evening, we got talking to Rahl, mentioned it was mine and my grandmothers birthday present to come New York, he quickly organised a massive slice of chocolate cake to be bought to the table free of charge. Friendly staff and great location for all things to do in New York. Allison on the concierge was great, helped us a lot!!

title: Great experience with staff
text: I took my daughter down to NYC for a one-night stay at the hotel so she could see Wicked for the first time. After mentioning that it was an early birthday present for her to the front desk check-in clerk, Rosa, she asked us whether my daughter liked chocolate, and had me write her name on our check-in paperwork. While it felt like she was making small talk about visiting the Hershey's Store or M&M Store (which are nearby), we said yes, and then completed the check in. Later that night, after we returned from the store, we entered our room and saw that Rosa had sent up a slice of chocolate cake and two sodas, along with a very nice note wishing her a happy birthday. This amazing customer service made us feel very special, and we enjoyed our stay even more. Thank you, Rosa, for making my daughter's birthday trip even more special!!!

title: Great stay in NYC
text: The Crown Plaza was a great place to stay on Times Square. We had 2 rooms and both were very nice. One looked at the Hudson River and the other viewed Times Square. We saw three Broadway shows with each an easy walk from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

title: Un caos.
text:
Me hospede en dos oportunidades.
CHECK IN: mucha gente, mucha fila. 
INFORMACION: Mala, me indicaron  telefonicamente  en IHG que podia dejar valijas en deposito mientras viajaba a otras ciudades pero la informacion fue erronea y no me las aceptaron. 
HABITACIONES: Muy pequeñas e incomodas, Tomamos  2 habitaciones  y no estaban conectadas. Con niños chicos se complico. Es increible que en 48 pisos de hotel no habia una sola habitacion conectada incluso doñicitando categorias superiores. 
BAR DEL LOBY:  malo y sucio. Tardan mucho en atender, es desagradable toda la gente tirada acostada en los sillones del bar por todos lados sin consumir esperando ingresar al hotel. 
ASCENSORES . Tenes que tener la suerte que te den un piso  alto (+40) para que cuando quieras bajar al loby el ascensor tenga poca gente y puedas ingresar, sino a pesar que hay dos tramos de ascensor tenes muchos  minutos de espera.  
Las habitaciones NO tienen frigobar. Hay maquinas de expendio de coca, agua y sprite en cada piso. 
KIOSCO DE VENTA PARA DESAYUNO: Tiene mala atencion. 
ROOM SERVICE: bueno, pero a partir de 1630
LIMPIEZA: ok
No volveria

title: Not as good as expected
text: The beds very comfortable and location is brilliant. Very disappointed with our view from our room we were looking onto another tower block....the room didn’t have a fridge or mini bar.. resort fee we thought was $20 per night per room but it was per person per night so we had to pay over $320 for 4 night stay. All the staff were friendly and helpful except the guy we checked out with, not even a good morning from him. Overall the hotel is in a good spot with easy excess to great places but wouldn’t return. We’ve stayed in the empire, the Sheraton and Belvedere on previous visits which is just round the corner and it wasn’t as expensive and had great views from our room.

title: Perfect location, excelent staff
text:
The hotel is located right at the Times Square, a perfect location in the middle of Manhattan. Rooms well maintained, bed comfortable. Quite busy hotel, the lobby bar, the front desk and especially the elevators can be crowded at times. 

The staff is excellent, their attitude is great and they are very helpful – be it at the front desk, in the bar, or at breakfast. In particular, Sandra Esp. at the front desk was amazing, she helped me a lot with my complicated booking and billing requests. Thank you, Sandra!

title: Excelente localizaçao
text: Hotel no coração de NY, da onde pode acesar à grande parte dos pontos turistícos a pé ou perto de muitas estações de metrô. Quarto grande limo e espaçoso. Só que pelo valor de diária devia incluir cafe de manhã grátis.

title: Awesome!
text: Had a great time here! The hotel was connected to a studio I was visiting and it was very convenient and cool. our front desk associate Donald, was very nice and accommodating he also had a super nice tie 10/10

title: Beware!  Check your bill!
text:
The service at this hotel is awful and the manager is shifty and charged me more than my guaranteed rate  I am filing a complaint with the Attorney General's Office for Consumer Affairs,  Check your bill or better yet, book a well managed and trustworthy hotel elsewhere.
Buyer beware!

title: Perfect Location for Broadway Shows
text: My daughter and I just completed a 3 night stay at this property and the location was perfect! We saw 3 shows and loved the convenience of being so close to all the theaters. We had a King room and for NY, the room size was nice. We ate at the Bar 49 restaurant one evening before a show, the waiter was good, but had too many tables, it took forever to get our check paid and we were almost late for a show. Also, we had the spinach and artichoke dip, which was very good, however you get a generous serving of dip but only 5 small slices of baguette...we had to ask for more bread, they brought 3 more slices,  there was a lot of dip left over...what a waste!

title: Dont trust this hotel
text:
When I made the reservation I was told 2,276.00 Arbitrately the hotel withhold 300.00 The bill says 2927.00 I 
I will never stay in one of the hotels. Poor customer service. The only nice people are in the buffet.

title: Best service and superb hotel
text: The customer excellence from Evelyn at the front desk was just outstanding She helped to make our vacation amazing and the hotel itself is in the perfect location. Highly recommended and we will definitely look to return.

title: Juste moyen
text:
L'entrée principale en travaux,  quel dommage pas tres joli du coup pour les premières impressions. La chambre donne une vue panoramique sur times square mais on entend les sirènes et klaxons dans la nuit même au 37e etage. La clim fonctionne bien mais on entend un ronronnement toute la nuit si vous laissez la clim toute la nuit.  Wifi fonctionne bien. Salle de bain vieille, les produits shampoings, crème... sont minuscules,  nous avons du en demander à l'accueil. Service Laverie pas dispo le week-end. 
Petit déjeuner 28$ par personne,  nous n'avons pas testé,  une mini boutique de boisson chaud et froid et de viennoiseries disponible derrière l'accueil

title: World Pride
text: Rosa at the front desk really made us feel welcome. This was great as I had called the hotel 2 days prior to my arrival and was given all sorts of incorrect information.I did find the rooms to be over priced and I used a discount that was available to me. The room seemed a little worn. The food and drinks were great. The location was perfect. I would most likely stay here again.

title: Excellent Location
text: This hotel is in an EXCELLENT LOCATION right in the middle of everything.  Arrived late and was able to jump into vacation mode Juniors is right across the street and is a MUST!!!! Beds were very comfortable and room was very clean. I would definitely stay here again!!!!

title: Não caia nessa!!!
text: O hotel está péssimo, super descuidado, não tem o mesmo padrão, quartos com mal cheiro, sujos, carpetes e cortinas imundos de ácaros, ar condicionado não funciona bem, elevadores com problema, percebe-se o descuido!! Não vale a pena! Caro e péssimo! Desde o atendimento até os quartos, nem frigobar tem!!

title: Great locatio
text: We had a great experience checking and each night the room was clean and ready to start over.  Great location. The food prices reasonable but window seats limited.  During the loss of power we were still able to get to our rooms.  Over all,  great experience. I would say don’t book shows from here there are better ways and less expensive. the picture was taken at the corner from the hotel.

title: See Travis in the morning, He's one more reason to stay...
text:
I've spend the last two weeks in this hotel and as I'll be returning to the area 2 more weeks next month, my reservation is happily made. From check in to out it has been a joy to stay here. Beds are the most comfortable around. Rooms are less claustrophobic than others in the area. Very quick walk to surrounding areas with plenty of options for everything. 

Do stop by and see Travis Sherrod in the Restaurant in the mornings. He is quick with a coffee pot, smile and pleasant quip as well. Really made my mornings.

title: Nice hotel - really over-priced and medicore quality (at best) breakfast
text:
Visiting Crown Plaza for the first time - however definitely not the first time in NYC.

Arrival: despite arrival at 6 PM, room was not ready. Took a while - and only after a talk with the manager, a room was magically found.

Rom: Nice, clean and large for NYC. 

Black-out: The July black-out of NYC happend while we were there - and the staff handled it like a charm. Water available at reception, one elevator servicing some fælles working, and we could actually get into our rooms. 

Breakfast: The in-house cafe is good - with an okay selection of Pastries. 

Avoid the breakfast buffet!  Even with a discount from 140 USD (4 adults) to around 70 USD is extremely overpriced. Quality of food was really not amazing, bagels not fresh (they were way better in the cafe!), and fruit without much taste. Not worth the money!

All in all an okay stay - but there are plenty of “okay stays” in Manhattan with a better mix between overall price and quality.

title: Favorite hotel in New York City
text:
We love this hotel. The service is great--housekeeping is first class. Front desk staff is welcoming. 
Location is great for those of us attending theater.

A word about the toiletries. LOVE LOVE LOVE BEEKMAN 1802 products. Because I have sampled them here, I have bought shampoo, lotion, shower gel

title: Two Nights in NYC
text: Overall I highly recommend this hotel.  The rooms were clean, the elevator was super fast, the check-in / check-put process was smooth, they gave to free drinks at the bar, there is a cafe on site, the location cannot be beat.  You are in the heart of the theater district.  Walking distance to every touristy place in NYC.  Since everything in NYC is so expensive it was nice not to have to pay for a taxi.  The one con is the parking situation.  When we arrived it was backed up and we had to wait 20 minutes for a valet to be available.  Also it took 20 minutes for them to get our car when we were leaving.  The biggest issue is the price per night for parking...$70!!!   I know that is standard for parking in NYC but it really hurts.

title: Fun Trip!
text: My wife and I came In on June 30th. My family and I have been coming to this hotel for close to 15 years. This means we have made some great friends at the bar haha! Not only did we make friends with other guests but with the staff. Karim is one of the managers who is super friendly and a snappy dresser. He always treats us so well and always makes us laugh. Behind the bar Jason, Phil and Martin make amazing drinks while making us spit them out because we are laughing so hard. If you sit at a table Tony is the man to see, great service and very fun. The hotel itself has amazing views of the greatest city in the world! It is very clean and modern. We will continue to return and excited to make new friends!

title: Best Location in NYC
text: Perfect location for a week or weekend in New York. Wonderful helpful staff. Front Desk efficient and friendly. Special mention of Victoria and Sandra . Both were very helpful.  Morning buffet was great. Our waiter Ali started our day with great friendly service. Looking forward to my return.

title: Quartos bons e ótima localização
text:
Minha família de quatro pessoas ficou hospedada neste hotel por 7 noites. Os quartos são pequenos, mas são novos, limpos, com frigobar e microondas. Atendeu plenamente nossas necessidades.
A localização do hotel é muito boa, fica a poucos quarteirões dos teatros da broadway, perto de estações de metrô, restaurantes e lojas de conveniência.
Nossa experiência foi positiva, principalmente porque conseguimos uma diária com preço bastante razoável.

title: Central Location, good rooms, swimming pool a bit crap
text:
We stayed here for 5 days in July. 

Location - Cannot get better than this! so central. 50th St subway station close by for getting around. 
Room - Spacious and clean, huge bed and lovely bathroom - though no bath. 
We didn't eat here so can't comment, although as it was my birthday they did leave a huge slice of cake and bottle of prosecco in the room and the cake was delicious! We also received 2 bar tokens on arrival and instead of having to sit down at the bar, the barman offered for us to take them back to our room which we were delighted with. 

Resort fee - We were prepared for this when we arrived - so no biggie. Please read the small print before you book. $40.16 per day that you are there. 

Swimming pool - On a hot day we decided to come back to the hotel and use the swimming pool we had paid for. You must have your own padlock for the lockers. 
Quite strict, lane swimming and had to wear a shower cap. 
The swimming pool needs some TLC. Not great. Considering we paid $40.16 a day for it on arrival. 

Would definitely stay here again!

title: Excellent location. Right on times square
text:
Location near Time Square was very convenient and was well within walking distance of many Broadway theaters. Also, plenty of restaurants and shops to choose from. Food Emporium on 49th St. just down the block was excellent.
酒店位置佳，出门就是第五大道，几步就到时代广场.
无电冰箱、无送两瓶免费矿泉水。
check in 前台人员态度冰冷，但checkout时另一前台又很热情。

title: Receptionist Donald Mei is great!!!
text: When we checked in at the first day,Donald helped us a lot.He was so kind and helpful.Besides Crowne Plaza had good location,nice service,good restaurant and bar.We had a wonderful time for staying at the Crowne Plaza.

title: Disappointed
text: The rooms are old and need a good clean.  It’s a very busy hotel.  The staff were very Helpful the location is good.  The room was not what I would expect from a Crowne Plaza.  We had dinner at the hotel every night, the meals were great and the staff work really hard to deliver great service.

title: Great week in Times Square
text: Great location and staff at this Crowne Plaza. Tofael is great for service in the restaurant for breakfast. Evelyn and Sophi take good care of you at the front desk. Bar is wonderful after shows. Just wish they stayed open later.

title: Perfect First-Time Hotel
text: For our first time in NYC, this was a great place to stay. It is a reasonable walking distance from everything we wanted to see and we loved having breakfast at the restaurant every day. The waiter was kind and the food was good (waiter Tofael). We would stay here again!

title: Good hotel
text:
Right at the Time square. Good location. Good restaurants nearby. Responsive staff. At midnight,I asked for water, the staff readily gave water bottles. Was lucky to get river view room.
Rooms are little but small , i thought. But neat and clean.

title: Considere como uma excelente opção
text:
Localização com sofisticação resumiria assim.
Não usei o cafe da manhã e restaurante, porque o preço é padrão NY, e brasileiro sempre achará algo mais em conta aos arredores (pequenas lanchonetes, Starbucks) bem fácil aos arredores.
Legal é a noite descer de chinelo na Times Square, cansou estar do lado da cama.
Voltaria com certeza.

title: First visit to NYC
text: Good location, currently my family of 4 is staying here for 5 nights with the city view of Time square, Corner view. Guest assistance was so fast to accommodate our needs. The only thing they forget is I requested a special thing for my daughter for her birthday in our room ( a simple cupcake or baloon)when we get to our room but unfortunately nothing was done. The room was a good size and bed was very comfortable. The housekeeper today that clean our room 3102 was so kind to return my wallet that was left unattended. It was so nice of her/him. We we're also given a military discount.

title: First visit to New York
text: Hotel was nice . Good location to Time Square, theaters and Some food places - We wanted to add another day to our reservation before coming . We called spoke with a couple different people - long story short - they booked us  another 3 days and did not cancel the first one. So we have been talking to management every day- they keep reassuring we will not have to pay but no Refund yet - Also, the men at the Grind & co store in Crown Place are not very kind. Did not find that any staff was really friendly or helpful.

title: Evelyn is wonderful!
text: After a long drive from Florida, upon arrival we had an issue with valet parking, the manager on duty fixed that problem, and we were introduced to Evelyn to complete our check-in. Evelyn was very kind, which helped ease my frustration with valet, and made our check-in a very smooth process. We stay here often, and the service has always been good, but today with Evelyn, service was exceptional.

title: A fuir
text:
Prix exorbitants pour une prestation très moyenne.  
Mise à part la situation sur time square très sympa, les chambres sont vieillissantes, on vous met 3 serviettes pour 4 personnes,  il faut prévoir son gel douche car ici on vous donne l équivalent d un dé à coudre pour 4 par jour et encore , pas tous les jours ...
Et pour couronner la prestation,  on vous facture 35 $ par jour pour çà !!!
Les petits déjeuners sont hors de prix et la nourriture à l hôtel n est pas bonne , notamment les wings tellement épicés qu ils en étaient immangeables...
On y retournera pas .

title: Luces y show
text: Excelente opción para pasar un momento maravilloso. Las luces, los personajes en la calle, las comidas que ofrecen y las fotos coloridas. No se la pierdan, preferentemente de noche, aunque el día es una muy buena opción, también.

title: Spettacolare la posizione
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel con mia moglie e mio figlio di 2 anni nel mese di Giugno. Abbiamo soggiornato nella camera con vista su Time square. La stanza era abbastanza grande e molto pulita con Wi-Fi gratuito. Al primo piano presente Bar con possibilità di fare una veloce colazione al mattino. La posizione e la vista dalla camera sono qualcosa di straordinario in quanto si trova in Time Square che è assolutamente il centro del mondo! 
Consigliatissimo

title: Disappointed Stay
text: My husband and I travel 6 times a year, 3 internationally. Our experience with IHG has varied from excellent to disappointing. We rented two adjoining rooms with granddaughters on June 19, 20 and 21 at the Crown Plaza Times  with points and cash. I had called and e-mailed at least two times to secure adjoining rooms with children. They assured me there would be no problem. The receptionist was short and rather curt indicating no quarantee of adjoining rooms although she did give it to us. Points cost 60,000 (a lot) per night, plus $23 property fee and $40 destination fee per room per night. That is equivalent to about $550 per night. The lights went on and off, faulty bulbs, in both rooms, the shower was either very hot or very cold, carpet was dingy. The room was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. No room refrigerator or make-up mirror. We will continue to make every attempt to stay at Hyatt (our favorite) and Hilton when possible after this experience.

title: TERRIFIC!!!
text: We returned to this wonderful hotel & was greeted by Evelyn. She was very friendly & made us feel like VIP’s, thanking us for returning & being loyal customers to IHG. When we went to the bar we met Joseph, Alvaro & Marcos. We returned to the bar after dinner  & Amanda was also tending bar. All four bartenders were great!  They helped make our evening enjoyable!

title: THE place to stay in Times Square!
text:
I stayed at the CPTS with my two daughters from July 2-6th, 2019.  From start to finish, this hotel gets 5 stars from us!!  Check in was a breeze, and they had our room ready even though we arrived before noon.  The check in staff were very friendly and answered all of my questions with a smile.

Our room was clean and surprisingly spacious for NYC!!  Our bathroom light stopped working on our first day and after notifying the front desk it was fixed within minutes.

You are truly within steps to everything here, you cannot find a better location!!  We ate a few times at the hotel and the food was delicious and the service was impeccable.

Thank you Crowne Plaza for making my daughters first trip to NYC so memorable.  5 stars all the way!!

title: LOCATION!!!
text:
It is ideally located in the heart of the action! Walking distance to Manhattan's main attractions!!
Busy staff who do not really care about you.
It would have been nice if they provided a bit more room cleaning.
Costly parking.

title: A complete rip-off
text: We stayed for 4 nights, having booked a package of a Cunard cruise and this hotel. Before we even travelled I had a bad expereince; as my wife is diabetic and needs a small fridge in a hotel room to store insulin, I e-mailed the hotel to ask if rooms already contained a fridge; they couldn't even be bothered to reply. On arrival at the hotel we had to wait an age for our room to be ready, when it finally was I phoned down requesting a small fridge; they promised to bring one ""in a few minutes"; it actually took nearly 3 hours!  Then I discovered that the safe in the room didn't work; I followed the instructions faithfully but nothing doing; on phoning down for "service" I was told in a very condescending way that I must have swiped my card the wrong way round; when after yet another long wait - an hour and a half - someone came to our room to look at it, he spotted straight away that it was broken and sent me down to the reception to ask for a safe deposit box at that level - hugely inconvenient. On the second day they removed all the large towels from the bathroom, even though we had not placed them on the floor and were perfectly happy to re-use them; this took well over 2 hours to sort out. The restaurant - an absolute embarrassment given the charges. The evening menu is seriously limited, they showed no understanding or concern when I pointed out that my wife as a diabetic had to be extremely careful with food; some of the waiters were absolutely incompetent. Ask for a milky coffee and they fill the cup with coffee to the brim, leaving no space for milk; when I asked them to bring me a piece of cake together with my coffee so that I could enjoy them together, that proved to be too difficult. I despair. I am used to 4-star Swiss hotels, so I expect high standards, but given how expensive the Crowne Plaza is this should not be a problem. I wouid never return to this hotel even if I were given free accommodation - it is absolutely shambolic, a complete rip-off.

title: Thank you for another fabulous trip
text: I booked the CPTS for my birthday again and was lucky to have Donald check me in! He’s always the caring professional and allocates my room preference - this time a wonderful corner room on a higher floor. It is greatly appreciated. After arriving in the room, Grant rang to make sure everything was okay and a Birthday amenity was delivered from Christine.  This property has the location but these employees make the difference and make you want to return! Thank you again for an incredible stay and your hospitality and kindness!!

title: Superb hotel
text: Very impressed quick check in nice polite staff and in an excellent location to get around and see everything. The only bad thing is the cleaner locked us out off our room on the morning off departure but this was quickly sorted out would stay here again

title: Very nice place except for double charge that comes $18k for 9 nights
text:
Top location and all staff are very professional and nice all the time. I am quite impressed by their service. I want to give them 5 star but I cannot due to that they charged double that comes $18k for 9 nights with two rooms.  
I found this strange charging issue while I stayed in Crowne Plaza Times Square, so I visited the counter to discuss about it and the gentleman spend several minutes to resolve the issue. He told me the charging issue has been resolved but actually it has not been resolved. Now, I get $18k charge on my credit card. WHY?
I returned to my country and I found $18k is still there.  
So, what I am not happy is about the credit card payment issue that has killed my credit card usage due to double charge, $18k, and it has cause limit issue. Now I am unable to use credit card anymore due to limit issue even though I should have enough room to use credit card if Crowne Plaza Times Square did not charge twice. 
I received full payment on my card on both 2nd and 3rd July, and my check out was on 4th July. This must be caused by time difference between NZ and NYC. 
I need to pay some other important payments but unable to use my credit card anymore that made me very upset. 
I called Crowne Plaza as soon as I returned NZ but I was told I need to contact Billing department of Crowne Plaza Times Square; however, it was Friday night in NYC at the time due to time difference between New Zealand and NYC. 
Due to long holiday in USA and weekend in NZ, I cannot use my credit card for 3 days at least that has been causing major problems on me seriously.

title: Very disappointed
text:
My family and I came to the hotel for a two night stay and we were treated very nicely during check-in. The ladies at the front were very accommodating and friendly. (Wanda & Rita)
After check in we were getting cleaned up to go to a show and ran out of hot water before everyone could shower. Considering the size of the hotel and the location and of course the amount of guests that this hotel would have I never thought that they would run out of hot water. Sadly I dismissed talking to anyone that night and since we were in a hurry I left it alone until the next evening when it was time to have a shower. This time there was absolutely no hot water and we were running out to another  previously planned engagement. I called the front desk and told them how disappointed I was and that I would like the situation dealt with ASAP for the amount of money I paid for this hotel I expected some service. When we returned to our hotel room later that night, the message to maintenance was lost and nobody showed up to fix the problem, I  immediately went down to the front desk and the lovely ladies there called the appropriate maintenance staff and sent him to the room. I went to talk to the front office manager John Acosta and he dismissed my complaint because he was busy doing other things. After the maintenance staff fixed the problem and was rude to my children I took the two drink certificates we received at check-in and decided to take my two daughters to the lounge for a non-alcoholic Shirley temple. When Micheal in the lounge was rude to us once again I decided to warn others about my experience. It surprised me how super friendly some of the staff were and how super disrespectful and rude the other half were. Our visit to New York City was awesome and it was amazing the whole time except for the bad experience at this hotel.
I assume that every hotel has complaints and this hotel is no exception. Just 2 pieces of advice, make sure you have hot water and lock your valuables in the safe.

title: Great Central location for exploring!
text:
I stayed here for one night after arriving from London, access from the airport (JFK) is fairly straightforward on public transport and with the traffic in NYC I chose the subway as a fairly painless way to get to the heart of NYC.

The hotel is currently undergoing renovation and the access is off a side street which isn’t that easy to spot, I appreciate there were lots of billboards on the temporary hoardings around the building which would have been easily visible from across the street but if you are on the same side of the street they are almost impossible to spot and eye level sighs would have been helpful!

Once I found the entrance although busy the hotel was very calm and relaxing, a welcome change to the streets outside! Checking in was fast and efficient and the staff were very welcoming. 

My room was on one of the highest floors in the building with limited views of the Hudson River and some of the city. Perfectly acceptable for my needs as after a long flight I just wanted to sleep! I would suggest requesting a room that isn’t next to the lifts though as the noise which is almost constant 24hr a day was somewhat annoying but not enough for me to complain and I slept to I guess not that bad! 

The room itself was very nice, large very comfortable bed, nice furniture and gear en suite bathroom, I have added an image below. The room was very clean and had plenty of space for what I believe was just a standard double room. 

Breakfast was served overlooking Times Square and was a very good buffet with superb service from very friendly staff. It was also very good value for money! 

If you want to be in central NYC then you won’t go far wrong with this hotel, I would certainly stay again if visiting New York.

title: Great Service!
text: Tofael was great and made breakfast a pleasure! He was always willing to do anything he could to make our experience even better! The breakfast was great and we will come again. Thank you Tofael! You made it a better experience.

title: Time Square
text: other than the odd hotel entrance via the parking garage the interior was clear, bright and nice. quiet rooms and so close to Time Square and all the places we were visiting. traveling with high school group of 37 people went seamless.

title: Only the location nothing else is good about this hotel.
text:
We stayed for 4 nights in Crowne plaza and were a family of 8. 

Our check in experience was not too good even though the reception was quite and all receptionist were by themselves. They were not welcoming at all and didn’t really provide any information of the hotel or it’s facilities the staff’s attitude is very unpleasant. We booked a strip view room and when we checked in our room had views of building garages with literally no view at all I contacted reception and the manager on duty advised there is no other room than what we had and if we are to change rooms it wouldn’t make much difference hence we decided to stay in the given room.
The rooms are really old and tiny.
The gym is pretty big with lots of machines but again very old the only good we liked about staying here was the location and nothing else really is appealing and if anyone’s looking to stay in Times Square there’s much better options with better price options.

title: Great location
text: Great location in Times square. Easy walking distance to many of the main attractions, bars and restaurants. Friendly bar staff, good service all round. Reasonable bar prices. I didn't eat here, so many restaurants of all varieties and prices close by. Very quiet room, good soundproofing and aircon. Good nightly rate given the location. Recommended!

title: Dissapointment
text: I asked for a mini bar and they brought me with a medicine that another guest had left. I called the room service and complained to her and she said she was sending me a farm to clean my room. A guy came to me only with a bathing cap and told me he would take it over.  What he saw to his manager ... I wait and we still see how long I will have to wait ..

title: Disappointed
text: My kids and I stayed at Crowne Plaza Time Square for a couple of days. The hotel was good until someone decided to help themselves to a package that was delivered there for me. I made several enquiries but I kept being transferred from one person to another. Eventually my issue was never resolved and I got tired of making the long distance calls to find out what happened.

title: BRILLIANT CROWNE PLAZA TIMES SQUARE NYC
text:
Well we had six days at this hotel and it did not disappoint, in fact it was fantastic. We got a yellow cab from JFK which dropped us down in the parking lobby of the hotel. Bags taken care of and up we went to get our keys. Seen to straight away and allocated a Double room on 33rd floor best bit it was a corner room with a view down to Times Square and along 49th. Could not have asked for a better room. Bed comfortable. Serviced daily. Nothing but praise. Concierge arranged out transport on our return to JFK at 0400 in the morning.
Thanks Crowne Plaza it was brilliant

title: Muy buena atención y ubicación
text:
Hotel con muy buenas vistas al rio y a Times Square , muy buen desayuno buffet 
Las habitaciones cómodas , excelente wifi en todo el hotel . Estaciones de Metro a una cuadra . Muy cerca de buenos restaurantes y de paradas de los buses turísticos

title: Maybe I Expected More From Crowne Plaza
text:
I’ve stayed at a number of Crowne Plazas over the years and I remember them almost always being a good experience. And while the location truly can’t be beat for wanting to be in Times Square, this one feels stuck in a time warp.  

While the lobby feels very dark and dreary in stark contrast to the bright lights and excitement of Times Square, the real fail was the room. Paint chipping around the windows; every piece of furniture gashed, chipped, scratched, and worn; bathtub glaze severely chipped (I felt like showering in my flip flops); tub took forever to drain and shower difficult to fully turn off; and the ceiling showed the scars of every piece of patchwork and repair that had been done over the years. 

Another minor, yet telling, sign of the age of this hotel is that the desk in the rooms do have power supply but not straight USB ports...a true sign the hotel is dated.

Oh, and the elevator call light button on our floor was out so you were never really sure if the elevator was coming to get you when you pushed it.

C’mon Crowne Plaza! This should be a showcase property for you and it’s sorry and depressing. Sink some money into the place and show some pride. I expect more from your brand.

title: 立地がいい
text:
今回世界一周旅行の最後にニューヨークを選び、ミュージカルを見る予定でこのホテルを選びました。3回見ましたが、いずれもホテルから歩いて行けるところにありました。
部屋も広く清潔でしたが、ホテル代は非常に高いと思います。ただし、IHGののメンバーになるともっと安く泊まれそうです。

title: Great location
text: The location was prefect and our room was adequate.  Our shower did not drain very well, had to stand in water entire time.  Other than that it’s a basic hotel with several restaurants in the hotel.  It’s about a 25 min walk to Penn Station and 15 min walk to Central Park.

title: Very good Times Square location overall
text:
If you want to stay close to Times Square this is a pretty good choice. We reserved a King bed city view in mid-June 2019 and was given a corner room at the top floor (46th floor - Northeast corner). This corner room gives you nearly a wraparound view of the city. In other words, the windows wrap from the north side continuing to the east side of the room. This was pretty nice for staring out into the city from up high. Noise was about what you'd expect in the middle of Times Square.  Even from the 46th floor you can hear sirens and car horns. If you're a light sleeper, might I suggest not staying in Times Square, maybe consider not even staying in Manhattan. It didn't bother us much at all, what was annoying was the bright blue Barclays building sign at night. Luckily the room has curtains to block out most of the outside lights.  

Other than that, for the most part everything was in order. The bathroom is a bit on the smaller side than I'm used to and the closet basically shares that space as well.  Plenty of room for 2 people. For the price you pay a simple continental breakfast would've been nice.  We did not get to try their restaurant/bar. (Why bother when you're in Times Square?)  

Elevators were pretty quick most of the time. Not much waiting or stops except for the mornings.  Subways are 1-2 blocks away depending on the station.  

One small gripe, if any staff from the hotel reads this, might I suggest reversing the toilet paper holder.  It's mounted in such a way that when you pull the toilet paper out the whole roll starts to come off the holder.  If the holder were installed in reverse, that would solve the problem.

title: Great location. Overnight Front Desk Staff needs Help
text: This is a great hotel because of location and room quality is great for the price. There are a few things that very much annoyed me enough to write about it. So here is my story. I reserved my room on the 27th of this month and due to issues with my flight I got to this hotel around 2 or 3am the next morning. When I made it to the front desk to checkin I realized I forgot my wallet in the shuttle that dropped me off and ontop of that my phone was dead. The front desk agent was very nice and told me where I could charge my phone to call the shuttle service to get my wallet back. She saw that I was an IHG member and knew I had a reservation but I still needed my credit card and my ID. While waiting for the shuttle service to come back i wanted to let her know that i would have my wallet in 30 to 40 minutes and to thank her for her help. Unfortunately she was not there but her supervisor was. I decided to let him know about my situation since the woman u was speaking with earlier was gone. I was also going to see if a picture of my ID and credit card would be enough to get me in my room until the shuttle driver arrived with. Y wallet. While e playing my situtation to the Supervisor he got a very nasty attitude with me and very rudely cut me off while I was talking and told me to wait down stairs next to the bellman.
