Then he just ignored me and went about his business. I wanted to get his name but he had his name tag covered by a jacket. At that point I decided not to make a big deal out of his attitude and continued to wait for the shuttle driver. I had gotten. My wallet about 30 minutes later and went to checkin. The same Supervisor's attitude was very short and impolite. I felt like he thought I was below him or I did not deserve to stay at this resort. After he gave me my room key I proceeded to my assigned room and the keys did not work. I had to go back to the front desk which was over 30 floors down and get new keys. The same Supervisor was there and seemed shocked that the keys didn't work. So for some reason he told security to check the room and he also called the room to see if anyone was in there. That seemed strange to me because any other hotel or resort I have stayed in would just give me a new key. That is how i knew that he already knew something was wrong and was trying to hide it. After he called the room he said someone picked up and had to assign me a new room. He did not even apologize to me for the mistake. After I got the key to the new room I proceeded to it and when I got in there was cloths and bags all over the place (picture is attached to this post). I went back to the front desk which now was over 20 floors down. The same Supervisor was there again and i told him and showed him the picture I took and now he was shocked. He called out the person assigning the rooms to take care if it and offered me a free breakfast voucher. The person assigning the rooms came out and was very nice. He apologized to me and told me that the day was a little hectic and that he would take care of thg e problem. The Front Desk Supervisor seemed to catch an atti5with him as well eventhough he was doing his best to fix the problem. While the room assignment person was off making sure a room he found was clean and empty, the Front Desk Supervisor handed me 3 more breakfast vouchers and finally apologized to me. The room assignment person came back and told me every5was good now but the room type I had reserved was not available. I overlooked that and told him it was ok since I saw how hard he looked for a room for me. He then offered me dinner for the inconvenience and I accepted. AS I WAS WALKING AWAY THE FRONT DESK SUPERVISOR TOLD THE ROOM ASSIGNMENT PERON HE JUST GAVE ME BREAKFAST VOUCHERS AND WHY DID HE GIVE ME A COMPED DINNER? Very nasty and rudely to the room assignment person. I could also tell he had made a few more comments but could not hear everything because I was walking away. Bottomline, the Front Desk Supervisor working overnight from June 27th to the 28th had a very nasty attitude and made me feel uncomfortable about staying there. The room assignment person was awesome and had a fantastic attitude when under pressure and dealing with the negative attitude of the Front Desk Supervisor. The rest if the hotel staff was great.

title: Great location but not worth it!
text: Paid an arm and leg per night ($350-450) for a room then was hit with $35 service fee which was told could be waved but they didn’t.  Front desk wasn’t willing to help either. They really do like their “fees”- service fee tax, city occupancy tax, occupancy tax, Javis Center fee which I never saw and don’t know what it is.  Just not worth the money and charges.  Due to dust mites and mold my allergies flared up probably cause of the super old rigs in the room so I can’t get out of here soon enough.  I’ll stay elsewhere for my next visit which I expect to be very soon.  I will say concierge was super helpful and hotel food and food service were great!  Might stop in to eat but otherwise can’t wait to leave.

title: Great location!
text: We booked two double beds for our stay however upon arrival they did not have a room available and so they upgraded us to a room with a king size bed and a sofa bed for the kids with views of Times Square as well as free breakfast which was greatly appreciated. The location is central to everything however we did have trouble getting to sleep so I would recommend ear plugs.

title: Great Concierge
text: The hotel is a block off Broadway where we saw Wicked. The next day, the concierge, Corinne, helped us to know what we should see in Manhattan and steered us away from an expensive ridesharing service to the MET advising us Manhattan is one of the only places where taxi is a better choice.

title: Great Location
text:
Stayed in this hotel for five days and four nights during a recent trip to New York. The best thing about this hotel is the location - it's right at the heart of Times Square where all the action is.

The room was clean, modern, and actually spacious by New York standards. There were plenty of sockets and USB ports for us to plug in our devices, and WiFi was pretty good. Our rooms were cleaned daily and toiletries were regularly restocked. However, the room did not have a minibar or even a refrigerator, which is odd for a hotel at this price range. 

The hotel's facade along Broadway was being renovated, so there was a bit of a confusion locating the hotel entrance when we first arrived. Although there was a sign directing people where to go, it was too small to easily notice. Also, given the hotel's location and popularity among large groups (like student tour groups and large families), the elevators can get a bit busy at times.

Overall, this is a very good hotel and highly recommended!

title: Best receptionist
text: New York is one of the cities I love to visit. I decided to stay in the Crowne Plaza this time to see how things are here. Let’s start off by saying excellent excellent customer service by the receptionist Sandra. I travel a lot for work and stayed in a lot of hotels across the US but never had such service like I did today with Sandra.she made my daughters day and my day and all I can say is thank you and hopefully management will notice this and do something special for her. The hotel is conveniently located to Times Square and restaurants. The rooms are clean and comfortable.

title: Make America smaller again...
text: Überteuert, schlechter Service, altes Hotel, voll mit Gästen die sich nicht zu benehmen wissen. Einmal New York, vielleicht ein zweites Mal aber sicher nicht in diesem herunter gekommenen Hotel! Schade, nette Leute überall aber Qualität wie ich sie an vielen Orten auf der Welt kenne existiert hier nicht. Bin selber Besitzer und Manager eines Hotels aber sehr enttäuscht 😔

title: Great location and very clean
text:
Stayed here for one night as my friend and I were having a girls night out in the city. We had actually booked a cheaper hotel but on arrival could not stay there as it was so dirty! We then booked the Crowne Plaza online at the last minute. It was such a relief to find our room was clean, comfortable and well maintained! 

The hotel has a fantastic location, right on Times Square. Despite this, we didn’t find it noisy and got a good nights sleep. The only reason I have given 4 stars instead of 5 is because there was no bottled water in the room. Unusual for a quality hotel.

All in all, would thoroughly recommend! And if you’re swithering between this and a cheaper hotel, don’t! You get what you pay for in Manhattan and this hotel is definitely worth the price.

title: Rahi
text: Rahi not only offered great bartending services, but he also gave us useful information, helped us get the most out of our vacation, and booked us a reservation close to the venue of our evening activities

title: Rahi
text: Rahi is a waiter at the bar and lounge in this hotel. he gave us very useful information for restaurants to visit and sights to see! he was a friendly face to see after long days of touring the city! he even called a restaurant and made a reservation for us at an amazing french restaurant!

title: Rahi
text: Rahi served us in the lounge every night we stayed at the hotel. He was very friendly and suggested what to do on our trip. Rahi was very helpful and even made us a dinner reservation for one night of our trip!

title: Best Location
text: The Crowne Plaza was an ideal location.  We walked to so many things.  The rooms are spacious, comfortable and CLEAN!  Some of the staff were less than friendly but our overall visit was fantastic. The breakfast buffet was average.  The lounge/bar area was nice.

title: Mujeres maravillas
text:
Como tantas otras veces,con mi esposa e hija nos hospedamos,en este hotel cuyas virtudes son muchas.Una de ellas es la excelente ubicacion,estä en pleno Time square,rodeado de los teatros,de Broadway,de excelentes restaurantes,comercios y a pasitos de la famosa escalinata,donde se festeja el año nuevo.Sus habitaciones son muy acogedoras(pedir piso bien alto y con vistas al time square)Tambien recomiendo sus desayunos servidos en el restaurante del primer piso.
Pero la virtud mas destacada de este hotel,es la excelente atención de todo el personal,pero destaco a 2 personas fundamentalmente,a ADALIZ RODRIGUEZ,y a SANDRA ESP que siempre pero siempre!! tienen una bella sonrisa,para atendernos a todos.

title: Great location but poor reception.
text:
As a platinum ihg member I expect decent treatment and usually receive it. 
Good points. Just off broadway and decent sized room (elite level). Breakfast is good.
Poor points
Some reception staff are brusque and come across as if they don’t care. My room was missing a comfortable chair, it should have had a chaise long in it. Nothing but a plastic desk chair. I asked receptionist. A plastic chair on wheels was delivered. I tried again but was told they were refurbishing so there wasn’t a chair available. $300 per night and nothing comfortable to sit on. Had to go direct to ihg to get it sorted. 3 out of 5 days with no chair. Not good enough! Perhaps if the beds were being refurbished they’d expect me to sleep on the floor or a camp bed. 
Very very expensive but I guess that’s nyc. And tips expected rather than earned.
The place is being refurbished so the only way in is through the car park around the side. 
Wouldn’t stay there again because of the reception staff. Perhaps it’s just nyc in general.

title: Pleasant Business Stay
text: The check in was quick. This was important after a very busy day. The room was clean and comfortable. The location of the hotel is near everything, dining, shopping and the downtown area. There is a mall right next to the hotel. The parking lot can be accessed without difficulty in inclement weather, which was the case during my stay. I would stay again when in the area.

title: Great Hotel from Top to Bottom
text:
Time Square is crowded and it is a spectacle for tourist but the Crowne Plaza was a great place to come back to earth and feel comfortable.  The room was comfortable a great view of all the excitement and the beds were also pleasant.

Id like to give props to the security staff as I departed Sunday, I realized I lost my job phone and had no idea where it was.  It was turned in and the security staff has been very helpful in getting it back to me. I live in Upper Marlboro Maryland. Albert Valdes of the security staff has been my contact and very helpful.  

This along with the amenities and food at the hotel made this Crowne Plaza, a place I would like to visit again.

title: Sandra esp
text: When was checking out of the hotel sandra esp of the hotel she was excellent agent very kind and helpful, I enjoyed in the hotel thank you all and have a great day , Ahmed from saudi arabia nice to meet you .

title: Muy mal hotel
text:
Es un hotel bien ubicado, no es barato, y a mi criterio es un hotel de fama pero con muy mal servicio, habitaciones sucias, alfombras viejas, me equivoqué por escogerlo ya qué hay otros mejores mucho mejores con el mismo precio, además en el restaurante la comida no es buena y la atención, pésima, lástima no puedo recomendarlo.
Es muy caro para lo que es,

title: Birthday Celebration
text:
Had a room for four of us on the 33rd floor overlooking the Hudson River. 
No noise, we all slept very well following our busy days in NYC.
Good sized room with 2 comfortable double beds, lovely clean fresh bedding.
Room furniture was dated but didn’t bother us.
Bathroom was clean with a bath/shower which worked really well.
Fresh towels provided daily.

Some bottled water in the room would have been a welcome touch and some biscuits to go with the coffee!

Reception staff were very professional but didn’t feel that personal, had to ask where to find the swimming pool/gym.

Didn’t eat in the hotel restaurant. 

Great location for exploring the city of New York and enjoy all the local restaurants! 
Be prepared to walk loads.....

title: Very nice and accessible
text: Had a bit of trouble parking but after that it was great!  Enter through the parking garage drop off.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Room was nice, stayed in a king on 36th floor.  Noise wasn’t bad.  Concierge was also helpful getting show tickets.  Ate at the bar and had good service one night and bad the next.  Overall great experience and enjoyed the location.

title: Did the job
text:
Very comfortable room with a great central location in Times Square 

The bed almost made you not want to get up and everything was clean and spotless

Breakfast buffet was good and staff were always happy to help

title: Mittendrin statt nur dabei
text:
Wir waren 6 Nächte hier und haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt. Nicht billig, aber es war es wert. Zentraler kann man nicht wohnen. Und natürlich kann es bei der Lage auch nicht total ruhig sein. Wir hatten ein Eckzimmer in der 25. Etage. Der Blick war sensationell und wir haben sehr gut geschlafen 🛏. Beeindruckend war die Größe des Zimmers, ganz anders als wir es sonst aus Großstadthotels kennen. 
Das Frühstücksbüffet hat alles geboten, was will man mehr.... Das Personal ist hier - wie überall im Hotel - freundlich und hilfsbereit. Thank you, Ani 😊
Überrascht hat uns das Restaurant im Hotel. Mehr durch Zufall waren wir das 1. Mal dort und wurden durch Überzeugung zum „Wiederholungstäter“. 
Wir kommen gerne wieder 👍🏻

title: Da sogno
text: Camere bellissime, ho avuto la fortuna di averne avuto una all’ultimo piano con imperdibile vista su Times Square e su Manhattan. Non manca niente: TV con schermo piatto gigante, safe box e tutto quanto serve per un soggiorno dove ti trattano da re!

title: Poca cordialidad.
text:
la ubicación es excelente y las instalaciones son buenas. Pero considero no haber recibido un trato acorde a mi condición de turista de habla hispana.
No siempre teníamos en la recepción alguien con quien poder requerir soluciones a nuestras inquietudes.
Parece que sólo tenés que hablar inglés

title: Convenient and comfortable
text:
This is probably our 3rd stay at this property, this time using our points for a single night stay. Location is incredibly convenient for tourists - which we are not, but we still find it best because we go off in all sorts of directions using this as the center. Rooms are very generously sized (for NYC where they're typically teeny) and the windows isolate sound well. 
The bar is very handy to meet or for a quick something but the service is pretty lacking. We had to ask several times for something because our server wouldn't come back, so I asked the bartender who said "I'll tell your server" rather than just getting the water herself. Then the server never came -- she wasn't slammed, it was just lackluster service. Prices are typical for NYC.
Check in was surprisingly slow (not the line, the actual check in) but the desk agent was really nice and helpful. Have never eaten in the main restaurant and with all the choices nearby, I can't imagine choosing to do that. Luggage hold is very well served too.
We'll stay again especially if the points value from IHG makes it worthwhile.

title: Perfect location!
text: Our family stayed here when visiting NYC.  A very pleasant stay and so close to everything.  We walked everywhere because it was close to all we wanted to do.  Staff was nice and friendly, rooms were clean and comfortable.  Price was high due to graduation week so we only stayed for 2 nights.

title: Very professional staff with quiet rooms
text:
We stayed in a corner room on 41st floor and rarely heard any noise from others in hotel. Outside street noise was minimal. I asked for a couple of things regarding housekeeping and was supplied with them very quickly. 
- Water from faucet in bath is great. Tastes good and I drank it.
- Mocha from Cafe by elevators was not. I’ve had better from circle k. 
- sports club is nice; I swam once while there. It is a lap pool - not an indoor play for kids pool
- location is near multiple subway stations and theaters
- they will kindly hold your luggage before checkin if you arrive early 
- the elevator doors close quickly; be forewarned :)

title: Crowning glory
text: Spent 6 nights at the CP just off Times Square. Great location. Easy access to all areas. Decent rooms. Very busy place but efficient. Rooms are fine. Can recommend. Didn’t do the breakfast as plenty of options in the local.

title: Great hotel bang on the Times square!
text: Location is the USP of this place! Located right on Times square overlooking the M&M's world and walking distance into the best shopping and most happening places of downtown NYC, it is also near to most of the Broadway theatres, so one can do the late night shows without having to worry much about commute and others. The Central terminus is also within 100 metres. The rooms are decent, amenities useful and adequate, breakfast spread very satisfying. The breakfast location is wonderful overlooking the times square and its neons! You cannot ask for more in that budget in NYC. My stay was quite comfortable.

title: Better and Better
text: My wife and I stay at this hotel several times a year and have recently returned from our latest  visit. The hotel was VERY busy but the service did not suffer.  Of course the location is still perfect for sightseeing, theater and shopping.  Special mention must given to the front deck personnel.  We had a small issue that was quickly resolved by Evelyn and as usual  Hajar took care of all of our needs.

title: Good stay
text: I was there for a business trip. Location is awesome right in the thick of the manhattan. Rooms are comfortable and decently sized. Breakfast served at the brasserie is a bit expensive but the spread is decent. Overall service is excellent at the hotel. Would definitely recommend

title: un peu vieillot mais top !
text: idéalement situé sur Times Square - à proximité immédiate du métro et des principaux centres d'intérêt . l'accueil est efficace et chaleureux .les chambres un peu démodées mériteraient une petite rénovation , mais l'hôtel est propre et  le personnel efficace

title: Birthday weekend
text: My husband bought me tickets for a Broadway show for my birthday so The Crowne was the perfect spot for all of the planned events! It was easy to get to Penn Station, the Empire State Building, and  Central Park! The hotel was clean and everything was well kept! We had a great city view and a comfortable bed!

title: Slap bang in the centre of Manhattan
text: Would have received 5 stars if the service in the bar had been even satisfactory. Great location and considering the huge scale of the place it is well run with friendly and welcoming staff. However, we visited the bar three times after long days out. First night on arrival was perfect. Fast regular service by a friendly and super efficient waitress. Second visit we were served quite quickly but then ignored despite frantic waving. Decided not to wait for a second drink despite 20 minute wait. Another couple just gave up and left without ordering! Third time waited 20 minutes to order and then another 20 minutes to get the check. Didn’t bother going again. Shame because it’s a nice space. The hotel is missing out in revenue due to not having enough staff. Bad economy!

title: Great Location
text: Hotel is in Time Square on Broadway.  Perfect location for sightseeing and seeing Broadway Shows.  Hop on Hop off bus picks up right in front of hotel.  Great customer service.  Clean and comfortable rooms.

title: Hôtel vieillissant
text: Si ce n’est son emplacement idéal sur Time Square l’hôtel mériterait un sérieux lifting! Les chambres sont spacieuses mais aucun travaux depuis 10 ans. La moquette laisse à désirer et l’insonorisation est inexistante.

title: Bien situé
text:
Bon emplacement 
Chambre très correcte, bien équipée 
Possibilité de téléphoner gratuitement en Europe 
Bémol sur le petit dejeuner qui reste cher et pour le prix on aurait aimé qu il soit plus complet ( il faut réclamer une banane, pas de crêpes ou pancakes ou gaufres etc..)

title: Unmatched location, lovely hotel..
text: Yes, I do enjoy it everytime. The higher floor rooms with corner locations, that is what they put me in every time. The view, see my pics, breathtaking and no match. The rooms may be old but very clean. The spirit is Manhattan. And last but not the least, starting with the nite shift front desk mgr, the whole staff is nice and friendly. They do their best to take care of you. I am a regular every year. It is very NYC:)

title: 80's Hotel at 2019 prices
text: Very disappointed on arrival. For such a prominent hotel, the room looked like it hadn't been decorated in over 20 years! Furniture all scrapped and dirty cupboard. The carpet was disgusting!! Dirty tissue on bedside table on arrival. Temperamental shower had no pressure. Up side. Bed was OK. Towels and sheets were clean. Bell hops very helpful and friendly. However reception staff could use more training, especially concierge on people skills.  Was a shame as a great location but I think for what people pay the hotel needs to seriously up their game. Unless their aim is to overcharge and under deliver!!

title: Solo But Not Alone!
text:
The service at this hotel is impeccable!  Every single employee I came into contact with exhibited genuine care and consistent great hospitality!  

Traveling alone, I wasn’t interested in checking out the local food unless the hotel food wasn’t up to par.  I NEVER once ate a meal outside of this hotel!  The fool was incredible!!!   My server, Tofael went above and beyond.  Offering to take a group picture of one of his tables.  Cleaning other tables when not busy serving.  What a blessing he is to CPTS I’m sure!

title: Dom
text: What wonderful service we got from the time we got here. Donald Mei was so accommodating at the front desk and made us feel welcomed from the start. Kim at the bar was also incredible!!! She went out of her way for us. What a wonderful trip. The service from Donald and Kim makes us want to come back again and again.

title: Nice place Great Location
text: I spent two nights with family in May at this hotel. The location is wonderful you can walk to everywhere and the subway is close by. The room was clean and felt updated. The beds were comfy. I did not use the lounge or other amenities while there so I cannot comment on them. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

title: Plastic plates
text: Plastic plates for room service dinner i paid over 100 for dinner served on plastic with plastic silver wear.i couldn’t believe a high end hotel would dare do this. This is my last stay with this chain.

title: En el corazon de manhatan
text: Buen hotel con situacion excelente. Esta en el mismo Time Square con vistas impresionantes. Genial tanto para moverse andando como en metro. Ibamos con dos niños y la habitacion era amplia con dos camas grandes y comodas. Muy recomendable.

title: The nice room salvaged our stay
text: The lobby and other public spaces of this hotel are dated, shabby and need an overhaul. There is construction on the outside of the hotel, so maybe that is in the works. There is really no lobby, just a lounge, so nowhere really to sit while waiting for others. The main entrance is through the car drive-through. Some of the front desk staff were brusk, while others were very nice. The room was clean, good size and pretty nice, with a comfortable bed and linens. When we entered the room, the maid had not removed 2 opened bottles of water that the previous guest had used.

title: Best Location with attitude problem
text:
We arrived from Delhi after a 20hrs.Flight, Immigration and New York traffic at the Hotel, which is located bang in the heart of the famous Time Square. they have a nice private Porch for pick up & drop off in this, busy district. Rude shock starts now, nobody 'welcomes' you, Here,  and the guy manning the entrance doesn't bother to explain, that the  front desk is two levels up, nor does he offer any help for it, when he saw us with three big Suitcases ( not Business Travellers). After figuring out the whole thing one reaches front desk. Here Mr. Gerry informs me  wrongly that we have a room on triple Sharing but the Breakfast is Only for Two. For this I again have to request him to confirm from his office, which he reluctantly does, but doesn't admit that it was a mistake on their part.
  We found it was an average room, with just manageable facilities. Back home I would not pay so much for "such" an average accommodation & rude treatment. Is this the Price one pays for staying at Time Square. 
  Final assault was at Check Out, they charged me $40:00, per day,(Total $200:00) extra as Service Charge for (non Existing service ) which they never informed me at Check In, nor was I told if these charges were mandatory or optional.

title: Long stay vacation
text:
We recently stayed for over two weeks just this May til June. Our family was there in New York on holiday. Initially skeptical about it because of the location but have learned being at the center of everything is better. It’s the best location for tourists who want to go to the theater. You will never be late for a show! Also ubers and cabs were available everywhere, not counting the nearby subway stations. But so many places like Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, and Grand Central Station are within walking distance. Everything in the area is open til late so if you need last minute shopping or just convenience store supplies this is the area to be in. 

The hotel does tend to get busy on weekends so lines for breakfast could get long but then the service fairly fast enough that you get a table fast enough. Breakfast is a buffet and they do change it up every few days.
Sandra at the front desk was very helpful especially since we checked in at about 2 am. Rooms are large and comfortable, some furniture is a bit worn down but clean. I liked that the TV is new and they have enough charging ports for devices.  Bathrooms are modern enough and clean. Our only issues were with the airconditioning and the hairdryer but they did help us sort it out. The hotel is under construction but did not inconvenience.
The bar/Lounge at the lobby is a decent place to have a midnight snack. Fast service and good food.
Price as compared with other hotels in the area is competitive and for the time we booked, was in fact cheaper considering we booked quite late.
All in all i would recommend it for anyone wanting a convenient stay in New York City!

title: Great Visit
text: Room was full size, not tiny like some NY hotels.   It  was nicely furnished, with comfortable beds and it was very clean. The view from the 30th floor was nice, and we were within easy walking distance of many restaurants, subway stops and the Jumbotrons of Times Square.  Freddy checked us in and he was delightful!  He provided several breakfast vouchers and restaurant vouchers for bar or evening dining.  I was traveling with two kids under the age of 10 and appreciated the lower prices for kids meals.  All in all, I’ll go back again.

title: Wow is all I can say!
text: The Crowne Plaza is right in the heart of Time Square.  First of all - it is a first class hotel and offers everything you could ever want.  Then, just getting to walk out the door to see the lights of Time Square or walk to a show just a block or two away. Priceless!

title: Good Hotel with Really Big Rooms
text:
Stay Report - 5/31 - 6/2

Location: Seemingly every hotel between 33rd and 51st, 10th Avenue to 6th Avenue claims to be "Times Square" so that's a meaningless term.  Specifically, this hotel is located on Broadway between 48th and 49th (the hotel takes up the whole block and has entrances on both 48th and 49th).  48th Street has an entrance to the 49th Street N/R/W Station, 49th has an entrance to the 50th Street 1 Station and a block away on 8th Avenue is the 50th Street C/E Station.  There are a number of theaters nearby and plenty of restaurants and the like.  LGA is about a $40 Uber away in no traffic

Hotel: The hotel itself is a massive high rise.  I was happy to find they have separated the elevator banks into serving the lower half and upper half of floors which means shorter waits than at other high rises.  The lobby is one floor up from the entrance and has a large restaurant which does a buffet breakfast, a coffee shop and a bar as well as a lot of meeting space another floor up.

Check In: As a Spire Elite I was given a coupon for the buffet breakfast for just $16 instead of $40.  

Room: Much, much larger than many Manhattan rooms I've stayed in.  While it was nothing all that special, having the space for me and my travel companion was really nice. The bathroom was also big enough and the shower got really, REALLY hot if you wanted it to.  Wifi worked well as well.

I was just here for a Points and Cash Accelerate rate but I found myself pleasantly surprised.  I'd be happy to return.

title: Súper ubicación
text:
Fuimos mis amigos, mi hija y yo dos noches y fue la mejor elección de hospedaje, súper céntrico y muy bien cuidada las instalaciones, limpio y con una vista preciosa a Times Square.
Lo único que vi, había mucha gente en la sala de espera, imagino que esperando habitación pero eso hacía que el personal estuviera ocupado y muy difícil de preguntar sobre alguna cuestión.

title: Excellent Stay!
text: The Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan provided a solid hotel experience. Nice corner room, excellent bed, and conference facilities. Overall, the staff were nice but service was a bit mixed. A great location. Thanks for an excellent stay!

title: Room with a view
text: What a location.  Our room was on the 44th floor so the view over Time Square was excellent.  The location on Broadway/48th allowed for easy walking access to everything you might want to see and to the Broadway shows.  The room was comfortable (though we were hardly in it) with an excellent mattress.

title: Customer service is disgraceful
text: Jewellery was stolen from bedside table. Reported with no response. Went in to discuss with security and was told an investigation would take place. This did not happen. Followed up again - no response. Emailed head office - twice NO RESPONSE. Avoid this place. And the rooms smell putrid.

title: Bon emplacement, s’armer de patience
text:
Soit vous êtes client lambda, et vous allez peiner dès l’arrivée car cet hôtel est un géant et les arrivées/départs très nombreux.
Soit vous êtes un client régulier ou IHG élite et là on respecte votre statut et je dis merci!

Accueil très agréable par un personnel avenant et professionnel. J’ai eu une chambre avec une magnifique vue, des sanitaires qui semblent avoir été rénovés récemment.
Ce n’est pas un 5 étoiles - je ne venais pas pour ce type de service mais la localisation. 
Les prix à Manhattan sont élevés. Se loger à Times Squate coûte et vous devez le savoir AVANT de venir et surtout ne pas vous en plaindre après. Sinon prenez un hôtel dans le Queens ou le New Jersey et le métro pour vous rendre au sein de Manhattan.

Juste in-deux bémols : pas de minibar rempli mais un service d’étage rapide, une connexion au réseau GSM impossible dans les étages supérieurs (mais le WIFI calling fonctionne à merveille) et un dépose bagage devant les escalators peu sécurisé.

title: Great location and excellent Concierge
text:
This is perfect if you want to be in Times Sq / Theatre land . We chose the hotel to specifically be near the theatre as we had splashed out on tickets for To Kill A Mockingbird ( excellent production by the way )

Check- in was efficient and helpful . We were in room 3627- quiet , spacious and great views of buildings, yet with the Hudson in the distance . 
The concierge was really helpful in helping us identify getting from A to B.

The bar area is surprisingly pleasant- lots of windows and a nice relaxed atmosphere .  Staff are friendly (but not intrusive ,as can happen in the US sometimes - which , although well intentioned ,it can be mildly irritating to be asked repeatedly by complete strangers how your day has been so far !

Normally we would avoid crowded touristy places like Times Sq but this hotel is a really good compromise .

title: Great spot.
text: Nice hotel, very busy and a bit faceless but nice rooms with very comfy beds. Great views from our room. Helpful staff but the best thing about this hotel is its position right at the heart of Times square.

title: Made in Manhattan
text: I love NY ! Such a cool place so many things to do. The city never sleeps. Didn’t really get much sunlight though. Benihana‘s was really good had to wait an hour even when we made a reservation 🤷🏽‍♀️

title: Best experience ever, excellent service and location
text: This is my first time review for a hotel. The whole staff at the hotel was so helpful, polite and the best service. Rahi at the bar area was the nicest person in the hotel, I had a cold and he recommended an Indian tea "Bombay Chai" which helped me to recover. The best service ever! The location is excellent to stay at Manhattan for tourism. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy every minute at the big apple, you will not waist time in transportation, you can walk almost everywhere and if you want to take the subway there is an station just cross street.

title: We loved Ming!
text: The hotel was great in most every way. Wonderful staff and service, but the star of the show was our bell boy, Ming. He was soo cheerful and helpful. Took care of the luggage,  got us water and then filled us full of tips and ad advice on the city that was invaluable!

title: Great Stay
text: We’ve stayed here several times over the past several years and will continue to do so. Comfortable rooms. Friendly staff at front desk and breakfast buffet. Great breakfast buffet. Special thanks and compliments to the breakfast staff, especially Samantha, Tofael and Peel. Can’t say enough about their friendliness and service to guests!!!

title: Great time square location
text: The corner rooms are nice the others are pretty average on par with most 4 star hotels. The bedding is very comfortable but the windows are not soundproof so you do get some street noise (I was on the 16th floor). Just FYI the king rooms only have showers (no tub) so if that is important be sure to reserve a room with two doubles. The lobby area is small in comparison to other large resort hotels in the area. It is mostly made up of a bar area. There is a nice coffee/snack counter on the same level, with amazing pastries and lunch items. The real selling point to this hotel is it's smack in the the middle of time square location. Fantastic if you plan on taking in some broadway shows. It is also a easy walk to Rockefeller center (NBC, Top of the rock, Radio City etc.)

title: Girls Weekend
text: While the location of the hotel is great, the maintenance of the rooms and the response to the issues was poor. We booked 4 double rooms at a cost of more than $1600.00 per night. We could not use the bath tubs in two of the rooms as the porcelain was cracked or missing patches. One room had a leaking toilet, safes were missing or not working. I spoke to the front desk clerk who responded that the hotel is booked every night, so there is no opportunity to fix the rooms. I then spoke to a Manager who volunteered a complimentary drink for our issues. Our trip was fabulous and the only negative feedback was that we would choose a different hotel to stay the next time we traveled. Lots of choices for hotels, I would not recommend.

title: Great Location and good Concierge service
text: I stayed here for a quick overnight stay. Room was above average. It was pretty clean. Shower was great and service at the concierge desk was superb! We had a great corner room over looking Times Square. I would stay here again!

title: Excellent
text: Fantastic staff in a perfect location. This is a hotel that knows it’s customer needs and basically responds through a staff that are never in your face but who always deliver at the right time. I could not recommend this hotel enough.

title: Brilliant!!!
text: We booked this hotel via a package with BA Holidays and so resort fees etc were all included in the price😃. We chose this hotel because of its location and we were able to book a room overlooking TS. On our previous visits we have stayed just off 8th Avenue and TS but this was definitely a great choice, especially since I have mobility problems this hotel is right in the centre which for me was ideal and the room overlooking TS allows me to rest and at the same time have a view😍😍😍. We ate in the lounge a few times and the food was excellent although not a big menu the food on it satisfied both of us as vegetarians and our son who is a meat eater. This a busy hotel but we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for a lift. There is also a coffee shop selling good coffee and fresh bakery items, cheese plates, and hot breakfast sandwiches only 1 day was there a bit queue but they put extra staff on and we were quickly served - the corn muffins and almond croissants are delicious😍😍. Would I stay there again yes in the blink of an eye and we are certainly looking to book again😍😍

title: Beware of the $40/night resort fee. There are may hidden fees. Sneaky and tricky fees. Great managers and staff.
text: Beware of the additional hidden fee, the resort fee $40/night. When you search this hotel it will show you a lower price, then at the very bottom small section you will see that the resort fee is $40/night. For us, who are staying 11 nights at this hotel. This is totally ridiculous. However, the managers are helpful. The manager is very helpful and great in providing solutions. The front desk is also a nice lady who is also very helpful in accommodating my needs. They also have a customer service to handle your matter quickly by phone. Basically, they have a great team here. If you want to use the pool a shower cap is needed, they don't sell it. but at the shop downstairs they sell it for $10. It is unfortunate that the hotel still practicing the hidden resort fee $40 charges/night. They have hidden charges for other things too. $7 for accepting a mail. $5 for using the computer for 5 minutes. It makes the hotels looks sneaky and tricky. Thus, I would not come back here again.

title: Excelente opção
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, na Times Square, próximo a escada vermelha, metrô, restaurantes e lanchonetes. Atendimento muito bom, com destaque a Sra. Sandra que foi super atenciosa e gentil no check in. Os quartos são bons, camas grandes e confortáveis. Limpeza diária. Quero muito voltar

title: Great Location, Great Service, Great Room
text: Our Texas Family Group had a wonderful visit to New York City staying at the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan.  The location was perfect for getting all over the 5 boroughs via the MTA.  Hotel service was excellent from check in to the room servicing staff.  We were upgraded from an interior room to a corner room overlooking Times Square - what a view!  We owe special thanks to Travis who was our Brasserie 1605 Breakfast host everyday.  He rendered to us the most professional, attentive, and kind service.  We felt like we had our own private concierge!  The Texas Family Group

title: Buen hotel
text:
Es un hotel bueno, quizás las habitaciones están un poco viejas comparadas con otros hoteles pero cumple con todas las funciones.
El personal es muy amable y predispuesto.
Si te gusta estar en el centro de todo y tener acceso a todo, está muy bien ubicado porque es donde apenas comienza Times Square. Pero si queres estar más tranquilo no es lo más recomendable porque está lleno de gente todo el tiempo.

title: Great Room
text:
We moved here for our last night in New York.

We had a great corner room on the 32nd Floor with views of Times Square.

The room was spacious, very clean, well appointed and had the most comfortable of beds. However it’s worth noting that the bed was quite high and might not suit everyone.

The room included a coffee machine, iron & ironing board and great blackout curtains (especially good given the light from Times Square). The room was well insulated from noise too.

Although on the smaller size the bathroom had all that we needed but no bath but we didn’t want one.

The only things the room could have benefited from was a long mirror for dressing in the bedroom / hallway and additional charging points.

We would definitely stay at the Crowne Plaza again and can recommend it.

title: Great Location, Great Service
text: Despite a reservation mixup on our part, Michelle at the front desk solved our problem with humor and good cheer. After checking with the manager, our problem was solved.  We were also helped by Imran at the front desk, who also guided the six of us smoothly through our registration.  Also cannot say enough about Michael, who handled our luggage and helped us with transportation and answered a myriad of questions. The employees at concierge were also incredibly helpful. We would definitely go back. Perfect location!

title: Excelente
text: El Hotel es un buen lugar para quedarse en Manhattan, está cerca de todo y de un metro para poder llegar a cualquier lugar . El desayuno complementario es bueno , tal vez no espectacular pero sirve para llenarte de carbohidratos y poder andar por toda la ciudad .

title: Great Stay!
text: Our stay was great everything was top notch,  felt like it was 1st class. Michelle at check in was very helpful at getting us a early check in for me and wife. She gave us the 5 star service plus. Hotel is close to everything!

title: Birthday celebration
text:
We travelled to NYC to celebrate a friend's special birthday so a central location with a brand name was selected, the Crowne Plaza Times Square.

Upon arrival the check in was swift and efficient and my credit card taken as a guarantee with a holding amount that would be released at the time we checked out.

The room we had wasn't overlooking Times Square which we were happy about as when we went to our friend's room (that did overlook the square) the outside noise was apparent.  I don't think you'll need to worry too much about noise keeping you awake (unless you're a REALLY light sleeper) as I didn't struggle at all - the alarm woke me every morning!

The room was as expected of a Crowne Plaza; decent size, large king size bed, clean bathroom, TV, in-room safe, coffee maker, hangers in the wardrobe, iron with ironing board and bathroom amenities.  There wasn't anything wrong with the room however I wasn't wowed either.  I think this is because it's older decor; warmer browns/creams in colour rather than the fashionable silver/greys.  I would say that the hotel could benefit from some TLC throughout as rooms and public areas are beginning to show signs of wear and tear.

The location is what sells this hotel - literally step outside the hotel and you're in the centre of Times Square, overlooking the M & M's store. The front entrance is currently undergoing refurbishment so all access is via the rear doors where the cars/taxis drop off customers.

When we checked out the bill showed the resort fee as $5 more than we were expecting.  I pointed this out to the reception staff who rectified the bill.  Our friends were also incorrectly charged and hadn't noticed the difference until we mentioned it.

The only source of disappointment was the amount of time it took for the funds to be released back to my card - almost 2 weeks.  This I find unreasonable as well as unexpected.

All in all I would recommend this hotel however you'll pay a premium due to it's location.

title: Manager Lyonnel wasn't any help
text: Stayed here last week for a night and paid for room in advanced. We get there they say it's a $40.00 resort fee. We had proof of what we paid and where it had nothing about resort fees. Spoke to manager Lyonnel about waiving fee and he wouldn't do it. Third party site offered a refund if he would make an exception and he wouldn't. Basically was forced to stay there or lose money. Hilton around the corner didn't have any resort fees where I really wanted to stay at. Won't EVER STAY HERE AGAIN. We didn't need free wifi, to use fitness center or two beers that they said the fee was for. Don't like paying resort fees, used to it in Vegas and they are up front with them. We would have chosen another hotel if site listed that.

title: Perfect Manhattan NYC location/Anniversary
text: We are IHG reward members from inception & using our points for reward stay at Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan is our perfect choice & use of our points. for shows. Excellent  location on Broadway between 48th & 49th -walking distance to Broadway Shows/Restaurants & Shopping. Our room on the 30th floor w/well appointed furnishings,spacious by NYC standards,corner  room,perfect city views. Front Desk managerJuliet C. Helped us plan our Anniversary stay. We stay every year.In house restaurants are excellent fr breakfast/lunch-brunch to afternoon cocktails/lite or small bites to evening cocktails dinner/ after dinnerdrinks or just Grab & Go  Highly recommend.Alwsys look forward to our next stay

title: problemi per storni autorizzazioni carta di credito
text:
Ho soggiornato a Pasqua per 4 notti. Molto buona la posizione. Raggiungibili a piedi molti luoghi di interesse. Forse da curare un po' di più le finiture dei bagni. risentono dell'età e si sollevano i rivestimenti delle pareti.
Purtroppo però sto ancora aspettando la restituzione dell'addebito sulla mia carta di credito. Non rispondono neanche alle continue email di richiesta di spiegazioni e di riaccredito di quanto pagato in eccesso. Il soggiorno è stato infatti pagato al tour operator con cui ho prenotato. L'hotel invece mi ha addebitato credo l'intero soggiorno e non quanto riportato sul foglio che mi hanno consegnato al check out. Non lo ritengo un comportamento degno di un 4 stelle. Ci penserò due volte prima di recarmi di nuovo presso questa catena di hotel.

title: Service client déplorable
text:
Je rentre tout juste de NY et m'empresse de poster un avis sur cet hôtel que je ne recommande pas. Les points positifs pour commencer : l'emplacement hyper central en plein Times Square (avec l'inconvénient d'être dans une zone ultra touristique avec des prix prohibitifs. Exemple tout bête : on passe de 4 dollars à 1 dollar le hot dog en s'éloignant du quartier). Autre point positif : les chambres sont correctes et propres, sans plus. Attention, les double beds sont petits. Nous avions réservé une chambre pour 4 avec 2 lits, on s'est senti un peu à l'étroit. Evidemment ne pas se mettre en tête les photos des chambres avec grande baie vitrée et vue imprenable sur NY. Ce sont les chambres les plus chères. Pour nous, au 15ème étage, c'était une vue bof sur une rue latérale avec une toute petite fenêtre.
Pour le reste, l'hôtel est vieillot et mériterait un bon coup de jeune, à commencer par la moquette. Mais je reconnais que c'est propre et fonctionnel. 
On a beau être prévenu, le principe du service fee (30 dollars par jour et par chambre à payer en plus, sans compter les taxes) semble complètement abusif. Ce prix est censé comprendre l'utilisation illimitée du téléphone depuis la chambre. Nous n'en avions pas vraiment besoin mais nous avons tenté de passer des appels. Sans succès, cela ne marchait pas (nous avions pourtant bien fait le 9 pour sortir, comme indiqué sur la notice). Le prix est censé également couvrir les boissons offertes au bar de l'hôtel. Mais nous étions 7 au total pour 2 boissons offertes par chambre. Je vous laisse faire le calcul... Les autres doivent donc payer leur boisson et on parle d'un hôtel où la petite bouteille d'eau coûte 5 dollars. On n'a donc pas utilisé les tickets. On repart avec l'impression d'avoir payé 320 dollars supplémentaires de service fees (2 chambres pour 4 jours) pour aucun service au final.
Mais le pire c'est l'accueil réservé par le personnel. Absence de sourire, grimaces qui expriment l'exaspération si vous demandez qu'une phrase soit répétée plus lentement (le charme de l'accent français ne semble pas faire effet ici...). Bref, impression permanente de déranger. Nous avons tous été surpris pour un hôtel de cette catégorie.
Je garde le pire pour la fin : dès le check-in, lorsque nous avons dû payer le service fee, la personne qui nous a reçus a fait une erreur de 20 dollars en nous rendant la monnaie. Celle-ci ne me croyait pas alors que j'avais compté la somme que je lui remettais devant toute ma famille. Elle a recompté sa caisse une première fois en affirmant ne pas avoir commis d'erreur. J'ai demandé l'intervention de son manager qui est resté mutique face à mes explications. La personne a de nouveau compté sa caisse devant le manager avant de retrouver les 20 dollars manquants et reconnaître son erreur. L'affaire a duré près de 30 minutes (quand vous arrivez tout juste de l'aéroport après une nuit dans l'avion...) Ce qui est choquant ce n'est pas cette dame qui a commis une erreur et avait l'air franchement épuisé, mais c'est l'attitude du manager qui a à peine prononcé un mot d'excuse.
Bref, je m'attends déjà à lire un message du community manager disant qu'il regrette que j'aie passé une mauvaise expérience... que l'hôtel fait son maximum... qu'il espère nous revoir bientôt... Ne vous fatiguez pas, c'est quand le client est là qu'il faut faire son maximum, pas après sur les réseaux sociaux.

title: Amazing stay on Crowne Plaza
text:
We stayed 5 nights, it was really excellent so without exaggeration I would recommend to everybody it will make the visit much worth it.

You are able to see and feel outside activity from every position, and quick be part.

title: Great weekend
text: Stayed at this hotel.  Great location in the city all the theaters were only a few blocks away.  The hotel room is very clean and roomy. Very safe hotel security in hotel lobby.  I would go back and recommend

title: Ticks most of the boxes
text:
Stayed two nights. Great corner room overlooking Times Square.
Room spotless, huge bed all you could need in a modern hotel except milk for the coffee in the room.
Staff very attentive and friendly. Special mention for Audra the concierge. I had a mix up with my booking for the shuttle bus to Newark. She stepped up to the plate and had it sorted in no time.
I was booked to see Chicago on Broadway, to my surprise the theatre was directly across the road.
If I am ever in NYC again that’s where I would be staying.

title: Great Breakfast!!! and location. Highly recommend...
text: Thankful to Ana & personnel from restaurant and front desk for your good service, the breakfast is very complete and variety every day. I stayed three nights during spring break with my husband and 2 kids and the Hotel was very confortable and good location. I highly recommend the Crown Plaza Times Square.

title: Great hotel!
text: We stayed here for 5 nights while we were in a family vacation. The staff are very friendly, especially Sandra Esp, who kindly assisted us with a smooth check in and check our process and made sure our stay was comfortable. We had a great time here at the Crowne Plaza Times Square!

title: Amazing stay at The Crown Plaza Times Square
text: Stayed four nights at The Crown Plaza Times Square.Final stay on a four week tour of the USA.From check in to leaving services shown by all staff from concierge to management were excellent.A special mention must be given to Karim Sharif [food and beverage outlet manager] and his staff Jason Robert and Mark in the bar and restaurant.Every evening on our return to the hotel after a busy and long day,s sightseeing we were welcomed and genuinely asked how our day was.Room was very clean and well appointed.Defineately will be returning to this hotel on our next visit to the Big Apple.Michael and Colette Belfast Northern Ireland

title: Brilliant
text:
Great Hotel.comfy beds.friendly bar,lots of staff around who are helpful especially Rueben who was great with directions to places.
Ideal location.will definitely be back in New York and will stay here again.

title: Stay somewhere else
text:
Booked 3 rooms with this hotel due to its location.  But utterly disappointed with its dilapidated condition.  The lobby has a greasy smell, the elevators are dated and move unsteadily.  One room experienced a malfunctioning mattress on the 1st night, so had to change room the following morning.  My room experienced a clogged water closet, busted light bulb and damaged bathtub drain stopper.  Moreso, the window ledges were dusty.

On the day we checked out, the bell captain on duty was quite wreckless in handling our luggages.  He was literally throwing them into the trunk.  Omg!  Another bellboy looked on and quickly apologized to me for the incident.  

I would highly recommend to stay away from this one to rid yourself of the stress.  And if you're after the location at Times Square, there are many other options.

title: Awesome
text: We toured New York and time square was an amazing place to be and to see . Rode a double decker bus and it was so cool . I will be back for sure . Make sure you have time to see New York ... lots to see and do that cost little or nothing but don’t think it’s a cheap trip because it’s not ,but totally worth it ;

title: I LOVE the Crowne Plaza
text: I have been an owner with IHG/HI properties for 25 years. I live in PA and try to get to NYC several times per year for both day trips and overnight visits. I love to stay at the Crowne Plaza because out of all of the IHG properties I stay at, Crowne Plaza treats me wonderfully and always offers the best experience-even well beyond where I own my timeshare property in Florida. I always have a perfect check in experience and they always thank me for being a platinum elite member. Earlier this month, I was in town for the day and decided to stop by Bar49 at CP for a glass of wine before a concert I was going to. I want to give a big shout out to my most amazing server TONY and to the manager KARIM for taking good care of me and being such wonderful hosts. This hotel is in the middle of Times Square, has comfortable and clean rooms with super comfy beds, an amazing breakfast buffet and they treat you extremely well. Highly recommended! Until next time Crowne Plaza!

title: RIP OFF. Yes, great location, but so are a lot of other hotels.
text: This hotel was a disappointment from beginning to end. I've been visiting NYC for several months and have stayed at other hotels that are in the same area and are much better for the cost. The service desk was horrible, and they rape you for everything including a refrig in your room, parking, you name it. They grab you because the price seems relatively bette online but when you compare to others in the very SAME great location, this place is a rip. Hampton Inn, for example, is only a few blocks away, gives you free breakfast, and the concierge and people at the desk are so welcoming...here, they screwed up my check-in, never apologized, made me wait endlessly when in fact it was their error! What kind of a hotel does this, except for one that packs people in and doesn't care. By the way, only a lap pool.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Second time in this hotel having again an excellent 4 days stay in New York just a few steps from Times Square. Perfect location of the hotel, staying in a great and quiet room on floor 33. Excellent and friendly staff with a special attention given to us by Adeliz at the Front Office.

title: Perfect location
text: Wonderful experience, gorgeous views. Parking is ridiculously expensive but it’s expected in the city. We left on a Disney cruise out of Manhattan cruise terminal and it was a short drive right to the port. Nice stay of you want to see time square without worrying about the subway!

title: Buena opción en NYC
text: Serán 2 noches. El checking perfecto a cargo de la señorita Sandra Esp. Habitación cómoda, espaciosa para 2 adultos y 1 niño. Recomendable. Lo reserve con tiempo a un precio Excelente. Cobran una tasa de 40 USD/dia

title: Great Location
text:
We arrived 8:30 AM and we were given early check in , that was much appreciated ! Front desk was really friendly and helpful. 
Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. 
My first trip to NYC and location of this Crowne Plaza was perfect . Theaters were just around the corner and lots of restaurants to choose from .

title: Great break
text:
Great central hotel, staff friendly and helpful. Greeted by Evelyn on reception who made us feel very welcome. Had a meal in hotel one evening and whilst not a large selection, food was lovely and at a competitive price to on street. Had breakfast one morning with a complimentary voucher which was nice but I wouldn't want to pay $28 for it. In all cases staff were brilliant.
Whilst the hotel was expensive, you have to realise that everything is in New York so overall was happy.

title: Right where we wanted to be
text:
The hotel  needs some renovations but it was ideal for what we wanted.
I you want to be right in the middle of the broadway this is the right place.
The only complaint is the breakfast is bloody expensive 130$ for 3 breakfasts.
The rooms where clean, well stocked with towels, the coffee facilities in the room ain’t great but at least there is some bad coffee in the room.

title: Not impressed, noisy and bland
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights in April, had corner room 2601, full view of Times Square, but oh my god, insulation was none existant, you would think being on the 26th floor it may be a little quiter, but no, the people in Times Square could have been in our room it was that noisy. The beds so uncomfortable and so bloody small. We tried to use the restaurant and for some reason it was closed up, not quite sure why but we ended up having to go out for food, probably a lot cheaper than the hotel though. They had a luggage holding room, but when our cases were delivered to the room, my sons back pack which had been hooked onto one of the cases was missing, eventually found it but not the point.
Sink was broken, we had to climb under the vanity unit to unplug it when we needed to use it, shower...would have had more of a result standing in the rain..... A/C incredibly noisy too.

title: Saving lifes
text: I missed a connection in NY and this was the only hotel with early check in that day. Front desk personnel was really attentive on the phone and also in person. The restaurant food was really good and the place is good to rest. Recommended!

title: The BEST!
text:
If you’re having any doubts about staying at Crowne Plaza Times Square - let me squash them! 

We were looking at this hotel prior to our trip, however we made the mistake of trying to save some money by staying at a nearby hotel (The Gallivant) only to regret it INSTANTLY! After one awful night and almost on the verge of tears, I jumped on booking.com to see if Crowne Plaza had any rooms available and thank goodness it did! 

We were greeted by a lady at the front desk named Rhoda who made everything better instantly. She was so kind, helpful and accommodating. While I’m still on the verge of tears, Rhoda put us in a nice & spacious room and gave us vouchers for a complimentary breakfast and drink! 

Rhoda has remembered our faces every day since arriving at Crowne Plaza (note: we still here, currently on day 5 and never want to leave). 

Crowne Plaza is perfectly located in Times Square, yet is still quiet and classy enough to escape the hustle and bustle of the surroundings to get a good nights sleep. 

All the staff here are so friendly and willing to help. It’s been a fantastic experience from the moment we stepped through the doors.

If you can, spend the extra money to stay here. It’s worth every penny. 

Our time in NYC was almost ruined after our first night at the other hotel. We are so glad to be spending our time in NYC at Crowne Plaza. It’s allowed us to fall in love with the city the way it deserves! 

THANK YOU TO RHODA for being our saving grace and welcoming us to this wonderful hotel! 

Good luck getting us to leave ;)

title: Great Location
text:
Stayed here on our visit to NYC great check in very quick rooms were nice could probably be up dated bathroom was a bit grubby but to be honest we weren’t in hotel for any length of time. Wouldn’t pay for an upgrade as you are so busy out and about why pay for a view not as if you are going to sit at your window.
Beds were comfy and room was clean. You could get food which was nice but there is so many places to eat there you are spoilt for choice. 
This hotel is great for location you are right in the midst of it all Broadway theatres are right on your doorstep minutes to walk to in fact we walked nearly everywhere from here and it was so easy.
Coffee and bagels or cake in hotel in morning not overly expensive and very nice.
I would definitely stay here again if I were visiting New York

title: ottimo
text: La posizione è davvero splendida, su Times Square. Camera pulitissima, unica pecca (ma purtroppo diffusa in quasi tutti gli hotel) la moquette. Gentili alla reception, in definitiva molto consigliato. Tra l'altro camera silenziosissima, molto ben insonorizzata (Times Square è sempre caotica, giorno e notte. Non si sentiva NULLA). Dai piani alti (noi eravamo al 26) vista spettacolare

title: Bon hotel
text: Nous avons résidé 5 jours sans cet hôtel qui est situé en plein Times Square. Nous étions au 38 em etage. La vue donne sur ses buldings mais surtout les fenêtres sont très bien isolées donc on entend aucun bruit. La chambre était plutôt spacieuse et la literie très confortable. Nous n’avons pas consommé sur place. Il propose une conciergerie pour les réservations mais nous n’avons pas pu changer sur place de l’argent. Petit conseil pour le change, faites vous remettre par la conciergerie un petit papier blanc qui permet d’avoir 50% sur le change et rendez vous au Mariott qui se trouve une rue à côté ou la ils ne prennent que 5$ pour le change.

title: Gut, Zentral, Nicht Billig, Groß
text:
Das Crowne ist gut ausgestattet, sauber und hat große Zimmer. Leider etwas in die Jahre gekommen, könnte hier da da mal etwas in Unterhalt und Instandsetzung investiert werden.

Die Betten waren sehr gut.

Im Bad hatten wir leider eine flache Badewanne mit Duschvorhang. Bin kein Fan von den Dingern, aber dieser war zum Glück ein hochwertiger und keine Kunststofffolie.

Das Frühstücksbuffet war für deutsche Mägen gut. Bagels in verschiedenen Arten (Brötchen mit Loch), verschiedene Eierspeisen, Wurst, Käse und frisches Obst.

Falls man planen sollte, mit dem Mietwagen anzureisen: Überlegt es euch! Macht keinen Sinn und das Parkhaus verlangt am Tag über 30 EUR.

title: Long weekend in New York
text:
Lovely hotel with superb location on Times Square in Manhattan.
Helpful and friendly staff.
Well appointed rooms.
Renovations were in progress during the visit but this did not spoil our stay at the Crowns Plaza Hotel.
Received a free drink on arrival when we checked in. A central location for accessing the main points of interest on Broadway and Times Square.
Great choice of theatres, bars and restaurants near by but take loads of money...

title: Great location, Nice hotel
text: This was my first visit to NYC and chose this hotel for our 6 night stay because of its location. After a long flight and taxi ride, the hotel check in was lovely and smooth. I had a corner room on the 38th floor with a great view of times square and partial view of the Hudson river, high enough not to be bothered by the noise. The room was lovely and clean on arrival and was serviced very well every day. We ate at the Bar49 in house most nights as the price was not too bad and the food was delicious. My tariff included the buffet breakfast which was delicious; plenty of choice and as much as you want. Staff service was excellent, very polite and attentive. Would my wife and I stay again ... without a doubt. An excellent hotel; a bit pricey ... like everything in New York ... but the hotel and it's location made our visit.

title: They came to my rescue!
text:
I travel a lot. My average flight number per year is ~140-200 flights per year across the continental U.S., Europe, Asia, and sometimes South America. Needless to say, I am seasoned when it comes to living on the road.

This past weekend I was traveling not for work, but for pleasure. Once a year, I visit a large city with some old colleagues of mine to relax and enjoy local activities. NYC for us is a mainstay because of the great food, and most of all, Broadway.

As such, the Times Square Crowne Plaza is usually my top choice given the location and amenities the facility offers. Though some Crowne Plaza locations have a reputation for being a little aged, this location is definitely well kept and a great option for a weekend trip in the city.

This weekend was special for us as I decided to bring my parents along, as my father had never been to New York, or seen a Broadway show.

We arrived Friday morning at LGA and took a NYC Yellow Taxi to the Crowne Plaza. The Taxi Driver was named, "Freddie" and he and I had some great discussion while he was driving us to the hotel. He was discussing how long he had been in NYC, and that he came over from Ecuador with his wife and mother. The conversation was very pleasant, and Freddie was a very nice guy. This will be important later.

For the first time in my career (5+ years of 100% travel), I left my laptop in the NYC Yellow Taxi. It's my fault. I was sidetracked ensuring that my family had their bags while assisting with the payment method. Needless to say, I left the laptop in the front seat. This is a work laptop, and I needed it to complete some tasks before stopping for the weekend. Once I realized (in line at check-in) that my laptop was missing, I ran back outside to find that the driver had already left.I have several remote lectures to give next week, and I cannot host the meeting without this laptop, as the data is encrypted. I'm completely stuck, now.
This, is a complete nightmare. 

I called NY Taxi, but was advised that they do not accept calls on lost property. I was directed to their website. I submitted a claim on their website, and the contact my work IT team to discuss options.

After discussion, it was decided to plan as though the laptop is gone forever. As such, I was required to submit a police report before the company can consider the loss covered and allow me new laptop hardware.

After much fumbling on the web with my cell phone, I approached the front desk of Crowne Plaza and spoke to Michelle. Michelle was kind and provided me with the address and telephone number to NYPD 18th Precinct 3C. I called NYPD who advised that I must make the report in person only. Fine.

I walked to the NYPD precinct office and made my report in person. With this, I had the case number to provide to work IT, and to get my new laptop hardware. Hopefully, this would only disrupt one day of my lectures next week. Outlook = grim.

By this time, it was early afternoon and I was ready to be finished with the day. I had done everything in my power to correct the situation, and mistakes do happen, I was pretty bummed; what a stupid mistake!

The rest of the evening was uneventful, with dinner and our first Broadway show of the weekend (Come from away). We spent the rest of the evening walking around and trying whiskey bars. 

Saturday morning: I receive a call at 7:46AM. This was an officer from NYPD precinct 18. Freddie, the taxi driver, was there with my missing laptop and wanted to give it to me personally. 

WOW.

I dress and uber straight to the Police office. I'm met with some laughter and the NYPD officers saying, "wow, you are SO lucky!". I look and behind me is standing Freddie with my laptop, and the guy is all smiles! 

Freddie then tells me, when his shift ended he cleaned his car and found the laptop. It was in the front against his middle console. He knew that the computer was mine, and he himself was distraught.He remembered our conversation during the ride.

Freddie, on his own time, went back to Crowne plaza at 6:00 AM, and spoke to the front staff. This was when Michelle (whom helped me yesterday) remembered speaking to me. Michelle advised that she remembered me, but that she was remiss in taking my information down (and I was remiss in giving it to her). Both Freddie and Michelle know I'm there, but they have no way to know my name or how to reach me.
Michelle DID remember, however, that I went to the 18th precinct office of NYPD. Michelle advised Freddie to go to NYPD, which he did.

Afterwards, Freddie drove me back to the hotel and was SO GLAD to have found me.

Needless to say, I was very touched and showed my gratitude to Freddie and team.

Were it not for the kindness of Freddie, my work would have been disrupted. I work in the medical field, which means this disruption could have caused delays in patient care (indirectly). Were it not for Michelle's kind attention and keen memory, Freddie would have been unable to take the laptop somewhere I could be reached. The staff at NYPD also were extremely helpful as well.

If these stars had not all lined up, my week at work would have been pretty rough.
The stars, though, aren't really stars that line up, they are people.

Freddie, Michelle, and the folks at NYPD are the stars here. Your hard work and kind attention, and overall good nature lead to this excellent outcome for me, and salvaged the rest of my visit to NYC. By taking the extra time, you eased my mind for the rest of my trip with my family, AND you ensured that my work was not disrupted this week.

I wanted to share this excellent story, and thank Freddie and Michelle for their kindness. I will absolutely recommend this location to my friends and colleagues, when I tell this story.

Thank you SO much!

title: Great staff!
text:
This was my fourth visit to this hotel! Great location since most of the theaters are to a waking distance! If you are IHG member don’t forget to ask for your breakfast discount coupons! The staff at the restaurant is super! 
Tofael, Christina & Aly! Thanks

title: Harsh laundry detergent
text:
I visited this hotel from 3/23-3/27. I had stayed there before and it is in a great location and a very nice hotel. However, after the first night I began to itch and my legs were covered with a rash. I went to the nearby Walgreens to get some lotion but it continued to
get worse. By the 3rd night I was miserable. My entire body was covered with large red welts and the itch was unbearable. When I returned home my dermatologist said it was an allergic reaction to the detergent the hotel uses. She gave me medicine but the rash
is slow to disappear. It appears to be scarring. I stay at hotels about 10x per month and have never had this happen. Beware!

title: Service client décevant
text:
Hôtel très bien situé en plein times square. 
Par contre c'est l'usine. 
Accueil expéditif et aucune compréhension du français. 
Piscine et salle de fitness non indiquées donc introuvables. 
Chambre vieillotte mais pas de bruit car étions au 44eme étage. 
Service client inexistant : grosse difficulté à faire éditer nos billets d'avion retour car réception n'étant là que pour réaliser le chek in/out. 
Service conciergerie bondée et ne comprenant pas le français. 
Bref débrouillez vous et n'attendez rien de l'hôtel. 
Pas acceptable pour un 4 étoiles.
Grosse déception.

title: Vraiment moyen
text:
Lavabo avec des fissures
Vue inexistante
Chambre vielliotte
Je suis actuellement dans l’hotel et je suis déçue
Ce n’est pas ce à quoi je m’attendais en prenant le crown plaza
Effectivement à deux minutes de time square

title: Crowne Plaza Times Square, New York
text:
Highly recommend Crowne Plaza Time Square, our room overlooking the square was on the 42nd floor. The room was clean, modern with great space 👍🏻
My hairdryer didn’t work but my GHD straighteners did 🥳 the room came supplied with a good hairdryer, iron and board, coffee/tea machine. 

We could hear noise from time square but it was faint noise, apart from the police sirens 🙉 but like other posts have mentioned, you’re too shattered to even notice 💤💤💤

The hotel had an AMAZING bar (Broadway 49 bar and lounge) the food was SO good 🤤 so we ate here 3 nights. Customer service was great! 

On the lobby floor, we had a coffee stand (Grind & Co). This was expensive but handy to have for the odd evening munchies 🤦🏻‍♀️😂 we only took advantage of it once, 1 slice chocolate cake ($9.95) and 1 bag of crisps ($3.50). The same floor also has two vending machines. 👍🏻

The hotel gym was well equipped 💪🏻 we were very impressed.

title: Best 13th birthday ever for my daughter
text:
We arrived late because of a flight cancelation and the front desk was so helpful getting us settled.
Then we had brunch at the Brasserie 1605 and the waiter, Ali, was so kind and friendly.  He discovered it was my daughter’s 13th birthday and did everything possible to make her day special.  He even surprised her with a piece of cake & some treates waiting in our room after the matinee we attended.  There should be more special individuals like this in the world.  It absolutely made her beam in what was already a lovely trip!!

The hotel is so clean & the most convenient location we have had!

We will stay again!!!

title: very helpful and friendly service
text: I was there in May 2019 with my daughter and granddaughter to see NYC.  We chose this hotel based on reputation and proximity to Times Square where we planned to board the hop on Bus (Big Bus) for touring.  I would give it 5 stars if it had not been for the shabby furnishings in the bathroom and the problem with getting hot...or even warm water in the shower.  Apparently you need to run it for about 15 to 20 minutes.  Hot water in the sink was no problem.  The coffee shop was wonderful and I enjoyed a cup of coffee and a pastry every morning.  beds and bedding very comfortable.

title: Sweet 16 Success!
text:
I had reserved 2 rooms and they didn’t end up to be on the same floor which wasn’t ok but then Freddy at the front desk did all kinds of magic!
The Birthday Girl and her friends had a corner room with a wonderful view of Times Square and I was in a room a couple doors down with the younger sisters of said Birthday Girl. 
I was given coupons for complimentary beverages for each room. 
Between Freddy’s professional & friendly demeanor to help me and the condition and location of the Crowne Plaza; we couldn’t have been more satisfied.
THANKS FREDDY & CROWNE PLAZA

title: 四つ星ホテル
text: 28階の角部屋に泊まりました。価格は高いですが、最高のサービス体験が得られます。フロントの対応も感じ良いですし、部屋も広くて綺麗です。冷蔵庫が無いのと、無料ミネラルウォーターの提供も無いのが少し残念です。プール、サウナ、ジムは無料です。バスタブが無いのも残念。朝食は付けなかったのでわかりませんが、バーの感じは良さそうでした。

title: Outstanding stay
text: Only wish it could have been for longer.  We had a room on the 35th floor.  It was clean and quiet and the bed was perfect.  Our room came with 2 complimentary drinks in the hotel bar (Broadway 49), 2 international phone calls and access to the fitness club.  Checking in and out was quick...maybe 2 minutes each time.  Next time we visit NYC we will stay at the Crowne Plaza.

title: Best place to stay for Broadway!
text: Convenient to theaters and exceptional service from the staff, especially Victoria who made our check-in experience pleasant!  We also received two free drink coupons upon check-in which we used at the lovely bar. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Great. Location, wonderful bed!
text:
We recently spent 5 nights at the Crown plaza.   Our trips to New York alway focus in seeing lots of theater and this hotel could not be in a better location.  It was our third stay in this location. 
And the bed In Our room was really fabulous.   The sheets were so soft and the mattress was just divine. One of the best hotel beds I have ever had. 
We had a lovely river view.  We could see way into New Jersey. 
The service in the hotel was spotty. The bar /restaurant was noisy and the service was slow and sometimes our orders were wrong. Fortunately there are a lot of other places to eat.  The entrance and lobby were frequently very congested with people.  
The concierge desk told us a Harlem tour we booked was in a mini van and it was in a huge tour bus.  Not sure why he said that but we were very disappointed. (Don’t book the Harlem gospel tour, it was not much about Harlem!  Very disappointing with a horrid guide.) 
All in all our stay was pleasant.

title: Κέντρο!
text: Μείναμε 8 μέρες στο συγκεκριμένο ξενοδοχείο, πληρώνεις κάτι παραπάνω αλλά το αξίζει!  Βγαίνεις από το ξενοδοχείο και είσαι ήδη στην Times Square και συνεχίζεις τις βόλτες σου απ’ εκεί.  Εξυπηρετικότατοι υπαλλήλοι, ότι θέλεις να κάνεις σε δραστηριότητες δεν χρειάζεται να το κλείσεις από πριν, τα βρίσκεις όλα μέσα στο ξενοδοχείο και είναι πολύ κατατοπιστικοί και ξέρουν τη δουλειά τους.  Δωμάτια και μπάνια πολύ καθαρά.

title: Hat mich leider nicht überzeugt.
text: Es ist ein eher älteres Hotel. Wir hatten ein Zimmer mit zwei Betten, die viel zu klein waren genau wie unser Zimmer. Ausserdem bin mir nicht ganz sicher, aber ich meine, dass ich etwas Schimmel an der Decke im Badezimmer gesehen hätte. Ansonsten ist die Bedienung sehr gastfreundlich und der Ausblick ist toll.

title: Busy Hotel in a Busy location
text:
If your aim is to be in the centre of the busiest area of New York, Crowne Plaza Times Square is the place to go, very busy hotel in a very busy location, hotel room costs are little over priced for what you get but I have seen worse and it is New York.  A good variety of restaurants & shops close by & again iit’s the centre of New York so a little over priced also.
Hotel is well located to many of the central New York attractions, close to the Hop on Hop off bus stop,  Check In is upstairs 1st floor &  busy but reasonably quick,  hotel rooms are a reasonable size, comfortable & clean,  the one thing that the hotel lacks is good coffee/tea facility in the room,  they provide a basic (and I mean very basic) a coffee machine, they use paper cups instead of real cups (but I found that with the 3 other USA hotels I stayed in on this trip), there is no refrigerator and you get a couple of coffee bags and creamers, there is a Starbucks round the corner, but sometimes after a long day of walking you just want to relax in the room with a coffee.  The Bar downstairs opposite reception is a good choice for simple food and the occasional drink or there is the restaurant opposite the bar,  the downstairs concierge area can get crowded on check out
Would I stay again, probably not,  if I were to do another trip to New York I would stay out of Times Square (you can walk or catch the bus there), I think I would look to stay around either 34th or 57th Street,  a little quieter but still lots to do.

title: Over all experience was fantastic!
text:
