This was my fourth time coming with a group this year of 122. We love the Crown Plaza, accommodations, location, service, all staff friendly and helpful.

Mr. Sharif, there to greet you, always with a smile.
Ana in the dining area for breakfast, can't be any friendlier, all make it a most pleasant experience.
Great food too!!
I can't say enough, and I may be back to post more...

Tina

title: Conference
text: Sandra Esp. Was great checking us in. She was super nice and helped us with our questions. Quick service and nice hotel. Quickly got up to the room and found it to be nice and clean with a beautiful view.

title: Perfect spot for the theater.
text: You are right in the middle of the theater district at the Crowne Plaza. We walked to everything. Check in started poorly. A woman at the desk finished with the person in front of us but did not make eye contact or tell us that she’d be with us in a minute as she shuffled papers for quite a while. Finally the woman next to her who was very friendly and vivacious, checked us in. Kudos to her for doing her job so well. Our room was large, especially for NYC.  The bed was very comfortable, the sheets grey (ugh), the towels were a good size and nice and white. We were on the 34th floor and it was nice and quiet! Had the full American Buffet breakfast. It was so so - eggs Luke warm. Personally, if I’m paying $35., I prefer a plated breakfast not a buffet that you’d get for no additional cost at a HI Express.

title: Pluspunkte: Zentrale Lage mit toller Aussicht
text: Die zentrale Lage des Hotels und unsere tolle Zimmeraussicht aus einem der oberen Stockwerke waren super, allerdings waren wir insgesamt von dem Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis enttäuscht. Alles dort war extrem überteuert. Deshalb haben wir auch kein Frühstück dazu gebucht, was ich sonst immer gerne dabei habe. Es ist auch einfach nicht schön, wenn man mit der Forderung der allgemeinen Service-Fee empfangen wird, z.B. für W-Lan-Nutzung (!) und unbegrenzte internationale Anrufe, da fühlt man sich gleich abgezockt. Kannte ich nur aus einer Fernsehreportage und habe das bisher in keinem anderen Hotel so erlebt. Sind darüber auch vor dem Reiseantritt nicht informiert worden. Zudem war während unseres gesamten Aufenthalts im superheißen August 2018 der Pool geschlossen. Ein Rabatt oder irgendeine Art von Entschuldigung, z.B. ein Getränk auf Kosten des Hauses? Fehlanzeige. Manche Hotels verlässt man und blickt zurück: Einmal und nie wieder!😕

title: Excellent front desk officer Sandara Esp.
text:
The whole experience was fine, but What made a real difference in our stay is that we got excellent service from Sandra Esp. the front desk officer, professional, considerate, and helpful, we extended our stay online, and were initially told we had to change the room to keep the rate of the first booking, Sandra Esp. was engaged and dedicated to make sure that all guests have the best treatment possible and spent time and effort so we stay in the room.
5 stars Sandra

title: One of the Best Places to Stay on Times Square.
text: I've stayed at several hotels around Times Square and the Crown Plaza is my favorite. great rooms, comfortable beds and nice amenities. Love the breakfast buffet too. Thanks Travis for remembering me too.

title: Nice Location, Service Left Much to Be Desired
text:
This Crowne Plaza has a great location at the north end of Times Square and the lobby lounge is a great place to relax and has great burgers.  That said, the quality of the sleeping rooms and the level of service are sub par.  I stayed here for two consecutive weeks.  The first week a drain in an adjacent mechanical room plugged up and my room took on a lot of water, soaking the carpet in the entry way.  The hotel sent up an engineer and a housekeeper who got the drain unplugged and put plastic and towels over the carpet, so that got handled.  

When I was at the hotel the next week the air conditioner in my room did not function, the room safe was broken and the room had no coffee or water.  When I asked for help the only thing I got was water.  The safe was not fixed and the air conditioner for some reason that was not resolvable could not be fixed.  When I arrived back in my room the message light on my phone was blinking and when I touched the message button it only rang a busy signal.  When I asked to have the phone reprogrammed I was informed that that could not be done.  

Then, to top off the whole experience, for some reason the hotel decided not to service my room the next day.  Ah well, I can make my own bed.

Seriously, I'd suggest care in the decision to use this facility and be ready for problems.

title: Best holiday
text: Firstly best view for Times square. Our room 45. Floor for our room help us Evelyn thank you from Cappadocia :) we stayed for honeymoon holiday. We very happy to choose this hotel. We hope to come again

title: Hotel and crew are the best!
text:
We are so pleased staying in Crown plaza hotel.  The front desk Victoria Martin was very helpful, respectful and kind.  I have 3 kids with me, but she made me feel like I have extra hands.  She definitely  went far and beyond simply checking us in.  Excellent employees like her will make me book over and over again to this hotel.  
The hotel room is very nice, clean, and big and nice view.  The location is just perfect, right at the middle of Manhattan, and accessible to everything.  The security in the hotel is very good, and they hold luggage for you before and after check in so you can still roam around the city.  They even bring the luggage to your room.  This a great hotel!

title: New MD Mark Saunders maintains Excellence in employee customer service . Still awesome
text:
My wife and I visited the Crowne Plaza as we were celebrating our son's Birthday 2 weekends ago and after MD Niles Harris left I was really curious to see whether anything had changed especially with employees, many of whom we have known for years.

No need to worry especially as Sylvia  Geronimo as Exec. Assistant still there and keeps everything flowing even when she isn't at work. Our preferred room was made available and they even remembered my wife's favorite wine which was a real bonus. Sylvia is awesome.

Checking-in was a breeze and although our room wasn't ready at check-in time, John and Grant, Managers moved things along really fast and took care of refreshments while we waited. A nice touch.

It was great to see the Restaurant hostess Ana still there as friendly as ever and always looking out for a great table for us and many of the servers were still there and remembered us and we them. Comforting. Not sure who runs F&B there (I used to get cheese and crackers every time) but I'm sure with Agathe still there (didn't get to meet her) things are very smooth.

Location is hard to beat right in the middle of Times Square. Looks like some construction so the entrance right onto Broadway is closed. The access to the 3rd party Gym on the 15th floor is awesome and there is nothing else you need for a great work-out. 

Lobby bar is great for cocktails and the service is super. We received some vouchers but had no time to use them.

Employees miss the former MD, as I do, but they all had great things to say about MD Sanders, which is always the mark of great Leadership. I gave a reference for an upcoming conference mid-June and will continue to tell everyone it’s a super place to stay whether on business or pleasure.

title: Hotel de 4 estrelas fraco.
text:
Hotel num sítio ótimo mesmo no coração de Times Square. As camas boas , mas 

 sem um frigobar, as toalhas de banho de tamanho reduzido , a limpeza a 80%, 

 Valeu o pequeno almoço que era bastante variado e a localização.

title: Location, location, location!
text:
This is the place to stay if you want to be at the centre of it all! Close to all amenities and especially handy if you’re hoping to go to any theatre shows or visit tourist attractions. We had a lovely stay there made even better by Evelyn at reception who was always so helpful and greeted us with a smile. 
My only criticism of the hotel is that it is somewhat dated in some parts and needs sprucing up generally but I understand that they are in the process of refurbishing it.

title: Best in Restaurant
text: Everything was good. Times Square is the pleasure place. Breakfast was greatly. But in the restaurant wan excellent Rahi! The best dinner in NY, at my wife ´ s birthday! Rooms was very children friendly. Housekeeping personnel is hopeful. Thanks very much!

title: Perfect Location for Times Square Fun!
text: Gorgeous hotel with a fantastic little pub and restaurant that has prime seats to view Times Square. Rooms are clean and very comfortable with excellent amenities. Loved our stay. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

title: Ottimo albergo nel cuore di new yirk
text: Per il nostro soggiorno a New York abbiamo optato per un albergo centrale con prima colazione inclusa. Le camere non sono enormi. I letti sono da una piazza e mezza un po’ strettini. Bagno datato. Sei nel cuore di New York ad un passo da Times Square. Trovi ristoranti ad ogni angolo. La metropolitana sotto l’albergo. Colazione ottima sia dolce che salata a partire dalle ore 6.00. Cappuccino a pagamento ( euro 7.50). Sono inclusi la Wi-Fi e due cocktail di benvenuto.

title: 3 nuits au Palace crown plaza Time Square
text:
Hôtel bien situé à la fois au pieds de Time square et stations métro. Hôtel sympa le mot Palace est de trop au vu de la chambre certes confortable mais un peu vieillotte. Le service pas très au point nous étions 4 avec 3 serviettes il a fallu s’y reprendre à 2 fois 2 jours et relancer l’accueil pour avoir la 4eme.
Un des deux loquets de la fenêtre était dévissé. Pour autant donnant sur la rue au 19eme le bruit n’a jamais été un problème pour dormir. 2 lits doubles de 150/160 maxi.

title: Excellent location but amenities expensive
text: Very conveniently located hotel. Mutiple subway stations very close. All the amenities of time square on your door Breakfast very expensive in hotel restaurant. Hour extension to checkout time given free and without hesitation.

title: Room sucked but staff was great
text: I had the best check-in experience from Evelyn. She was fantastic & very welcoming. Gave me my handicap room w/the most beautiful view. The room ended up looking great but it was freezing even w/the heat on 80 the whole time & the removable showerhead didn't work. Which isn't good considering my condition & I fall often. Not good for the handicap. Olger T At Broadway 49 Bar & Lounge was Fantastic & friendly. He even took care of my daughter's chicken pesto dinner when she cut into and it was raw pink. I thought this place was going to be much better for the $501 I paid for 2 nights but it wasn't.

title: DONT be fooled y the location!!
text:
I stayed at the Crowne Plaza with my significant other from April 12 to April 18th. I have stayed here before with my children and it was a pleasant stay. Not this time though.
The A/C in the first room I received did not work so they sent a person to fix which of course did not fix anything. They left a machine to cool the room down but of course the sound was terrible and I could not sleep with this machine. Then I was changed to another room after pretty much BEGGING the front desk to change me. In this new room the A/C did work. I left in the afternoon to visit NYC and when I came back to my room I found a piece of underwear which was not mine on the couch.  I repeat, a piece of UNDERWEAR WHICH WAS NOT MINE on the couch.  After reporting this to the front desk they mentioned that they could not show me the cameras and after talking to a nice colombian manager they said that they had not found any trace that could lead to the underwear arriving in my room. So basically I was now a liar and I had made all this up. Incredible lack of empathy, poor customer service and resolution of guest problems in this hotel.  The cherry on top was when I went to the Hotel Bar with a bag of crackers i had bought downstairs by the parking garage, i was approached by one of the waitresses (red haired waitress) and she said that I could not sit there because I was not consuming anything.  So basically I am a guest at the hotel but i can not sit in the empty bar and eat a bag of crackers I had bought downstairs since I was not consuming anything at the bar..  can it get worse? hopefully not.   I will definitely not stay here or any Crowne Plaza ever again and if you are reading this I recommend that you dont either.  
(just to note that after all this I was not offered a free night or such, I only had some minibar bills and laundry taken out of my bill)  WAY TO GO CROWNE PLAZA!

title: Amazing breakfast!
text: Tofael (and everyone in the breakfast area) was so helpful and accommodating! Very friendly and kind, wonderful service each day. We have a big family and he made us feel very welcome and comfortable! And the breakfast itself was delicious!

title: Evelyn and Rosa
text: We received excellent service from Evelyn and Rosa! Our flight was cancelled with no further contact with the airline for over a day and they went out of their way to make us feel at home during our stay.  We've stayed at Crown Plaza Times Square a few times and they are the reason why!

title: Perfect in every way!
text:
As a former New Yorker now living in the south, I’m coming back to New York on a regular basis. Sometimes I stay with friends and sometimes I need to be at a hotel. My last trip to the city I said at the Park Lane Hotel on Central Park, and was very disappointed 

This time, I’m staying mid town in time square at the Crowne Plaza. 
What a welcome surprise to find such a lovely hotel in the middle of all that’s happening 
 It all started when I went to check in. Imran was at the front desk and took amazing care of my reservation. As a traveler, you learn to love the little things that people do that make you feel good. Imran welcomed me to the hotel in the most polite and professional manner.  
And my room is just as I expected it to be, clean...nicely furnished and very very comfortable.
Jackpot!
My son came to meet me for dinner and was also very impressed with the hotel,..the look of the hotel, and my accommodations.
 We had dinner at the lounge and much to my surprise the food was incredibly delicious. I mean who would’ve thought we would have a memorable dinner at this hotel. 
(New York  has many many restaurants to choose from, and to have such a quality restaurant in your hotel is a rare find)
 And is it that wasn’t enough praise, I had a special request that the food and beverage manager Karim
took care of on the spot.
To top it all off, we had two waiters. Not one, but two waiters, Jordan and Victor, and both of them were as nice and as attentive as you could ask for 
Somebody pinch me!
 Travelers, look no further. The Crowne Plaza is a fabulous find in the heart of Manhattan

title: Expensive 3 star - there are better options around
text:
Been to New York many times, but unfortunately this time we had booked a hotel last minute.

We chose this place because it had ajoining rooms.

When we reserve we originally requested king beds, in ajoining rooms.

Unfortunately upon arrival we were offered only double beds.

Doesn’t seem like much but when you make a special reservation and you’re arrive, and it’s not correct it is pretty disappointing at 400$ a night. 

The manager was pretty kind and offered us breakfast vouchers.

This hotel is fairly dates and other than the pillows and the beds that are very clean and comfortable and everything else is dated. But this is a high volume area. 

We had to wait 5 to 10 minutes to get hot water in our room, and the breakfast area there is huge in service probably about 200 people has a very small buffet area which ran out of food. On the last day which was a Tuesday they ran out of croissants at 10 AM?

The location was great and the in-house restaurant and bar was pretty good but was always kept it very cold.

We had some burgers and salads and those were pretty good.

title: Buena opción para alojarse en Manhattan
text:
Hotel situado en el corazón de Manhattan, en la plaza de Times Square.
Las habitaciones están bastante bien, no son excesivamente amplias pero las camas son muy cómodas. Elegimos una de las habitaciones con vistas a Times Square y, en mi opinión, merece la pena ya que no es excesivo el cambio en el precio y tienen unas muy buenas vistas.
Es una opción perfecta para visitar Nueva York si lo que buscas es un hotel céntrico, cómodo y agradable.

title: Perfect spot for our 1st visit to NYC
text: Great location, especially if you'll be seeing some Broadway shows. Clean rooms, excellent & friendly staff, neat city views (recommend a corner room if you can get it).It seemed like we'd step out of the hotel and be in the heart of it all. There's multiple access points for the subway to get you where you need to go and being in the middle of Manhattan, your never more then a 20 minute subway run from all the sights you want to see. Definitely recommend it for the first time visitor, ideal location!

title: Impersonnel et industriel
text: Service moyen, propreté moyenne. Petit déjeuner hors de prix. Trop industriel. Si vous aimez n’être qu’un numéro c’est parfait pour vous. Sinon fuyiez. De plus c’est très bruyant. Évitez les chambres vers le 16ème étage.

title: Great location!
text: A very good location to go around Manhattan. They have clean rooms, comfortable beds and always better if you get a deal that comes with breakfast. Great value for money and Steps away to all tourist spots nearby.

title: Great place for first trip to NYC
text: Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Room clean and comfortable.  Great location for top attractions.  Food on the breakfast buffet was mediocre but warm smile if our server Tofael was a great start to the day.  Would definitely recommend to others to stay here.

title: Crowne plaza times square hotel
text: The service is excellent and the employees are very nice. The location was perfect. April 2019 was my son's 17th birthday. At Breakfast Ana and Tofael was excellent. They make my son have the best birthday ever. Singing happy birthday with me for him. At anytime in the future I will recommend this hotel to any family and friends because of those two people. They are very welcoming, friendly, respectful, helpful, Ana and Tofeal have a smile in them face to make anybody feel welcoming.

title: Great Location, Great Service, Great View
text:
It started with the folks at the front desk, they were so  and accomadationing that I have to admit  they made me feel special. The staff throughout the hotel in well tuned into providing great customer service.  If you want to experience Time Square and surrounding areas you won't find a better location. If your also into meeting travelers from all over the world this is your place. 
We also stayed here for New Years a few years ago and bought the package that put you in front of the hotel at 11PM ish to watch the ball drop. Its a bit pricey(check it out on line) but worth every penny  of it vs standing outside from 3PM to wait for New Years !

title: Great hospitality!
text: A nice hotel at the very heart of Big Apple! Very close to all best places in Manhattan, just a few steps away from the Times Square. Hotel offers good buffet for breakfast. There's a swimming pool, but we didn't have a chance to visit it. Sandra Esp. at the reception was extremely helpful, courteous and kind. She's a valuable asset to this hotel.

title: Great Check in
text: There was a line when I arrived. However the check in process went quick. Sandra's provided excellent customer service. She asked questions to make sure that I had everything that I needed. Also, she made recommendations for things to do while I'm here. Definitely recommend this place.

title: Very good service!
text: Excellent service at the front desk by Sandra Esp. Very nice rooms with magnificent views over Manhattan. Make sure you go for breakfast! Top location, in the liddle of Times Square! Highly recommended!

title: Crown Plaza Time Square
text: Crown Plaza was great. Sandra Esp was very nice and extremely professional. She was kind to all guests before me as well. Because of her I will book the crown plaza again. The location is great. Very convenient for shopping

title: Great hotel and service in heart of Times Square!
text:
I regularly stay at the Crown Plaza Times square for business trips to the city. This time I brought my family for school vacation week. Like many other visits I chose to add breakfast to my stay as they have a great buffet better then most hotels! 

One of things I like as a regular guest is that they are always friendly and seem to remember me from my last visits. 

This time Ali our server came over to say hello and greeted me with a smile and asked if I was here this time on vacation and was very happy to meet my family. When my wife mentioned it was my Birthday he wished me a happy birthday. Later that night we had a knock on the door and room service showed up with a huge piece of Chocolate cake and a bottle of red wine with a card from Ali wishing me a happy Birthday! I was shocked at the gesture as it was totally unexpected and very thoughtful. He has waited on me many times and always friendly as I’m usually eating alone before starting my day if client appointments.

So I was truly taken back by his thoughtfulness. We stayed several more days and never got to thank him, but he added something special to my birthday and my wife, kids and I all enjoyed the cake together! The wine was just for the two of us and made for an even more special night.

Overall this hotel is comfortable, great showers, comfortable beds, good food options and as an IHG member they often give you extra vouchers for the cafe.

Overall we had an amazing visit to NYC made extra comfortable by Ali, and the front desk staff, and other waiter Tofael who also provided friendly service.

This is the way all hotels should treat their guests and why I always return!

Kudos to management for creating such a positive environment for the staff to rest guests so well!

title: My go-for hotel in Manhattan
text: This is def my go-for hotel whenever visiting Manhattan. Perfect location, great gym and amazing staff. Always a pleasure to return.  Special thanks to Sandra from the, front desk. So helpful, carring and looking into the extra mile to make are, stay even more wonderful.! Thanks and, see you soon!!

title: 5 day visit to manhattan
text: The hotel is great! Check-in was very easy with pleasant service provided by Sandra Esp. If her attention to the hotel guest is typical of all Crowne Plaza staff we will have a very pleasant stay. We recommend this hotel for the great staff and the ideal location to enjoy this great city!!

title: Great hotel - Shame about the service fees
text:
Having just returned from a 4 night stay we were pleased with the accommodation itself. We were on the 44th floor at the rear of the hotel and were generally pleased with the room itself - good size, clean, amazing beds (temporally eased my lower back pain!), other reviews have mentioned it was either too hot or cold, we found the temp to be just fine, so much so it didn’t even cross our mind. Windows offered a relatively good view out to the river, no doubt it would have been better with the Times Square view but that’s an extra cost. Could have done with a fridge in the room and the shower would have benefitted from more water pressure.

The one sticking point is the service fees. Although we were aware of them at the time of booking I still find it hard to justify the hotel actually charging them to guests. Several booking sites state that the WiFi is free (as you may expect) but apparently this is part of the service fee and at $35 a day seems excessive. Yes it includes other ‘benefits’ but I would expect and have received these at other hotels at no extra cost. I would have happily paid $10-15 for the WiFi each day but the rest is surplus to demand and I expect many guests don’t make use of these extras. Either include it in the price of the room or break it down into optional extras that you pick and choose to pay as you use them. The member of staff who checked us in ‘conveniently’ forgot to mention the service fees and gave the impression that the WiFi was indeed free.

I would happily stay again if the service fees were reconsidered and more transparent to guests.
